text: An employee was standing on a trailer inside of a tank spraying foam insulation when he slipped and fell 2 feet. He landed awkwardly and fractured his right femur.
Two employees were overcome by fumes that were emitted into their work area from epoxy being applied to the floor in the garage.

An employee was working with a flat automated calling system machine and over-the-road container when the container shifted, catching her left hand between the container and a dumper restrain bar. She suffered a left ring finger amputation and fracture.
An employee was removing a positive displacement diaphragm pump in the wastewater treating unit when potassium hydroxide splashed the employee's eyes and face.
An employee fell on icy ground outside and broke her left hip.
An employee fell from a ladder and broke his ankle and heel.

Employee was setting a column form with an overhead hoist, when his finger became caught between a metal bracket and a two by four. The bracket lacerated the tip of the employee's finger and shaved a small portion of the bone. Employee was taken to OccuCare Medical clinic, where he was then referred to a specialist at Memorial Herman Hospital.
A steel frame fell over onto an employee's right foot crushing toes. The toes were later amputated.
An employee fell approximately 5 feet from a ladder to the concrete floor below, suffering a back injury.
On or about August 25, 2015, an employee suffered the amputation of two fingers, when his right hand got caught between the wire and spool while running wire.
An employee was cleaning a propane dryer and blowing dust with compressed air when an explosion occurred. The employee suffered a shoulder injury and hand burns.

An employee picked up a case of jelly from one pallet and walked over to another pallet to place the case of product. Once the employee got to the second pallet, he tripped and fell in a lunge position, striking his right knee on the ground and fracturing his right femur.
An employee was operating a circular saw when it cut the employee's hand.

The employer is contracted for all the ground and foundation work for a new grain facility.  On the day of the incident the employer was having gravel delivered to construct a road.  One of the side-dumper trucks got stuck in the ditch across from the site.  In an effort to pull the truck free the employer used one of their Caterpillar D6 dozers and two 16 foot long 5/16 inch chains.  After the first unsuccessful attempt to pull the tractor trailer free the dozer operator attempted another pull. The chain snapped flying backwards towards the dozer where the hook end crashed through the rear window and struck the employee. The employee was taken to the hospital for facial reconstruction surgery.
While exiting the television trailer to take paperwork to another location, an employee slipped on wet stairs and fell to the ground, suffering pain in the left shoulder, left hip, and lower back.
An employee was on a ramp near the planes when he climbed on a loader and his foot slipped. He lost his balance and fell approximately 8 feet to ground, breaking his right ankle.

An employee was climbing a ladder to cut tree limbs that were blocking the customer's view of the satellite dish. The employee fell off the ladder and struck a galvanized pole. The employee was hospitalized with kidney and abdominal trauma.
An employee was injured by a falling box.
On February 16, 2016, an employee suffered a fractured left forearm when their arm was pulled into a hose puller at the reeler end of line 8 in the extrusion department.

An employee was drilling on an electrical panel using a cordless Dewalt 20 volt drill when her glove got caught.  Her hand placement was directly behind the 8" drill bit.  The grove somehow wrapped into the bit and pulled it through.

On September 2, 2015, at 4:00 p.m., an employee had finished trimming some branches while suspended in a tree in a climbing saddle. He was descending when the knot that secured his lifeline to his safety harness clip came loose. He fell approximately 14 feet to the ground and suffered a compression fracture to his L-4 vertebrae in his spine, requiring hospitalization.
An employee sustained broken ribs and a punctured lung when he fell off a ladder at a height of 6 to 10 feet.
An employee was hospitalized after slipping and falling while working as a member of the night freight crew, resulting in an injury to his right elbow.

An employee standing at the end of a production line reached inside a bin that contained 30-75 lbs. of rubber. A bin shifted, pinching the employee's finger between a bin and the roller. A piece of the skin on the employee's middle finger was pulled off.
On November 13, 2016, an employee dropped a cleaning pad while cleaning a hopper. When reaching down to retrieve it, the employee contacted a moving part and suffered a fingertip amputation.
An employee was offloading cargo from a truck when a vehicle struck a hand-truck and the hand-truck then struck the employee. The employee was sent flying into the air and suffered a severed ear.

On December 15, 2016, at approximately 1:00 PM, an employee was pulling boxes when she lost her balance and fell. As she was falling, she attempted to break her fall with her hand and suffered a broken wrist. She was hospitalized and had surgery.

On or about August 6, 2016, an employee was using a vehicle-mounted winch when the holding mechanism malfunctioned and the wire cable kept unwinding. The employee could not pull their right hand back in time and it was pulled into the first "sheave" that was about 6 feet away from the winch, amputating three fingers.

An employee was loading a pair of forks for craning onto a delivery truck. The pair of forks have a sliding mechanism that helps with loading and unloading. One of the forks slid towards the employee as he was loading the truck and his right middle fingertip was caught and amputated (no bone).
An employee was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was adjusting a lifting hook in order to pick up some rebars and was struck in the head by the hook resulting in hospitalization for a concussion.
An employee was crushed between hay bales being loaded into a semi-truck trailer, rupturing his small intestine and crushing his pelvis and shoulder.

An employee was validating the work progress at the jobsite when he picked up an available aluminum ladder and climbed to the roof of the business. As he started descending the roof using the ladder, he lost his footing and fell 15 feet to the asphalt pavement below, injuring his right side and head.
An employee was walking down a flight of three stairs from the client's home into their garage when she missed the last step and fell. She was hospitalized for a fractured tibia and fibula.

An employee entered a bag holder to access a bag placer carriage and monorail where a bag had fallen. While the employee was kneeling below the monorail to pick up the bag, the bag placer carriage engaged, pinching the employee's head between the carriage and monorail. The employee suffered head lacerations that required sutures, as well as contusions on both sides of the head and nose.

On May 24, 2016, at 6:30 a.m., an employee was helping to guide a platform into position while a coworker used a crane to lift it. While guiding the platform, the employee's fingers entered the open walking surface grating. He suffered hand and finger injuries, including possible broken bones and/or finger amputations.

An employee was working in a ceiling crawl space installing an air line. While attempting to switch position, he lost his balance and cut his left wrist with a utility knife. Because the knife hit an artery he was kept over-night while surgeons determined whether or not surgery would be needed.
An employee was working the first base media entrance and stepped between the magnetometer and the bag check table. She tripped over cable and fell breaking a hip.
An employee suffered a left leg injury while exiting a stand-up reach truck, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was walking backwards with a pallet jack that was loaded with two pallets of product on its front forks. He walked into another pallet jack being operated by a coworker. His right ankle/foot struck the operating platform of his pallet jack, breaking bones in his right foot.

An employee traveled to Target in Decatur, Illinois, in a company vehicle to purchase items for a client. The employee slipped on the ice in the parking lot and fell. The employee struck her head on the pavement and was taken to Decatur Memorial by ambulance for treatment.
An employee opened the trap door of a rotating floor on a restaurant to reach a guest's credit card when his leg was caught in the rotating floor mechanism. He suffered a leg fracture.
An employee caught her foot in a pallet and twisted her back resulting in a back hernia that required surgery.
An employee tripped and fell while walking down a hallway, fracturing her elbow.

An employee was driving a flatbed delivery truck loaded with construction materials (e.g. lumber) to a residential construction job site.  The employee drove into the respective subdivision and past his destination.  The employee stopped on the roadway, place the vehicle in reverse, and attempted to drive back to the destination. The vehicle stalled and the employee jumped from the cab of the moving vehicle resulting in a broken ankle.
An employee was using a wrench to tighten a bolt on a baler. When the bolt broke loose, his right forearm struck the edge of his tool cart and fractured.
Employee was reporting for work, got out of the car, slipped on ice, fell and struck the back of the head. He was admitted to the hospital for a brain injury.
An employee was feeding lumber on a conveyor belt of a horizontal band saw and amputated the third finger on the right hand.

An employee in a roadway work zone was struck by a vehicle that left the roadway.  The employee had dismounted the equipment in a coned area when he was struck.  His leg broke, and he was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was attempting to remove the lid from a ladle that contained molten metal. The molten metal splashed onto the employee, burning his right arm, right hand, and back.

On Sunday June 7, 2015, at approximately 4:55 p.m., an employee on the production floor was operating a crimper machine, which is a wire connector crimping machine operated by an unguarded foot pedal. The injured employee was hand-feeding wire pieces into the point of operation when she inadvertently pressed a foot pedal with her right-hand index finger, resulting in an amputation. The point of operation was unguarded at the time.
An employee was troubleshooting a grease line when he contacted an energized electrical line that ran parallel to the grease line. He was shocked and suffered electrical burns to his hand.

An employee was repairing a blower machine from a step ladder.  While on the ladder and using a crowbar, the employee lost his balance and fell to the floor striking his head and back resulting in a concussion and back injury.

An employee was fixing a freezer door from a ladder when the door opened and struck the ladder, causing the employee to fall 12 feet onto the concrete floor. The employee suffered a concussion and fractured legs, ribs, shoulders, and nose.

On 10/21/2015, a roofing employee was performing a roofing tear off of dead wood. During the replacement of dead wood the worker ran out of replacement wood. The worker covered an opening in the roof with felt paper. The employee lost his balance and jumped from the roof of a single story mobile home instead of falling through the felt covering. Both heels were injured.
An employee was operating the manual press. She was changing parts in the machine and activated the foot pedal crushing her right hand in the machine.
An employee working from a swing stage scaffold was struck in the head by the counterweights of a winch that was being used to hoist mud/stucco inside 5 gallon buckets.
An employee was performing maintenance on the wing of an aircraft and fell to the floor fracturing the right side of their body. The employee was not attached to the SRL at the time.

Employee using a sledge hammer to straighten a piece of metal had his grip on the hammer slip. The handle of the hammer then came back and struck his jaw, breaking his jaw and knocking out several teeth.
While unloading trash into a dumpster during roofing activities, an employee fell approximately 15 feet onto an I-beam, breaking ribs.

An employee was using a jib crane to flip a cantilever. He guided the hook with his right hand and used the crane controller with his left hand. The employee hit the "up" button on the controller and his finger was caught between the hook and the cantilever, amputating his right index fingertip.

An employee was erecting a portable ready mix concrete plant and was lifting steel plates into position when one of the plates became unattached from the boom and fell on the employee's foot, amputating three toes.
A maintenance employee was changing out a control transfer in a motor control cabinet when an electric arc occurred, causing burns to his face and arms.

An employee splicing communication cables pricked himself with a piece of rusted metal debris that was on the ground. Later in the day the wound became infected and the employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment.

An employee was adjusting the lacquer recycling machine. When the employee opened the machine to fix the bag, hot liquid sprayed out, causing second degree burns to the right side of the employee's trunk and head.

An employee was transferring two metal bins half full of product to the mill area for production using a forklift truck. As he exited the truck to open the bin door, the bin fell on top of him, crushing the lower half of his body and breaking one leg.

An employee was in an aerial bucket, trimming trees to get to a communication cable. As he moved the bucket, it touched the powerline, resulting in an electrical shock. He suffered severe burns to both arms and was hospitalized.
An employee was preparing material to be roped up to a scaffold crew when a pipe struck him on his hard hat. He suffered a bump on his head.

An employee was moving a pallet with a manual pallet jack when a forklift operator struck the employee while making a U-turn. The employee fell to the ground and suffered a possible hip fracture, requiring surgery.
An employee's finger was amputated while closing the safe door.
An employee was bitten by a rattlesnake on a finger on his right hand while moving boards on location.
An employee was installing a metal roof and handing sheet metal to his coworkers above when the sheet metal slid off the roof and cut him from his elbow to his shoulder.

An employee was checking lumber sizes in a "safe zone" about 18-20 ft from the board edger when a board broke while being processed. The wooden pieces were ejected, striking and injuring the employee 20 ft away. The employee sustained a broken nose, injuries to the face and loss of consciousness.

An employee was standing on top of a masonry wall, removing the wall forms, when a wall form fell. The employee's personal protective equipment was attached to the form. As the form fell, it also brought the employee down 10 feet to the ground below, crushing the employee's left hand, fracturing the spine, and causing lacerations.
An employee amputated the fleshy part of a finger when an automatic feeder malfunctioned.

An employee was hospitalized from injuries he received when he fell off of a ladder.  The employee put an aluminum ladder in the bed of his truck and leaned it against a power line to cut a telephone line.  The employee fell on the concrete area below.

Employees were standing at the company truck about to break for lunch when a log truck came down the road and a tire blew. The weight of the logs broke an axle on the log truck and the tire and wheel broke off striking two of the employees standing at the company truck.
The employee was adjusting limit switches on an energized woodworking machine (tenoner) and amputated the right ring finger.
While fixing a condenser unit, an employee's glove got caught by the belt pulley, amputating two of his fingers.

An employee was unloading product from the truck and slipped off the ramp. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured right arm and a head laceration. The employee was also knocked unconscious for a brief period of time.
An employee was loading an aircraft when she was struck by a dolly being used by another employee. The dolly struck her left foot causing her to fall and fracture her left wrist.
An employee's fingertip was amputated in the workplace.

An employee was using a forklift to unload a pallet from the top rack (approximately 15 feet) of an industrial storage rack. The employee stepped off of the forklift to inspect the contents of the pallet he had just moved. At this time, three separate cardboard boxes of rubber hoses fell from the top rack. While backing away, the employee suffered a scalp laceration (from being struck by the boxes or from tripping and falling).
An employee was holding a metal piece in place in a milling machine when the clamp came down and struck his hand, amputating his right pinky finger.
An employee sustained an amputation to the right index finger after pushing a rod through a roll of plastic sheeting.

An employee was moving carts out of the way to connect a bag cart to a tug. One of the carts hit a seam in the concrete, and the cart's tong arm swung around and hit the employee's arm, fracturing it.
An employee was framing wooden walls.  A gust of wind blew a wall over and knocked the employee to the ground. The employee sustained a shoulder injury and a cut above his eye.
An employee was redrawing a steel wire to reduce the diameter using a redrawing machine. When he attempted to untangle the wire, it amputated his left pinky, ring, and middle fingers.
An employee's middle finger was amputated when it was pinched between a rubber feed tire and a steel tube.

An employee changing filters on a filter system connected to a grinding unit dropped one of the filters into the filter unit. The impact inside the unit created a spark that ignited the aluminum dust, causing an aluminum dust deflagration. A fire ball discharged from the filter unit, contacting and causing second degree burns to the employee's hands.
An employee was unloading food items from a truck using a hand truck.  When the ramp broke, the employee slipped and fell to the ground injuring their chin and breaking the right ankle.
An employee tripped over her feet and fell to the ground, fracturing her right shoulder in two places.

An employee was climbing an extension ladder that was leaning against a generator. The top of the ladder shifted and the employee fell approximately six feet off the ladder onto a concrete curb breaking the lower right leg.
An employee suffered a serious injury resulting in hospitalization when a steel beam being moved on a crane knocked him off the extension ladder he was on.
A volunteer was skiing and fell approximately 20 feet off the edge of the mountain suffering a head injury and several crushed bones.

An employee was performing duties related to lawn care when he was overcome by heat. The employee complained of a stomach ache and started vomiting. EMT services were called and the employee was taken to a local hospital where he was treated and kept overnight for observation.
An employee was performing maintenance on a conveyor when his hand was caught between the conveyor and the sprocket, amputating his left thumb.
An employee slipped and fell on a wet painted ramp while helping people onto a bus, breaking the left leg.
An employee tripped while walking to the refrigerator in the dining area, falling to the floor and injuring a ball socket. The employee required surgery.
An employee was repairing a hot water boiler when a bolt snapped and the employee was sprayed with hot water. The employee was hospitalized with burns.
An employee was hospitalized due to heat-related symptoms.
An employee crushed a finger between two scrap iron parts on a tray resulting in amputation at the hospital.
On September 7, 2016, an employee was hospitalized overnight for dehydration after building a brick wall with the mason group.
A temporary employee working at the facility was scooping product out of a barrel placed on a plastic pallet and stepped off injuring her left hip. She was subsequently hospitalized for treatment.
While treating water in an aboveground tank, an employee became ill from heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.
An employee was unchocking a piece of equipment when his right hand was caught by the machine belt amputating the fourth finger at the first knuckle.
An employee Injured her back while lifting a case of soda and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was walking on the roof and fell 8 feet to the ground. His head struck the ground and he sustained injuries requiring hospitalization.
An employee was putting Brake-R chemical on a shelf above his head. The chemical fell from the shelf and the lid came off. Some of the product splashed him, causing chemical burns.
An employee was using a wire wheel to remove corrosion when a filament from the wire wheel flew off and embedded itself in his hand. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee fell 10 feet from a fixed ladder while performing HVAC maintenance, suffering a lumbar fracture and head concussion.
An employee was smashing down the trash on top of a metal dumpster when he fell 4 to 6 feet, injuring his head, left calf, torso, and scapula.
An employee was breaking off castings on a pneumatic press and crushed his right hand.
The employee was dicing red peppers when he cut his left thumb resulting in the amputation without bone loss of the tip of his left thumb.
An employee was working with a chop saw when his hand was exposed to the blade, partially amputating his right index finger.
An employee's hand was severed just above the knuckle while operating the hub press.
On December 2, 2015, an employee was giving a bath to a patient. The tub door closed on the employee's hand, which became infected and required hospitalization.
An employee ran to retrieve an at-risk patient as he was leaving the premises. She fell down on the floor, bled from her mouth, and broke her right hip. She was hospitalized.
An employee was using Gatorade bottles to store floor cleaning products.  The employee mistakenly drank the floor cleaner, became very ill, and was hospitalized.

An employee was loading a hose for testing in a tensioner when the clamping mechanism activated while his index finger was between the clamp and hose. When he pulled away, his fingertip was amputated.

Employees were opening a hatch at one of the salt water disposal tanks when a spark created a flash fire. The employee was burned in the flash fire and hospitalized. The other employees received minor skin burns and were examined and released the same day.
An employee tripped over a partially open cart washer and fell to the floor, fracturing the right hip.

An employee was inside an open-top trailer using a pendant-operated crane to load packages of extrusions. A load weighing approximately 700 pounds, and measuring approximately 24-feet-long by 2.5-feet-wide, was being moved with straps and loaded onto an existing stack of materials. The employee was positioned between the load and another stack of materials. The employee was unhooking the load when the extrusions inside the package shifted and caused the newly set load to slide and trap the employee between the bundles. The employee suffered spinal fractures, two broken ribs, and a left pneumothorax injury.

An employee was setting a rebar wall panel. After cutting the panel loose, the crane started to ascend. The employee held the crane choker to keep it from getting hung up on anything as it ascended. During this time, he got his finger pinched between the choker and the rebar. He was hospitalized with a potential broken finger on his left hand.

An employee was operating a forklift, carrying an aluminum billet. Another employee was acting as a spotter for the forklift driver. The forklift operator placed the aluminum billet onto the storage rack and began moving away from the area. As the forklift operator was moving back from the area, the forks of the forklift caught another aluminum billet. The aluminum billet rolled off the storage rack and struck the employee who was acting as a spotter. The employee suffered a broken tibia and fibula. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on the broken leg.
An employee was injured during a horseback ride when the horse was spooked and flipped over, crushing the employee and injuring her pelvis.
On or about August 27, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation to the right middle finger and ring finger while working at a sheer press.

An employee suffered an amputation to the right-hand index finger and an injury to the left-hand middle finger when a light curtain failed to protect the point of operation from a press in the manufacturing operation.

An employee was operating a commercial grass mower on an incline when the mower began to roll over. To prevent a rollover, he placed his hand onto the mower deck. During the machine's movement, his hand entered the rotating mower blades under the deck, severely lacerating and injuring his right hand. He was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over plastic produce crates and fell fracturing their right hip.
An employee was shot in the abdomen during an attempted robbery.
An employee was delivering packages, slipped on ice and fell scraping and cutting his elbow. The employee was later hospitalized for an infection.

An employee was troubleshooting a chain and sprocket inside a welder machine conveyor when a coworker started the machine from the other end while the employee's hand was still inside. His left fourth fingertip was amputated.
An employee was assaulted by a shoplifter and was knocked unconscious, suffering a head injury.

At approximately 5:07 p.m., on 7/6/16, an employee tripped on the floor threshold near the window area vault and fell, dislocating the left elbow and fracturing the left forearm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was bitten on the right index finger and left thumb by a client. The employee was hospitalized after an infection developed.
While cutting wood with a table saw, an employee contacted the moving saw blade, amputating half of the left middle finger.

An employee went to measure a concrete beam that had been removed from the ground with an excavator.  The beam, which had been supported on the excavator bucket, fell onto the employee's right foot and crushed it.
An employee was admitted to the hospital for heat exhaustion.

An employee was on a 5-foot ladder cutting a pipe used to carry nitrogen. As the employee was cutting the pipeline, the pipe (which was filled with carbon dioxide) ruptured. The employee suffered a concussion, fractured orbital bones, a skull fracture, and neck injury.
While driving a transfer car, an employee's foot contacted an in-feed conveyor, partially amputating his big toe and index toe. His foot was hanging outside of the car at the time of the incident.
While preparing set props, an employee backed into an unguarded area and fell approximately 10 feet, suffering facial bruises, a right arm radius injury, and a right orbital injury.
An employee broke his right hip when he fell from his chair. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was loading oil into the gun barrel while on a ladder. The gun barrel caught fire possibly from the electric heating element and ignited the employee's FR clothes. The employee received second degree burns on his forearm, his hand, and behind his ear.
An employee slipped off a scaffold that was 45 feet high while hanging curtains from the ceiling of the sanctuary on 5/27/2015 at 8:35pm.
Employee tripped on a metal skid 8' X 20' X 5" and fractured an ankle.
An employee was operating a jointer machine and his left hand contacted the blade amputating the left index fingertip.

On 10/30/2015, an employee fell approximately 17 feet during the installation of ridge cap on a pole barn that was being constructed. The employee suffered head injuries, a punctured lung and facial fractures. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was hospitalized with an infection after a piece of metal became stuck in his right hand while he was moving a metal table.
An employee preparing meals at a residential home slipped and fell on the floor, fracturing a hip.
An employee was using a coin press when it crushed and amputated her middle fingertip. The press guard was in place at the time.
An employee was hospitalized due to skin damage.

An employee was delivering mail to a residence. The mailbox was mounted to the outside of a fence near a gate. A pit-bull/boxer mix that was inside of the fence jumped on the gate, causing it to open. When the dog attacked the employee, she put up her right hand and the dog bit it, resulting in broken bones. She was hospitalized.

On 3/5/15 around noon, an employee fell approximately 8' from a ladder when the ductwork he was releasing swung down, hit the ladder, and rocked it. The employee sustained two left arm fractures (wrist and elbow) and a possible pelvis fracture. The employee was transported to ECMC where he was treated and released.
An employee suffered cramps and was taken to hospital for heat stress symptoms.
On January 6, 2017, at around 10:00 AM, an employee was using a baker scaffold to patch concrete on interior walls when he fell about 4 feet to the hard floor below, fracturing his pelvis.
An employee was injured while unhooking a truck from the wrecker, requiring hospitalization.

Employee was exposed to hot sparks from furnace number 1 in the melt shop, which resulted in his clothing catching on fire. The resulting fire caused second degree burns to the exposed employee and he was hospitalized due to burns.

An employee was walking on a clean, dry floor wearing a cast/boot on her left foot from a previous injury and fell fracturing two bones in her right foot. 
She was transported to the hospital and admitted for treatment.
An employee was involved in a physical altercation with a co-worker, suffering broken teeth, facial fractures, a swollen eye, and back injuries.

On January 29, 2016, an employee was attempting to unjam the nailing machine when a coworker started the machine. The employee's hand was dragged through a chain and sprocket, amputating the right  middle, ring, and little fingers.
An employee was moving a 2' base plate with a fork truck and 1/2 inch chain. He caught his finger between the fork and the chain amputating the right index fingertip.
An employee was cutting and deboning shoulders when the knife lacerated his abdomen. He was hospitalized.

An employee was going to a residence to provide emergency medical treatment to a patient with shortness of breath. The employee began having breathing problems and suffered poisoning once inside the residence, where the patient had set off insect foggers.
An employee was feeding the sander on the Hessman Sanding Machine. A panel of plywood (18"x96"x3/4") fell from the buggy and struck him on the head, neck, and shoulders.

An employee was cleaning the paddles on a bone canon when his frock was caught in the machine. The employee tried to free himself from the machine and in the process his hand was caught in the machine. His left pinky finger was amputated as a result.
An employee shoveling snow outside of the facility slipped and hit his head.
An employee was holding a hydraulic hose while pressurizing a high-torque wrench to remove large nuts from a pressure vessel. The hydraulic hose ruptured, puncturing the employee's left index finger.
A worker slipped and fell breaking her hip.

An employee was attempting to reach and adjust a chain that was holding up one of the very large bags in the baghouse. The employee crawled on top of the bags, which are held in place by angle irons 11 inches apart. While crawling toward the bag, the employee lost his grip and fell through the 11-inch gap. He fell 37 feet to the ground, breaking a foot and fracturing a vertebra.
An employee was using a pressure washer and lacerated a finger.

An employee was performing maintenance on a compressor unit. The compressor unit inside the building was shut off. The employee went to restart the compressor and a flash fire occurred. The employee suffered first and second degree burns to the hands, face, and arms, requiring hospitalization.
On August 19, 2015, an employee severed his right hand middle finger while operating a unguarded auger.
An employee was engaged in sanitation of the meat blender in the blend room and amputated the right thumb.

An employee was working on top of a steel girder when he stepped down to a concrete bend that was approximately 30 inches beneath the girder and diagram. While climbing down, the employee's retractable locked up, causing the employee to lose his balance, slip, and fall against the girder and diagram, fracturing his left leg.
An employee was training soldiers on the new paladin military vehicle. The hatch for the driver's seat closed on his right hand, damaging his middle and index fingers requiring surgery.
An employee was struck by truck at the loading dock resulting in a broken pelvis.
An employee was pulling a mold cart. The cart tipped and the employee fell onto the concrete floor injuring his back.
An employee was pulling a cool lift when he lost his balance and fell, striking his head on a guardrail and the ground and fracturing his wrist.
An employee was cutting blocks with a microtome machine when the employee's left index finger was caught in the machine, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was performing maintenance on a communications antenna. He was trying to connect a harness to the ladder, but the shackle was hard to open. His arm gave way and he slipped, falling 30 feet.

An employee was performing maintenance (cleaning) on the top and bottom roll coater machine at the end of his shift. During the cleaning process, the employee touched the roller and his left arm was pulled into the machine. The employee was transported to the hospital.
An employee was working on a roof and fell through a skylight. He hit his head and body and was hospitalized with head and back injuries. He was wearing fall protection at the time.
While loading luggage into a can and dolly, an employee's hand became caught in a pinch point, partially amputating the middle finger.
An employee was using a two-step step stool to reach a high shelf when she fell and struck her knee on the stool. She broke her left knee and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee's finger was amputated while changing a coupling on a drive shaft. The finger was pinched between an indexer sprocket and the cell chain.

Two employees had just completed transferring a patient to a bed using a Hoyer Lift.  The employees were then going to wash the patient.  One of the employees stepped away from the bed and tripped on the Hoyer Lift.  The employee fell and struck her head on the wall.  The employee was hospitalized.
The rope broke while a new cross arm was being installed on an electrical power pole. An employee walking under the rope was struck by the falling arm.

An employee was performing maintenance on the Niagara Punch Press machine. He was looking at the die setting. When the machine cycled, the employee's hand was caught between the pin and bussing resulting in the right forearm amputation.
An employee was pushing a piece of wood through a saw blade when the blade partially amputated his right index finger.
An accident occurred on or around January 26, 2015, when an employee was working on a MAC valve and was exposed to fly ash.

An employee was inspecting a pump house frame when he discovered the back board box was installed upside down. He enlisted a coworker to help remove and reinstall the box. His left hand was inside the box and his right hand was underneath it as it moved a few inches. When it cleared the framework, the box fell and pinched the employee's finger between it and a piece of angle iron below. His right middle fingertip was partially amputated.
Employee was hospitalized after cutting his finger while operating a water-jet cutting machine.
An employee was greasing/cleaning a machine barring when his shirt was caught in a roller, pulling his arm into the machine. He suffered an open left distal radius fracture with soft tissue damage.
An employee suffered a finger injury while drilling a blade at or near 101 Sunrise Ridge Road in Brookings, South Dakota.
An employee was walking backwards while pulling a cart full of coolers into the facility, tripped over a mat, and fell breaking four ribs. The employee was hospitalized.

Employees were manually aligning 6"x6"x9' stainless steel beams weighing approximately 300 lbs on the tank stands. The injured employee and another employee were aligning beams in the same sequence on the same line.  The supervisors were making the final adjustments when the employee attempted to help and his right little finger was pinched between the beam and the beam that was already in place.  The employee was wearing gloves at the time of the incident. This resulted in a partial amputation of the little finger on the employee's right hand.

An employee was reassembling and calibrating  the Cherry Burrell Machine and leaned under the machine while it was running.  The employee's hand slipped into the point of operation amputating the right hand index fingertip.

An employee was standing in a basket attached to a forklift. The lift lowered the basket to the ground and the operator disconnected the basket straps. The employee in the basket was attached to the forklift not the basket. As the lift drove away, the employee was pulled and fell out of the basket hitting his head and shoulder.

An employee was working with seven other employees to manually lift, move and place a section of fencing. While setting the fencing down, the injured employee's finger was pinched resulting in the degloving of the left hand middle fingertip.
The injured employee was working the 2nd shift (2:30pm - 11:00pm) packaging bags of lime (material). The employee's arms came in contact with the lime.  He was later hospitalized.
An employee was walking between machines when his left foot was caught on a slip roll pedestal. He fell to the ground and fractured his right tibia, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee had just come out of the restroom and was waiting by a stack of pallets. A coworker turned on his pallet jack and moved the handle, causing it to move in the wrong direction. The jack then hit the employee's left leg, breaking it above the ankle and requiring surgery.
An employee fell 12 feet from a pitched roof before installing the anchor point, D ring system, and retractable lanyard.

An employee was attempting to remove a piece of wood that was lodged between the rollers and a piece of metal on the conveyor belt using a wrench. The employee's gloved hand was caught in the machine resulting in the amputation of the right pinky fingertip.
An employee was hospitalized after slipping and falling on a wet floor and fracturing her right hip.
An employee was moving a kettle of molten metal when the molten metal spilled and burned the employee.

An employee was trying to remove pepperoni that was jammed in the guard of a slicer. As he pulled out the pepperoni, his hand was caught in the slicer blade. His right hand index, middle, and ring fingers were amputated.
An employee was walking towards the kitchen when she slipped on the wet floor and fell shattering her right kneecap, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using the scanner, tripped over the scanner cord and fell fracturing a hip.
An employee slipped and fell on an icy sidewalk while delivering mail, suffering a compound ankle fracture.

On 1/24/2017, an employee was dismounting an excavator when his safety vest got caught on one of the levers. The lever engaged and caused the bucket to drop on a second employee who was standing close to the excavator and crushed both of his ankles.

An employee was employed as a tour guide for this steel mill facility.  He was giving a tour and was walking down a two step set of stairs when he missed the second step and fell to the floor. Later that day he went to the hospital and was admitted for three broken ribs on his left side.

An employee was installing internet on a mid span cable using a 28-foot extension ladder. While the employee was descending, the ladder shifted and the employee fell to the ground, suffering contusions.
An employee's hand was crushed by a cocoa press. The employee was hospitalized.

On or about 4/2/15, at 3:15 p.m., an employee was moving a catwalk that provided fall protection at elevated positions during  manufactured home building. The catwalk tilted while being moved. The employee was struck by the falling catwalk and his right foot was crushed.
An employee was skiing downhill with his class and attempting to stop when he fell and broke his collarbone and sternum.

Employees were picking up a mud pump using a winch and two trucks. The winch line slipped and broke causing the truck holding the pump to be raised approximately five feet off the ground and then slammed back down. The employee in the truck suffered a compression fracture in their back.

At approximately 12:45 p.m., on 23 July 2015, an employee was gathering nitric acid at 67% into an 8oz bottle. The employee filled the bottle and it splashed acid in 
the employee's face, causing chemical burns.

An employee was using a hydraulic vise to secure an "I" beam to the band saw table. The power switch on the vise was triggered, causing the loss of his left-hand middle finger. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was on a roof and getting a new battery for his drill when he fell through a fiberglass skylight and injured his right elbow, requiring surgery.
An employee was struck by a 70-pound flange that fell off a passing forklift, sustaining a broken right fibula.

An employee was removing lashing turn-buckles on the bottom level of a container when a turn-buckle fell. The turn-buckle swivel crushed the employee's left middle finger between deck plating, and his fingertip had to be medically amputated.
An employee was hospitalized due to a flash fire at a compressor station while servicing a stage 2 compressor in Alexander, North Dakota.
On or about 1/25/15, an exercise rider, was attempting get on a horse when the horse spooked and turned suddenly.  The employee fell injuring his knee. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was making rounds in the Inmate Housing Unit C when he slipped on wet stairs inside of the housing unit and fell injuring his neck and back.
Employee slipped and fell on a wet wooden access ramp at a residential home while delivering mail.

An employee was hospitalized after suffering breathing difficulties related to a compressed air spray operation to spray paint fire extinguishers conducted on August 19, 2015. A respirator wasn't worn and no monitoring was conducted to determine employee exposure during spray operations.
An employee fell on a walking working surface, suffering fractures to the left wrist and knee.
While delivering mail/packages to a residence that had no sidewalk, an employee slipped in the mud, fell, and broke her right ankle.

An employee was preparing to unload a truck mounted shipping container by activating the dock plate which is manually operated with a handle. While lowering the dock plate onto the back of the truck, the dock plate recoiled upon striking the right side of the truck causing the plate not to clear the truck as required to lay flat for unloading operations. The employee's left ring finger was pinched between the steel dock plate and left side steel edge of the dock plate.
An employee fell through a hole in the 3rd floor to the 2nd floor and landed onto a set of chicken cages.  The employee broke two ribs and sustained a fracture in the upper neck.

The injured employee and another worker were working at an elevation of 10 feet, 7 inches on top of a mezzanine while landing bundles of decking that were being  moved by a crane.  The bundle of decking had to be spun by the crane in order to be landed correctly. The employee lost his footing during this process and fell from the beam he was standing on.
An employee's right arm was caught in a "notcher" machine and amputated above the wrist.

An employee was moving a 220 pound cutting edge (blade) onto a pallet using a forklift. The blade was unstable and the employee exited the forklift to steady the blade. The blade shifted and fell onto her left ring finger resulting in the amputation of the finger up to the first digit.
An employee was welding a trailer fender.  The tire burst and debris struck the welding mask causing a facial laceration and temporary vision impairment. The injured employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell while moving a chair.
Employee fell 15 feet from a concrete form and broke his pelvis.

An employee was leaning against the truck frame in the back of the truck with his hand resting on the edge of the frame close to the truck's mud flap spring release. A student unknowingly pushed down on the spring amputating the employee's left pinky fingertip.
An employee was operating a saw and contacted the saw blade resulting in a fingertip amputation.
Employee slipped on ice and fell in a customer parking lot.  The employee will require surgery to repair a broken leg.

An employee had a steel beam suspended from an overhead crane and was attempting to lower it onto the ground. He had one hand on the end of the beam while his other hand held the remote control for the crane. While moving it to the saw area, he stepped on a stack of beams. The top beam tipped over and landed on his right foot, fracturing three bones.
An employee pressed a button to raise an overhead door and ducked under the door as it was rising. The door broke loose from the its cable and fell, striking his head.
An employee suffered pneumonia, requiring hospitalization, after sealing tiles with a chemical sealer. PPE was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was delivering parts when he complained of chest and arm pain. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was installing metal flooring and had rested the pieces to be installed. When the employee moved one of the metal grates, the other fell over and landed on the employee's hand, amputating the left ring fingertip.
An employee was struck by a material moving machine and suffered a fractured right ankle.
An employee was attempting to retrieve something from on top of a racking system when the employee fell through the racking and suffered a head injury, requiring hospitalization.

An employee cut a hole in the roof to install a vent curb and then fell 15 feet through the hole to the concrete floor below, sustaining leg and pelvic fractures. The hole was uncovered at the time of the incident.
An employee's right-hand index fingertip was amputated by a mixer-grinder machine head. The grinder was still spinning at the time of the incident.

On September 7, 2015, at about 04:00 PM, an employee fell from a 4- to 5-foot scaffold while cutting an aluminum structure beam with a chain saw. The saw kicked back, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall to the concrete floor. He sustained a head laceration and was hospitalized.

An employee passed out and was found unconscious. The employee regained consciousness and was found to have a gash near the right temple. Blood was observed on a parts cart and the floor where the employee was first found. EMS responded and took the employee to Doctor's West Hospital. A cat scan was performed and the employee was found to have minor internal brain bleeding. The employee was taken to Grant Hospital for further tests.
On or about September 14, 2015 between 3:30 pm-4:00 pm, an employee operating a chop saw in the Cut Shop had their right hand amputated (four fingers and half of palm).
An employee was pushing a pocket stream feeder cart sideways across the floor. The cart tipped over and fell onto the employee's foot crushing two toes that were later amputated.
An employee was attempting to dismount a tall storage rack and fell breaking the right leg.
An employee was walking into work, tripped on a piece of angle iron, and fell injuring his cheekbone and head.
An employee was attempting to reinstall a chain on a drive sprocket when his right thumb was pinched as the chain rolled the chain sprocket, amputating his thumb below the knuckle.
An employee was delivering parts to a customer's residence and was bitten on the right hand by a dog.
An employee suffered a broken ankle and was hospitalized when a large metal baffle fell from the table and stuck his leg.
An employee was cleaning an asphalt paving machine when the roller struck him in the leg.

An employee was putting tools into a job box when another employee closed the lid, pinching his left middle fingertip in the handle, resulting in the tip being amputated up to the finger nail. The employee received stitches in the ER and was released on the same day.
On or about June 26, 2015, at approximately 1240 hrs. an employee for J&M Energy Services suffered the amputation of the distal phalanx of his right thumb when it was caught in a pumping unit.
An employee fell from the top of drums loaded on the rear of his service truck while trying to reach absorbent materials. He struck the shelves in the truck, straining and tearing a back muscle.
As an employee was moving a grill to be cleaned, the employee's finger was caught between the grill and the wall.
An employee was loading rebar onto the forks of a forklift when the rebar rolled off the forks and struck the employee, breaking the right leg.

An employee was operating the fiberglass pipe end abrasive wheel grinder. The grinder has a copper pipe that sprays water onto the abrasive wheel when it sands the fiberglass pipe. The employee struck the pipe with a piece of wood to remove a clog. His hand slipped, and his right index finger was grinded on the face of the abrasive wheel.
An employee was hospitalized after scrapping his arm on a metal stud wall at a job site.  The cut/scrape became infected.
On or about November 6, 2015, an employee's left ring finger was amputated while pushing a turkey into a hock cutter.
An employee was performing vertical casting activities when he felt overheated and experienced cramping, dizziness, and nausea. He was hospitalized with heat exhaustion.

An employee was working inside a trailer with an approximately 7-foot-long tube. The tube is used to straighten the walls of the trailers and has a detachable base. The tube slid down the trailer wall, and the employee's left pinky finger got caught between the tube and the detachable base. He sustained an amputation injury from his first knuckle and was hospitalized.
Employee was admitted to the hospital for back strains and muscle spasms after subduing a patient.
An employee stepped on a piece of bridge decking and fell through to the ground, suffering a cut on the head and one broken rib.
An employee was operating a service rig with a snubbing crew when a flash fire or explosion occurred and severely burned the employee.
An employee was standing on an orchard ladder while trimming a bush. He lost his balance and fell 6 to 8 feet onto the asphalt road, breaking his hip.

An employee was hospitalized as a result of a struck by hazard to the head.  An employee was operating a yard truck and attempted to disconnect from a trailer. The glad hand snapped and struck him in the head.
An employee was servicing a labeling machine. He waved his hand past the light sensor to activate the labeler and got his ring finger caught between the chain and sprocket.

While disconnecting the chain from the connecting point of the hangar door, the employee's left pinky got caught between the chain and the door. The tip of the pinky and the top part of the nail came off.
An employee was walking when he tripped over the forks of a forklift and fell on his face.
Employee suffered an amputation of the tip of his thumb while using a table saw to cut wood.

An employee was on the ground floor securing the containment with flexible tarp when the wind started to move it around.  A gust of wind blew against the flexible tarp, knocking him backwards and causing him to land on the ground on his right wrist. His wrist fractured and required hospitalization.
An employee fell from a flat roof.
While setting up a curing work area, an employee was exposed to extreme heat from the curing operation and steam, requiring hospitalization for heat exhaustion.
An employee was struck by a forklift truck while walking in the warehouse and sustained a leg injury.

An employee was about 13' up a cell tower in a spider basket taking steel off of the tower for new reinforcement. The employee fell and sustained lower back fractures. The employee was not tied off at the time.
An employee was removing a die from a machine when it fell and fractured his right thumb.

An employee was installing a robotic welder and finishing the cement grouting around the workstation when his right foot entered the service pit of an adjunct active robotic welder. The active robotic welder began its cycle and crushed/pinned the employee's right foot against the barrier guard and the welder. He suffered lacerations and fractures to the big toe and two adjacent toes. The active welder was guarded at the time of the incident.
While attempting to install a hand line, an employee made contact with an energized power line, receiving second and third degree burns to the left hand. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell 4 feet off a ladder, fracturing the lower left leg.
An employee was getting a drink at a customer's deli when she fell through an open hatch in the floor and fractured her femur.

An employee was on his last delivery. As he entered his trailer, the cables on the door broke and struck him on the head. He fell out of the trailer, and the door caught his ankle. He suffered a blood clot and required foot/ankle surgery.

An employee was standing on a movable machine bed. The employee reached up to grab a rail and caught her hand in a shear point between a bearing block and the machine frame. Her right hand pinky and ring fingers were amputated to approximately the second joint.
An employee's arm was caught in a construction hoist's counterweight, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was injured in a fight and suffered bleeding in the brain.

An employee's right hand was on the mezzanine near the catwalk when a coworker adjusted the catwalk, causing it to move and set down on the employee's right middle fingertip. When the employee attempted to remove his hand, his middle fingertip was partially amputated.

On July 28, 2016, at approximately 10:00 p.m., an employee was on a locomotive that struck a metal plate next to a rail, causing the plate to flip up and strike the employee on the leg. He suffered a fracture to the left ankle area.
An employee was in training to use a metal stamp machine when his left hand got caught in the machine crushing the left ring finger.

An employee was working from an extension ladder to paint the side of a single-story residential home when he lost his footing, fell to the ground, struck his head on the concrete surface below, and sustained a head injury to the point of unconsciousness. He was hospitalized.

An employee was entering a laboratory at a customer's location to deliver drinking water when a gust of wind and the pressurization of the laboratory caused the door to close on the employee's right pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee working on an incline belt was caught between two rollers, breaking her left arm.
On September 29, 2016, an employee was playing baseball with clients when he suffered a torn patellar tendon avulsion in his right knee, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was cutting castings off of trees with a saw when the sawblade caught or broke and pulled his hand into the blade.  His right-hand ring finger was amputated, and the back of his hand was lacerated.
An employee was applying a belt dressing to an aggregate conveyor when his arm was caught by the conveyor. He suffered arm and pinky finger fractures, requiring hospitalization.

An employee returned to work on July 27, 2016, after being off since May. He was experiencing cramps although he was keeping hydrated. The employee began to feel worse and experience cramps. He was late admitted to a hospital for potential heat stroke.

An employee was removing an attachment from a skid steer. He released the locking devices of the bucket and disconnected hydraulic hoses from the machine, but the bucket did not separate completely from the machine. The employee operated the machine and raised the bucket to check if debris was preventing it from disconnecting. When he came over to check the bucket, it dropped on and broke his left foot.

On September 19, 2016, an employee was sliding a ductwork transition across the ground and tripped over a 4-inch step. The employee fell to the ground and the flange on the ductwork amputated the employee's fingertip.
An employee was working in a launder trough inside a clarifier structure when he fell out of the trough to the concrete floor 16 feet below. He was hospitalized with a head injury.

An employee was trimming a tree limb with a chainsaw while working off of an extension ladder. The ladder fell and the employee fell approximately 10-12 feet with the ladder landing on the ground in a standing position. He broke his right leg in three places and suffered an open fracture to his lower right leg requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was attempting to sit on a chair located on a loading dock when he lost his balance and fell backwards off the loading dock, which was 34 inches above the ground below. He broke three ribs, fractured five vertebrae, and ruptured his spleen, requiring hospitalization.

An employee of another unit was moving bar stock with a forklift when it became stuck as he went through a doorway. The injured employee was helping to move the bar stock and when the forklift lowered, the bar stock fell onto the injured employee's hand amputating his middle finger.
On October 22, 2015, an employees was using a blow torch on a car and cut through the air conditioning line, causing an explosion and burns to the face.
On June 10, 2015, an employee was operating a UTV on the range when the UTV hit a patch of soft sand and flipped. The employee fell out of the UTV, landed on an ammunition can, and injured his back.
An employee was hospitalized after being nauseated and throwing up from working outside in the sun for some time.
On November 10, 2016, an employee's right ring finger was caught and avulsed between a guard and a band saw, requiring amputation.
An employee fell while picking fruit from a ladder, fracturing two vertebrae.
An employee got caught in the top plate of a shaper in the dovetail department. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on three left-hand fingers.
While using a band saw to cut pork chops, an employee amputated the right thumb tip, including portions of the finger nail.
An employee was hospitalized after breaking a hip while walking in a sewer.
An employee was injured after stepping out of a jobsite trailer that had no stairs. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a fractured right leg.

Employee was replacing the panel on a Case 650K dozer.  The panel slipped and the employee's hand made contact with the fan, resulting in a major laceration and bone crushing.  Employee was admitted to the hospital and underwent hand surgery with a hand specialist.

An employee was blowing shot dust from a shot blast machine. When the employee tilted the machine, it became unhooked and hit the employee in the back and shoulder. He fractured his back and was hospitalized.

On 12/18/16, an employee was walking up the basement steps while carrying a few packages of frozen meat when she missed the top step, lost her balance, and fell. When she attempted to brace herself from the fall, her right hand went though the lower tier window of the back door, severely lacerating her right wrist.
An employee was carrying a mirror to the dumpster when it broke and cut his left wrist, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was splicing two wires using the terminal press when her left index finger entered the point of operation and was amputated.

At 9:00 AM, on 5/10/16, an employee and a coworker were preparing to replace a malfunctioning gauge board on an asphalt tank. They transferred contents from the malfunctioning tank to another tank and shut down the malfunctioning tank. Every energy source was off/locked out. Using an impact wrench, the employee began loosening/removing the bolts holding the manway cover on the tank. After he loosened several bolts, some hot liquid asphalt splashed out from behind the cover onto the concrete pad and onto his hands, arms, and legs. He suffered second and third degree burns to both arms, hands, and legs, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was securing a flatbed semi-trailer on top of another semi-trailer using cargo chains and load binders when he rolled his ankle, breaking it.

An employee was loading his pickup truck. While waiting for an inspector, he decided to clean some trash out of the bed of his truck. A gust of wind then came along and blew the employee off the tailgate of the truck. He lost his balance and fell to the ground, fracturing his left leg and requiring hospitalization.
Employees were setting up bleachers for an event. One of the employees fell from the bleachers and was injured.
An employee was helping to work on an electrical panel when the panel arc flashed. The employee suffered burns over 65% of his body and was hospitalized.

An employee was supervising as a forklift operator was unloading switchgear. While retracting the forks, the forklift operator backed into a lip on the ground, which caused the forks to lift up and the switchgear to tip over. The switchgear fell onto the employee's right leg, breaking two bones.
Employee was lowering a boom lift while installing fire protection piping. The hydraulics failed, causing the employee to break the lower left leg.

An employee was helping to install a guide wire for a high voltage 7620 volt line. He was holding onto the guide wire at ground level while a coworker in an elevated aerial lift was tightening the guide wire bolt. The coworker came into contact with a live wire bolt, which energized the guide wire that the employee had in his hand. Both of his toes suffered electrical burns, requiring hospitalization. PPE was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee suffered burns to both hands and the right side of the face while moving a vehicle on the fire line on 7/26/15 at 5 p.m. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was setting up a vessel to be cleaned. When the employee opened up a sample port on the vessel, he was sprayed with yeast extract, suffering first and second degree burns to his torso and upper legs.
Two employees were engaged in horseplay and one employee was knocked to the ground, suffering a left femur fracture.

An employee and a coworker were applying stucco from a scaffold to the exterior of a building. When the employee and his coworker stepped off the scaffold onto a canopy awning, the canopy came off, causing them to fall. The employee suffered a broken left ankle and tailbone, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was lowering a dock plate when it became stuck. As he used a pole to lift the dock plate, the plate became dislodged and fell on his foot, severely cutting one toe.
An employee's foot got caught under a forklift, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was setting up equipment to move a load of steel coils via an overhead crane when his left index finger was smashed between the lifting hook and lifting device, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was walking from the back prep area to the line when he slipped and fell. He attempted to brace himself on the side of the fryer, but he missed and his arm went into the hot fryer. He suffered partial thickness burns to approximately 3/4 of the arm.

On November 11, 2015 at approximately 12:15 pm smoke from an electrical fire in the building activated the fire alarm.  An announcement was made over the PA system that it was a false alarm, so employee(s) remained at their work stations. Moments later the employee(s) were told to exit the building.  The fire department was called and arrived on scene (for approximately 30 minutes).  The employee coughed for the remainder of the day and the rest of the night.  Due to difficulty breathing and excessive coughing the employee sought care at the emergency room.  She was admitted.
An employee tripped and fell off the back of a flatbed truck trailer, fracturing the L1 vertebra.
An employee was getting a sample brick from the brick stack when bees came out of the stack. The employee then dismounted the stack and broke his ankle and lower leg.

A maintenance employee was working on a snorkel lift that was up in the air. He reached down to retrieve something and steadied himself by placing his other hand on the sprocket. The sprocket moved and amputated his right thumb tip, including the nail. The lift guard was not in place at the time of the incident.
An employee lost his balance while tying his shoe and fell, fracturing a hip.

An employee was repairing a seal on a valve operator. He placed the drum cover over the actuator piston using an overhead crane and was manipulating the drum while operating the crane controls. While attempting to lower the drum the final 2 inches, he inadvertently pushed the wrong button on the hoist control, causing the drum to move upward. As a result, his left thumb was pinched between the base plate and drum cover. There was no amputation.

An employee was disassembling a deck on the press when an unexpected signal was sent to the motor. The motor then started up while the employee's hand was in the point of operation. The employee suffered severe lacerations and broken bones in the right hand, requiring hospitalization.
Employee was moving a stock cart when he smashed his left pinky finger between the handle and something else.
On July 20, 2016, an employee experienced a fingertip amputation when the ram of a hydraulic press crushed the employee's finger on a trunnion part.
An employee was installing an auger on a digger derrick. As he slid the kelly bar down into the sleeve, the bar/sleeve amputated his fingertip.
An employee was wrapping meat using a deli meat wrapping machine. The machine fell onto her right leg causing a laceration.
An employee had an allergic reaction to a patient's anti-fungal foot cream. The employee developed a rash and experienced breathing problems, requiring hospitalization.
An employee tripped over a computer wire and fell to the ground. The employee suffered a possible broken hip and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was grinding parts on a pedestal belt grinder and suffered a left thumb amputation.

An employee was working/walking near the exterior of the mobile kitchen trailer when a vertical swinging door on the mobile kitchen trailer suddenly fell, striking the employee. The employee suffered fractures to the nose, hip, pelvis, and cheek.
An employee shopping for a client was struck by a car in the store parking lot.
An employee was assisting a patient in the restroom when they both fell on the floor resulting in injury to her back. She was hospitalized.
An employee's left thumb tip was amputated while she was cutting pork loin with a band saw.
An employee was carrying a piece of hydraulic shoring on his shoulder and it slipped. He grabbed it and pinched his finger, amputating the tip.
An employee was cutting a dock plate when it came loose and landed on the employee's left foot, injuring several toes. Two toes had to later be surgically amputated.

An employee was standing on a 3-foot tall scaffold, using a wrench to turn a tool on a machine, when his wrench slipped. He then slipped off the scaffold and hit the floor, breaking six ribs and suffering a contusion.
An employee's left, fourth finger got caught in the roller of the pillowcase folder.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood on the table saw and caught the side of his thumb on the saw blade amputating the left thumb nail. The employee was hospitalized.

On August 1, 2016, at approximately 10:00 a.m., an employee was driving a stand-up rider forklift at a cold storage facility. As he was turning to exit the freezer, his glove became caught in the steering wheel and he lost control of the forklift. He was thrown from the operators' platform and became pinned between the forklift and a bollard post located at the freezer door opening, fracturing his pelvis.
An employee was working with a palletizer to restock pallets of milk crates when his foot was caught and crushed between the pallet and a catwalk.
An employee was recording the serial numbers located on the side of wooden crates containing parts. One or more of the wooden crates fell on the employee, breaking the employee's ankle and hip.
On 9/9/2015, an employee suffered a right ring fingertip amputation and fractured rib when a storage rack containing tires fell on top of him after being struck by his forklift.
An employee's left hand got caught between two sheeter rollers when she lifted the guard to adjust the rolls. She did not break any bones, but was hospitalized for treatment.
A temporary employee attempted to remove dunnage from on top of a bundle of rebar when a bundle shifted and struck his left shoulder/arm area, fracturing his left hand and left leg.
An employee was setting up on block one when his left-hand middle and ring fingers got crushed by a cylinder.
A worker was fabricating a spool from steel. A portion of the steel fell onto the worker's hand and sliced through the tip of his pinky.
An employee was mopping floors in a kitchen, slipped, fell, and broke his arm.

An employee was presetting a roller channel machine.  While presetting the chuck, a jam occurred.  The employee tried to clear the jam.  The pusher activated and pinched the tip of the employee's right index finger.  The employee went to the emergency room, which documented the injury as an amputation.
An employee was unloading a drill. The auger was still spinning. His clothing became caught on a bolt and he was caught up in the auger, suffering three fractured left ribs and bruises.
An employee had his hand on the back door when someone opened the front door and the draft caused the back door to open and jammed his finger.

Employee was offloading customer hoses at facility and attempted to remove the cap off of a hose. The hose still maintained some pressure, and when the employee removed the cap, Styrene splashed onto the employee's face and midsection. The employee was sent to the hospital and was admitted overnight.

An employee was working with a coworker to clear some scrap paper that was blocking a sensor on the baler and preventing the baler door from closing. The door could only be raised or lowered using the manual controls. While the employee was clearing the scrap paper from the sensor, his coworker activated the controls to lower the door. The door closed on his left hand, causing multiple metacarpal fractures and lacerations.
An employee was emptying a fryer and spilled hot cooking oil on the legs of a second employee. The second employee was hospitalized.
Employee experienced leg injuries when snow fell on the employee's leg(s) while trying to manually dislodge snow/ice from the elevated bed of a dump truck.
An employee was installing a cable outside a customer's home using a 6-foot ladder when he fell from the ladder and broke his left tibia.

An employee's arm was between two flanges, one stationary and the other being pulled by a come-along. The non-stationary flange came free and caught the employee's arm between the flanges, fracturing his right ulna. He was hospitalized.
An employee slipped on ice, resulting in a broken hip.

Employee received burns to his left index finger and portion of his left hand, while performing routine service on a plastic mold injection machine. Employees needed hospitalization at University of Rochester Strong Hospital.
An employee's shirt got caught on the coil winder, pulling her into the machine. She was not wearing her apron at the time.
An employee working at the service desk tripped over an object and fell to the ground, hitting their upper left arm and sustaining a possible fracture.
Am employee was adjusting the grinding plate of a machine when the plate fell on the employee's hand, amputating a finger.

An employee was using a vertical meat cutting bandsaw to cut short ribs. The employee's glove became caught in the working section of the sawblade, resulting in the amputation of the left ring and little fingertips.

An employee was on a lower level roof (unknown height) and was climbing an attached ladder fixed to the building to go to the upper roof. He was almost to the top of the ladder when he missed a step and fell approximately 15' to 18' onto the lower flat roof. He landed on his feet first, then buttocks, and finally his side and was unable to get up. He was hospitalized and required surgery for a broken right femur.
An employee fell and fractured her ankle while walking in the parking lot. She was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was directing traffic at the main parking lot along Lancaster Avenue. The employee experienced heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.

On 10/6/16, at approximately 2:00 p.m., an employee was operating a compound miter box saw to cut cardboard tubes. The saw kicked upward, pulling her right arm into the blade and lacerating the right bicep. The saw was guarded at the time.

After cutting 2 x 4s with the saw, the employee was breaking wood using his foot in a stomping motion to break the remaining halves. The half with nails sticking out swung upwards and struck the employee in the leg, lodging two nails into the employee's knee.

An employee was pulling the sampler attached to a 140-pound hammer out of the ground using the "cat head" (a revolving spool that helps raise the hammer) when he was pulled up off the ground and into the cat head by the force of the rope being pulled. He broke his left forearm.
An employee was cleaning a dough mixer when the mixer was operated, causing the employee to have one finger amputated and two other fingers fractured and severely injured.
An employee was carrying a door frame and door when it slipped and fell, bending the employee's right index finger backward and dislocating it. The employee required surgery.

A crew was removing material (hot ash) from the outside of the loop seal on the power boiler. Once they finished removing the loose material, the crew was exiting the platform when the material inside the boiler gave way. The material came out of the boiler's manway door and contacted an employee burning his hands and the back of his legs.
An employee was using a pressure washer when he lacerated his left middle finger. He was hospitalized overnight.

On Thursday, May 5, 2016, at approximately 12:15AM, an employee was severely burned when performing maintenance work on an aluminum furnace door. The employee suffered second and third degree burns to 20% of his body.
An employee was breaking a horse when the horse ran into the metal railing of the pen, fracturing the employee's knee.

An employee was using a bulldozer when it became stuck. He attached the lifting slings to the brackets and was lifting the bulldozer and placing it on top of cargo. After hooking up the shackles/sling to the bulldozer, he held onto the cable with his left hand and flagged the crane operator to lift with his right hand. When the slack was taken up, the employee's left pinky was pinched between the cable and the cab of the bulldozer, partially amputating his pinky fingertip.
An employee was ripping a board using a circular saw and amputated part of his left thumb.

An employee and coworker were installing a cable lifeline while standing on a scaffold platform. The wall plate of the middle scaffold support broke at the connection point, causing the employee and coworker to fall approximately 12 feet. The employee was hospitalized with a ruptured spleen, requiring surgery.
Two employees were hospitalized for carbon monoxide exposure.
An employee was setting beams using a crane and lifting hoist when a beam tipped over and broke his leg.
While moving a 125-pound wooden door to a table, an employee's finger was caught between the table edge and the door frame. The employee's right middle fingertip was amputated and fractured.
On or about February 14, 2016, an employee was scrubbing equipment by hand and was hospitalized for a chemical irritation to the back of the hands from the diluted acid cleaner.
An employee was demolishing a piping assembly. When the weight shifted, the pipe rolled and struck the employee, fracturing and severely lacerating his left index finger.
An employee fell from a scaffold rack while unloading scaffolding material from a flatbed truck and sustained a broken wrist and head bump.

An employee operating a stand-up forklift removed a pallet from a storage rack. His left foot was hanging over the rear of the forklift as he backed away from the rack. While reversing, he struck the storage rack behind him, injuring the toes on his left foot. He was wearing steel-toed shoes at the time. His second toe was amputated.
An employee was hit by a mini-excavator bucket while walking, suffering a right shoulder injury.
An employee was injured when a framing beam came loose from the forks of a forklift and landed on his foot, crushing it.
An employee was using a nail gun to package batteries when a nail shot into the employee's left hand.
An employee was descending a ladder when his foot slipped through, causing him to fall. He put his hand out to break his fall, suffering a broken wrist. He was hospitalized.
On or about October 19, 2015, an employee's left-hand index finger was amputated by the chain of a red iron chain conveyor. The employee was hospitalized.

Worker was in the process of moving a roll off box onto a transport trailer when the lid came down and pinned his hand between the lid and the box.  The worker sustained a crushed hand and fingers, requiring medical attention and an overnight stay at the local hospital.
The cover of a splice box closed on an employee's hand, amputating the ring and middle finger down to the middle knuckle and a small portion of the pinky.
A Bobcat employee was loading steel into a punch press when multiple fingers got crushed and amputated in a pinch point.
An employee was performing various tasks in a barn, such as cleaning stalls, walking horses, and filling water, when he passed out due to dehydration and heat exhaustion. He was hospitalized.
