An employee was setting up the machine in the converting department when his hand got caught in the nip roller crushing his hand. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery to repair the injured hand.

An employee was outside behind the store removing toy freight from a storage container. The storage container door was open at the time. A gust of wind blew the door shut on the employee's ankle, giving him a large gash. His Achilles tendon was severed, requiring surgery.
A forklift operator ran into a parked forklift. The employee's left hand was caught between the two forklifts resulting in a broken hand. He was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
Worker lost the tip of her pinky finger in a feeder machine while pushing prepackaged food (macaroni and cheese) forward.

An employee was cooking at the stove. A small pan of hot oil was on a ledge above the stove. The employee reached up for the pan of hot oil and knocked it over. The hot oil spilled onto her chin and chest resulting in burns.
An employee was pulling poly film off a roll when the poly film gave way and the employee fell backward to the concrete floor, suffering a fractured hip.

An employee rode a shuttle bus from the parking lot to the building. When she stepped off the bus and onto the street, she tripped on a curb, fell forward, and struck a cement column. She suffered contusions to the head, face, and scalp.
An employee was helping a coworker hoist a motor to change out an auger when his right pinky became caught between the motor and the railing, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was walking dishes back to the dishwasher when she tripped on her foot. She hit her head on the ice machine while she was falling to the floor, suffering spinal vertebrae damage.
An employee's finger was crushed by a piece of falling casing material. As a result, his finger was later amputated at the first knuckle.
As an employee was pulling material and backing up, the employee's left lower leg struck a support bracket and was lacerated.

An employee was pouring hot tar from a tote bucket to a mop cart when the person mopping went to dip the mop. The hot tar then splashed up and inside of the employee's glove, burning his right forefinger, thumb, and hand.
Employee strained his back when he was pulling the gas trap lid with his hands.
An employee tripped over the scanner cord she was using and fell to the ground, resulting in pain in her right shoulder and hospitalization.
On February 7, 2016, an employee cleaning the beef patty machine unit amputated the tip of the left ring finger.
On 4/21/16, at approximately 9:20 AM, an employee accidentally drank cleaning solution while mixing an iced tea.
An employee fell from a rolling scaffold.
An employee was unloading a three-foot I beam onto a work table. The I beam slipped out of the employee's hands and the employee's right middle finger was caught between two I beams.
On or about July 11, 2016, an employee was braking a part at a 45-degree angle when the part came up and partially amputated the employee's thumb. The employee's other thumb was lacerated.
An employee was loading vehicles onto a car hauler and fell approximately 9-10 ft. sustaining broken ribs, a punctured lung and other serious injuries.
An employee was putting a trailer onto a hitch and caught a finger between the hitch and trailer resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.
While moving baseboards to the scrap pile, an employee was bitten on the hand by a rattlesnake.
On or about June 5, 2015, an employee working with waste cement drums felt light-headed and was hospitalized.

An employee collapsed while pushing a shopping cart inside of the store.  The employee's head struck the ground causing bleeding and damage to the back of his skull.  Surgery was performed to relieve swelling.

An employee was delivering sheet rock to a new residential home. While unstrapping a metal cart from the truck, it rolled off and struck the employee on the head and shoulder. The employee was hospitalized.

A bus person was carrying a big box of cereal after restocking the counter and started to walk away. She hit the corner to the salad bar and fell to the floor. She was hospitalized for an injury to her left hip.
On or about 10/24/16, at 4:00 p.m., an employee was cutting a tie on a group of wires with a box cutter knife when he suffered a laceration, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was installing a transmission line when the cable snapped, causing it to recoil and strike the employee in the mid section. He suffered broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee was landscaping and was run over by the tractor when their pant leg was caught under the wheel.
An employee walking between buildings slipped on the damp floors and fell. She broke a bone in her elbow and was hospitalized.

An employee was cleaning a transfer roller on a lamination machine with a rag. While using a "job" pedal with his foot in slow speed, he began cleaning the roller. The rag got caught and his hands were pulled into a nip point. He was hospitalized and received stitches.
On July 23, 2015, an employee suffered a finger amputation while grinding a casting on a stand grinder.
An employee was cutting a metal panel with a saw when the blade broke, hitting and cutting his face.
An employee was feeding nonferrous cable material into the cable stripping machine when their right hand was caught inside the machine amputating four fingers.

The shoe in the powdered metal press was hanging up so the employee who is a set-up trainee went to trouble shoot it.  The employee unplugged the plant airline to the moving part (shoe). The employee then plugged in the cleaning airline to the shoe. The cleaning airline has much less pressure than the plant airline. The shoe did not move as it should.  The employee tried to maneuver the shoe with her hand and it would not move. The shoe then moved forward and caught her fingertip between the shoe and the die resulting in the amputation of the left middle fingertip.

An employee was operating a zero turn lawn mower and became stuck.  When trying to free the mower, the employee lost his footing and fell backwards striking his head on some rocks.  The employee was dazed, but continued to work. The next morning he was found in bed partially paralyzed and could not communicate.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion/kidney failure.
An employee fell approximately 5 feet off the back of a delivery truck to the ground, suffering a broken tailbone and concussion. The employee was hospitalized.
On 09/22/2015, two employees working on a propane gas line to a grain dryer were burned on the face, back, torso and arms when leaking propane gas ignited.
An employee was preparing a pipe flange for paint when the pipe ruptured causing a release of trichlorosilane. The employee sustained chemical burns to the left hand, forearm and hip.

On August 30, 2016, around 11:30 a.m., an employee went up in an articulating lift to conduct painting activities on a building. He contacted power lines and fell into the basket. The employee was hospitalized for burns on his right arm between his elbow and shoulder.

At 11:34 a.m., an employee was working with an electric pallet jack while another receiving associate had a forklift. When the employee went to move the electric pallet jack, the handle was turned in such a way that when it moved, it moved backwards and smashed her left-hand pinky into the forklift battery. Her pinky fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was using a ladder to take a nitrogen purge line off of a unit that was being decommissioned. He lost his balance on the ladder and fell backwards onto his backside. This is not the fall that caused the injury, but was a precursory fall. He gathered himself and headed back toward the control unit when he then tripped over his feet and landed on an approximately 12-inch high dike on his right side, causing the injury. He was hospitalized for a fractured pelvis.

Two employees were attempting to lubricate pinion gears on an overhead crane bridge drive. To prevent overspray, the first employee held a blue shop rag behind the pinion gear being lubricated.  The second employee sprayed the lubricant. The first employee asked the second to move the bridge forward using the crane pendent control, so he could lubricate the entire gear. The second employee inched the crane forward, at which time the blue shop rag and the first employee's finger got pinched between the pinion gear and the drive wheel.

An employee was positioned at the base of the pole, aligning it into the correct position. As the employee was stepping forward, a chain hoist fell from an overhead bucket truck/personnel lift, striking the employee on the hard hat. He suffered a fractured C1 vertebra and was hospitalized.
An employee was using a meat saw to cut meat when his hand slipped and his right index fingertip was amputated by the saw.
An employee had finished loading baggage onto an aircraft when he tripped and fell, hitting the pavement.  He suffered broken bones near his eye socket and sinuses, knee abrasions, and swollen hands.
An employee was using a broom to push cardboard down the trash chute. He tripped and fell into the compactor injuring his knee.

An employee was preparing rice for the Brandeis University catering service. When the rice was finished cooking, the employee pulled the hotel pan out of the cooker. The residual water left over from the cooking process splashed out of the pan and onto the employee's lower right arm, causing second degree burns.

An employee went under an F-350 truck to repair a locked transmission with the engine turned off. He disconnected the transmission cable and the vehicle moved in reverse naturally due to a slope in the terrain. The left front wheel ran over the employee from the shoulder to the abdomen.
An employee was injured while operating a saw to cut a plastic sheet. The employee's hand slipped resulting in the employee's right thumb being amputated near the first joint.
An employee fell off the tailgate of a customer's pick up truck and injured his head.
An employee was operating a cope and drag machine when the employee's hand slipped, causing the employee's thumb to get crushed beneath a plate.
While cleaning a sensor, an employee's right thumb was caught in a drive chain and amputated.

An employee was instructing another operator on how to run a task with a new machine set up in place on the autogrinder machine. He used his right hand to point out a piece of glass as material was being fed into the machine on a small conveyor belt. His finger contacted an in-going nip point on rotating gears, and he sustained a right index fingertip amputation.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking lot and broke several ribs. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee driving a jockey truck around the yard suffered a collapsed lung as a result of manually adjusting a side mirror.
An employee was adding sealant to an air handler unit when the sealant container ruptured, injuring the employee's hands. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a rail mover to move three railcars. An employee on the ground was assisting him, and the two were communicating via radio. The employee on the ground became trapped between two of the railcars. He was taken to the hospital (Erie County Medical Center) with a non-displaced sacral fracture and torn cartilage in his pelvic area.
An employee was making adjustments on the paper feed of a printer when four fingers on his left hand were crushed to the second knuckle in the rollers. He was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a door as he entered the facility, injuring his eye socket and cheek.
An employee tripped while walking into the break room, shattering her elbow and sustaining bruising.
An employee was teaching a snowboarding class and missed the airbag off the jump landing on the ground. The employee suffered a broken pelvis, cracked rib and a collapsed lung.

An employee was cleaning out the drain port underneath a mixer tank. He removed the drain port cap and was attempting to clear out the port when the mixer ribbon (metal agitator) struck his hand and partially amputated three fingers.

An employee was in the mold maintenance area unloading an approximately 4 ft. by 4 ft. steel mold from the transport trailer with a crane. He stepped up on the trailer (approximately 29 inches high) and as he was stepping down from the trailer, he slipped and fell to the floor fracturing his left elbow in multiple places. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery to repair the fractures.
An employee was working near mail transporting equipment when the web on the machine became caught on the employee's right leg, causing a bone fracture.

An employee was raising a roll of paper up with a hoist so that they could turn the roll of paper to the right position on the ramp. While working on the raised roll of paper, two or three other rolls of paper were prevented from coming down the ramp by an air activated cushion and a rubber chock.  Somehow, the rolls of paper became free and started rolling down the ramp. One of the rolls of paper struck the employee and pushed him against the roll of paper he was working on fracturing his pelvis.
An employee tripped over a door threshold and fell on his face, breaking his neck and lacerating his face.

An employee was using a band saw to cut angle iron. One of the five pieces of angle iron that was being cut was shorter than the others and was not secured by the clamp. When the band saw was lowered to make the cut, the unsecured angle iron was pulled into the backstop, or guide, and the employee's left thumb was caught between the angle iron and the backstop resulting in amputation.

A crew of three employees had just repaired a heater/treater water leg 3" vitriolic coupling and had pressured it up with a pump. A leak appeared at a bolt on the unit and the two injured employees proceeded to tighten it. While the two were tightening the bolt, they heard a pop and something gave away. They were drenched with liquid and gas. The third employee saw this and shut the pump down and was going to isolate the unit when it caught fire near the coupling. The fire spread to the two drenched employees. One employee suffered third degree burns while the second employee suffered second degree burns.
An employee experienced heat cramps and dehydration while stacking materials.
On August 23, 2016, at approximately 4:15 PM, an employee passed out and struck his head on the floor due to heat stress.

An employee placed his right hand on top of a the cylinder of a tamping machine. The tamper came down onto the cylinder, pinching his right little finger and causing an injury that required the amputation of a portion of the right little finger.
An employee was making a delivery when he slipped and fell on ice, fracturing his right lower leg.

An employee was operating an overhead crane to move steel coils. While raising the crane to remove the lifting chain, the employee had his right hand on the lifting chain. The end of the chain got stuck and started to pull the coil towards an adjacent coil. The employee's right ring and middle fingers were pinched between the coil and lifting chain. The employee required surgery.

On or about June 18, 2016, an employee was attempting to fluff green beans through a green bean cutter when the employee's hand went into the cutter, amputating the left middle finger to the first joint.

An employee had finished unjamming logs in the log deck when he asked a coworker to use a log turner on the logs. The area was not completely cleared when the coworker used the log turner. One of the logs escaped and rolled onto the employee, injuring his left knee, fracturing his left fibula, and lacerating his right elbow.
An employee was doing quality assurance at his desk computer when he passed out and hit his head on the floor due to dehydration.

An employee fell five feet from either a ladder or the HVAC unit to the concrete floor below while performing plenum work. The employee suffered a fractured  collarbone, two fractures to the lower spine, and head lacerations.

An employee was fixing a lock on a pallet in an airport trailer when he lost his balance and fell backward approximately 5 feet onto the concrete floor. He suffered a head injury and broken neck, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by a vehicle that entered a work zone.

An employee opened the gate to inspect a part of the Tangent deep draw hydraulic press. Lock out/tag out wasn't used. A co-worker provided additional light and crossed the light curtain in front of the press activating it. The injured employee suffered cuts to both arms, burns to the left hand and a compression injury to both arms.

On March 7, 2016, an employee was moving a motor weighing approximately 350 pounds when the motor broke the floor, creating a hole. The employee fell approximately 25 feet through the hole, dislocating the left shoulder, fracturing an elbow, breaking a hip, and possibly rupturing the kidney and spleen.

An employee was walking between a barrier (parapet) wall and a rubber track excavator when the excavator struck his right lower leg and ankle, nearly severing his right foot. His right foot was surgically amputated, and his left foot was fractured.
While climbing off a work platform, an employee lost his grip on the side rail and his leg was caught between the rail and platform. His leg was severed and required hospitalization.

An employee was cleaning a wood floor and picking up wood by hand. He picked up a piece of plywood that was covering a shaft and then fell approximately 20 to 30 feet through the shaft, breaking his hip and eye socket.
An employee was sorting cattle and was moving cows from one pen to another when a cow kicked his lower leg. He suffered a broken tibia and fibula in his left leg.
An employee became disoriented while delivering mail and suffered leg cramping. The employee was hospitalized with heat exhaustion.

On May 4, 2015, an employee was cleaning the strapper on the bailer unit.  The employee suffered a fracture and partial amputation of the right index finger after his finger was pulled into the pinch point between the two pinch wheels of the machine.
On March 28, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., an employee was stepping over the tongue on a cart and fell. The employee sustained injuries to the right arm and head, resulting in hospitalization.

An employee finished installing switches. While cleaning up and removing the rubber cover up used to protect from inadvertent contact, he touched the wire with more than 50 volts, resulting in 1st, 2nd, and 3rd degree burns to both arms.

An employee was pulling a rope connected to tubing when the tubing bent and the attached clamp struck him in the face and collarbone. He suffered a facial laceration and fractured collarbone, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using an order picker to select cartons from an elevation when he fell and struck his cranium on the walking surface, requiring hospitalization.

An employee operating a powered industrial truck drove over an oil spill and lost control. The employee slid and rested against an iron column. The employee's left leg was pinned and fractured between the powered industrial truck and the iron column, requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered respiratory distress that appeared to be caused by paint vapors and was hospitalized overnight.
While descending from the roof on an extended ladder, an employee slipped and fell approximately 4 feet from the ladder, spraining the left wrist.
When handling a 4 foot waler and loosening bolts, an employee's finger was caught between metal bolts and the waler, amputating the left middle distal fingertip.
An employee, who was walking down the jet bridge, fell and injured her right shoulder, requiring surgery.  The jet bridge was slippery from inclement weather.
An employee suffered a partial finger amputation when the wind blew an exterior door closed onto the employee's hand.

On or about July 7, 2016, at 5:00 p.m., an employee fell down the marble staircase as she was leaving for the day. She was hospitalized with a lacerated bottom lip, loose teeth, dislocated right elbow, fractured right ulna and radius, concussion, and multiple bruises.
An employee was working on a pallet truck when the pallet truck tipped over. The employee was caught between the pallet truck and a stationary object, suffering a back injury.

A horse was in a horse ring and was hooked to a carriage. The horse became spooked and started running, broke free of the reins, and attempted to exit the horse ring. An employee entered the horse ring to try and calm the horse. The horse struck the employee, who suffered a serious neck injury that required surgery, abrasions, contusions, and lacerations to the thighs/arms.

The injured employee was operating a Crown 4500 Pallet Jack (stand up type) and was in the process of navigating it into the designated parking area, when his left foot became caught between the parking space concrete curb and the left side of the pallet jack. The employee sustained a fractured left foot.
An employee was unloading a hopper when the hopper door closed on his left thumb, amputating the tip.
An employee was getting down from a truck and fell backwards off the truck.
An employee operating a boom lift struck a door and broke a leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee slipped and fell on the ice resulting in a broken ankle.

An employee was on top of crates, helping to rig them to a boom lift, when he stepped into a hollow area in a crate that was covered by plastic wrapping and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground. He suffered multiple right-heel fractures.
Employee fell on ice and struck his head while delivering a parcel.
Employee was hospitalized when he jumped off of a ladder, injuring his ankle and tibia.
While positioning a Linkbelt 98 track logging yarder, an employee got his left foot caught under the left front track causing crushing injuries to his toes and foot. He was hospitalized.
An employee received an electrical shock when their drill bit contacted an energized wire while drilling a hole into a wall.

An employee was cutting grass with a 52" stand-on mower. While cutting on a side hill and moving around a pole, the mower started to go downhill. The employee dismounted the mower, and the blade caught and severely lacerated his right foot.
On July 25, 2016, at 11:30 a.m., an employee was hospitalized with a compound leg fracture after a steel drainage grate that he was carrying fell on his leg as he tripped.

An employee was feeling for a hole that needed to be patched on the outside of a corn leg's steel housing, which was leaking grain. The employee's left index finger entered the leg and was amputated above the first knuckle. The corn leg was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.
An employee's finger was lacerated while working with a saw. He was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a boat and fell while descending the ladder breaking the left radius.
Employee was hospitalized after sustaining a laceration to the left wrist while using a saw.

An employee adjusting a skinner machine locked out the machine with a wrench and loosened a bolt. The wrench slipped off of the blade, causing her right index finger to contact the blade and remove skin.
An employee was bitten on the hand by a rattlesnake while turning a valve to change the flow direction. The snake was coiled underneath the tank hatch. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was riding an electric pallet jack and slipped.  She came down and pulled on the handle.  The pallet jack ran over her ankle.
A temporary employee received a right foreman fracture as a result of entanglement injuries from contact with a moving conveyor line and tail pulley.
On 2/2/15, an employee suffered a broken finger and crushed hand requiring hospitalization while cutting a steel support for a silencer.
An employee fell 4 feet off the loading dock while bending over to pick up a box, suffering left wrist and right ankle pain.

An employee was drilling a hole through an overhead bar joist. The bit broke suddenly and the employee lost control of the hand-held drill. The unused portion of the drill bit went around his safety glasses and penetrated the eye.
An employee was hospitalized with two broken legs after the ram of a press brake he was cleaning fell on top of him.
An employee tripped and fell while carrying plates resulting in a fractured left shoulder and arm.

A 250-pound tank was being slid from the forks of a forklift into a frame when the injured employee's hand got caught between the frame and the tank. The employee's right-hand, middle finger nailbed was amputated.
An employee was walking in the warehouse when he stepped on an extension cord and lost his balance, falling to the ground and fracturing his right hip.
An employee fell from a truck while delivering product to a school.

An employee was moving a cart in a warehouse when a nearby pallet that was being moved pushed the cart and smashed the employee's finger between the cart and a pole, amputating the left ring fingertip.
An employee's fingers became stuck in a construction equipment mast during inspections, requiring hospitalization.

An employee attempted to hook up an anhydrous ammonia nurse tank to a farmer's truck hitch. The farmer reversed the truck and pinned the employee's right leg between the vehicle and the nurse tank, breaking his right tibia and fibula and injuring his right ankle. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was picking plastic parts off a machine. When he attempted to dislodge a part that was caught in the machine, the machine blade amputated his left middle finger and lacerated his left index and ring fingers. The guard was in place at the time.

Two employees were pressure washing mud tanks.  The injured employee slipped and grabbed the end of the wand barrel.  He then came into contact with the pressurized water, resulting in a laceration on his leg.  The water was considered dirty which led to a hospitalization as a precautionary measure.
On or about April 6, 2016, an employee fell one story down detached stairs to a lower level. The stairs then fell on top of him, breaking his vertebrae.
An employee was observing equipment being offloaded when a piece of wood bounced out and hit his thumb, amputating the tip.
While changing a machine die, an employee's left index finger got caught between the hydraulic clamp and cylinder, resulting in a finger amputation.

On 8/30/16, an employee was delivering product to the store and suffered serious injury to his left thumb when backing up a powered pallet jack into the freezer and striking his thumb on the locking mechanism on the door.
While clearing a paper jam in the embossing section, an employee caught a hand between two rollers.

An employee was taking flange coil to the beam line on a coil car. When he stepped off the coil car, he did not remove his hand from the control button. The coil car kept moving, ran over his right foot, and severed all five of his appendages.
An employee was cutting wood on a table saw when a piece of wood shot back and struck him in the eye.
An employee was installing an electrical fixture when he fell from a 16-foot fiberglass A-frame ladder to the concrete floor below. He hit his head on the floor and was hospitalized.

An employee was working from a 14-foot boom lift, setting up a wire pool and trying to place it in a sheave, when he lost control and his right arm was caught between the wire and the railing of the lift, breaking it.

On June 1, 2015, at 10:00 a.m., an employee was moving a 160-pound steel die along a roller conveyor when his finger got caught between the die and a conveyor roller, amputating his right index fingertip.
On or about April 3, 2016, an employee was operating a water lance to clean a fixed pipe when he made contact with pressurized water, lacerating his left thumb.
An employee suffered an amputation injury while closing a door.

An employee was a passenger in a golf cart used to transport people around the site. The driver was traveling to a building directly in front of them to get needed parts, but realized he might find the parts in another building to the left. As the driver turned to the left, the employee fell off the cart and struck her head on the pavement, fracturing her skull.
An employee using a deli slicer was approached by a customer. Her right index finger was amputated by the deli slicer blade.

An employee was starting to clean the cabin of an off-road haul truck used for rough terrain when his left middle finger was caught between the truck frame and the truck door, amputating the fingertip.
On August 28, 2016, an employee was clearing a "hot drop" at a press and was sprayed with hot plastic. The employee was hospitalized with second degree burn injuries to the face and right ear.
While stepping off of a crane platform onto a ladder, an employee lost his balance and fell 66.5 inches, injuring his left leg. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was working on a printing press and pinched a finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.
On or about 8/09/2016, an employee was guiding an operator who was lowering a concrete mat. The spreader bar came loose and hit the employee in the lower back, fracturing his right femur.
On or about Monday, February 9, 2015, at 2:45 pm an employee was changing a transformer in a Merit Energy oil rig when he touched a hot wire injuring his head and left hand.
An employee's ring finger became caught and was smashed in a pinch point while adjusting forklift tines.

An employee was setting up a salad bar. A pot of chicken noodle soup was just filled and the pot was placed in the back kitchen hot window. When the employee lifted the pot, soup spilled on her neck and chest. She suffered first and second degree burns to the right cheek and neck, as well as chest burns.
Employee slipped on ice in the rear parking lot of the nursing home and was hospitalized with an ankle injury.

An employee was working with a sealer for packaging shipments when it jammed.  The employee tried to clear the jam, triggering it to close, and burned the four fingers on his left hand, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was cutting the aitch bone out of a hog carcass when the boning knife slipped and lacerated/punctured his top right rib area.

An employee working at the crate loader was struck by a forklift that was backing up. The employee sustained serious injuries and was hospitalized at the Washington Regional Medical Center in Fayetteville, Arkansas, for treatment of a fractured pelvis.

An employee was attempting to clear a blockage in a corn flaker. The equipment was shut down and locked out at the time. The employee removed a corn cob from the rollers when residual pressure from the rollers smashed the employee's fingertips, resulting in an amputation of the middle left-hand finger.

On 7/1/15 an employee was working at the Firestone Plant in the scale house, when it was discovered that a gate on the asphalt silo had a broken bolt and was not functioning properly. At ~ 12:40 AM while attempting to replace the bolt, his crowbar slipped and struck him in the face. He was admitted for in-patient hospitalization for a fractured bone above the eye (no eye loss/damage) and a fractured cheek bone.

An employee was working in the electrical box changing out an fuse block and replacing it with a motor circuit breaker. The employee made contact with a live component and an arc flash occurred causing burns to the employee's face, both hands, and forearms.

An employee was attempting to hook a trailer to the hitch of a customer's vehicle. The customer was backing up and hit the gas pedal while in reverse, pinning the employee between the vehicle and the trailer. The employee suffered severe leg contusions and was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was attempting to secure an anti-tip chain with one hand while a crane pendant was in the other hand. He lost his balance and fell approximately 18 inches off the platform he was on, lacerating his left kidney.

An employee had been welding in a clean fuel tank while standing on a scaffold when he became dizzy. He fell off the scaffold and suffered fractured vertebrae, a fractured left scapula, and a fractured rib.

On Saturday 10/10/15 at approximately 5:00 AM, an employee's hand slid underneath a fixed guard at the Department 5540 Pleater. The employee's left index finger made contact with a belt and was pulled into a roller resulting in injury.  Medical provider's diagnosis is that of a partial amputation of the left index finger.

An employee was performing maintenance on the underside of an airplane wing and was standing on a pump stand. When finished, he turned and fell from the stand onto the chain guards. The chain guard broke at the attachment to the stand and the employee fell approximately 7 feet to a concrete floor. He sustained an open gash head injury, fractured ribs, and fractured vertebrae.

An employee was hospitalized for a finger injury when her right ring finger was severed at the knuckle and reattached.  Her ring caught on something while she was reaching for an item on a shelving unit.

An employee was making deliveries from a flatbed trailer. As he was climbing down the attached ladder, a weld broke and he fell backward onto the hard surface of the lot, lacerating his head and left ear and fracturing his spine. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was driving a forklift and placing a pallet of aluminum on a racking system when the pallet fell off the racks and landed on the employee's ankle, breaking it and requiring surgery.

An employee was responding to a call of the A/C unit inside the attic not operating. She fell approximately 8 feet to the floor below through an open hatch in the attic, breaking her ankle and sustaining a head injury.

An employee was using an air nozzle attached to a hose when she tripped and fell over the hose and a T-handle. The employee broke her left ulna and radial bones in her forearm. She was hospitalized and required surgery to repair the broken bones.
An employee began to suffer from heat exhaustion while working outside to complete an installation for satellite television.

At approximately 8:10 p.m., on 3/25/15, an employee fell 20 to 30 feet from an articulating boom bucket to the ground. The employee was tightening bolts for mast arms on traffic signal lights when the clip tie-off point broke and the employee fell. The employee sustained cracked lumbar vertebrae and head lacerations.
An employee was operating the leveler machine when his glove got caught by a part going into the machine. He suffered an avulsion.
An employee was walking on the sidewalk inside the construction perimeter. He tripped over a discharge hose and fell onto his side, breaking two ribs and puncturing a lung.
An employee was overcome by the smell of gasoline, which was on a patient's clothing, and suffered respiratory problems. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee tripped and fell, injuring his leg/knee.
An employee was struck by a counterweight while adjusting lines during workover rigging activities. The employee suffered facial injuries and a fractured eye socket.
On January 13, 2017, an employee suffered an electrical shock after stepping in a water puddle that was energized by 480 volts of electricity. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped on a wet floor while she was mopping it and fell breaking her right wrist.
An employee was performing a task involving electrical connections when an electrical arc flash occurred, causing second and third degree burns to his upper body. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell from a ladder.
An employee was struck and trapped by a tire he was removing. He was hospitalized.
The top part of an employee's thumb was amputated on a table saw.

An employee was operating a stand-up forklift. As the employee was exiting the freezer section of the warehouse, she noticed that her forklift began to slide. As she attempted to stop the sliding with her left leg, her foot came in contact with a concrete bollard, which was located outside of the freezer section and on the side of the forklift. She lacerated her foot and possibly fractured her ankle.
An employee was picking up surgical instruments and twisted her chest and side.
An employee was discussing a stressful situation with a supervisor and began to feel ill. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee parked on a ramp, then opened the railcar door. The employee's right thumb got caught between the ramp and door, causing a partial amputation.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut a 2" x 6" wedge when two left-hand fingers were amputated.

The last digit on an employee's pinky finger was amputated when caught between a metal plate attached to a pump and a trailer bed while unloading scrap metal into the Peddlers Yard. Suitable safeguarding was not in place at the time of the incident.
An employee was loading a part on a rack and caught a hand between the part and rack resulting in amputation of the left middle finger above the knuckle.

A painter was walking up the indoor stairs.  He fell from the second floor landing down to the first floor breaking his collar bone, five ribs and punctured a lung.  It is new construction so there is no railing on the stairs.

An employee was resetting a machine center to the home position when his left-hand ring finger got pinched between the spindle and the ball part of the press. This 
de-gloved the finger, which had to be surgically amputated.

On 4/13/15, at approximately 5:00 p.m., an employee was setting up a metal grinding machine. During the setup process, he attempted to remove the part that was to be worked on. The manual control was in the reverse position at the time. As he pushed the job button with his right hand, his left ring finger was caught between the part and a machine guide, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was performing maintenance on a pasteurizer when the CIP mechanism initiated causing first and second degree burns to the employee's arms and side.
An employee fell backwards off the first or second step of a ladder while stocking grass seed on the shelf. The employee was hospitalized with a broken hip.

At about 11:00 p.m., an employee was rotating a pole to line up the strong back with the crane to hook. Two out of the six tacks were holding the strong back. The strong back came loose and dropped vertically to the floor; before it stopped moving, it struck the employee on the left side of his left leg. The strong back weighs approximately 600 lbs. The employee's leg, from the knee down to his ankle, received a glancing blow. He was taken hospitalized with several broken bones.
While operating a pallet jack and driving down an aisle in the warehouse, an employee lost control of the lift and struck the left leg on adjacent metal racking, fracturing it.

On May 4, 2016, at approximately 2:30 pm, an employee noticed that the (powders) raw materials were not going down easily through the mixing chamber (approximately 165 cubic inches) of an extrusion machine fitted with a rotating shaft "rotor" with a maximum speed of 100/500 rpm's. He attempted to clear out the material from the mixing chamber with a putty knife at different speeds (controlled/adjusted by the employee himself) beginning at 460 rpm, then down to 120 rpm, and then up to 130 rpm when his gloved hand (cloth) holding the putty knife was pulled in the mixing chamber. The knife was thrown out and when he pulled his hand out his right thumb and three other fingers on his right hand were amputated.

An employee was operating the winding machine and knelt down to get a better view. His knee gave out and he fell forward extending his hand to brace himself. His hand contacted the machine blade and amputated the right middle finger.
An employee was walking out of a trailer to his forklift when another forklift struck him and fractured his leg.
A temporary employee was working at a knock-out station lifting castings.  He complained of chest pains and was hospitalized.  He was diagnosed with muscle strain.
An employee was loading advertisements into the tie machine and got his left hand caught in the machine resulting in amputation of the pinky and right fingertips.
An employee climbed an 8-foot ladder to get into the crawl space in the ceiling and fell.
An employee was pushing a cart of chrome bundles, which were 2" x 12' long. The bundles shifted and pinched two fingers on his right hand. When he pulled his hand out, his fingertips were amputated.
An employee was moving a metal locker unit when the wind caught the unit, causing it to lacerate the employee's right forearm.
An employee was burned while working with refrigerant.
An employee trimming trees fell approximately 40 feet when the main climbing line anchor broke.
An employee leaving the kitchen slipped on tartar sauce and fell, fracturing a hip.

An employee was using a torch to heat up a stuck stud on the tank. The torch ignited methanol gas that was put in the tank the day before.  The employee was thrown back 6 to 7 feet and received second and third degree burns to the abdomen.

An employee had been working on a telecommunication cable from a 28-foot extension ladder when a passing motorist found him unconscious on the ground. He was hospitalized for broken ribs, a concussion, and bleeding on the brain.
An employee slipped on ice at 7:45 a.m. while walking into work. The employee sustained a leg and knee injury requiring surgery and overnight hospitalization.
An employee fell into a tank that contained 180 degree Fahrenheit water while removing an aluminum extrusion from the tank.
An employee was picking up a socket from the floor when a box from the upper shelf of the overstock wall fell and struck the employee's lower back causing a fracture to the lower back.

An employee was operating a lathe machine to bore a pipe. The employee went to extract metal shavings inside of the pipe when his right hand got caught in a pinch point. He sustained broken bones in his right hand, severed tendons in the right middle and index fingers, and skin removal on the top of his  right hand, requiring hospitalization.

An employee entered the back of a semi-trainer to prep for loading. There were approximately five 8' x 10' x 1"-thick sheets of plywood used as dunnage on the previous load that were left on the trailer and needed to be removed. They were stacked on end and secured to the wall of the trailer.  The employee untied them in order to move them.  The dunnage fell on and injured the employee.
On or about 3/24/2016, an employee's finger was amputated while feeding a thermal former machine.
An employee's left arm was caught in the shaft of a conveyor belt and fractured while cleaning floors.

An employee was assisting during the installation of a new washer/dryer in a private residence. After plugging in the appliance to an outlet, he touched the dryer and received an electric shock. He was hospitalized.
An employee was coming down from their workstation, missed the last step and fractured their leg.
An employee was cleaning the scraper belt and lacerated his left thumb when his glove was caught between the scraper belt and the freezer line.

An employee was walking from the bakery to the sales floor. There was a transition in the floor that went from slip-resistant flooring to concrete. When the employee stepped from the slip-resistant floor to the concrete, she slipped and fell, breaking her arm and hip.
An employee was handling glass panes when the glass shifted and fell on the employee resulting in injury that required hospitalization.
On 10/10/16, an employee was unjamming a hydraulic shear when his left thumb was amputated.
An employee was working as a panel saw helper and lacerated the left middle fingertip. The distal phalanx was later amputated.

An employee was pulling hose to connect to a pump when his hand slipped and his left middle finger struck the moving impeller of the pump. His finger went down the intake pipe and his left middle fingertip was amputated.
On June 16, 2016, an employee was hospitalized after a case of 12 soda cans fell and struck the back of the employee's neck.
While operating a mail-processing machine, an employee's head became trapped between the equipment and a guard, fracturing the skull, breaking ribs, severing ears, and damaging vertebrae.
An employee was pushing a food tray cart when it fell on top of her. She was hospitalized overnight with an injured pelvis.
An employee was connecting wires to a switchgear when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's head and shoulders.
An employee slipped and fell on ice on the sidewalk, displacing and fracturing their knee cap and requiring hospitalization.

On July 27, 2016, an employee was using an aluminum saw to cut a piece of aluminum angle. The aluminum became caught in the blade of the saw, and the blade struck and lacerated the employee's left index finger. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet down an extension ladder. He landed on a rock and broke bones in his foot.
An employee was training when he suddenly felt ill. He was hospitalized and treated for dehydration.

An employee suffered a broken wrist as he attempted to close a container door while sitting on a forklift. The employee's wrist was caught between the door of the container and the cage of the forklift.

While the employees were picking up tubing, a worker grabbed the bell and pulled it back.  The elevator slipped and caught his finger between the horn's elevator and the bottom of the bell.  His middle finger was amputated from the finger nail to the first knuckle of the finger.  He was taken to the hospital, treated and released.
A temporary worker was sweeping the warehouse floor and was bitten by a rattle snake on the right index finger.

An employee placed a 4-foot long piece of metal into the passenger seat of a golf cart. The piece of metal hit the gas pedal on the golf cart and the golf cart lurched forward, hitting the employee on the left leg below the knee.
An employee was rolling up a door on a truck and amputated his right index finger when it was caught in the folding door.

An employee came in contact with hot water (greater than 105 F) when a hose split while the employee was priming a pump in the neutral plant. The employee received 2nd and 3rd degree burns to his back and upper legs covering approximately 13% of the right side of his body.
An employee was walking beside a forklift that was carrying a load of material. The forklift tire rolled onto the employee's right foot, causing him to fall and break his right leg.
The employee had a medical reaction to a chicken pox vaccine on 9-24-15. The vaccine was a job requirement.
An employee was prepping a rail car for a load of peanuts when he fell approximately 10 ft. and landed outside of the rail car breaking both of his legs.
An employee was ripping a board on a table saw when it kicked back. The saw blade amputated two fingers on his left hand.

An employee was using a chain saw to cut a tree. The saw became lodged within the tree and bucked, causing the employee to lose control of the equipment. The employee suffered a 7-inch laceration on the thigh, requiring hospitalization.

The employee reached over a safeguard to push a coil towards the wrapping machine.  While pushing, he triggered the proximity switch for the seal bar to come down.  The seal bar came down on top of his hand, which was between the seal bar and the coil.  The safety device, which makes the seal bar retract when it makes contact with an object, failed.  The seal bar remained in the lowered position.  The employee tried to pull his left hand out of the equipment resulting in the amputation of the middle fingertip.

In the bindery division, an employee had a partial amputation of his right pinky finger from the bottom knuckle up. The employee was working on the autostacker, which cuts paper product, when the amputation occurred at 11:00 PM on 5/14/15.

An employee was demonstrating the function of a sliding axle trailer to a coworker when the trailer drifted unexpectedly and caught the employee's finger in one of the adjustment holes. The employee's right index finger was amputated.
An employee amputated the left middle fingertip while using hedge trimmers.
An employee exiting a scissor lift missed the last step and fell approximately 4 feet, fracturing the hip.

An employee was operating the extrusion machine. When he slid a piece of equipment inside the machine (Nissan Step Rail) his finger was in a pinch point and he received an acute wound to the left middle fingertip.
Two employees were operating a press.  One of the employee's hands got caught in the machine resulting in the amputation of the left hand middle finger.
An employee suffered a leg injury while performing maintenance work activities when a 1,000 pound submersible pump fell onto the employee, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was putting on a metal elbow and fell, fracturing the right leg.
An employee was putting her coat away in a closet that was a fire door. The employee started closing the door and caught her hand in the door. Her right pinky finger was amputated to the first joint.
An employee dislocated their left-hand pinky finger. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery to repair torn tendons.
An employee was loading a box truck when he fell from the lift gate of the truck and struck his head on the ground, fracturing his skull.

An employee was working from a ladder, installing a communications drop. The ladder slipped laterally, and the employee fell and impacted the ground, suffering a fractured right wrist that required hospitalization.
An employee amputated his left-hand ring and middle fingertips when his hand contacted a running fan belt.

Rigging employees were setting a pipe that was 20 feet long, 24 inches in diameter, and weighed 5 tons. As the load was being transferred from the crane to the rack, the riggers were adjusting the chain fall hoists. Slack was taken up in one of the hoists, which caused the pipe to lift. When the pipe lifted the injured employee was straddling the beam, and the shoe plate of the pipe contacted the injured employee's left lower leg, causing a compound fracture. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
On or about December 15, 2015 an employee was injured when his hand became caught in the binding machine while unjamming it.

An employee was unscrewing lock pins from a wellhead to remove a tubing hanger when an L-80 joint of tubing and hanger was ejected from the frac valve due to the pressure-to-weight differential. The tubing and hanger struck the employee's back, fracturing the L1 vertebra.
An employee was moving drywall on a motorized pallet jack when his leg was caught and fractured between the jack and a scissor lift.
An employee was walking across the trailer yard (between the dispatch office and the fleet garage) and was struck by the yard horse (a 5th wheel tractor used to move trailers).
An employee was trying to clear a jam from a degater machine when his right middle fingertip and nail were amputated. He lost approximately one-eighth of an inch of his fingertip.
An employee was exiting a trailer when he tripped and fell on the ramp. His right ring finger was caught and amputated in the metal grate opening.
On or about August 7, 2015, an employee fell more than 30 feet while removing trash from the roof edge.
An employee that was operating a stand up power industrial truck at the warehouse of the distribution facility collided with a material rack system and suffered fractured ribs. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning the proximity switch on the palletizer machine and amputated two fingers at the second knuckle.
An employee was unjamming an infeed on a planer. When he unjammed the feed, his left hand got caught by the pineapple rolls, breaking three fingers.
An employee slipped and broke their patella.
An employee was working on a sprinkler pipe while standing on a 6-foot ladder when he fell off the ladder and broke his ankle.

An employee was attempting to free the arm piece of a pneumatically operated shear line machine. The machine's arm became free and caught the employee's right index finger between the arm and the frame of the machine, amputating it.
On 10/23/205 a temporary employee was trimming aluminum material using an electric router. The router kicked back and amputated 1/4 inch of  the employee's left index finger.
An employee was cut on the left hand while making a plunge cut.
An employee tripped over a wire while getting up from a desk and suffered a hip injury, requiring hospitalization.

On or about 1:15 p.m. on November 4, 2015, an employee cutting meat on a vertical band saw sustained a partial finger amputation to his left index finger.  The employee wore layered cotton, metal mesh and rubber gloves on his right hand, which he used to turn the meat during cutting/trimming.  He wore layered cotton and rubber gloves on his left hand which he used to take the trimmed pieces of meat and set aside for freezing or packaging.  His left hand inadvertently contacted the moving blade while placing a trimmed piece of meat to the side.
An employee had an allergic/asthmatic reaction to cologne/body spray and a flower on a desk. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
Two employees were struck by a copper pipe when they went into a storage room to retrieve pipe. Employee #1 was treated for bruising and released; employee #2 was admitted for monitoring.
An employee was hooking a sack of animal feed up to a forklift when the sack of feed fell on the employee's left leg, breaking it. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was operating the Greer #3 machine and caught his right hand between the rake arm and the machine frame. The employee's right hand was crushed resulting in the amputation of the index finger.
An employee severed the left thumb tip off including the entire nail while operating a band saw to process pork roast into chops.

While opening a rolling wall in the ballroom of a hotel, an employee's right-hand middle finger got pinched between two portions of the rolling wall. The employee was hospitalized and his middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee talking on a cell phone stepped onto a wooden pallet. Her foot got caught on the pallet, causing her to fall to the ground. She was hospitalized and required surgery for a fractured hip.
An employee was inspecting a customer's vehicle in the parking lot when he slipped on ice and fell, breaking his leg.
An employee was hospitalized after being pushed to the ground by a customer resulting in a broken hip, clavicle and ribs.

Employee fell off an 8 ft. step ladder while changing a ballast in a Publix Supermarket. Employee fractured his left arm and dislocated his elbow and was hospitalized overnight. Employee underwent surgery.

An employee was carrying a water form roller down three steps on the back side of a press when he slipped and started to fall. He tried to catch the roller, and his right-hand pinky finger was caught between the roller and stair, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was setting up a scaffold to work on painting a ceiling and fell off the scaffold breaking their heel.

On February 26, 2015, an employee amputated a portion of his right middle finger to the first knuckle while arranging 600- to 800-pound I-beams by hand so the load could be picked up with the forklift.
An employee was inspecting for leaks on a small 5-foot roof that extended above the main roof. The employee bent over, became dizzy, and slipped off onto the main roof, fracturing a wrist and ribs.

On or about July 28, 2016, at 7:00 a.m., an employee was on the second landing of a scaffold on the side of a building, preparing a chalk line to put a V-groove in a column. When he stood up, he became dizzy and fainted. He fell forward toward the building and onto a brick ledge, fracturing several vertebrae, his left scapula, and several left- and right-side ribs. He was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a paddle valve in an elevated lock position on the global SCM running tool. The valve self-assisted to the open position crushing his left pinkie finger between the paddle valve and the SCM running tool frame. The employee had an open laceration as well as an open fracture that was repaired at the hospital.
An employee suffered electrical arc burns on right hand while performing maintenance on an electrical plug/twist lock on a 2-ton hoist.

While stepping off an electric pallet jack, an employee's foot got caught between a loading dock platform and a metal barricade. The bone(s) above his big toe shattered. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery. The jack was in motion at the time of the incident.
An employee was cleaning the marker machine puck and press assembly when his hand was caught between the press and the puck, amputating his left index finger to the first knuckle.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet while installing a ladder inside an ocean-going barge.

On December 9, 2015, at about 8:00 a.m., an employee was struck by a door assembly fixture while installing a wind tower door. He was hospitalized with fractures to the sternum and lumbar area and a shoulder laceration.
An employee was installing an electrical panel for the new car wash when he was shocked.

A worker was welding the underside of a truck when the flame flashed back through a stress fracture in the fitting causing slag to hit the torch. The torch fell into his lap causing 2nd and 3rd degree burns.
A client at a group home became violent and charged an employee. The employee was knocked to the ground and suffered a fractured knee.

An employee was operating a shaper to mold pieces of wood when a piece of wood got thrown out of the shaper and caused the employee's fingers to make contact with the shaper knife. He lost the first digit of his ring finger, more than half of his middle finger, and his index fingertip to the bone on the right hand, requiring hospitalization.

While digging pits under the foundation of the building, a piece of concrete fell and struck two employees. One employee was treated and released with a hand injury; the second employee was hospitalized with a chest injury.
An employee had multiple strokes which doctors determined were from shoveling snow from a sidewalk a few days prior.
An employee was cleaning equipment, slipped in the mud, and fractured the right fibula.
An employee had an asthmatic reaction caused by another person's strong cologne.

An employee was laying on an inclined catwalk 30 feet above the ground to observe repair work on a beltline conveyor system below. As he positioned himself to stand up, he fell through the mid-rail and toe board of the catwalk, hitting the belt and the ground. He suffered three fractures to the right arm, multiple fractures to the right ribs, bruised lungs, and a bruised right kidney.
An employee slipped on water that was spilled on the floor and fell, shattering her kneecap.

An employee was cleaning equipment using the central vacuum hose. The hose was not working properly.  The employee tried to troubleshoot the issue and reached underneath the rotary feeder catching his finger on the blade and amputating the tip of his right index finger.
On or about December 1, 2015, an employee's right middle finger was crushed and fractured while setting up the "straight draw" press.
A steel beam tipped over and fell onto an employee's right ring and middle finger causing an amputation above the knuckle.

An employee was moving storage racks with a forklift when the forklift became stuck in the mud. The employee was putting boards under the tires with help from a coworker. The storage rack fell from the forklift and struck the employee. He sustained a crushed pelvis, broken ankle, broken ribs, and a head injury.
An employee struck a concrete bollard while following another employee on a stand up forklift resulting in amputation of the left leg.
An employee slipped on a frayed carpet and fell down the stairs, injuring the left leg.
While loading plants into a truck, an employee opened the back and was scraped by the door, causing a cut to the stomach area.

An employee was attempting to remove debris from the scanner on the veneer grading table. The rag he was using got pulled into an idler pulley, causing his hand to also be pulled in. He suffered a right thumb laceration and fracture.

The employee was working at an elevation on racks and slipped through the fall protection he was wearing after losing his balance. The employee fell 10 feet and suffered a broken left arm and fractured hip.

An employee was operating a mini excavator, removing a floor slab in the west annex of the green mile. The floor slab gave way, and the excavator fell one floor. The employee sustained a concussion and a severe laceration to the right forearm.

During the pre-operational PIT inspection process, one of the employees who was moving a stand-up fork truck pinned another employee's foot between his moving truck and a nearby stationary truck, resulting in a foot injury and the employee's hospitalization.

An employee was walking a dog from the back kennel area to the bathing area when the dog suddenly started to run causing the employee to trip on a mat and fall. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right hip and injuries to the knee and neck.

On May 9, 2015, an employee was operating a Raymond stand-up forklift when the forklift hit a protective rack on the top and caught the arms of the counter leaver.  The aluminum extrusions bundle weighing 1,000 pounds came down and struck the employee. He was hospitalized with injuries to his right arm and ribs.
While pulling a drilling pipe, the pipe broke and the jack fell onto the employee's foot crushing the steel toe portion into his foot.

An employee was going to turn off an escalator after a cable was cut when the zipper on his pants caught on the lever. The lever swung around and bumped the employee who then fell onto a drainage culvert. He suffered a rib fracture and a bruised lung, requiring hospitalization.
Employee was bitten by bed bugs while providing care at a patient's home.  The employee had an allergic reaction to the bites and was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was working with a high-pressure processing machine and was trying to put the push arm back when the machine reset and caught the employee's finger between the sheet metal and the push arm. The employee suffered a contusion and amputation to the left ring fingertip.
An employee was outside of a grain elevator watching the auger operation. When he entered the grain elevator, his left leg was caught and amputated in a running auger.

An employee was replacing plastic flapper in the de-icer machine when the start lever activated the de-icer. The employee's left arm was crushed inside the machine, which was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was loading or unloading a tote on the back of a truck and descending the ladder when he slipped and fell on his back. He suffered broken ribs and cracked vertebrae.
While inspecting a roof, an employee fell approximately 40 feet through an HVAC hole to the ground below, breaking multiple bones and suffering internal injuries.
An employee was making a delivery at a restaurant when he fell out of his truck to the ground, fracturing both wrists and an elbow.
An employee fell 15 feet from a 20 foot straight portable ladder breaking his left leg.
An employee suffered a partial amputation while performing maintenance operations on an HVAC system. The system for the pressure door was not shut off at the time of the incident.
Employee was stowing a wheelchair in the bus when she got her finger caught in a pinch point amputating the tip of the right index finger.
While cleaning up in the saw area, an employee attempted to remove scrap from a scrap conveyor. His hand was caught by the belt and pulley, and his radius and ulna were fractured.

An employee was dressing a grinding wheel with a rag when the rag became caught in the wheel. The employee's left hand was then pulled into the grinding wheel, amputating the index finger and lacerating the third, fourth, and fifth fingers.
An employee's left arm was injured when he attempted to stop a rolling 15-gallon beer keg.
An employee suffered a severe burn injury while working on a power pole when he made contact with a live wire. The employee was sent to Utah Burn Center.
While trying to manually rotate a forms shaft, an employee slipped and fell, breaking a finger and requiring stitches.
An employee was admitted to the hospital following a fire during the transfer of diesel fuel at a facility.

An employee was removing a hand temper (compaction for dirt) out of a dump truck by lifting it with a backhoe bucket. His left ring finger was pinched between the tailgate of the dump truck and the hand temper when he grabbed the hand temper as it slipped and fell off the bucket. The employee suffered some bone loss (no amputation) and incurred 100 stiches.
An employee was standing to the side of a load of wood being put in the kiln. The load shifted and fell on his right leg and foot, fracturing them.

An employee was using a wrench to remove snow that was blocking the magic carpet conveyor belt machine. As soon as the snow was released, the conveyor started going again and grabbed the wrench. When the employee tried to grab the tool, she was trapped under the conveyor belt bar, breaking her right humerus.
An employee was conducting a compression test on a part when the rig holding the part failed, allowing it to strike the employee's chest.
An employee working on a production line in the Parbake Plant amputated three fingertips on his left hand while trying to unjam equipment.
An employee was operating a pallet jack, lost control and pinned his right foot between the jack and a rack resulting in an open compound fracture of the right ankle.
An employee was decorating a cake stationed on a stainless steel table. The employee was standing on a rubber mat (fatigue mat) when she tripped on it. She fell and fractured her left hip.

An employee was carrying new filter cartridges upstairs when he lost his balance and fell down the stairs, striking the right side of his face and left arm. His left arm broke in three places, his right eye socket broke, and his chin was lacerated.

An employee was removing excess grease lube from a boom drum on the derrick with a putty knife and got his right hand fingers caught in the rotating metal gears. His right index finger was amputated and the right middle, ring and pinky fingers were crushed.
An employee was walking to his vehicle in the company's parking lot and slipped on ice or snow fracturing the left leg and ankle.

An employee was struck by a forklift and received an injury to the right leg at approximately 6:00PM on September 11, 2015. The employee was transported by ambulance to the hospital, received emergency care and was discharged.
On March 31, 2016, an employee injured both hands while hand-feeding a printer/slotter for corrugated cardboard.  The employee was hospitalized with fractures and lacerations on both hands.

On 07/14/2016, at approximately 11:15 a.m., an employee was using a saw to cut 4'x8' panels. As the employee was retracting the table back to its starting position, the blade cut the employee's right-hand middle, ring, and pinky fingers, amputating the pinky and ring fingertips.

An employee was trimming trees from a scissor lift at a height of approximately 10 to 12 feet. The employee fell from the scissor lift, sustaining a head injury, punctured lung, torn liver, and broken bones.

An employee was injured when the stand-up forklift he was driving hit a parked forklift. One of the parked forklift's forks entered the cab, struck his foot, and cut his foot and leg. He was hospitalized.
On or about January 29, 2015, an employee had his hand pulled into a saw.
An employee was welding on stainless steel when his welding rod caused a first degree burn to his left hand.
An employee was walking on the sidewalk when she tripped on the raised lip of the concrete. She fell on her gun belt and felt back pain, suffering a back contusion.
An employee was testing a 240v line that had a fault and received an arc flash burn to their left arm.
An employee, who was driving a golf-cart, lost control and the golf cart over-turned, resulting in multiple injuries to his body.
An employee was photographing/documenting shipped items on the loading dock. The employee's foot got run over by a fork truck and the employee's leg also broke.
An employee tripped and fell while walking down a flight of stairs, injuring the right knee.
An employee was stacking batteries on a pallet in the fleet garage. He lost his balance and fell to the concrete floor resulting in 2 hip fractures.

A pendant line on a crane was secured to the crane's boom. As the boom was being elevated, the pendant line broke loose and went through the crane cab, striking the injured employee in the face/head. The employee was hospitalized.
While an employee was wiping debris from a plastic compression mold press, the vertical injector plate came down and partially amputated the employee's left middle and index fingertips.
An employee suffered severe cramping and heat exhaustion while performing work in 80-degree weather. He was hospitalized overnight.

On Tuesday, March 8, 2016, at approximately 7:15 AM, an employee was wrapping the walls of a modular home for shipping. The wall fell and injured the employee when he tried to grab it to stop it from falling. He was hospitalized overnight for treatment of back injuries.

Two employees were preparing two industrial control panels for shipment. The control panel is 5 feet wide, 7 feet tall, 1 foot deep, and weighs approximately 500lbs. They were setting one on the shipping pallet when the second one fell on top of the worker striking him on the back and injuring his right shoulder, ribs, and lung.
An employee suffered burns from a flash fire that was created by a trash pump unit powered by a gas generator. It is used to pump oil and water from an open top tank at the well site.
An employee pinched two left-hand fingers between the mast and hoist of a moving lift jockey. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery.

An employee got his right foot and ankle caught in a pallet that was then pulled into the roller on the palletizer. When the pallet was rolling forward it cut his right ankle into the bone. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was lifting a forklift attachment and smashed this thumb between the swivel hook and the forklift attachment resulting in the amputation of his right thumb tip.
An employee was using a hammer and struck his left thumb on 09/01/2016.
An employee slipped and fell while walking into a patient's room and was hospitalized with a broken hip.
An employee was on a 5-foot fixed ladder, descending a work platform, when he missed a ladder rung and slid down the ladder to the floor. He fractured his right foot and required surgery.

An employee was using a meat grinder when some meat became stuck to the side of the hopper. When the employee went to dislodge the meat, the employee's left hand was caught in the auger, amputating the pinky fingertip and ring finger.
An employee had an allergic reaction to cleaning chemicals used in her area of operations. She was admitted to the hospital for breathing difficulties.

The injured employee was in the process of spraying a tacky solution onto the conveyor belt of a dump truck when his arm got caught and he received skin burns/abrasions on his left forearm and left hand. He was admitted to the hospital and had an incision to relieve the swelling.

An employee was assembling a mast on a forklift. The employee's fingers were caught in a pinch point, which resulted in severe lacerations of the middle, ring, and pinky fingers. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was feeding lumber into the saw and amputated the left ring fingertip.

An employee was using a pressure washer to clean a forklift. The pressure washer lost pressure, so the employee walked around the pressure washer to try and see what was wrong. At that time, the "caps" blew off of the heater element on the pressure washer, striking the employee in the jaw and fracturing it.
An employee was climbing a 6-foot ladder when he fell off and hit a water pipe, breaking three ribs and puncturing a lung.
An employee was delivering mail and fell hitting their head on the concrete sidewalk.
An employee had four fingers on the left hand amputated when his left hand was caught in the rollers of the paper converting machine.
Employee amputated finger on a buffing wheel.
On or about December 8, 2015, an employee stepped off a step stool and fell to the floor, breaking her femur.
Employee suffered an amputation of his right index finger while putting a bird's leg back into a shackle in the picking room. Employee's finger got caught in the moving shackle.
An employee slipped on ice and snow in the parking lot and fell, fracturing the left hip.
An employee was trying to remove a trash can from a certain spot. When he attempted to move a pallet jack out the way, it ran over his right foot.
An employee received second degree burns on the left hand while attempting to free an obstruction in an injection molding machine.
An employee was walking out of the kitchen area and lost her footing. She fell and hit her head on the kitchen sink.
An employee was operating a pallet jack and slipped off the pallet jack severely lacerating the right ankle and shin area.
An employee was injured while operating a plastic bottle palletizer. The employee was caught in the moving components of the machine and suffered skull, neck, and jaw fractures.

An employee stepped into a storage tote to retrieve fishing line. The tote tipped over, causing the employee to fall into the hold of the ship. The employee suffered a broken right wrist and right leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was lowering a scissor lift with the remote control. His left thumb got pinched in the lift resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was injured and hospitalized after they fell 7.5 feet from a platform. The employee suffered a head injury, broken wrist, broken clavicle, bruised ribs and stitches to the ear.

While lifting a pallet of cases, three cases fell off the pallet. The forklift operator picked up two cases and stacked them on the dash of the standing forklift. When he went to pick up the third case, the other two cases fell over engaging both the dead man's switch and the joystick, causing the forklift to rotate pinning him against an adjacent forklift.
An employee was working on an electric motor to get it going. When the motor started, his left thumb tip was amputated by the belt of the motor.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking lot, suffering a fractured hip.
The employee was cutting a 1/4 inch piece of plastic liner with a hand held grinder. The grinder jumped, lacerating the employee's left middle and index fingers.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee delivering mail was bitten by a dog and was injured.
An employee was adjusting the forks of a fork truck while they were lifted approximately 2 feet in the air when the forks failed and fell, partially amputating his left big toe. He had surgery.
An employee missed a step and fell while descending a two-step ladder, fracturing the left leg.
A temporary worker doing carpentry work for a client company suffered a back injury resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was raising the flag outside of the post office. Two dogs attacked him, causing lacerations on both forearms, knees, and calves. He was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a forklift truck when he struck a yellow pole. His left foot was caught between the truck and the pole, crushing his left leg and requiring hospitalization.

An employee changing out a drill bit on a machine when he realized that drill bits were left inside the machine. The machine was energized at the time. While attempting to retrieve the drill bits, his left hand was struck by a moving drill.
An employee fell through a tray ceiling while working in the attic of a residential home, suffering a bruised knee and cut hand.

An employee was working approximately 10 feet inside of a box truck, preparing materials for shipping. He was tightening a ratchet strap to secure gas cylinders. His hand slipped off of the strap and he stumbled approximately 10 feet backwards. He fell out of the back of the truck, approximately 4 feet to the concrete parking lot, and broke his left femur and hip. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was using a pressure washer at an oil and gas site. The water pressure was approximately 1400 psi. He lost control of the hose and the wand struck the employee's left hand causing a laceration between the thumb and wrist. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

On February 10, 2017, an employee was using a torch to cut an automotive die when a line ruptured, spraying the employee's legs with hot hydraulic fluid. The employee sustained serious burn injuries to both legs and was hospitalized.
An employee operating a trim press received an amputation injury that resulted in the loss of all four fingers on each hand.
An employee injured his/her back while stocking kitchen materials on a shelf.
An employee was kneeling over and cleaning floor mats when another employee backed a vehicle from a service bay and struck the employee's leg fracturing it.
An employee was operating a stand-up forklift, backing away from a dock door, and pulled into the path of another stand-up forklift resulting in three fractured toes on the left foot.
An employee had his left ring and small finger amputated when he placed his hand in the Horizontal Compression Machine (HCM) to clean the sensor that was located approximately 18" inside the machine.

An employee was repairing a seam weld on a combine head wheel when the wheel moved into position on the hub and landed behind the steel toe protection on the employee's footwear, crushing the employee's toes/foot.
An employee was installing u-verse equipment in a customer's home. When he stood up he felt a pop in his back. He was hospitalized for a pinched nerve.
While cleaning debris from a roof, an employee fell approximately 12 feet to the ground, breaking a rib.

An employee was walking from the dock area into a trailer across the dock plate/bumper when he misstepped and lost his footing. His right foot and leg went off the dock plate/bumper, leading his left leg to bend abnormally and his left femur to break above the knee.
An employee partially amputated the left index and middle fingers while using a 24-inch hook to reach the drum de-boner auger.
An employee was conducting maintenance on the nacelle of the wind turbine when he slipped and fell onto a stair, landing on his right-side ribcage and suffering a collapsed lung.
On or about September 28, 2015, an employee felt a pop in their back while driving a forklift. The employee was hospitalized for a back injury.
