An employee was rigging pilings for hoisting and pinched a finger between the sling and piling. The tip of the index finger was amputated and reattached.
An employee slipped and fell while getting out of a vehicle, suffering a bruised spleen.
While cutting material using a table saw, an employee's fingers contacted the blade, resulting in a finger amputation on 3/1/16.
An employee's arm was fractured after getting caught by a Gloucester bag machine's shuttle.
An employee was moving a meat slicer in the trash room. Protective gloves were not worn at the time. The employee sustained a left-hand finger amputation.

An employee attempted to clean rice bran from the trunk of a whitening machine. His right hand contacted a rotating blade, amputating 1 inch of his middle finger. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was operating the edge bander and amputated the right index finger.
An employee slipped on the icy covered sidewalk leading to her car and broke her hip.

An employee was removing a hose from an asphalt truck. When the employee unhooked the hose, the oil remaining in the hose splashed back onto the employee's left arm, causing chemical burns. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell and hit his head while trying to run away from a dog. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a beam with a crane and sustained a foot injury.

On April 20, 2015, an employee was loading a powered wheel chair weighing approximately 400 lbs into the cargo bay of a 757 aircraft and got his left pinky finger caught between the wheel and the frame of the wheel chair resulting in the amputation of the pinky fingertip.
While rigging wire, an employee slipped and fell off a truck, breaking a wrist and ribs.

An employee was working on a vehicle on the lift with the engine running. The employee attempted to stop the spinning front wheel and caught their left index finger in the wheel spokes resulting in amputation at the first knuckle.
An employee operating a forklift struck the back of another forklift, breaking his left leg and injuring both feet.
An employee stepped out onto the damp porch, slipped, and fell injuring her left knee.
An employee was walking down the hall when he turned a corner and fell, breaking his leg.
An employee unloading furniture from a freight truck suffered heat stress and was hospitalized.
Employees were coming down from a roof along with equipment and tools using an articulating boom lift.  The lift wells gave out, and the employees fell suffering broken bones.

An employee was rolling an oil drum off of the back of the truck when he slipped and fell to the pavement below.  The driver was found unconscious. The employee was hospitalized with traumatic injuries to the C-5 and C-6 vertebrae that will require surgery in the future.

An employee was stacking boxes on a pallet. The employee struck his leg on a box containing product. After a half hour, the employee's leg began to swell and he was taken to the hospital. The employee was diagnosed as having a blood clot and was hospitalized overnight. The employee had surgery the next day.
An employee was caulking the exterior of a boat while standing on a ladder or scaffold. The employee fell 6 feet from the scaffold or ladder, breaking a vertebra.
A security guard tripped in the parking lot and fell dislocating a shoulder.
On 11/10/2015, an employee was hospitalized with a rash that developed on her bilateral forearms after transferring a patient.
An employee was installing duct in a trench box. Because the trench was in an incline, the road plate shifted towards the box and pinched the worker's right forearm, causing it to break.

While swabbing operating equipment, an employee's sleeve was caught in the conveyor, pulling the employee's left arm into the machine. The employee's arm suffered a compound fracture and skin removal.

On 2/25/15 at approx. 5:15 p.m., an employee was sanitizing the muffin batter depositor pump.  She removed the cover off the side of the equipment, sprayed inside, and then reached into the pump with her right hand to check for remaining batter mix. As a result, three fingertips on her right hand were amputated. The machine was not locked out at the time.
On or about December 15, 2015 at 3:10p.m., a mail handler got her right foot caught in some unsecured netting on a parcel container and twisted her foot resulting in a fracture.
While helping a client stand up, an employee tripped on the client's foot and fell to the floor, suffering a fractured hip.
Employees were cutting metal. A piece of cut metal fell and struck an employee on the back causing a laceration.

An employee was injured while mounting a small tire.  The rim split and the tire struck the employee. The employee received lacerations to his face and fractures to his right wrist.  He was transported to Morristown Hospital and admitted for treatment.
While operating a piece of equipment to cut metal stock, an employee's right index finger was crushed, requiring surgical amputation.
An employee was climbing a ladder after a rain storm to set a 2 X 6 on the roof.  The employee slipped and fell about 15 feet to the ground, fracturing his vertebrae and injuring his head.
An employee was lifting sheet metal to put in the dumpster when he felt a bubble-like substance, resulting in a hernia.
While climbing a fixed ladder, an employee fell backward and fractured his wrist.
An employee suffered an allergic reaction to powder coated nitrile gloves.
An employee was servicing a gas boiler system and was burned on the head/face due to a faulty gas valve.

An employee and a coworker strapped an industrial site plan printer onto a forklift's long skid to take it to the second floor. The employee was on the forklift's skids when he fell 10 feet to the first floor of the warehouse, suffering lower back injuries that required hospitalization.
An employee was installing wires on an electrical box when a worker at the jobsite energized the box, which then burned the employee's right palm. He was hospitalized overnight.

On January 21, 2016, an employee was operating veneer press roller while working with material that was not feeding through properly. As he attempted to push the misaligned material through the machine, is left little fingertip was pinched. When he attempted to pull his hand back, the flesh and nail of fingertip were degloved.
An employee's pinky finger was crushed beneath an air pallet being used to move a semi trailer.

An employee was working on a pipe-threading machine, placing caps on the end of a pipe. The employee's finger caught the sharp edge of the pipe and was severely lacerated. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's left hand received an electrical shock when it grabbed an electrical conduit wiring as he climbed down a ladder.
An employee was flagging traffic in a work zone behind a line of cones when a driver drove straight into the employee, bruising the employee's right leg and causing a concussion.
An employee was working from a 10 foot ladder and fell to the ground cracking two vertebrae in the neck.

An employee unplugged a pallet jack at the charging station. The employee was riding the pallet jack when it jerked, causing her to fall off. Her right foot then became caught and was crushed beneath the pallet jack, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized due to carbon monoxide exposure.
The employee was climbing down off of a step ladder and lost his footing. He fell 16 feet off of the awning resulting in head and elbow injuries.
An employee was backing out of a parking spot when the employee's vehicle was struck by another vehicle. The employee suffered head, neck, and back injuries.
An employee was working at the yard and was overcome by the heat. The employee suffered a heat illness, broken nose, and a laceration to his head.
An employee was removing the inside corner form for a concrete foundation when his left hand was crushed between the form and a waler, amputating his left middle finger and fracturing his thumb.

An employee was lifting panels from one place to another place, finished the job and then went home. While at home the employee felt pain in his chest. The employee went to the hospital and was admitted with a collapsed lung.
An employee was on a platform. When he stepped over a ladder he lost his balance and fell to the ground fracturing the right foot.
An employee tripped over the curb while carrying items and injured the face and neck requiring hospitalization.
An employee was troubleshooting a broken valve when the valve opened, causing a wrist fracture. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee began experiencing heat-related illness and cramping due to high temperatures, humidity, and dehydration, requiring hospitalization.
While removing scrap metal from a lathe, an employee's right thumb was crushed between the lathe and saddle.
On 12/26/16, an employee was bending rebar with a machine. The employee sustained a hand injury requiring hospitalization.
Two employees operating a meat slicer inside the kitchen area lacerated their fingertips requiring amputation.
On or about May 22, 2015, an employee was cleaning with a sweeper and tripped over the cord and fell. The employee broke a bone in the left arm between the elbow and the wrist and hurt a hip.
An employee was responding to a patient's call, tripped over the call light cord, and fell fracturing the left hip.
An employee was injured when struck-by plastic pipes while unloading.  The worker was hospitalized.
An employee was working inside of a tank that was roped off when he fell approximately 10 to 12 feet, lacerating his right ear, fracturing his right facial bone, and puncturing his upper right leg.
An employee was injured while cleaning a blending machine.

On March 13, 2016, an employee was putting a belt (48" wide by 17' long) on the screener.  The employee was on a ladder three rungs up. When he attempted to pull on the belt, the ladder went out from underneath him and he fell to the floor. He suffered a compression fracture to his lumbar vertebra.
An employee was getting ready to hook up to the dome while using the vault cart. The employee's left thumb was caught in the vault cart winch and the end of his thumb was amputated.
An employee was working in the OCA department attempting to light the OCA furnace with a butane lighter. There was a suspected gas leak that ignited and burned the employee's right arm.

An employee slipped/tripped and fell in the concrete parking lot while running to his automobile in the rain at an administrative building. The employee severely strained his right hamstring and sustained an abrasion on his right knee, as well as abrasions on the palms of both hands.
An employee was shocked when the trackhoe he was loading onto a trailer made contact with power lines.
An employee was cleaning up and hot water (estimated at 150-200 degrees F) got inside the top of his boot burning the employee's right foot.
While running tubing into a well, an employee was struck on the head and face by the tubing, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was walking to her car at the end of her shift, slipped on ice and fell in the parking lot fracturing her tail bone.
An employee was injured when boxes fell on him.

While using a table saw to cut down plastic parts, the tip of an employee's glove was caught by the saw pulling the employee's thumb into the saw and removing the flesh from the very tip of the right thumb. No bone was removed.
An employee was dismantling a trash chute when he was struck by a 5-pound brick that was stuck in the chute, severely lacerating his forehead and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was attempting to remove a piece of chicken trim from a machine when his left hand/arm entered the machine's moving parts.
While moving a wooden pallet, an employee received a wooden splinter to the left palm.
An employee was getting a cup of coffee when she tripped over a mat in the lunchroom and broke her left femur. She was hospitalized.
An employee was standing on the top of a ladder hanging a banner on the side of the truck. He fell several feet from the ladder and broke a hip.
An employee experienced back spasms and back strain while loading a hand truck with bottles of water.

An employee was watching a surge pile in the staging area while supervising the work, when he was struck by a forklift that was loading out trucks in the vicinity. The employee's right leg and elbow were injured, resulting in surgery and hospitalization.

An employee was removing concrete forms and loading them onto a flatbed tractor trailer when his left index finger got caught in the chain rigging that was in use to move the forms.  The load shifted and amputated his left index finger between the bottom of the finger nail and the top of the knuckle.
An employee suffered a back injury (slipped discs) while reaching into the back of the LLV to retrieve a parcel for delivery.
An employee was getting out of a vehicle and slipped on ice injuring his left hip.
A maintenance man removed a guard without LOTO and his left pointer finger was amputated above the first digit.
An employee suffered a finger amputation when his finger made contact with a moving fan belt on the aerosol air system control fan.
An employee lost his balance and fell while working on a 10 foot ladder, breaking his left elbow, right wrist, and lacerating his forehead.
An employee was lowering a cover die with an overhead crane when his left index finger was pinched and amputated between the cover die and the machine sleeve.
An employee was delivering mail on his walking route when he became lightheaded and dizzy. The temperature at the time was 91 degrees with a humidity of 41%. He was hospitalized with heat stress.
On or about September 18, 2015, an employee fell while working on an eight foot step ladder. The employee was hospitalized with a broken arm and a head injury.
An employee was cutting a beam with a torch. When the beam was cut, it rolled and fell on and crushed both of the employee's feet.
An employee from Packard Sanitation Services was cleaning a casing machine when her glove got caught between the rolls. She lost the middle fingertip on her left hand.
An employee was moving brush using a winch and caught a finger in the winch.
An employee was shaping a piece of wood with a router. When the employee lifted the guard on the router to shape the wood, the tip of his right ring finger was amputated.
An employee was cleaning out a heat exchanger when hot material blew back and burned 50 percent of the employee's body.
An employee was operating a table saw and cut his right index finger resulting in amputation of the finger at the knuckle.
On April 14, 2015, a bundle of steel landed on an employee's foot. Due to the injuries, four toes and a partial big toe were amputated.
On or about February 26, 2016, an employee was feeding material into a shear when the employee's fingers entered the shear point. The employee's finger was amputated.

An employee was overseeing the transport of product from the upper level to the lower level, when he stepped into an opening and caught his upper body in the opening. The employee caught himself with his upper body. He did not fall to the ground.

An employee was working on the tear tape machine and was loosening bolts to the supporting bar when the bar fell and forced his right hand down and into the hot plate area. He suffered third-degree burns on the back of his right hand.
An employee was attempting to unjam a bag filling machine when the machine's blade amputated his right middle fingertip.
Employee was delivering lumber when the ladder he was using to access the truck slipped on ice and the employee fell. The resulting injuries required hospitalization.
An employee was refueling a passenger bus that was not properly parked. The employee slipped on ice and fell in front of the rolling rear wheels resulting in crushing injuries to the lower abdomen.
An employee was conducting cleaning/unjamming operations on a dust collector machine when his hand entered the point of operation, amputating his index, middle, and ring fingers.
An employee was troubleshooting a packaging machine. The machine engaged, and his hand was pushed by the belt. When he pulled his hand back, his fingertip was amputated.
On March 31, 2016, at 12:00PM, an employee tripped on an electrical extension cord and fell.
An employee was injured from tripping while walking up a flight of stairs.
An employee was struck by a car in a work zone and suffered multiple severe injuries.

An employee was cutting a 3/4-inch plywood using a table saw when the riving knife broke, struck the saw blade, and was thrown forward, striking and lacerating the employee's right bicep. The employee was hospitalized and required wrist surgery.

An employee fell through an opening 15 feet to the ground. The employee broke the left hip, ribs, a tibia, and sustained damage to the spleen. The employee was admitted to the hospital and underwent surgery.
An employee was power-washing the airfield surface when the water spray or the sharp edge of the spray nozzle lacerated his upper left arm. He was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell on a wet floor suffering a strained groin muscle and  lumbar disc herniation.
An employee's finger was caught in a rotating part. A finger on the right hand was amputated at the second digit by a physician.
On 7/9/15, an employee broke a bone in his face when the string trimmer he was using hit him in the face while he attempted to adjust the string.
An employee sustained a right index fingertip laceration while clearing a misfeed part in a strapper machine.
An employee was using a drill when the glove was caught in the machine resulting in a pinky finger amputation.
An employee was setting up a die in a press machine. The die slipped and pinched the left middle finger between the die and the press.  The left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while operating a pallet jack.
An employee got his left hand caught in the winder and suffered a compound fracture to the left hand.
An employee was hospitalized on February 25th, 2015, after falling on black ice and sustaining multiple fractures.

An employee was operating a snowmobile to conduct fishing license checks and fell off the snowmobile after catching a patch of ice.  The employee was hospitalized with seven broken ribs and a dislocated shoulder.

The employee was preparing to operate the water stripper gun to perform a quick test prior to beginning work. During the test, a particle lodged in one of the newly installed jewel tip nozzles of the whip hose causing a sudden surge in pressure. This resulted in a failure of the whip hose (the pressure surged to 18,000 PSI and was rated for 22,000 PSI). High pressure water exited the hose from the break and struck the employee's wrist.
An employee needed to access a trailer to untangle a strap. While climbing a 4-foot ladder he lost his balance and fell to the floor, breaking a vertebra in his back.
While working on a ship's radar, an employee fell after a rusty safety ring gave way. The employee suffered a hematoma to the head.

A route driver stepped off the back of the delivery truck,  missed the grab handle and fell to the concrete.  The employee's left arm sustained a compound fracture requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee tripped and fell while unloading goods with a hand cart. The hand cart came down on the employee's hand, pinching it between the cart and ground.

An employee was working from an aerial lift to install purlins on a steel shed when the shed shifted and collapsed. The collapsing building struck the aerial lift, causing it to turn over. The employee hit the ground, breaking his hip.
An employee was collecting trash in a residential neighborhood when he was struck by a car and thrown into the rear hopper of the garbage truck. He suffered lower leg fractures and was hospitalized.
An employee drove a forklift through the loading dock door causing severe injury to the lower leg.
Four employees were riding on an ATV when the ATV rolled over. One of the employee's right leg was pinned under the ATV and severely lacerated. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was hooking a trailer up to a truck with a coworker. The hitch got stuck; while attempting to unhook the hitch, the employee placed his hand on the hitch. The coworker lowered the trailer, and the employee's right, third fingertip got amputated after getting caught between the hitch and trailer. He was hospitalized.
An employee's right index fingertip was amputated when the finger was caught between a piece of over-pour and the door to the shaker-shack.

An employee was attempting to loosen the pin so that he could adjust the tandem wheels under the back of his 53-foot semi-trailer for loading/unloading. An air line failed or an air spring (ballast) burst, suddenly dropping the trailer down and pinning the employee's arm between the top of the tire and bottom of the trailer frame. His arm was crushed and lacerated.
An employee fell from the second story of a residential home and was injured as a result of the incident.

Employee was working from a scissor lift approximately 12 feet high when it collapsed and ejected the employee onto a concrete slab.  The employee was admitted to the hospital with a broken arm and a broken back.
An employee amputated the end of his left index finger while dumping materials from the grey dumpster.
An employee was injured when he entered into the stacker conveyor belt area.  The employee's legs were crushed by moving equipment.
An employee making a delivery fell off the lift gate on the back of his truck, struck the ground below, and broke his lower right arm.
An employee's finger was bitten by a venomous snake while attempting to search for a welding pipe. The employee was hospitalized.
On 01/07/15 at 6:45 pm, an employee's  middle index finger was amputated while unclogging a pipe of the dust collector system.

An employee was inserting a piece of metal inside a piece of vinyl window profile when she got a splinter. She and a co-worker removed the splinter.  Later she went to the doctor to receive further treatment and was hospitalized for an infection.
An employee was lifting a grader with an air tugger and got her left hand index finger caught in the metal wiring resulting in amputation.

On or about September 14, 2016, an employee was a passenger in the company shuttle bus, commuting from the employee parking lot to the building. The company shuttle bus quickly braked to avoid another vehicle and the employee slid forward, striking her left abdomen on the seat in front of her.
While standing and talking, an employee's foot slipped off of the edge of the sidewalk. He fell into the parking lot, breaking his right femur and hip.
An employee tripped when her foot got entangled in a computer cable, fracturing her right elbow.
An employee's index finger was caught in the chain of a conveyor belt, amputating it at the first knuckle.

On July 2, 2015, at 1425 hours, an employee was cutting inside a water tank on the U.S.S. Bataan at BAE Shipyard in the TITAN Dry-dock when he received an electrical shock from a welding lead. He was hospitalized.
An employee was outside training on a Meggar and started sweating profusely.  The employee was hospitalized for dehydration.
On August 13, 2016, an employee fell while descending an A-frame ladder leaning against the wall of an overhead platform, requiring hospitalization.

While unloading a trailer that contained donated goods, an employee made contact with the blade of a food processor that was inside a black garbage bag, requiring hospitalization for an arm laceration.
As he was tightening a bolt on a piece of equipment, an employee's left hand was caught and fractured between a piece of metal slat and a sprocket.

An employee was driving a forklift when the tie strap behind his seat began falling off. As he grabbed the strap, the end of it became caught in the tire, causing the strap to cinch and lacerate his right pinky, ring, and middle fingers.

An employee was working on the second step of a six-foot ladder in the backroom sorting through hardware bins. The employee began to come down the ladder and missed the last rung. The employee fell and broke the left hip.

An employee was teaching a class when she turned to walk away from the podium and tripped. When she started to fall, she placed her right arm out to brace herself. Her arm hit the wall, fracturing her humerus and requiring surgery.

An employee was installing fiber cable optic in an apartment complex building. The employee stepped out to the hallway on the second floor and leaned against an unsecured railing, falling approximately 9 feet to the ground below and fracturing the pelvic bone.

A temporary employee and three to four additional temporary and permanent employees were attempting to down-stack leaning pallets of product (canned and bottled beverages) from a stack of three loaded pallets. The stack was approximately 15-20 feet high. The pallets fell, for an unknown reason, and the temporary employee was pinned under product and pallets against the wall. He suffered a broken femur and fibula, broken ribs, a punctured lung, and a possible lacerated spleen. He was hospitalized.
An employee was walking with a tagline for a forklift carrying an 8' by 13' steel sheet when he tripped and the forklift operator rolled over his right foot. He was hospitalized with tissue damage.
An employee was standing on a piece of equipment.  The drum that spools the cable caught his foot near his left little toe, and the toe was amputated.
The employee was doing a quality line check in the hot fill area. As she turned around, she tripped over the water hose, fell, and sustained a comminuted fracture to her left elbow.
While repairing a grill exhaust fan, an employee suffered an amputation of the right index finger at the first joint and a fractured right middle finger at the first joint.
An employee was struck by a dump truck resulting in an in-patient hospitalization.
An employee was pulling out a core from the laminator machine when his left index finger and thumb were crushed between the core and spindle chuck.
An employee was lifting an I-beam that weighted approximately 75 pounds using a rope. The employee's thumb was caught under the rope as the beam began to drop resulting in an avulsion injury.

An employee was inserting a blank piece of pipe into the chucks of a CNC machine when the blank fell and his right finger was caught between the blank and the metal bar inside the machine. His right ring fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was carrying pot of hot grease when he slipped and fell. The hot grease spilled on him, causing third degree burns to his arms, chest, neck, leg, and back.
An employee received electrical burns to the right thumb and middle fingers when his wrench contacted the control module of an AC unit on a boat.
An employee was operating a concrete paving saw. He lost control of the saw, and it hit and severely cut the back of his right leg.
An employee was working at the pipe threading machine. As the employee walked away from the machine, he tripped over a tripod leg of the machine and fell breaking the left hip.
An employee fell from a ladder on April 23, 2015, causing a broken tibia on the employee's left leg.

An employee was freeing a jammed wood product (veneer panel plywood) from a saw line workstation.  While freeing the jammed plywood from the grader bin, the operator pinned/pinched his arm between a piece of metal angle iron (under a load) and the metal cross member causing a puncture wound on his right arm below the bicep.

An employee was pushing a crate of sweet potatoes down a ramp to a roller table. His hand got caught and made contact with the drive chain sprocket, severing his right index finger and fracturing his ring and little finger.
An employee was preparing to apply ice melt to the sidewalks around the post office when she slipped on ice and broke several bones. She was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a water line that was being unloaded from a truck, suffering a fractured skull, broken ribs, and a cracked pelvis.

An employee was painting a room with a paint sprayer (approximately 2000 psi). The equipment malfunctioned and the employee's left thumb was lacerated. In addition, paint was injected into the laceration.
A delivery driver was in the process of delivering beverages when he fell off of the lift gate.  He was found on the ground unconscious and bleeding from the head.
An employee was cutting the zip tie off a bar using a utility knife and severely lacerated the left forearm.
An employee ingested degreaser that was placed in a cup and handed to him for cleaning the grill. The employee's esophagus was burned and the employee underwent surgery.
An employee was on a scissor lift when it tipped over onto him and pinned him, breaking bones in his back.
On December 10, 2015, an employee fell to the floor in the hallway leading to the activity room, sustaining a broken right wrist and broken left hip.
An employee fell off the ladder while cleaning the ceiling vent.
Two workers at the National Counter Terrorism Center were on a suspended scaffold when the scaffold malfunctioned causing the employees to fall.
An employee fell at the job site on October 30, 201, and injured his left elbow requiring hospitalization.
An employee was setting up a core machine and became caught in the machine.
An employee was shot by a customer at an employee-sponsored pheasant hunt, suffering gunshot wounds to the stomach, heart, face, and arms.

An employee was making adjustments to the "feed dog" on the multi-spindle screw machine located on the east side of the production building. The machine was energized at the time. The "feed dog" engaged, amputating the employee's left thumb.
An employee was hospitalized after falling 20-25 feet through a roof skylight.

On or about June 27, 2016, an employee incurred a fingertip amputation of the little finger and laceration of the ring finger on her right hand. The employee was operating a laminating machine when the machine stopped.  The employee tried to get the machine started by adjusting the belt.  When she touched the belt, the machine started up, catching her fingers.
An employee was exposed to electrical current while setting up a supplemental lighting/camera resulting in blisters and electrical burns on a hand.
An employee was unloading a truck when the employee's left middle fingertip was pinched and amputated between two steel beams.
While installing underlayment on the roof, an employee fell to the ground and suffered a fractured pelvis.

An employee was sitting on top of a toolbox while riding in the back of a pickup truck. When the truck made a right turn, the employee slid and fell off the left side of the truck onto the side of the road.
While placing a hide in clamps, an employee's thumb was caught and crushed in the clamp.

An employee was in a boom lift, replacing an emergency light at a warehouse. As he was lowering himself, the bucket swung into an industrial ceiling fan, which lacerated his left forearm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using a roller cart to move stock paper rolls. The employee caught his left leg between the roller cart and a fixed ladder breaking it.
An employee was walking into a resident's room when she tripped over a dog cage and fell fracturing a hip. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a flat bar with an iron worker when the employee's finger was crushed and cut, suffering artery damage.
An employee suffered a crushing injury to his right leg when the excavator that he was walking behind stopped and backed up.

An employee was cleaning the units on the second floor when he stepped on a loose platform close to the forklift and fell 10 feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right elbow and had surgery.
An employee was carrying pies in the kitchen when she lost her footing and fell, striking her head on a counter and the floor.

A maintenance employee was connecting a meter to a disgester. The employee was checking the digester probe when he was splashed by hot condensate from the digester. The employee suffered burns on the right torso, right arm, and right thigh. He was transported to the hospital where he received emergency treatment and was kept overnight for observation.

Two employees were using a pressure washer (8500 PSI) to remove paint lines from concrete.  One of the employees accidently swept the discharging water across the other employee's foot. The injured employee suffered lacerations, tendon damage, and a chipped bone on the foot.
An employee was cutting plastic laminate when the laminate moved and pulled his hand toward the saw. His index, middle, and ring fingers were partially amputated.
An employee had a seizure and fell to the floor, hitting and lacerating his head. He was hospitalized on May 19, 2015.
An employee was moving a rolling milk cart when it tipped over. He tried to stop it from falling and it fell on him, breaking his femur and requiring surgery.
An employee was assembling an aluminum tailgate when the torque gun he was using to tighten bolts slipped and caught his finger. His left middle finger was amputated.
An employee was removing plastic from the sprocket of a machine when his right thumb was pulled in and amputated above the knuckle. The machine was running at the time of the incident.

An employee exited the poultry building to take a water break. The employee mistakenly ingested diluted Virocid thinking it was water, suffering stomach pain and vomiting that required hospitalization.

An employee fell 6 feet from a ladder to the cement floor while installing a piece of pipe duct work for an HVAC system. The pipe got hung up on a wire and hit the ladder, knocking him down. He fractured his right forearm.
An employee was struck by a forklift while unloading material.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and broke her wrist.

The employee was leading a group of clients on a bike ride when she came to a temporary construction walkway. The employee swerved to avoid a shoe in the middle of the walkway at which point a 2 x 4 wooden plank that was sticking out into the walkway got caught in her front wheel. The employee fell off her bike onto her left side and was hospitalized with broken ribs and a fractured back.
An employee was injured after they climbed on top of a forklift and inadvertently kicked it into gear. The employee became pinned between the roll bar and the mast, suffering a cracked sternum.

An employee had finished rolling and wrapping a deck sheet and was using a hoist with hooks to lift it when he noticed a problem and grabbed the hook. At the same time, the deck sheet came out of the hook on his side. His finger became wedged between the air bar with the rolled deck sheet and the bracket that holds the air bar on the power roller, partially amputating his left ring fingertip.
An employee's foot was run over by an electric power jack and his toe was amputated.

While spraying a runaround conveyor machine with a pressure washer, an employee noticed something on the conveyor belt. The employee was attempting to remove the object when the employee's hand was caught between the belt and a moving sprocket. The employee suffered a right arm fracture and tissue damage.
An employee suffered a finger amputation.
Employee was maneuvering a piece of raw steel to drain residual coolant from the tube. The employee lost control of the material, causing his finger to get pinched between the material and rollers.
An employee was working on the second floor of the inside section loading material. He fell out of a window opening onto the pavement and fractured his wrist.
A piece of metal from a crusher machine splintered off during routine maintenance and hit an employee's right eye.

Two employees were managing two 500 lb. steel plates with an overhead crane. One of the steel plates fell crushing an employee's right hand between the two pieces of steel.  The injured employee was hospitalized and three fingers were amputated.

On August 19, 2016, an employee was repairing a chain when the actuator pin on the chain caught his finger and pulled his hand into the sprocket. His right-hand middle and ring fingers were amputated at the first knuckle.
On 08/14/15, at 06:15 a.m., an employee tried to unjam a press. The machine was still running at the time and it cycled, partially amputating the employee's left middle finger.
On 04/07/2015 at 6:30 p.m., an employee feeding wood into the web saw had his right index fingertip amputated 1.5 inches.

An employee was pulling a crate of produce out of a truck using a manual pallet jack when he lost his grip and fell backward, striking the floor of the truck and injuring the back of his head. He was hospitalized.
An employee was placing packs of tortillas into a machine that cuts the tortillas into triangles. The employee's fingers came in contact with the machine where it lowers to cut the strips.

An employee received a partial (1/4-inch) amputation to her left middle finger. She was adjusting a wait on top of the Prodo Pak filling machine when her finger got caught in a pinch point and her fingertip was severed.
An employee fell through a hole on the third floor and landed on the second floor resulting in a head injury.

While assisting in material handling operations, an employee's finger was crushed between a skid steer fork and a concrete slab. The employee suffered a fingertip laceration resulting in amputation and fingernail loss.
An employee was adjusting a loose belt on a conveyor when his left hand fingertip was amputated.

Employees were loading chickens onto a trailer when the wooden platform they were working from collapsed, causing them to approximately 10 feet to the floor below. One employee was hospitalized with six fractured ribs and a head laceration, which required sutures.

On 8/11/15 a rural mail carrier vehicle was struck by a township road work truck while delivering mail near an active construction zone. The employee sustained cervical and lumbar strain injuries requiring hospitalization.
An employee was attempting to retrieve a cat from a cage to give it a shot when the cat turned and bit her.
An employee fell 10 feet off an unprotected edge and fractured his left ankle.

An employee was installing a light fixture. He was shocked and fell from the 8-foot, A-frame ladder he was using, with his feet about 4 feet off the ground. When he was shocked, the ladder and he fell in opposite directions. He has some tingling in his right arm and restrictions for both arms until further evaluation.
Two employees in a lift were installing a window when they fell approximately 11 feet to the ground. They were not tied off at the time.
An employee was driving and lost control of the company truck. The truck flipped and the employee fractured his neck.
The worker may have been clearing a jam or retrieving some mail when he tripped and fell hitting his head on the floor or railing. He was found by another employee and admitted to the hospital.

An employee was performing his regular duties in the boiler room when a three-way valve malfunctioned and steam was released, causing second degree burns to the employee's right arm and side. He was hospitalized.

A temporary labor employee was using a grinder outfitted with a cutting wheel to cut metal truss material for the roofers. The employee's glove was caught by the spinning cutting wheel drawing the employee's hand into the cutting blade. The employee suffered lacerations to the wrist and hand area. The employee was sent to the hospital where he was admitted.
Employee was injured in an 18-foot fall from an access platform between two boilers when the catwalk grating gave way. Employee suffered a broken pelvis, fractured ribs, and a dislocated shoulder.
An employee was moving a roll of paper with a pallet jack when his left foot was pinned between a piece of angle iron and the pallet jack, fracturing four bones.

An employee was landing in a jump spot. Upon landing, the employee ran into a coworker who was already on the ground and pulling his parachute in. The employee was hospitalized with C6 and C7 neck fractures.
An employee was loading/unloading steel I beams when a steel I beam slipped off the crane hook and amputated two of the employee's toes.
An employee was trying to grab a small piece a wood that was being cut with a circular saw when his left hand contacted the blade, lacerating his index finger.
An employee transporting asphalt on a roof tripped and fell, injuring his/her hands and wrists.
Employee was injured while operating an electrical jack. He pinned his leg against the wall.
An employee was pulling cut pieces from a Tsune saw with gloves on. The employee's glove got caught on the blade, pulling his finger into the vise and cutting the tip of his right middle finger off.
On July 17, 2015, an employee was struck by a piece of a press machine while holding down a flat truss. The piece pinned and broke his leg.

Employees were rolling flotation tires into the bed of a pickup to take them to a field where the contracted company could install them on trucks to remove modules from the wet fields. An employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee broke an arm while attempting to assist a box of product along the conveyor belt.

An employee was disconnecting chlorine gas system tubing to attach a chlorine cylinder to the water treatment system when a small amount of chlorine gas escaped. The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted.
An employee was trying to unjam a staple gun when the staple gun activated and shot a staple into his hand. He was hospitalized.

An employee was dressing a heat exchanger plate with a hand grinder. The grinder blade caught the edge of the groove being ground and the grinder fell out of the employee's hand striking the top of the employee's left foot and causing a laceration including separation of the big toe tendon.
An employee's hand was pulled into a spindle shaper machine, injuring fingertips and requiring hospitalization.
An employee running from a dog jumped onto a car and crashed through the windshield.

An employee was removing excess yarn from a yarn package (a roll of yarn) inside a cabling machine. He held the excess yarn in his right hand, and as he put it back into the machine, the yarn became caught on the pre-seed roller. The roller then pulled the yarn around and partially amputated his fifth digit (pinky finger).
An employee got her finger pinched in the conveyor on the packaging line resulting in the amputation of the left ring fingertip.

An employee was dismantling scaffold when a large exhaust fan turned on. The fan blades amputated the employee's right middle fingertip below the nail bed, fractured the right ring finger and lacerated to the right index finger.
An employee was operating a punch press to punch holes in an aluminum door frame when his left middle finger was caught in a ram, amputating his fingertip. The ram was unguarded at the time.
An employee delivering packages injured a knee while walking in a snow-covered area.
Two employees working from a man-lift received an electrical shock.
An employee pulled the start cord on a generator, and the generator fell on the employee. The employee suffered a strained knee.

An employee was attempting to lift a slurry tank to move with a pallet jack. The tank rolled catching the employee's right middle finger between the slurry tank cribbing and the asphalt ground resulting in an amputation to at least the first knuckle.

An employee was cleaning a running conveyor machine. The employee lost balance and put a hand up to catch themselves. The employee's hand and arm were pulled into the machine by a pulley, resulting in multiple hand fractures that required surgery. The pulley was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was repairing the tufting machine and straightening up the yarn on a puller roller when his right ring finger was caught and amputated in the machine.
An employee working from an aerial lift removing Christmas decorations received an electric shock from a possible arc flash. The employee received second and third degree burns.
While working outside on a truck's waste collection route, an employee experienced difficulty breathing due to heat stress, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was unloading materials in a UPS trailer while standing on a step stool. The employee fell off the third rung of the step stool to the ground below, fracturing the left leg.
On 01/20/2017, and employee was descending a 10-foot step ladder when he tripped on the bottom rung and contacted the surface below, fracturing his tibia and fibula.

At 11:20 a.m., on June 2, 2016, an employee was attempting to adjust the air flow of the stamping press when his right little finger was caught in the press bumper that is used to stop the die from bottoming out. His finger was surgically amputated at the first joint.
An employee suffered hand/finger injuries as he was helping to unload corrugated metal sheets/sea walls from a truck. The metal sheets were being removed with a back-hoe and chain.
An employee was clearing a line vessel when a hose came loose and struck the employee's left arm. The employee was hospitalized with a left bicep tear requiring surgery.
Employee spilled water on the floor while making coffee. Employee then slipped and fell, breaking her left upper arm requiring surgery.
An employee had been working outside moving baggage and was found passed out in the break room. The employee was hospitalized for extreme dehydration that caused kidney failure.
On 09/29/2015, about 10:30 am, an employee rolled a heavy piece of equipment onto his right foot. On 10/09/2015, the employee was hospitalized and had surgery to amputate two toes on the right foot.
An employee lacerated a finger when it was caught in a press brake.
An employee started removing fiber and cleaning a carding machine while it was being repaired and his right-hand ring and pinky fingers were amputated.
An employee was moving a steel plate with a gantry crane when his thumb became pinned between the plate and the frame of the crane, amputating his thumb tip.
An employee was moving a hose when a manual job switch was activated. Her hair got caught and wrapped around the shaft of the post gluer machine when the machine operator went to adjust the machine.

On or about 1555 hours on March 10, 2015, the right intermediate and distal phalanges of an employee's middle finger were amputated after his finger got caught in the pulley of a winch he was operating. The employee was holding the winch cable with his right hand due to a kink in the line and operating the winch with his left hand when his hand was pulled into the pulley. He was hospitalized and the phalanges were surgically removed.

Employee's right ring finger was amputated after it came in contact with the blade on a bread divider. During a jam, a photo electric eye is supposed to shut the machine down. The photo electric eye malfunctioned as the employee reached into the machine resulting in the ring finger amputation.

Three employees were injured during two separate incidents. 1) On Monday, two employees were injured by steam while performing maintenance on the boiler water feed system in the Building 265 Power House. 2) On Tuesday, a production employee injured his hand and required treatment for cuts while grinding.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report.
An employee amputated the tip of the left middle finger when he tried to catch the pipe he was carrying and pinching his finger between the pipe and the floor.

Workers were using bottle jacks to move a heat treatment oven laterally. One of the bottle jacks moved out of position, causing the footing of the oven to come down and crush the injured employee's left hand.

On or about June 4, 2015, at 11:15 a.m., an employee was crushed by a core box when the hand truck, which was supported by a bucket, shifted and pushed him over onto his back while he was still holding the box. He fractured his right hip and was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee passed out while walking from dehydration. The employee was hospitalized for IV fluid treatment.
An employee contacted a wall with his hand while engaged in horseplay and caught his finger on a screw. His finger split open to the bone and required surgery.

An employee was moving 2x4's into a single-family home under construction when he fell into a floor hole in the middle of the floor, breaking ribs, puncturing a lung, and fracturing neck vertebrae. The floor hole was unguarded at the time of the incident.

On January 26, 2015, at approximately 8:06 a.m., at the Tel Hai Retirement Community, the worker sustained a partial amputation. At the time of the incident, workers were using a forklift truck to lift a job box (metal box) onto the upper level. While taking the job box off of the forklift truck, the worker's hand was pinched between the forklift truck and the job box. He was taken to Brandywine Hospital Emergency Outpatient. He sustained a bone fracture and partial amputation of his right fourth finger, distal phalanx, distal tuft, with a loss of overlaying soft tissue. He was treated and discharged.
An employee was coming down a mobile staircase when he missed the last two steps and fell. He fractured his lower left leg and left wrist and dislocated his left elbow. He required surgery.
An employee was installing a conveyor system using a pry bar to separate parts and amputated a fingertip when the tool slipped and pinched his finger between the two parts.
An employee fell to the ground while repairing shingles on the roof of a private residence, requiring hospitalization for facial injuries and a torn aorta.
A worker was engaged in steel erection activities when he tripped on his life line and fell off the canopy striking his elbow resulting in a broken elbow.
Employee had his left fifth (pinky) fingertip amputated when his hand was pinched between a high-torque wrench and a bolt head.
An employee was running a punch press and amputated their right index finger.
An employee's right hand was caught in the rollers while feeding dough into the dough machine, amputating the ring and middle fingertips.
An employee was placing plastic bags into a bailer when a forklift truck crushed his left leg.
An employee received a deep laceration on his thumb while using a circular saw to cut wood.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet when the duct work he was working from fell to the floor. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood. While he was guiding it with his left hand and using a push stick in his right hand, the piece of wood kicked back causing his left hand to come in contact with the saw blade resulting in a severe laceration to the left thumb. Part of the employee's left thumb was later amputated.

A crane was removing a heater from a platform. The heater was lifted up to tighten the chains before resuming the lift, but the heater stack (7 ft. pipe) broke off of the heater. The broken piece struck an employee, who suffered a severe concussion and broken bones in the neck.

An employee was responding to an emergency call after a liquid nitrogen leak at a laboratory. When the employee entered the lab to close the valves, the employee inhaled nitrogen, suffering hypoxia and loss of consciousness. The employee was hospitalized.

On December 2, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., an employee was walking down a stairwell to the basement when he missed the first step and fell down approximately 12 stairs. He was hospitalized with a head laceration and a fractured left wrist. At the time of the incident, the backup generator was being tested and a delay in the emergency lighting caused the stairwell to be poorly lit.

An employee was taking pictures at the finish line of a track event. One of the participants finished the race and turned toward the employee. The runner struck the employee, knocking her to the ground and fracturing her right ankle.

At the facility shop area, an employee tripped over his feet and fell on an industrial sized valve stem used in hydrofracking (a piece of sharp equipment) and lacerated his abdomen.  This injury required hospitalization for two days.
An employee working in the deli slipped in mop water and fell, suffering a broken pelvis and elbow, as well as internal injuries.
The tip of a bicycle mechanic's thumb was amputated while servicing the drive chain of a stationary cycle.
An employee's arm was injured when it was caught between a chair and desk while he was working at his desk.
A maintenance employee servicing a wheel abrading machine was hospitalized after breaking two of his right-hand fingers.
An employee's right index finger was amputated at the second knuckle as the employee adjusted a drive belt that was slipping.

An employee was pulling electrical wire onboard a marine vessel. A large hole was cut into the main deck to place the engine into the vessel. The employee fell into the hole breaking ribs and the right wrist.
An employee was repairing a pallet with a nail gun when a nail ricocheted and went under his face shield, piercing his left eye.

On January 19, 2015, at approximately 9:50 PM, an employee slipped while stepping from the parking lot to the sidewalk.  The employee struck her knee, resulting in the need for surgery and hospitalization.
An employee finished work at the end of the day  and as he was walking to his truck he began vomiting and feeling light headed possibly due to heat stress.

An employee was troubleshooting a malfunctioning machine that is used to wash metal parts. The metal door of the machine fell down on the employee's right forearm, causing a deep laceration that required surgery.
A maintenance employee injured his hand while checking for leaks on the high pressure hydraulic injection on a press. Hydraulic fluid was injected into his left hand, requiring surgery.
An employee was measuring a bundle on a moving conveyor belt. His index left finger got caught between a roller and the bundle and the fingertip was amputated.
While inspecting a residential roof for damage, an employee fell from a ladder and suffered an arm fracture.
An employee removed a tire from a company trailer and was airing the tire when the tire exploded. The employee sustained multiple fractures to the left forearm and required surgery.
An employee suffered a finger amputation while performing maintenance on an edge bander.

An employee was moving a catwalk (a long piece of equipment that helps move tube) against a rig to perform an inspection when his right ring finger was caught and fractured between the catwalk skate and a pin. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a forklift to line up the shaft and bearing on a yarder. His finger was inside a bolt hole on a cable drum when the weight was shifted to line up the equipment. His finger got caught between the drum and the forklift fork, necessitating the amputation of his right index fingertip.
An employee was stripping concrete forms when a form fell towards him. As he attempted to move out of the way, his back impacted a metal toolbox, fracturing his lower ribs.
An employee lost consciousness while operating light construction equipment due to heat illness and was hospitalized.
An employee got off a ladder to move the ladder and while pulling the ladder towards himself, the ladder struck his right shin resulting in a contusion.
On October 25, 2016, an employee's distal right index finger was amputated when a metal door closed on the finger.

An employee was trying to set up a trim die on a thermal molding machine when his left forearm, thumb, and index finger got crushed. The machine was not locked out at the time. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was attending a meeting in a conference room next to a laboratory. The lab was using xylene in a ventilated hood when the hood fan failed and xylene was released into the conference room. The employee suffered a respiratory allergic reaction and was hospitalized.

On 9/7/16, an employee was moving wooden pallets by hand. He picked up one pallet and held it against his abdomen while bending down to pick up a second pallet. In doing so, two pieces of wood punctured his abdomen. One piece immediately fell out; the other had to be removed at the hospital.
On October 12, 2016, an employee was attempting to close the sidewall curtains on the north calf hutch and was hit in the neck with the crank.
An employee received a fingertip amputation to the 2nd digit of the left hand.

An employee was in the attic of a residential home setting up equipment to blow insulation into the attic. He was walking on the ceiling joist while pulling an insulation hose when he lost his balance and his foot slipped off the joist. One of his feet went through the ceiling and caused his upper torso to fall onto the joist, fracturing four ribs and bruising his chest.

Employee was taking a load of manure to the manure pad to dump it.  In the process of raising the trailer, the manure load froze while both of the safety latches at the bottom of the tailgate were still engaged.  The employee exited the trailer and began to walk around the trailer to see why the load hadn't released.  As he got near the tailgate, the manure load let loose and broke the two safety latches (1-1/4" steel rod), blowing the tailgate open. The bottom of the tailgate hit him in the leg.  The employee suffered a fracture to the left thigh due to impact.  Employee was transported to Backus Hospital and admitted.
An employee fell while exiting a truck. The employee suffered a head injury and was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was pushing a rolling table when his right index finger was caught between the table and a wheel, amputating the fingertip.
An employee sustained a partial amputation of the small finger while operating a drill press.
An employee was hospitalized with injuries sustained during a helicopter crash.
An employee tripped and fell down the stairs in the dock area. The employee was found unconscious at the bottom of the stairs.

On or about September 15, 2016, an employee was driving a stand-up forklift in reverse from the back of a semi-trailer after setting down a load. A second stand-up forklift was also backing up and the two forklifts collided. The elevated forks of the second forklift struck the left foot of the employee controlling the first forklift. The employee suffered three broken toes, requiring surgical removal of the fourth toe, as well as a cut (left foot).
On September 25, 2016, at 5:00 p.m., an employee was unpacking printer equipment when the corner of the box scraped his right leg just below the knee. He was hospitalized for a possible infection.

On December 2, 2015, at approximately 8:45 AM, an employee was changing out propane tanks on a forklift when another forklift operator backed into him, pinning him between the two lifts and fracturing his pelvis.

An employee was stacking tire rims when a stack began to fall. The employee tried to catch the falling tire rims, which crushed his pinky finger on his left hand. His pinky finger was surgically amputated to the first knuckle.
An employee injured their back when lifting a patient.
Employees were stripping concrete forms from a bridge when a 4 x 8 piece of plywood fell hitting another employee on the ground causing broken ribs, a back injury, and a punctured lung.
An employee was climbing a cell tower. The employee slipped and the safety climb did not grab. The employee's right ankle fractured.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet through a working surface to the concrete below, sustaining fractures to the skull, ribs, and wrist and requiring hospitalization.
An employee's left thumb got pinched in the stamping die of a punch press. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was cleaning a mobile field storage tank with a pressure washer hose when it shot him in the left hand with 5,000-psi water pressure, lacerating his middle finger and causing tendon damage.

An employee was cleaning the battery condenser between catwalks while standing on one of the machine's discharge side, between a catwalk and a 45 degree slide. The employee slid down the battery condenser slide (45 degree angle) and fell into the cotton press. The press was not running at the time of the incident. The employee sustained lacerations to the back of the head, fracture lumbar vertebrae and a collapsed lung.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking lot, suffering a concussion and a fractured shoulder. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's foot came off the pallet jack platform and got caught between the platform of the pallet jack and the product.

An employee received rib and shoulder injuries after falling off of a picking cart.  The cart tipped over while the employee was standing on it while picking orders and/or putting merchandise in a bin.
An employee became dehydrated during work and was hospitalized overnight.
A worker slipped on the icy exterior stairs and fell breaking a leg.
An employee was on top of a shopping cart trying to reach a tote of lettuce on an upper shelf. The employee then fell and injured the left leg.
On October 13, 2016, an employee was hospitalized after an arm was pulled into a machine during a cleaning activity.
An employee was operating an Ace strap cutting machine and the blade of the machine severed her left hand pointer finger at the knuckle.
An employee fell backwards off of ladder, striking his head and fracturing his skull.
An employee climbed a ladder inside a fenced area to clean an eye sensor and was injured when the shaker struck his finger. He lost his nail and fingertip.

While operating ground support equipment, an employee attempted to activate the door control button of a hanger door. The equipment then collided with the hanger door, which caused the employee's left forearm to be caught between the two objects. The employee's left forearm was swollen and severely bruised, requiring surgery.
An employee slipped on wet ground while checking a dewatering pump. He hurt his back and was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a forklift to move materials on a 16-foot high storage rack system. The materials, which weighed approximately 300 pounds, fell on the employee.

The employee was installing a shaker box on a plow when he inadvertently bumped the shaker box causing it to move on the jacks and pinch his right ring finger between the shaker box and the mounting arm of the plow. The employee sustained a fingertip amputation with loss of a finger nail.
While a backhoe was pulling dirt into a hole, it caught the wire on a nearby barbed wired fence. The backhoe pulled the wire out, causing it to strike and break the leg of a nearby employee.
An employee was repairing a hot condensate steam-line joint when the steam pipe broke and hot condensate steam splashed onto and burned his left thigh, right thigh, and right forearm.

On June 29, 2015, at 7:00 p.m., an employee was operating a hoist to lift beef when his finger got bumped between the hook of the hoist and the rail, fracturing his index finger. The injury required surgery.
While operating a wire press, an employee's left thumb was amputated by the press clamp.

An employee climbed a ladder to install a buss over an energized circuit. The buss slipped from the employee's hand and made contact with an energized circuit. An arc flash occurred and the employee's hands, face and chest were burned.

As the injured employee was kneeling down and rolling rims to a coworker, a third employee engaged him in a verbal confrontation and kicked him in the face while wearing steel-toed shoes. The injured employee was hospitalized with blunt force trauma to the head.

An employee had just finished lifting a shale bin using two loaders (one with a stinger, chain, and lifting equipment) in order to place matting underneath. Once the matting was in place, the employee directed the loader to lower the bin until there was enough slack in the lifting chain to remove it. As the employee grabbed the eye of the lifting chain to unhook it, the operator of the loader bumped the controls with his knee, causing the chain to tighten and pinch the employee's right middle finger between the bin and the chain. The employee's right middle finger was amputated between the middle and upper joint, and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped from and fell 11 feet from the top of a railroad tank car to the ground. The employee fractured both heels and the left wrist.
While vacuuming paint chips from a curb, an employee was struck by a bus and pinned against the curb, suffering a left calf injury.
On or about 2/10/15, a worker fell from a stainless steel tank to the ground, approximately 9 feet below, and sustained multiple rib fractures.  He was hospitalized overnight.

On March 30, 2015, an employee was using a hand-held grinder when it slipped from his hand and struck his left knee. The impact from the grinder left an abrasion that later became infected and required hospitalization.
An employee was pushing a rolling cart of dishes into a wall-mounted dishwasher when his foot entered a pool of water heated to 180 degrees Fahrenheit. He suffered a second degree burn to his ankle.

An employee fell from a 15 foot roof surface opening while removing material as part of asbestos remediation. The employee was wearing a personal fall arrest system that initially engaged then failed, causing the employee to strike the concrete pad beneath him.
An employee was mopping a staircase with multiple sections and landings when he misstepped and fell onto the corner edge of the lower level step.
An employee was riding on the back of a yard truck and got pinned between a trailer and the truck.
Employee was hospitalized for chemical burns after cleaning chemicals got on his clothing.
An employee slipped and fell on an icy sidewalk while delivering mail resulting in a knee fracture.
An employee got a finger caught in the shredder machine while unjamming it.
An employee was driving a golf cart through a gate and used her left arm to push the gate open. Her arm became caught between the golf cart bar and the gate, breaking it.
An employee's left-hand middle fingertip was amputated after getting caught between a large bearing housing and a tool rest.
An employee was descending a steel ladder when he slipped and hit his knee on the hand rail of the ladder.

An employee was using an overhead crane to set a jacket on a rail car. The employee's right hand was caught between the jacket and underframe, crushing his right-hand ring finger. He was hospitalized overnight and required surgical amputation of the finger.
An employee was disconnecting the existing power source to the cardboard balers when the employee received an electric shock, requiring hospitalization.
An employee's right big toe was amputated when the loading dock platform was lowered onto his toe.
An employee was cutting wood tack strips with a band saw and suffered a partial amputation of the left index finger.
An employee was staging material on a roof that was wet from rain when he slipped and fell to the ground, fracturing his pelvis.
An employee was bitten by a spider in his truck, requiring hospitalization.

An employee's hand was fractured when a 1700 pound John Deere fuel tank fell from a transporter cart the employee was pushing.  The tank fell because the cart frame broke. The support bar for the tank struck the employee's right hand as it fell. The employee sustained fractures and a severed tendon.
An employee was cleaning out excess meat from a meat grinder and amputated two fingers on the right hand.
While grinding on a disc sander, an employee's finger became lodged between the platform and the sander, amputating the distal tip of his right thumb.
An employee felt dull pain as he was going down the stairs at a customer's home. A week later he was hospitalized with a possible herniated disc.

An employee was trying to stabilize a leaning stacked pallet. He climbed the nearby roof access stairs and was reaching to straighten the pallet when he fell over the stair railing about 10 feet and landed on his back on the floor below. The employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair fractures to his back.
An employee's left pinky was amputated after his hand was caught between a roller and a tank.

An employee was flagging traffic on the west side of a jobsite on the east-bound lane. He was standing behind the cones in the lane ahead of the trucks that had flashers on. The other flagger had just changed from the "slow" to the "stop" position for traffic to let cars pass from west toward the east.  As the employee released from "stop" to "slow" for traffic going east, a car struck him. He suffered two fractures to his lower legs, a broken clavicle, broken ribs on his right side. and an abrasion to the back of his head.
An employee slipped and fell on ice while walking to her car. She hit her head, suffering a concussion and bruising. She was hospitalized overnight.
An employee fell in the parking lot and broke her humerus.
An employee was holding on to square tubing. A forklift approached and pinched the employee's finger between the square tubing and the forklift mast.
An employee walking at the job site slipped on ice and suffered a spiral fracture of the right femur.

An employee walked to the rear of a small crane to retrieve his tool bag. The crane operator extended an outrigger that came down on the employee's right foot, causing multiple fractures. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.

An employee was changing a hydraulic hose on a front end loader when the pressure on the cylinder released, causing it to come down and strike him, pinning and breaking his arm between the frame and the bucket.
An employee was carrying hot water into the freezer to remove ice. The employee slipped on ice, and the hot water spilled on the employee, causing burns to the face, neck, arms, and legs.
Employee received a crushing injury to the end of the thumb that required reconstructive surgery.
An employee received an electrical shock from a crust warmer.
An employee was calibrating a temperature instrument and was sprayed with hot water resulting in burns.
An employee slipped and fell on wet leaves on stairs outside a client's house, suffering a head injury and requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning a cat run and was in the process of placing the cat back in the run when it bit the employee's right hand, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was replacing a bearing on a shaft and was using a sledge hammer to seat the bearing when he suffered pain in his lower back. He was hospitalized with a broken blood vessel in the lumbar back area.

An employee was assembling a mobile set of stairs while standing on a ladder. The employee was trying to get a strap off a platform and fell from the ladder to the lower level. The employee suffered a broken jaw and right shoulder fracture.
An employee lost their footing and fell in the jet way while boarding the aircraft. The employee scraped both elbows and knees and broke their right kneecap, requiring surgery.
An employee was unloading equipment from a cart. The base of the cart dropped while he was still holding the handle, and his right fifth finger was amputated in a pinch point.

Worker had just picked up a load of chemicals for the supplier and he was removing the wheel chocks from the trucks wheels. He had removed the first set of wheel chocks and moved to the second set. As he pulled them free from the wheels, he tripped over the first set he had pulled. He fell to the ground and landed on the second set of chocks. He broke his hip and possibly injured his back.
The employee was feeding trays on a conveyor system when her right hand got caught in the rollers, causing a partial amputation of the right ring finger.
An employee was feeding film into the casting machine when his arm was caught between the rollers and broken.
While using a screw gun, an employee tweaked his back and had to be hospitalized.

An employee had just retrieved a full 30 lb. propane tank from storage and was walking and carrying the tank to place it on a forklift truck. The employee slipped on ice and fell breaking his fibula and tibia bones.
An employee was chasing a robber and suffered a head injury.
An employee amputated his left index fingertip including bone while repairing a metal punching machine. LOTO was not in place when the employee attempted to make the repair.

An employee was troubleshooting a pelletizer machine that cuts crystal polystyrene using a knife blade. He made contact with the pelletizer machine blade, amputating his right-hand index fingertip. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.
While an employee was attempting to stick or unstick something in the dough press machine, the press operator started the machine, amputating the end of the employee's right thumb.
An employee's right middle finger was cut while she was using an automatic slicer to slice cucumbers.
Employee was unjamming a part from a company-made machine when the employee amputated a finger.

While troubleshooting a machine, an employee leaned against an adjacent hopper machine and propped himself up with his left hand. The hopper housing moved under his weight and pinched this thumb, fracturing bone and amputating his thumb tip.
An employee was standing in an aisle, preparing to stock shelves, when he fainted, fell back, and hit his head.
An employee operating a radial saw in the door shop sawed through his left forearm.
An employee was pinned under the bumper of an 18-wheeler when the truck came off the jack while the employee was changing the front tire. The employee suffered broken ribs and internal injuries.
An employee received chemical burns to the right forearm while transferring 98% pure sulfuric acid from a tank truck.
On January 4, 2015, at approximately 5:10 p.m., an employee slipped on a wet floor while transporting a patient from one level to another.  The employee experienced a hamstring tear.
An employee suffered a serious leg injury from a power pole while moving a stack of power poles using a Gradall forklift at or near 83rd and 64th in Stanley, North Dakota.
On September 9, 2015, at 8:50 a.m., an employee's bare hand made contact with an energized heating coil in a rooftop unit, resulting in second and third degree hand burns.
An employee went to move stacked interlocking metal baskets. The baskets were not fully interlocked and the interlock came down and pinched the employee's left index finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee delivering fuel unhooked the metal cable across the driveway to enter the facility.  When he was going back to the truck, he got caught up in the cable, tripped, and fell.  He was hospitalized with a fractured hip.

An employee was changing the blade of the B-line chop saw located in the PMC finishing area. As he tightened a nut with a wrench, the saw activated and the wrench was ejected from the machine striking the employee in the face. The employee sustained a fractured nose and facial lacerations.
An employee was injured after being struck by a powered industrial truck.

An employee was helping to lift concrete panels when the metal brace slipped out of his hand and cut his right pinky finger. He was wearing gloves at the time. He was hospitalized for surgery, and his right pinky had to eventually be surgically amputated.
Employee slipped on ice and fell in the parking lot.
An employee on travel status fell over a railing to the floor below while waiting for a flight and suffered multiple fractures.
While an employee was adjusting a press die, the embossment press cycled and crushed his forearm in the point of operation.
An employee slipped and fell on ice or snow in the parking lot, fracturing his hip and one wrist and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was holding material for a coworker who was using a manual shear to cut a piece of sheet metal. When the coworker engaged the shear, it amputated the employee's left index fingertip.

An employee was moving a load with a crane onto the forks of a Big Joe-powered industrial vehicle.  After the load was on the forks and the sling around the load was removed, the hoist hook was not raised before the load was moved.  When the Big Joe was moved forward, the hoist hook came over the mast of the load and swung and struck the employee in the face.  The employee then fell backwards to the ground. The employee was hospitalized as a result of the injuries sustained.

A temporary worker was attempting to clear a jam on a bark conveyor when his arm was caught by a spool on the machine. The worker suffered a broken arm and was hospitalized. Surgery was performed to treat the injury.
On  11/9/15, an employee was pushing a cart while cleaning her work area in the store when she tripped, fell, and broke her right elbow.

An employee was operating a band saw when her glove became trapped in the conveyor belt, which pulled her right hand under the saw blade. Her right index finger was amputated between the first and second knuckle.
An employee was walking through a work aisle when she tripped on a co-worker's foot, causing her to fall to the ground and break her left hip. She was hospitalized.

A truck and trailer were backing toward a loading dock. An employee was signaling for the truck to reverse and got caught between the truck trailer and the dock, suffering a broken pelvis. The injured employee was hospitalized.
An employee was injured during concrete hammer chipping operations when a concrete piece flew off and caused a contusion on the employee's right forearm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was working from an order picker and fell approximately 12 feet. The employee suffered a broken hip, pelvis, and leg. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was cleaning the windshield of his semi truck when he fell from the rig and fractured his hip. He was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee tripped over a customer U-Boat and sustained blunt trauma to the back of his head and pain to his right shoulder.
An employee cut his hand with a high pressure water jet.

On or about February 18, 2016, an employee was processing a part down the chemical film line when the employee was exposed to hydrofluoric and nitric-mixed acid solutions, which chemically burned the employee's right thumb.
At 5:45 AM on 3/3/16, an employee was walking into work from her car when she slipped on ice in the driveway and fell, fracturing her right ankle and knee.
An employee was using a tire jack to change a tire on a postal vehicle when the jack handle struck him in the head.
An employee received an electrical shock.
An employee was walking from lunch break and was struck by a tractor trailer that was backing up. The employee received multiple fractures and head trauma.
