An employee was changing a cracked clamp used to join two panels together during bracing when the MSE wall panel fell over on and hit him. He sustained hand, arm, and torso injuries.

An employee was making routine rounds at the plant when a power outage occurred causing a fan to fail. The employee was overcome by sulfur dioxide. The employee did not have a respirator at the time of the incident.
An employee stepped out of a manlift 5 feet above the ground and fell, striking his head on the cement floor.

An employee suffered an amputation of the tip of his thumb while assisting in rolling metal into a power roller machine.  The employee reached back to get a better hold on the material when his thumb got too close to the rolls. His thumb was caught between a roll and the metal.  The second employee backed the rolls up to release the thumb.
An employee was observing the separation of a gear box when a hydraulic ram struck the left side of the employee's face, injuring it above and below the eye.
While removing a discharge hose from a water pump, an employee was exposed to hot water and suffered burns to the arms, neck and abdomen.

An employee was reloading pallets onto a truck and was returning the powered pallet jack to the truck. The employee walked the jack back onto the trailer in the space available on the lift gate. The jack moved to the right, running over the employee's foot and pinning his leg. He lost his balance and fell approximately 3 to 4 feet off the lift gate platform, twisting his right ankle and breaking his right leg below the knee.
A temporary employee became involved in a physical altercation with another temporary employee, suffering a fractured right fibula/dislocated right ankle.
After delivering packages for 7.5 hours, an employee suffered a heat-stress-related event and was hospitalized for dehydration.

The employee was operating a shear to fabricate a part for a crane.  The employee placed an aluminum sheet into the machine opening and accidently hit the foot control which activated the press.  The employee's left middle finger was amputated above the first knuckle.  The employee was treated at a local hospital and released the same day.
An employee collapsed and hit her head on the floor, suffering a laceration and a hemorrhage.

On December 7, 2015 an employee was opening a construction gate for a dump truck to enter when a passenger vehicle tried to pass the dump truck and struck the dump truck.  When the passenger vehicle struck the dump truck it hit the employee resulting in fractured ribs and a fractured pelvis and a head laceration.
Employee coming in to work stepped out of her vehicle and slipped on ice. She broke her left ankle.

An employee in the wood department was cutting a small rip on a table saw when the employee's right pinky finger was severed and three other fingers were lacerated; the right pinky finger was surgically amputated. At the time of the incident, no push stick was used and the guard was not in place.
An employee was taking a cart out of a storage closet when the door closed and caught the employee's right-hand finger, amputating the fingertip.

Employees were installing wood trusses on the interior 4th floor level of a newly constructed multi-family dwelling when one employee fell approximately 9 feet to lower level. The injured employee's head struck a nail gun that he was operating when he hit the floor. The injury occurred on January 9, 2015, at approximately 1 p.m.
An employee was injured when the ATV he was riding turned over and landed on him.

An employee was repairing equipment in the waste water treatment room. The employee had to go up and down stairs fifteen times to drain water from equipment. The waste water treatment room is very warm.  The employee was sweating a lot and vomiting.

The employer was conducting a crane switching operation at the intersection of track three and east track. A component part of the crane fell and released hydraulic fluids, which contacted the injured employee's left forearm. The employee was hospitalized, and the left arm below the elbow was amputated.
A truck ran over an employee who was working in a post hole.
An employee's right ring finger was pulled into and amputated by the chain and sprocket of a running machine. The machine was unguarded at the time.

An employee was repositioning a stop on the leg of an egg washer and was lifting the washer with straps around it. The straps dropped a little, and his finger went through the gusset and leg.  His finger was forced through this small opening, crushing it and requiring overnight hospitalization.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting a production line when the employee got caught between a welding parts machine and a robot while adjusting a sensor. The employee was hospitalized with a broken nose, fractured neck, fractured back, and two fractured ribs.

An employee was stepping up to access his work station at the trim saw when his left foot slipped/skidded and he fell into the running trim saw blade. His lower left arm was amputated and required reattachment surgery.

An employee was operating a dump truck in the orange grove. The truck was loaded with shell rock to be dumped to grade a road. Upon lifting the bed, contact was made with an overhead power line. Upon exiting the truck the employee was shocked and received electrical burns to the left arm and foot.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was struck in the abdomen by a tree branch while trimming a tree.
An employee was operating an electric pallet jack to pull orders. The employee backed into a parked forklift that was behind a divider curtain and broke their right leg.

An employee was finishing her morning medication administration cycle when she was called into an apartment by another worker to help move a resident from her bed to a wheelchair. The resident began to lose her balance, so the employee tried to help her to the ground, suffering acute severe lower back pain with disc protrusion in the process.
An employee was working on the #2 water softener. The sight glass blew, spraying the employee with hot water and causing an eye injury.

An employee received a partial amputation of the left middle finger when it was pinched between two wood blocks used as braces while attempting to use a pallet jack to lift a paper roll out of the corrugator.
Employee was struck and run over by a tractor trailer truck.
An employee performing security walks around trucks stepped on uneven ground and fell, fracturing the left femur.
While climbing a ladder, an employee lost his footing and fell approximately 6 feet and broke his leg.
An employee was hospitalized on December 6, 2015, to have work-related hernia surgery.

An employee was unloading fuel into a tank at a customer location. He was walking while offloading and talking with another employee when he lost consciousness.  A local bystander attempted CPR. Employee was taken to the hospital.
An employee amputated his fingertip while tearing down a setting tool on the McMaster Pad site.
An employee working in the layer/chicken house got his right hand caught in a pinch point while trying to clear manure from the belt resulting in a pinky and ring finger avulsion fracture.
An employee was standing on a piece of wood while cleaning out a furnace when the wood slipped, causing him to fall.
After installing a light fixture, an employee fell off the ladder, suffering a compression fracture to the lower back and dislocating an elbow.
An employee fell on a sidewalk at a client site and broke her arm.
An employee was pushing a pallet into a pallet dismantling machine. The blade caught the pallet and pushed it back into the employee's left side causing internal injuries.
An employee attached a tagline on some pipe casing. When the pipe was picked up, his foot was tangled in the tagline, ultimately breaking his ankle.
An employee was cutting pallets with a chop saw. The employee was clearing a piece of wood and amputated two fingers when his gloved hand was pulled into the running blade.
Employee experienced chest pain while wrenching at work. Employee was hospitalized over night.
An employee was working in the freezer. As he pulled a pallet out of the freezer, he slipped and fell, fracturing his neck and injuring his shoulder.
An employee was operating a standup forklift. When he exited the equipment, he was pinned between the dock door and the forklift, fracturing his left ankle.
An employee suffered an amputation while cleaning out a peanut inducer machine.
An employee was helping to set up a scaffold when a piece of clay tile/ceiling debris fell from the ceiling and struck the employee's lower back, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was choked by a patient while leaving a patient's room resulting in fractures to the throat.
An employee fell while moving boxes and injured his left hip.
An employee went outside to fill a bailer with trash and became locked out of the building. As he was climbing over a gate to access another door, he fell to the ground and broke his right kneecap.
An employee was picking up a metal extension for a forklift when the equipment fell on his hand and partially amputated his right middle finger.
An employee finished placing roofing materials on the roof for the customer and as he was stepping onto the ladder, he fell 10 feet to the ground resulting in broken vertebrae.
An employee fell while installing roof sheathing. The employee suffered a concussion and broken ribs.
An employee severely injured the index and middle fingers on the left hand when caught in a mixer before it had stopped. The middle finger was amputated at the most distant knuckle.
On or about March 5, 2015, an employee suffered fractures to both feet after falling approximately 6 feet during a training exercise (mock drill - high angle rescue).

An employee was removing built-up rubber from the inside of a baling machine. As he was standing on a ladder to reach the top side of the machine, his hand was caught in the cover ram, amputating parts of his left index, middle, and ring fingers.

An employee was working in the electric panel of a rotor machine when an arc flash occurred. The employee received burns on both arms and the face. The electric power was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was running rods into the well when the elevator/block began to lower. Something caught the elevator/block and pulled the elevator/block into the rod basket striking the employee.
An employee was walking into work when he slipped on ice, fell, and broke his right leg.
An employee was injured when he fell approximately 15 feet from a electrical pole where he was repairing a street light.  The employee fractured a hip.

An employee threading a calendar stack in a paper machine attempted to clear wrap that had wrapped around the stack. The employee's left hand got caught in a nip point, amputating the pinky finger and partially amputating the ring finger.
On 1/27/15, an employee was operating a horizontal press brake. The employee's finger got caught between the part being bent and a cover plate on the machine, resulting in an amputation.
A door closed on an employee's right pinky tip, severing it.
An employee was walking in the green lumber storage area and slipped on a wet surface and fell, suffering a broken hip.
An employee and a coworker were handling knives in the kitchen when the coworker accidently lacerated the employee's leg.

A maintenance employee slipped while clearing a jam and reached for something that crushed his hand. His left pinky finger was amputated, and he broke and lacerated his third and fourth fingers. He was wearing gloves at the time of the incident.
An employee was struck by a cart while loading packages from another loading cart, suffering fractured ribs.
An employee was using a horizontal milling machine to cut a cap for an engine when the employee's right hand was amputated.

An employee was struck by a suspended load (2x4) that was being hoisted by a crane. The material fell approximately six stories onto the employee's back, breaking ribs and a shoulder blade and puncturing the employee's lung.
An employee fell and broke her left ankle in two places while descending stairs that traversed a conveyor.

An employee was assisting a rigger and a crane operator with guiding a furnace tube through the opening of a furnace when the employee's finger was caught between the 90-degree point of the furnace opening and a furnace tube. The right-hand index finger was partially amputated, requiring surgery.
An employee was flagging for traffic control when a tandem dump truck struck her and ran over both of her feet. Her left foot was fractured and bruised.
An employee was selecting packages from the back of a delivery truck when he started feeling sick.  He was hospitalized for dehydration.

On or about July 20, 2015, an employee tried to park his small landscape trailer in the Trew Stone parking lot at 901 River Road, Deerfield, MA. As he tried to unhitch it, the trailer started to move backwards. While he was trying to stop the trailer from hitting a pickup truck parked there, he got between the pickup truck and the trailer and his left thigh got pinched. He was hospitalized and received stitches.
An employee slipped on a wet floor and fell.

An employee was testing a slide ride at startup. The water was turned onto the slide, but had not yet filled the bottom pool when the employee tested it. The employee slid down the slide and, once at the bottom, slid across the shallow pool (1/4" of water) and into the end of the slide wall.  The employee fractured her right tibia and suffered ligament damage to both ankles.  The employee was hospitalized.

On August 24, 2015, an employee of Russell Standard was struck-by a tri-axle asphalt truck.  The employee suffered multiple injuries including lacerations to his liver and lungs, crushed ribcage, and vertebrae.

An employee was operating a stand on mower and it got stuck. The employee got off the mower to see if he could dislodge it. When he got off the mower it started to roll. He tried to stop the mower with his body and it rolled on him resulting in injury.
On January 30, 2015, at approximately 8:30pm, three 70 inch diameter rolls, weighing 350-380 lbs. each, fell towards an employee and pinned him against a wall resulting in a fractured hip and foot.
On or about September 9, 2015, an employee's finger was amputated while slicing meat with a meat band saw.
An employee experienced heat stress while working on a tempering line for glass production, requiring hospitalization.

An employee followed a suspected shoplifter out of the store and into a parking lot. The employee started taking pictures of the suspect's car as the suspect was pulling away. The suspect hit the employee with the car breaking the employee's left leg.

A forklift operator was driving in reverse and making a right-hand turn when he collided with a 4,000-pound steel parts basket. The basket was pushed into a nearby employee who was operating a press, pinching him between the basket and the power press. He suffered a right buttock laceration and right leg contusion.

An employee was working at a roller coaster ride when he fell 3'6" from the loading dock to the walkway below the roller coaster track/rail. His head struck the roller coaster rail and he required overnight hospitalization for head trauma.
On August 26, 2015 at approximately 10:00am an employee was climbing a pallet racking system and fell approximately 10 to 15 feet breaking the L8 and L9 vertebrae.

An employee was performing work in a 24-volt DC electrical cabinet. While working, a loose wire grounded out and arced; the employee received an electrical shock and his left hand sustained a second degree burn.
An employee was using ammonium hydroxide with water to test a product for lead when he was exposed to potassium cyanide. The employee was hospitalized for cyanide poisoning.
An employee fractured her finger while unjamming the quarter machine.
An employee was standing on a ladder to retrieve parts from a overhead shelf. He lost his balance and fell approximately 5 feet to the floor injuring his lower back.
An employee was climbing a ladder and fell resulting in a fractured leg.

In the planner area, an employee was piling lumber that was being transported by a lumber chain.  One of the chains became jammed.  The employee reached between the chain way because the chains were doubled over. Energy was stored in the gear box due to the jam. The employee manually tugged the belt associated with the belt/pulley mechanism for the 2 hp motor and gear box.  The motor/gear box drives the chains.  When the employee tugged on the belt, it released the stored energy from the jammed gear box.  The employee's fingers went into the nip point created by the belt/pulley and three fingers on the right hand were severely fractured. The ring finger also had skin removed.
While climbing down a ladder, an employee was struck by a fan blade, suffering facial and forehead lacerations.

An employee was picking up some battery cells from the floor of the shop using a forklift. The battery cells were being secured by the employee, but the batteries slid off and his hand got caught between the battery and the floor. He was wearing gloves. The fleshy part of the finger was severed from the hand.

An employee was operating a horizontal bender machine to bend rebar. While he was adjusting the rebar for the second bend, his foot contacted the footswitch and activated the machine, which then crushed/amputated his right index finger.
An employee tripped over a newspaper rack and suffered a broken hip, requiring hospitalization.

An employee collected a sample cylinder of gas and was placing the cylinder into a weather guard job box that is used to organize the sample cylinders. The job box drawer closed on his left hand, amputating his left ring finger at the first joint, right below the nail.
An employee was attempting to remove the shaft stock in a machine when the stock slipped and crushed his index finger, requiring surgical amputation.

A belt on an auger became jammed with wheat. An employee turned off the power to the auger and attempted to loosen the belt. The belt temporarily released and pulled the employee's finger between the belt and a pulley, amputating the employee's left index fingertip.

A truck driver was preparing to load material in a truck. A steel bar fell from the bottom storage rack and caught his finger between the steel bar and the ground.  The employees left middle finger was amputated.
Two employees were installing a murphy bed when the lifting mechanism snapped.  One employee suffered a severe laceration to a thumb and was hospitalized for two days to reattach the finger.

An employee lifted, carried, and placed 6-inch frames, which weighed approximately 28 pounds, 3 feet to a nearby table. While separating the material, he felt a pop in his stomach and instantly experienced pain. He was hospitalized for rupturing a pre-existing hernia, requiring surgery.

While selecting an order, an employee was struck by falling material from a broken pallet that was being moved by a forklift approximately 30' above. The employee suffered a broken leg and head injuries.

On or about 11/09/2015, at 9:49 a.m., an employee was spotting for a coworker driving a reach truck.  The driver backed up and rolled over the employee's right foot, fracturing it and requiring hospitalization.
Two employees were conducting plumbing operations at a construction site when a lull operator hit a beam, causing a roof collapse. Both employees were struck by a beam, requiring hospitalization.
An employee sustained an amputation while working on a machine.

Employee was carrying a building truss with a forklift and placed a truss into a stored area. The employee reversed the forklift and walked up to the stored truss. The truss fell on the employee, causing facial injuries and fractured ribs.

An employee was attempting to move a reel of cable that was located on a trailer when his ankle became lodged between the cable reel and pallet. He lost his balance and fell out of the truck, breaking his ankle and bruising his hip.

An employee was using a crane to empty the scrap bin. As he was lowering the scrap bin's handle, his left thumb was caught between the handle and the steel bin, amputating it at the first joint and requiring reattachment surgery.
An employee amputated the left thumb by using an unguarded table saw.
An employee was looking into the pilger machine when the hood fell, striking the employee on the back.

An employee was climbing a telecommunications tower without incident.  A co-worker looked over and the employee appeared to be in pain while holding on to the tower at a height of approximately 250 feet.  No fall or other event occurred.  The employee just climbed the tower and started feeling pain in his lower back.  Tower rescue was initiated and the employee was lowered to the ground.  The employee was using a personal fall arrest system and was fully tied-off when he experienced the pain.  Upon reaching the ground, an emergency response crew began administering pain medication.  The employee experienced an adverse reaction to the medication and was rushed to the hospital where he was admitted primarily due to his reaction to the medication administered by the first responders, but the employee may have some lower back disorder(s) as well.
A driver was attempting to access the dock door on a loading dock, fell off the dock, and fractured their right leg.
An employee was trying to remove a mold by hitting it with a mold leg. His hand slipped and his left ring finger was caught between the mold and the mold leg, fracturing it.

A worker was attempting to install a safety pin in the self climbing form work system. The platform came down on his hand before any safety pins were put in. The worker's hand was crushed resulting in finger amputations.
An employee was rigging equipment on a flatbed when he tripped over a timber and fell 4 to 4.5 feet to the ground and fractured his right hip. He was hospitalized.
While an employee was operating a machine to cut a circular test sample, a pin in the machine broke and made contact with the employee's right index finger, amputating the fingertip.
The employee was switching trailers. While climbing into the trailer, the employee tripped over something and fell backwards out of the truck injuring his right elbow.
The employee was delivering packages and began to feel nauseous. He went to the cool zone, but was not able to cool down. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

An employee was pouring molten lead into molds. When lead solidifies, the lead is removed from the mold using an eye bolt and chain attached to a bolt that is poured into the lead cylinder. The employee attempted to lift the lead cylinder from the mold, but the mold was stuck to the lead. The employee attempted to clean the surface of the floor underneath the mold using his hand while the mold and lead cylinder were suspended in the air. The mold released from the lead cylinder and struck him in the right thumb, amputating the thumb behind the thumb nail.
An employee blacked out and fell down the stairs, breaking the right arm.
An employee was detailing an RV while standing on a ladder. As the employee was climbing down the ladder, he slipped off and fell, fracturing his right leg.

An employee had finished repairing the scraper and was pulling in the outriggers on his work truck. As he pulled up the outriggers, the truck rolled backwards and pinned him between the scraper and truck, breaking his back.
An employee was working on a CNC machine. The employee stepped back and tripped on the CNC subframe resulting in injury to the lower left leg and hospitalization.

Three employees were on top of the asphalt grinder trying to troubleshoot why it wouldn't run.  A fourth employee, a lowboy driver, walked over to the grinder unseen by the employees on top of the grinder. The employees started up the grinder. The lowboy driver's hand was caught in the moving belts on the back of the grinder.  The employee suffered the amputation of the tip of his left middle and ring fingers, and had a pin surgically inserted in his left little finger.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee tripped up the stairs from the basement and fractured his right elbow.
An employee was delivering product from a truck trailer to a local restaurant using a dolly and ramp. He fell to the concrete ground and shattered his ankle, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
On or about February 8, 2016, an employee was hand-feeding a gluer machine when the employee's right hand was caught in the machine. The employee was hospitalized with a right hand injury.

A maintenance technician was preparing to work on a maturation tank valve. When he opened the valve a caustic chemical splashed him in the face.  The employee suffered burns to his eyes and the left side of his face and neck.
On 7/29/15, an employee was walking to the assembly area when she fainted. She was hospitalized and treated for severe dehydration.
An employee was observing the pallet machine and attempted to access the platform to adjust the limit switch sensor. The employee then fell and suffered an avulsion fracture to the left leg.
An employee fell on the handles of a sled he was dragging and fractured his hip, requiring hospitalization.

An iron worker assisting in the unloading of large sheets of glass from a tractor trailer was struck by a pane of glass pinning him to the ground.  The worker was later hospitalized as a result of his injuries.

On Monday, March 30, 2015, at 12:38 p.m., an employee was standing on a 6-foot fiberglass ladder inside the entrance to the first floor when he touched an energized wire and received an electric shock. He fell from the ladder to the floor and fractured his left elbow.

A forklift operator was transporting a roll of material to the coating machine; their view was obstructed by the roll. As the forklift  approached the coating machine, the injured employee, who was standing at the machine controls, was struck in the lower right leg by the forklift and/or the material pallet. The employee sustained injuries to the lower right ankle and tibia bones.
An employee had to have the tip of his right middle finger amputated due to an injury.

An employee was struck by a lower roller from a feeding machine. The employee was feeding cloth and rubber from the back of the machine. Tension built up and caused the roll to swing out from the machine. The employee sustained multiple injuries, which led to hospitalization: internal injuries, possible right arm fracture, three broken right-side ribs, and 6-inch laceration to right abdomen.
On January 24, 2015, an employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell.  The employee suffered fractures to the pelvic area and was hospitalized.

An employee was working from a 20 foot extension ladder to apply bird repellant underneath of a store awning when he fell backwards approximately 15 feet and landed on his back. The fall caused a fracture to his spine in the mid to lower lumbar region.
An employee was lifting a 5-gallon oil container to empty it when he felt a pop. He was hospitalized with a collapsed lung.
On 10/05/2016, an employee's right calf was struck by construction equipment that backed up unexpectedly. He suffered a compression injury to his calf, requiring surgery.

An employee was guiding two wooden utility poles supported by a winch when one pole struck a pole lying flat. This caused one of the two supported poles to shift, slip from the restraints, and fall striking the employee's right foot and fracturing a toe.
An employee fell off of a truck and fractured their arm.
An employee was bitten on the leg by a rattlesnake and hospitalized.
On 3/16/16, an employee inverted her ankle and fell on her hip while standing.
An employee was injured when his arm was caught in a roll packing machine while oiling it. He sustained severe lacerations and was hospitalized.
An employee fell 3' 11'' and dislocated the right shoulder.
An employee's fingers got caught in a grease pump gearbox. The employee's right index fingertip was later amputated.
An employee amputated three left-hand fingertips while clearing a jam on a plate machine.
An employee collapsed while working at a construction site as a flagger. He was hospitalized for a stroke.
On February 1, 2017, an employee went to adjust a piece of meat on the bacon line and his hand was pulled in resulting in the loss of skin on the hand.
An employee was walking into work from the parking lot when she slipped and fell on icy pavement and fractured her left ankle, requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered the amputation of the left index fingertip while troubleshooting a packaging machine.
An employee was working on a dock when she stepped out from between two pallets and was struck by a clamp truck. She was knocked to the ground and suffered a compound fracture to her left wrist.

An employee was returning to her vehicle after delivering a parcel to the front porch of a house when she rolled her left ankle on the sidewalk. She then lost her balance and fell to the sidewalk, fracturing her right patella.
An employee was performing a rip cut on a table saw when he cut his left thumb approximately 1/2 inch above his knuckle but below the nail. The guard was not in place at the time.

On Tuesday, March 1, 2016, at approximately 6:15 AM, employees were attempting to unjam the end-matcher machine. The load chain was placed in reverse, and a lug on the chain pulled an employee's right thumb into a guarded area, amputating the tip.
An employee was shot in the left forearm while serving a warrant, requiring hospitalization.
An employee working in the store was injured when a vehicle struck the building.
The employee was positioning metal into a hydraulic press brake and amputated the tip of the second digit on his left hand.
An employee was closing the door to the rapid enforcement lane booth when a gust of wind caused the door to slam shut on his right hand, amputating his fourth fingertip.
On July 27, 2016, at 5:30AM, an employee was preparing bread to be put in the proofer machine when she experienced dizziness/lightheadedness. She was hospitalized for severe dehydration.
An employee was placing a core into the core chuck machine when the cylinder actuated while his finger was in the hazard area. His right ring finger was pinched and partially amputated.
An employee was opening a valve he was repairing when he dropped the valve hand wheel. As he tried to catch it, the wheel crushed his middle fingertip, which had to be amputated.

On January 23, 2015, an employee received a severe injury to his left index finger (partially amputated) when a beam fell from a rack that was not secured, making contact with the employee's back and pinching his left hand between the upright and the support bar.

An employee was installing expansion joints on a bridge attachment while working from a man lift. The employee grabbed hold of a pipe on the bridge and sustained electrical burns to his arms and legs.
An employee was hospitalized after being stung by a bee while walking on a powerline right of way.

Employees were using a 100-ton hydraulic press to separate a bearing from a drive shaft.  While removing the bearing, the outer bearing race of a ball bearing assembly failed under pressure from the hydraulic press. The part struck the employees.
On 07/09/2015, an employee delivering a package to a residence was bitten on both hands by the inhabitant's dog. The employee was later hospitalized when both hands became swollen.
An employee was performing carpentry work from a 10-foot A-frame ladder. As he reached for something above him, the ladder wobbled and he fell off. He was hospitalized with a broken shoulder bone.

An employee was lying on a floor dolly on his back underneath a newly fabricated bin weighing approximately 1,000 lbs. The bin was supported on all four corners by 6-foot-long metal saw horses. The employee was painting the underside of the bin using a spray gun. When he attempted to scoot the dolly along the floor, his foot pushed against one of the saw horses, causing it to move. The saw horse pivoted out from under the bin, which then tipped and fell on the employee, breaking his arm.
An employee had replaced a clutch in a drive belt when he tripped on the concrete base and struck his left hand on the unit frame. His fingertip and a small amount of bone were amputated.
An employee was moving steel tubes using a dolly. While taking a tube from the dolly, the employee's middle and little fingers were caught and amputated.

An employee was working on the timing belt under a vehicle when a coworker came and turned on the vehicle. Once the vehicle was turned on, the belt system trapped the employee's left index finger and amputated the distal knuckle.

An employee was lifting a pipe into place with a hoist. The pipe came loose and caught his right hand between the pipe and a fusion machine. The pipe was rigged with a choker but not shackled.  The employee's right little finger was crushed and he was hospitalized.
An employee's finger got caught in a delimber while making repairs, resulting in an amputation of the end of the middle finger from the last knuckle.

An employee was stocking shelves and loading a baler with empty cardboard boxes. She was pulling a rope attached to the baler door to close it when her left pinky fingertip was caught and amputated in the door.
An employee was moving an A-frame across a loading dock when a drain tipped over and fell. The employee was trapped between the wall and the falling material, breaking his leg.
An employee was delivering cargo at a local Dollar Tree store, assisted by store employees, when he collapsed. His body temperature was 108 F, possible heat stroke.

An employee was walking in a parking lot and turned quickly to see a salt/sanding truck coming through the lot and slipped on ice. The incident occurred at approximately 10:55 PM as the employee was walking to her car.
An employee was making copies when he tripped and fell against another copier, breaking his hip.
An employee was exiting an office when the right index fingertip was caught and amputated by the closing door.
An employee was using a hammer to clean accumulated material from rollers on a conveyor. The hammer slipped and his arm was caught between the rollers. His arm broke and required surgery.

An employee was in a skid steer with a bucket attachment, and was shoveling up cardboard.  The operator picked up a load and began backing up; he noticed that a piece of plastic was attached to the bucket. The employee decided to detach the plastic from the bucket. In the process of doing this, the employee stood up without disengaging the controls, placed his right hand on the right front post of the skid steer, then reached with his left hand for the plastic. When he reached with his left hand, his chest came in contact with the controls, lowering the bucket. As the bucket lowered, the right arm of the skid steer came in contact with the employee's right index finger and crushed it.
An employee was operating a motorized pallet jack in the warehouse and pinched his left foot between the wheel and a metal plate resulting in the amputation of his left big toe.
An employee was cutting plywood with a table saw and cut his left ring finger.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee's leg was run over by a forklift.
An employee was putting files away and lost his balance falling approximately six feet off a ladder resulting in a back fracture.

While repairing an elevator's counterweight, the mechanic isolated the counterweight by wedging a tool under it. The wedging tool dislodged, the counterweight moved, and the mechanic got his hand caught by the moving cable into the guard of the sheave. The incident de-gloved his hand and caused the skin to be ripped from the bone.

An employee was repairing a molding press when his right leg came in contact with a live conductor, causing him to experience loss of consciousness and burns due to electrocution. He was hospitalized for his injuries.

On or about February 4, 2016, an employee was operating a crane and lifting a bundle of wire mesh.  The employee was underneath the raised load when the load fell, fracturing the employee's femur, pelvis and face.
An employee fell as he was walking down the aisle to his work station, injuring his ankle and requiring hospitalization.
An employee left work and was admitted to the hospital for asthma issues.

An employee was using a crowbar to straighten a part when the crowbar slipped and the employee lost her balance. She fell backwards and hit her head on the base of a heat treat rack that was positioned behind her. The employee fractured her skull and injured her neck.

On March 8, 2015, at approximately 8:08 p.m., an employee disconnected a hose from a cylinder of allyl alcohol. He carried the hose to an area and began cleaning the hose with toluene when he experienced shortness of breath. An air evacuation was requested and the employee was air lifted to the hospital and hospitalized for chest pains.
An employee experienced a left thumb amputation when it was caught in a foam machine auger.
An employee was on a 6 foot ladder repairing an HVAC unit.  The employee started to climb down the ladder, lost his balance and fell breaking his left leg.
An employee was feeding bags into a pulley. When he hit the feed button, his finger was pulled up into the pulley, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee lost his balance and fell from a ladder.
An employee was installing a light fixture from a ladder when he received an electrical shock and fell to the ground, suffering broken teeth and a fractured right patella.
An employee slipped on ice and fell while walking on the loading dock, breaking the left hip.
A worker suffered a thumb tip amputation while cleaning a batch mixer.
An employee was leaving work and fell down the stairs at the loading dock injuring their neck and right arm.

An employee was helping a coworker place a forklift battery into a forklift when the battery fell over on its side and smashed two of the employee's left-hand fingers (3rd and 4th finger) between the battery and the concrete floor.
An employee working from an 8-foot step ladder fell from the sixth rung approximately 69 inches.  At the time of the incident, the employee was working to brace a wood frame panel.
An employee rolled and fractured her ankle while picking up bread trays.
An employee was moving boards when his finger was crushed between a board and a trailer frame, resulting in an amputation.
An employee completed his deliveries for the day and later experienced cramps. He was hospitalized overnight for dehydration.
An employee was tearing off roof when his finger got pinched between a piece of plywood and a piece of machinery that was not in use. His left index finger was amputated.
Employee was assaulted near the main entrance door by a customer. Employee was hospitalized with a laceration to the face, requiring stiches.
An employee was bitten by an insect while cleaning and the employee was allergic to the insect; the employee was taken to the hospital.
An employee fell over and bumped his head as he was trying to remove weed stickers from his pant leg and shoes. He suffered abrasions to the head and arm.

An employee was pulling the release rope on a self dumping hopper. As the hopper was dumping, the hopper slid forward and the safety chain separated causing the hopper to fall off the forks of the lift truck. The employee still grasped the release rope and as the hopper fell his left ring finger was amputated between the fingernail and the first knuckle.
A worker reached into a running palletizer machine to adjust a sensor.  A compression bar came down, breaking his arm. The machine was guarded at the time.
A worker was struck and injured when a discharge hose disconnected from the pump.

The employee was conducting a residential building inspection and was chased by a dog in the back yard of the residence. While running away from the dog on an uneven surface, the employee fractured the left foot requiring surgery to repair the injury.
An employee suffered a right index fingertip amputation while repairing a crimping machine.
While walking in a corridor of the hospital, an employee slipped and fell, fracturing her femur. She was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee fell from a 6-foot step ladder while replacing ceiling tiles and suffered a fractured wrist.
An employee was pulling a V-belt. The motor engaged and his right ring and pinky fingers were amputated.
A worker was installing soffits and while removing old boards a board fell striking the worker's left hand and pushing it into the rotating blade of the skill saw.
An employee operating a forklift had his foot caught between the forklift and a pallet.
Maintenance employee was adjusting the level of shipping roll-up door #34 when his right middle finger became caught in the chain and sprocket.
An employee was bitten by a venomous rattlesnake while pulling out weeds, suffering a hand laceration.

A worker was at a customer's facility repairing a commercial washing machine that was not properly de-energized. The worker came into contact with a live transformer and burned his right arm, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was carrying a case of product from a trailer into the store and stepped into a gap near a scissor lift causing the right foot to roll fracturing the ankle.
Employee was walking to work when he slipped on ice bruising his right hip.
An employee slipped and fell while walking down the stairs, injuring her leg.
On April 20, 2015, an employee was hospitalized as a result of being struck by a forklift.

An employee was operating a drill machine and cleaning the debris around it. As the drill bit was automatically pulling out of the drilled hole, the bit caught the employee's sleeve and pulled in the employee's right forearm, lacerating it.

An employee was assembling oilfield parts. He had a small piece of pipe (approximately 3-feet high) and was attaching another piece (approximately 500 lbs. with an 18" diameter) to the upright stationary pipe. As he lowered the piece with an overhead crane, he began to place the piece inside the stationary pipe and bolt them together. The pipe was disconnected from the crane, and the employee noticed that the bolt holes were not lined up. When he began to reposition the pipe, it slipped and amputated his pinky, ring, and middle fingers on his left hand. He was hospitalized.
On April 28, 2016, at 12:00 p.m., an employee slipped on a wet tile floor and broke a femur bone, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a stack truck (PIT). He turned the truck in the wrong direction and struck a metal guardrail post. He had stuck his foot out of the truck before striking the post, and his foot was crushed between the truck and the post.
An employee was using an overhead crane to move a piece of equipment into place when the piece fell and struck the employee's lower leg. The injury required surgery to repair.

On April 3, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., an employee was installing a beam on a commercial medical building when the ladder he was on gave out. He fell approximately 10 feet, fracturing his hip bone and injuring his wrist.
While scraping out the hopper inside a mixer/dough divider, an employee's left-hand fingertip was caught and amputated by a shear point. The divider was operating at the time of the incident.

At approximately 8:30 a.m., on March 11, 2015, an employee was struck on the face by a battery spreading beam. The employee was hospitalized at Strong Memorial Hospital with a broken nose and fractured cheekbone.

Employee was making a delivery and parked the tractor trailer behind Walgreens at 9th & Shipley.  The tractor trailer caught a low hanging wire from overhead poles on the front driver's side corner of the trailer.  The driver attempted to remove the wire from the trailer catwalk and then attempted to remove the corner cap from the trailer.  The cap came loose suddenly, hit the associate in the face, and he fell flat on the roof of the trailer.  He sustained facial and eye injuries, along with spinal injuries, and was admitted to the hospital for treatment.

An employee was using compressed air to blow out an extrusion unit before completing a resin change over when the mechanical hopper gate closed, pinching and amputating the employee's right index, middle, and ring fingertips.
An employee fell through the roof while carrying a metal panel. The wind caught the metal panel, dragging the employee over to an opening in the roof.  The employee fell and cut his forearm.
An employee was moving bricks on the roof of a one-story house when he lost his balance and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground, suffering left leg trauma.

On February 10, 2017, an employee was performing functional tests on a lawnmower. The engine was running, but the drive belts for the mower were not engaged or moving. At approximately 8:15 a.m., the employee was walking near the mower when he tripped and fell.  As he fell, his right hand contacted a sharp area where the belt met a pulley and his right index finger was de-gloved.
An employee was moving a standup forklift and returning it to the parking area when his foot was pinned between the forklift and a rack, breaking it.
An employee was using a table saw to cut flooring when the saw partially amputated his right-hand ring and middle fingers.
On October 22, 2016, an employee fell to the ground while sliding tandems into place on a trailer, suffering a head contusion/possible concussion that required hospitalization.
An employee was moving a PIV when their foot got caught between the PIV and a bollard. The employee injured the foot and ankle.

An employee was crossing the street and was struck by a taxi. The employee sustained a broken nose, a dislocated left shoulder, a broken femur, a sprained right ankle and needed 18 stitches on his head.
On July 21, 2016, around 2:30 p.m., an employee was driving from one corn field to another when she felt ill due to heat stress and pulled over to call for assistance. She was hospitalized.

An employee stepped backwards off a landing deck and fell approximately 21 feet to the ground below, suffering a head injury. His retractable lanyard caught, but the lanyard broke as it rubbed against the beam.
An employee was performing maintenance on a tractor-trailer dolly leg when the trailer fell over and crushed the employee's left ring finger, which had to be amputated.

On or about 7/11/16, an employee was moving four pieces of metal weighing about 84 pounds. He hand-carried the metal to a truck bed and set it down on his pinky finger. When he attempted to pull his finger out, he suffered a deep avulsion. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

On or about 14 April 2015, at approximately 1612 hours, a Troy Vines, Inc. employee was replacing the tire on a Redimix truck on Tradewind and Duval Street. He lowered the vehicle to reposition the jack and was caught between the road surface and the truck's structure. The compression caused a hip dislocation and a fracture in his hip area. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning a condenser coil. Kleen Coil (yellow) spilled into his boots burning his foot.
An employee was driving a Segway when it hit a curb. The employee fell to the ground and broke the right ankle.
An employee slipped on water on the floor of a patient's bathroom and fell.

An employee was working on a third floor balcony, applying flashing to metal. The employee stepped through the floor joists, landed on the second floor balcony, and then fell to the first floor. The employee sustained broken ribs, a broken ankle, and a punctured lung and was hospitalized.
On or about September 12, 2016, an employee was loading a trailer. When she stepped down onto the belly on the trailer, she twisted her knee and was hospitalized with extreme pain.
An employee fell about 8 feet from an A-frame ladder.
An employee was removing wiring and sensors from the top of a Tainter gate retaining wall. The employee fell 10-16 feet from the retaining wall and fractured vertebrae in the back.

An employee went on the roof to clean plastic debris. He noticed a piece of plastic by the leading edge of the roof. When he attempted to remove it, he slipped and fell about 13 feet from the leading edge of the roof to hard-packed dirt below, breaking both legs. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was walking between a cooker and a pot when a water hose began to whip around and sprayed him with hot water and steam. He suffered a second degree burn to his upper back.

An employee walked outside to get the client's newspaper and slipped in the client's garage. She fell and hit her face on the tracks of the garage door, suffering a nasal septal fracture and upper lip lacerations.
An employee suffered burns while trying to repair a water heater.
An employee fell on slick floors that were being mopped.
An employee was performing maintenance on an automatic door switch when the door closed on the employee's leg, breaking it.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood when he slipped and made contact with the rotating blade on a DeWalt miter saw.  The employee cut off the tip of his right index finger.  The employee was taken to UPMC East for treatment.
An employee was shocked while modifying a lighting circuit, burning his hands and causing a right index finger amputation.

An employee was moving a valve body with a hoist from a CNC Machine to the side of the machine.  The valve body slipped from the clamps that were holding it and hit the employee in the right leg between the knee and ankle. His leg broke.
An employee was on the second level of a scaffold outside of a building, installing an exterior insulation and finishing system, when he fell six stories. The scaffold was unguarded at the time.
An employee was finishing up concrete when concrete got into the top of the employee's boots and burned both feet.
On July 19, 2016, an employee suffered a partial little finger amputation while guiding the well casing into a bore hole.

On November 23, 2015, at approximately 8:45 a.m., an employee was troubleshooting a 110-volt ultraviolet lamp on a press.  The employee turned the light off, removed a cover, manually adjusted the bulb, and then received an electrical shock. The employee suffered tightness of the chest and elevated blood enzymes and was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was cleaning a laminate glue machine when his right thumb became stuck in the machine rollers, amputating his thumb tip.
An employee's leg was punctured by the nail from a nail gun the employee was using to hang fascia.
An employee was struck by a bar on the Elliot Packaging Machine while cleaning it. The employee suffered a broken arm.
An employee sustained a partial right thumb amputation while operating a metal filing band in the building's work area.
An employee was using a ladder on a tile floor with plastic sheeting when the ladder slipped out, causing the employee to fall and break their pelvis.

An employee was fabricating parts in a press brake. The employee bent a part and the part fell back. When the employee reached for the part, the press was activated via the foot pedal and pinched the employee's middle finger, amputating the fingertip.

The employee was traveling on his PIT to put it away and plug it into to a stationary charger stored on the second tier of racking. As he approached the area to park the PIT, he noticed the charging cord hanging down from the racking. He stopped and reached to move the cord and the truck moved forward catching his fingers between the truck and the racks.

An employee was hauling a concrete post with a forklift. The employee got off the forklift and became pinned between the forklift and a dumpster. The employee suffered a fractured right fibula and big toe.
An employee's shirt got caught in a floor mixer. The employee's right arm was injured.
An employee pulled a pallet from a stack and got a severe splinter in his right hand. The wound eventually became infected and required hospitalization.
On October 30, 2015, an employee fell down the outside steps as she left work. She suffered a head laceration and was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was exiting his vehicle when a knife in his car door lacerated his right leg.

An employee was operating a forklift and unloading materials from a tractor trailer when he noticed dunnage under the pallet and got off the forklift to remove it. The forks then crushed his left middle finger, requiring surgical amputation of the fingertip.
Three agents were unloading a transporter when one agent's foot was caught between the transporter and container loader when the driver pulled ahead causing several fractures in his right foot.
On November 8, 2016, an employee was cutting and removing bandings from bundles of tubing when two pieces of tubing fell and fractured the employee's right foot.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the left index finger while performing patty-machine maintenance.
On or about August 17, 2016, an employee was using a router when the piece slipped and amputated the employee's left middle finger.
An employee was working and was exposed to exhaust from a cooking unit that had a malfunctioning ventilation system. He suffered respiratory irritation and was hospitalized.
On or about January 23, 2015, an employee sustained a finger amputation while placing steel in a press.
On November 3, 2016, an employee's hand and finger were pinched while lowering a piano plate onto a table, amputating part of the middle finger.
An employee was cutting tails off hides with a knife when the blade entered his boot and cut his left ankle.
An employee was struck by drywall sheets, which broke his leg at the knee.
An employee was cleaning a machine when the machine cycled while his arm was inside. He suffered two fractures to his right arm.
An employee was operating a punch press and amputated four fingers on the left hand.
An employee was sweeping the floor when a bale of cotton fell on him, injuring his lower back.

An employee collecting trash containers at the facility suffered a finger amputation when his hand got caught between a hitch and a toe bar behind a tractor. The tractor moved forward and amputated a finger. The tractor was parked in neutral gear at the time of the incident.
An employee smashed his finger while moving drums from a pallet, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was cleaning the inside of a finished mobile home. She was using a two-step stool to get off the home when the stool moved, resulting in a broken left ankle. She was hospitalized.
An employee was feeding parts into a machine at her workstation when she experienced shortness of breath and collapsed, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working in the cockpit of a plane when his hand was crushed by a falling battery, breaking several fingers and requiring surgery.

An employee was helping to move a portable hydraulic lifting device onto the bed of a pickup truck. One of the folding legs of the portable hydraulic lifting device opened up.  The injured employee reached for the leg of the unit and caught his finger in a pinch point caused by the movement of the leg. His right little fingertip was amputated.
An employee fell through an opening on a permanent structure, a compressor, suffering a pelvic fracture.

On or about January 12, 2015, an employee was injured while loosening the bolts of a rod and collar assembly on a manual assist arm. A component fell and struck his hand, amputating the tip of his left little finger.

An employee was hospitalized after sustaining multiple fractures to the lower right leg while engaged in the un-cabling of a rail car. The employee slipped and fell while attempting to reduce the tension on the center beam ratchet.
An employee was cleaning up water that had leaked from the dishwasher. She slipped and fell breaking her knee cap.
An employee was washing a ready mix truck when the left middle finger was caught in the flip chute lock resulting in a fractured finger.

An employee replaced a hydraulic cylinder in a packer press. Then the machine was cycled to test it. While observing the cylinder cycle to ensure there were no leaks, the employee's hand entered the machine and his right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee sawing a femur bone sawed into his/her right index finger, lacerating tendons and requiring hospitalization. No hand guard was worn at the time of the incident.

An operator was carrying steel tubes using a forklift. The load slipped off the forks and landed on another employee's right foot. The employee was taken to the hospital where all of the toes on the right foot were amputated.
An employee was cut by glass due to an over pressurization event.

An employee was being handed shelving units by a coworker when the coworker lost their grip and the shelving unit made contact with the top of the employee's head. The employee was hospitalized overnight with a head laceration and contusion.

An employee was operating a loader to backfill a trench with sand when the loader turned over and slid into the open trench. The employee's leg contacted the control console of the loader, breaking the fibula and requiring hospitalization.
An employee used a pocket knife to open a box. When he closed his pocket knife, he amputated his right-hand middle fingertip.
An employee was securing a lift hook to a table on a jib crane when the employee's right thumb tip was crushed/amputated between the hook and lift table.
An employee slipped and fell on the ice while walking into work and was hospitalized with a broken lower left leg.

Two employees were inside a vehicle removing the dash console. The car shifted into drive and struck another employee that was sweeping inside the shop and pinned him to the wall. The employee suffered a fractured pelvis.
An employee was operating a table saw when a piece of wood kicked back. The employee's fingertip was amputated.
An employee was reversing a powered industrial truck when it collided with another parked powered industrial truck. The employee suffered a lacerated artery in the right leg and required surgery.

An employee had a small grease fire on his equipment. As he grabbed the fire extinguisher and handed it down to a coworker, he lost his footing and fell down, fracturing his right leg beneath the knee.
After operating a hydraulic excavator, an employee began to experience heart-attack-like symptoms. The employee was hospitalized overnight for dehydration possibly due to heat.
An employee was standing on a pallet as it was being lifted 6-feet high when he fell off and broke his wrist.

A worker was wearing leather work gloves and cutting aluminum bar stock on a horizontal band saw.  His hand contacted the moving saw blade and was pulled in causing an amputation of the left index fingertip.
While repositioning a 148-pound part on a pallet, an employee suffered a back strain and was hospitalized.

An employee was working on the rig floor of a workover rig. The crew was picking up pipe from the hole. The operator descended the block to the rig floor to connect to the pipe. The bails and elevators were connected to the blocks. When the elevators came down, the employee's finger was caught between the elevator and bail resulting in a left middle finger amputation at the first digit.
An employee was working at a customer location and slipped while going down the rear, concrete steps and injured his right knee.
An employee was using a pallet jack to select product and pinned his hand between the jack handle and the rack. Surgery was performed on the employee's left pinky finger to repair a cut tendon.

The employee was operating a grommet machine placing the bottom and top grommet on the canvas materials when she noticed the top grommet was not straight. She tried to straighten it and the hammer came down on her right middle finger, crushing the fingertip.
An employee pinched a nerve in his back while lifting luggage.

An employee was performing a quality assurance inspection of can-line valves.  While inspecting the double head tail filters, she placed her finger in the fill nozzle. The valve energized, closed on her right middle finger, and pinched off her fingertip.
An employee was erecting a fence when he tripped over some rebar on the ground and fell. He fell on top of his tool belt and punctured the stomach on his tools (pliers) in his tool belt.
An employee was exiting a 15-passenger van when the van moved forward while he was in the doorway. He fell out to the ground and injured his back and left leg.

Employee 1 and employee 2 were operating a welding robot in the fabrication department.  Employee 1 was loading a fin bank into the welding cell and was walking backwards into the welding cell while operating an overhead crane. Employee 1 stepped backwards into an open pit and fell approximately 8 feet. Employee 1 sustained the following injuries: fractured pelvis at both hip sockets, fractured ribs, fractured right elbow, fractured right shoulder.  Employee 1 is hospitalized at University Hospital in Columbia, Missouri.

An employee was operating a motorized pallet jack.  He fractured his right thumb when it became caught between the grocery rack and the handle of the pallet jack. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

The employee is a truck driver. The employee drove to another employer's location to deliver a tractor. While unloading the equipment off the trailer, the employee fell from the trailer and fractured a hip.

An employee was operating a forklift. The forklift wheels struck a plate between the loading dock and the back of the trailer causing the plate to move and the employee to fall off the forklift. The employee suffered a concussion.
An employee injured her left middle finger after tripping over temporary water removal equipment in the parking lot.
An employee was carrying a large, rolled rug. A forklift hit the rug that the employee was carrying knocking the employee to the ground. The employee sustained a concussion.
While cleaning a sifter and rotary valve, an employee's left-hand index, middle, and ring fingers were amputated.
An employee disconnected a pipe during a sanitation wash cycle and was burned below the waist by hot water.
An employee's right-hand middle finger was partially amputated when it got caught in an elevator door he was latching.

On May 8, 2015, an employee was putting an additional bend into a double torsion spring at a large servio table (wire bender) machine. He put his left hand on top of the part, and his left finger got caught between the bending mechanism (steel block) and the stationary block. He suffered a left ring finger amputation.
An employee was delivering packages. He experienced a gradual onset of cramping in his arms and legs, followed by nausea. He was hospitalized for treatment of heat stress and dehydration.
Employee in the back of a trailer amputated his thumb while catching a falling pallet truck by the wheel well opening.
On or about August 3, 2015, an employee was struck by a man lift while walking down an aisle.
An employee's gloved hand was caught in the rotation fan of a welder unit during repairs, amputating the thumb.

An employee was delivering product(chem treat bel1544) to a customer location using a tanker truck. The employee  removed a cap to the discharge line and the chemical sprayed onto his face. As a consequence, the employee had 2nd degree burns in the mouth lips and tip of his tongue. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was placing trash in a trash compactor outside the back of the store when the sharp metal edge of the compactor avulsed his right middle finger. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was stepping onto a forklift with his left foot when his foot slipped off the forklift. The employee twisted his ankle breaking it and his foot as he fell to the floor.
A worker was operating a chop saw and amputated the tip of his right middle finger when his finger was pulled into the saw along with the wood to be cut.
An employee was repairing a vehicle body by hammering out dents when he smashed his index finger with a manual hammer. The finger was lacerated and infected.

An employee was performing maintenance on a scissor lift at a customer's facility. The lift slid on gravel on an incline, causing the employee to lose control. The lift tipped over, and the employee sustained a broken femur and pelvis.
Employee was burned while working on a motor.
The employee's arm was caught at the head roller of raw material hopper Line #1.  The arm was surgically amputated to free him from the bagging machine.

An employee was repositioning a piece of cardboard over the vacuum holes of a printing press when the piece was drawn into the machine. His left hand was also pulled in, de-gloving the top of the hand and amputating the index finger.
An employee was hoisting steel beams with a crane. The steel beam swung and struck him in the jaw resulting in a fracture requiring surgery.

An employee was mowing the lawn when an object became tangled in the mower blade. When the employee attempted to remove the object, his right index finger was amputated. The mower was not turned off at the time of the incident.

An employee was retrieving a tool that fell into a chemical tank using a pole. The tool fell off the pole and back into the tank, splashing the chemical on the employee. The employee sustained first, second, and third degree burns on the hands, right knee, thigh, calf, and right foot, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was assisting a truck driver putting a tarp on a unit. The employee used a wooden pallet as a ladder to reach the tarp. The pallet slid out from underneath and the employee fell onto the truck fracturing his right lower leg.
An employee released the park brake on a forklift and went to get something from a van. The forklift rolled forward, striking the employee and breaking the employee's leg.

Employee 1 was helping Employee 2 weld a flange to a pipe. Employee 1 was holding a 20" diameter, 2" thick flange in place for Employee 2. The flange was held up by a pipe jack.  The flange slipped and Employee 1's fingers were caught between the flange and the pipe jack.  His right middle finger was amputated between the first and second joint and his ring finger was amputated at the first joint.
An employee was walking through a customer's yard during installation when he tripped over debris and fell breaking an arm.
An employee sustained a puncture wound to the left forearm on July 7, 2015. The employee was later hospitalized for treatment when the hand and forearm became swollen.
An employee was cleaning inside a manhole when he was hit by a car. He suffered a broken left shoulder.
An employee was restraining a patient when the patient sat on his left leg and fractured the tibia and fibula.
An employee was repairing a tractor tire using a jack. Something happened where the tire came off the rim and the employee was found underneath the tractor.
A powered industrial truck operator was transported to the hospital after becoming lethargic and unresponsive during a work break. The employee was admitted to the hospital due to dehydration.
On March 31, 2015, an employee amputated his right middle fingertip when it contacted a part he was deburring on a rotating lathe.
An employee was working inside a meat freezer when he struck his head. He was hospitalized with internal bleeding.
The end of an employee's left-hand middle finger was amputated by an unguarded hole punch machine.
An employee tripped and fell fracturing her left hip.
An employee was leaving the evisceration break room when the door started to close and her right middle finger was pinched in the door jam resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee fell about 20 feet from a ladder to the ground while drilling into a wood stud, suffering a broken nose and ankle.
An employee was approaching an injection molding machine when she tripped and fell from the floor level onto a conveyor, suffering a large hematoma to her upper left leg.
An employee went outside to investigate an odor. She approached a dust collector and stuck her right hand into a hopper that contained a rotating discharge valve. She amputated three fingers.

An employee attending a meeting in a conference room tripped over a data port located on the floor; a cover was missing over the data port at the time. The employee was hospitalized and underwent surgery for a fractured hip.
An employee was struck by a forklift truck that was traveling in reverse, fracturing his left foot.
An employee's right index fingertip was caught in the pinch point of moving equipment, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was transferring formic acid from a leaking tote to a new tote. The new tote's valve was open, which allowed the formic acid to run out onto the ground. The employee walked toward the tote, slipped, and fell onto the formic acid, suffering third degree burns (right leg, backside, right ear, and hands) that required hospitalization.

An employee was driving a Vermeer flex track loader onto a flat bed trailer when the load shifted forward. This caused the Vermeer flex track loader to fall off of the trailer and strike the employee's foot resulting in crushing injuries that required surgery.
An employee was mowing a residential property and stopped to adjust the blade on the mower. When he reached under the mowing deck, his left middle finger was lacerated and later amputated.
An employee was adjusting the chute on the T-Belt going to the FB4K hopper resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was hospitalized due to carbon monoxide poisoning.
An employee loading materials onto the roof fell through a skylight approximately 25 feet resulting in broken ribs and back.

An employee had just changed the upper inner tool on a powdered metal press. The upper inner tool was not properly aligned with the lower die. When the employee cycled the press, the upper outer tool shattered and created shrapnel, which struck the employee in the neck. The employee was hospitalized for surgery to remove the shrapnel from his neck.
An employee was struck by and ran over by a forklift.
An employee was preparing the workplace for underground electrical work and suffered a heat-related illness.
An employee was stacking small boxes on a roller system when his foot caught on the frame of a roller and he fell to the concrete floor, breaking his left hip.
An employee was moving a box of fabric when she lost her balance and fell, fracturing her left femur.
An employee's hand was caught between a conveyor belt and a roller.
An employee was helping a customer at the counter when she tripped and fell, breaking her hip.

An employee was repairing a pipeline at a residential home. The employee took the pipe apart and was handling the pipe and fittings when contaminated debris from within the pipeline contacted the back of his hand. He suffered skin irritation to his left hand that became infected and swollen.
While moving dye, employee pinched the right ring finger between the clevis and hook. The employee was taken to the hospital where the tip of the finger was amputated.
Employee's little finger was crushed and amputated by an industrial washing machine door.
An employee on an oil rig had his left hand amputated by a rock crusher while dislodging rocks from the machine. Lockout procedures were not followed at the time.
An employee was descending a dump truck ladder, when he jumped to the floor and his ring was caught. He lost part of his left-hand ring finger, from the mid-knuckle up.
Employee cut the tip of his left thumb off with regular scissors while dressing a window at the NorthStar Mall location.
An employee was building a riser for electrical power lines and received burns to the arm and neck.
An employee was using a drill press to drill a hole in a piece of metal when a metal bur contacted his glove and pulled his finger into the drill press. His finger was amputated.
An employee was connecting a pipe to a wellhead. The pipe separated under pressure and struck the employee, fracturing the employee's ribs and leg.
An employee was driving a pallet jack when he pressed the wrong direction on the machine and caught his fingers in between the pallet jack and a rack.

An employee was dismantling transformers when one of the transformers fell on him and injured both legs. His left leg and foot had to be surgically amputated below the knee, and his lower left arm was fractured.
An employee slipped and fell to the floor, breaking her kneecap.
An employee was exiting a cone trailer and slipped off the steps hitting his head on the pavement. The employee was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee was operating a shear machine and amputated the left middle fingertip.

An employee performing custodial work (sweeping in stairwell) misjudged his step and fell striking his head on September 12, 2015 at 2:30 am. The employee was admitted to the hospital. The employee sustained contusions and lacerations to the head.
An employee was loading a mold onto a forklift when the forklift moved forward and caught his finger between the mold and forks sustaining a 1st digit amputation to the right middle finger.

An employee was dismantling a scaffold when the pin from the toe board came out, lifting the guardrail up. The employee went to grab the guardrail as it was falling and fell with it. The employee fell approximately 20 feet to the ground below, fracturing an arm and cheekbones and suffering numerous contusions.
An employee was standing on a ladder and fell off approximately 20 feet when the feet of the ladder slipped. The employee suffered a fractured right elbow.
An employee on a construction site was standing while talking and suddenly passed out possibly due to heat, hitting their head on the wall and falling to the floor. The employee was hospitalized.
On July 5, 2015, an employee got pinned up against a table lift and a Toro workman and was hospitalized.

An employee had delivered a parcel to a house and stepped off the step onto a walkway when she twisted her left ankle. She then tried to catch herself with her right leg and heard a pop. She fractured her right leg in three places and was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was cleaning a hydraulic tank with a brake parts cleaning solution. The employee sprayed the cleaner on the parts to be cleaned and then dropped a mechanic's droplight to the ground. The bulb then sparked and caused the cleaning solution vapors to ignite, resulting in burns to the employee's face and neck.
While stepping off a ladder, an employee missed the last rung and lost his balance. He fell to the ground and landed on the left side of his body. He was hospitalized with a fractured hip.

Employees were welding a wall plate to connect a structural steel member. The base of the member became unstable, and the structural steel started to fall, causing an employee sitting on a cross member to fall 15 feet to the ground below. A second employee was welding while standing in an aerial lift basket when the structural steel member fell and crashed down on the lift, slamming it to the ground. The employee suffered multiple blunt force trauma injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a right ring finger amputation while operating a lathe in the manufacturing department.

While cleaning a lithography press, an employee's rag and left hand were pulled into the roller's point of operation. The machine was running at the time and the employee's hand was partially degloved and his left index, middle and ring fingers were partially amputated. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was removing shoring when a piece of plywood fell on him, breaking his finger and collarbone and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was plugging in a grinder to remove a metal piece from the floor. When he placed the plug into the socket, he was shocked and thrown back about 3 feet.
An employee tripped over debris on the floor, fell, and fractured her knee.

A special needs child got agitated and attacked an employee as they were driving.  An aid was on the bus and attempted to restrain the child, but was unable to prevent the attack. The employee suffered whiplash, a partially collapsed lung, right shoulder sprain, and a concussion. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's right-hand fingertip was severed from the nail down after coming in contact with an unguarded router bit.
An employee was operating the forklift in the yard. When he made a turn to return to the building, the forklift tipped over and rolled onto his foot.
An employee was descending a fixed ladder into an elevator pit to repair a sump pump. The employee fell 4 to 5 feet into the pit and suffered head trauma.
While driving a forklift in the parking lot, an employee hit a pothole and suffered a concussion that required hospitalization.
An employee was struck by falling countertops that fell from an unevenly stacked pile that became unstable. The employee suffered a broken lower leg.

An employee was descending a fixed ladder after adjusting the control wheel. The wheel is accessed from a platform at the top of the ladder. The employee slipped on either the third or fourth tread and fell to the concrete floor below, sustaining a possible small fracture to the left foot and a possible lumbar spine compression fracture.

An employee's finger was smashed when CANT, a cut log that can not be further processed in the saw mill operation, fell out of his hand. The employee lifted the log and lost his grip, and the log started to fall. While trying to change his grip to catch the log, his fingers got pinched between the log and the machine guard.
While operating a brake press, an employee amputated four right-hand fingers when the foot pedal activated during a change over.
An employee was helping a driver by moving a scissor lift with its remote control when the lift ran over his foot, breaking his left tibia just above the ankle.

An employee was removing a 14 foot jack in a parking garage by releasing clamps on the top and the bottom.  While the employee was releasing the bottom clamp, the top clamp that was previously loosened fell and caught his finger between the top clamp and the back. The left middle finger was amputated.
An employee pulled the generator string and his left hand got caught in the string as it returned into the generator amputating the middle fingertip and thumb tip.

An employee was using a scissor lift to mount a machine that shoots clay pigeons from 20 feet in the air. The scissor lift would not lower all the way to the ground, so the he attempted to troubleshoot the problem. When he tried to grab a wire underneath the fold of the lift that may have been the problem, the lift came down on top of his left arm. He was hospitalized with nerve damage.
