An employee was climbing a tree to cut off the limbs and underbrush when the tree roots came up and the tree fell into the lake. The employee also fell about 40 to 50 feet into the lake while still attached to the tree with safety equipment. He broke both legs and his pelvis.
An employee was assembling testing equipment. The employee's left index finger got caught between a nut and an impact wrench and was amputated to the knuckle.
An employee was labeling equipment to identify two high voltage batch feeders when he was burned by electrical shock from the feeder.
An employee operating the mandrel extruder lost her arm.  She was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
An employee was connecting the hitch of a wood chipper to a customer's truck when the hitch ball fell on top of his left foot. He had surgery and was hospitalized.

On May 03, 2016, an employee's fingertip was amputated after being pinched between an alignment stacking pin and the alignment hole of interlocking plastic pallets during material handling operations.
An employee suffered an amputation of his left, little fingertip when the folding chair on which he was sitting collapsed.
On or about August 25, 2016, an employee fell approximately 20 feet off of a ladder resulting in broken bones.
An employee was attempting to do maintenance on a wood chipper when his hand was trapped in the conveyor. All five fingers on his right hand were lacerated, and he was hospitalized.

Maintenance employee for Southwestern Plating was working inside a circuit breaker box that was not locked out. A flash fire occurred, burning the employee's arms (upper and lower), face, neck, and torso.  The employee was rushed to Memorial Hermann Hospital (Burn Unit) where he is currently hospitalized.

An employee was watching for oncoming traffic while a fellow worker was installing wiring on a light pole. The employee was struck by a motor vehicle that was driving illegally in reverse down a one way street in the wrong direction. The employee sustained a sprained right ankle, contusions to the left hip, thigh and forearm and lacerations to the left side of the face.

An employee was performing pipe-fitting operations at the top of a 6-foot rolling staircase (rollers locked in place). When she reached out and grabbed a fitted pipe, it came loose and caused her to lose her balance and fall down the stairs. She broke her right wrist, left hand, and sacrum.
An employee was operating a truck wash rack and was pinned between a parked truck and the machine resulting in broken bones.

An employee was moving a conveyor with a crane and sling when the sling snapped, striking the employee in the face and knocking him backward. He was then struck in the face by the conveyor. He suffered facial cuts/lacerations and was hospitalized with a possible concussion.
While standing on a loading dock to the side of a forklift, an employee was bumped by another forklift, fell down, and sustained a deep laceration to his left leg below the knee, requiring stitches.

An employee was unloading equipment at a storage facility. A 2" x 6" x 20' steel bar rolled onto the employee's left-hand pinky finger, crushing it between the bar and trailer. The first digit of the finger was surgically amputated.
On 8/3/15, at 10:00 a.m., an employee amputated the left thumb tip while cutting cabbage. The employee's cutting gloves had holes in them at the time.
An employee's left pinky finger was amputated while working with the baler machine.
An employee reached under the guard of the punch press to clear a bottle jam. The trimmer came down and cut his right thumb.

While walking into the dining manager's office from the stove area, an employee slipped on the threshold of the office door and landed on his left elbow and onto his back. Preliminary diagnosis was concussion without loss of consciousness, acute headache, cervical sprain, thoracic spine sprain, and lumbar spine sprain.

An employee was pushing a dolly and slipped. The employee's thumb was caught between the handle and a piece of equipment. The employee was sent to the hospital and some tissue was removed by the doctor.
On 12/08/2016, an employee fell off the back end of his tractor-trailer at a customer's loading dock and suffered a severe concussion, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was removing an electrical cord from a water tower when he came into contact with overhead power lines and received electrical burns to his hands.

An employee was working with a crew to remove a tree branch from a cable wire on a pole that fell down during a storm. A crew member was cutting a branch to free it from the communications line when it hit an adjacent branch, which then fell onto the employee's back and pinned him to the ground. He fractured his rib and punctured his lung.

An employee was attempting to stabilize the concrete barrier that was being lifted by a rubber tire loader. The operator of the rubber tire loader lowered the barrier and caught the tip of the employee's right foot resulting in amputation of the tip of the right foot to the first joint.

An employee was filling a natural gas powered vehicle. A noise startled the employee, who then fell backward and made contact with the lip of the fueling island, breaking his right leg in the process. He was hospitalized for surgery.
Employee slipped on snow and fell, breaking his ankle in three places.
Forklift Incident.

A motorcycle entered the work zone and struck an employee who was cleaning up a pot hole. 
The work zone had TCD.
A fire extinguisher fell while it was being serviced, striking an employee in the face. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee tripped and fell while pushing a bin with merchandise.  The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a dog-eared board machine when his leg was severely lacerated by a moving part at the edge of the machine near the bottom that catches the boards. He was hospitalized with a cut ligament in his right leg just below the knee and required surgery.

An employee was changing out a pole-mounted transformer. A wire that the employee touched was still energized by the overhead powerlines. The employee was shocked by 7200K volts, suffering electrical burns to both hands and memory loss and requiring hospitalization.

After exiting the parking shuttle and walking into the building, an employee's foot stuck to the floor, causing the employee to fall face-forward onto the floor. The employee suffered a fractured right humerus, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was cleaning a pipe and removing debris that blocked the air hole. The release of pressure lacerated and broke the employee's right index finger.

An employee was injured on April 23, 2015, at approximately 11:50 PM, when she was struck by a powered industrial truck driven by another employee. The injured employee sustained fractures of both ankles, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was working at approximately six feet in height when he fell from an A-frame ladder.  The employee suffered a head injury requiring in-patient hospitalization.
On or about July 9, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation to his left thumb while performing an unjamming activity on the graham cracker packaging machine.
On or about April 5, 2016, an employee was guiding a die in a press when he attempted to remove a scrap. His right middle finger was caught between the die and die stop, amputating the fingertip.
Employee struck by Air Train.
An employee was attaching clamps to a hide at the side puller station on the kill side of the plant when his left thumb got caught in the clamp. He sustained a left thumb avulsion.

A company truck was overheating and an employee removed the radiator cap in an attempt to fix the problem.  As he removed the cap, hot fluids exited the radiator and splashed into the employee's face, burning him.  The employee was hospitalized.

On September 9, 2016, an employee attempted to remove a part from a welding machine while a setup person was making adjustments on the machine. The welding tip came down and amputated the employee's right thumb.
An employee's walker caught on a loose rug as she was exiting the restroom. She fell, hitting her head and twisting her left knee.
An employee severely lacerated the palm of his hand after coming into contact with a chipper blade. The chipper was not running at the time.
An employee exiting a bucket truck lost his footing on the last step and fell to the ground fracturing his left leg.
An employee was struck by the fork of a forklift, fracturing and lacerating his right leg (calf).

An employee was installing a dryer felt when the pipe slid off the end of the forks and struck the employee, knocking her to the floor. She suffered injuries to her right fingers and the left side of her body.

On May 9, 2016, at about 4:00PM an employee was admitted to the hospital due to a forearm laceration with a circular saw while cutting a piece of wood.

On May 9, 2016, at about 4:30PM another employee was injured when a forklift struck the concrete structure the employee was working on, tilting the structure, and pinching the employee's left foot under it.  The employee was admitted to the hospital due to the injury on his foot.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report.
An employee was struck by a car within the garage. The vehicle operator moved the car off of the hoist platform and hit the employee injuring his abdominal area.

Employee was wiping off the plate while the machine was running. The rag got caught in the machine pulling the employee's hand into the machine and catching it between the print cylinder and the anologix cylinder. The right 4th and 5th fingertips were amputated.
An employee was fixing a link on a track. The track pads shifted and pinched the employee's left pinky finger. The finger was later amputated.
An employee was operating a pump and was moving it from one drum to another when the rotating blade on the pump amputated his right pinky finger.
An employee was delivering mail and climbing snow-covered stairs when she slipped and fell, fracturing her ankle.
An employee working the paunch table amputated part of his right thumb.
An employee received second degree burns when pouring water into a dryer that contained hot oil.

An employee was removing rust from a steel beam when the beam fell from a transfer table onto the employee's right foot, fracturing multiple toes. The employee was wearing steel-toed boots at the time.
An employee was stepping from a walkway with guard rails onto the roof when he stumbled and fell off of the roof edge. The roof was approximately 32-feet high.
An employee was on a wooden structural wall pouring concrete when the machine started to malfunction. He jumped from the wall and broke a leg.
An employee was pressing a stainless steel shaft into a wheel when the shaft shattered and became lodged in the employee's abdomen.
An employee was servicing an elevator when he was caught between the elevator and was hospitalized with injuries to his abdominal area.

On October 6, 2016, an employee was changing out cutter blades when he saw a piece of plastic. As he removed the plastic, his left hand contacted the blades, injuring his index, middle, and ring fingers and amputating his middle finger.
On January 3, 2017, an employee fell from an A-frame ladder while attempting to change the ballast in an overhead light fixture, suffering heel fractures to both feet.
An employee was pulling shopping carts from a cart corral, tripped, and fell in the parking lot. The employee fractured the right hip.
An employee was hospitalized after suffering a laceration on the inner thigh when the RotoZip saw kicked back while dismantling a storage rack.
An employee in the steakhouse kitchen was using a mandolin slicer to slice a potato.  While using  the slicer, the employee amputated the tip of his right index finger (no bone).
An employee was trying to clean the conveyor belt when his right hand was caught by the conveyor, amputating his ring fingertip.

An employee was helping to discharge fuel from a barge by positioning a C-hook on a coil. After he slid the C-hook into the coil, his hand rested on the bottom of the C-hook. When a crane began to lift the hook, the coil and his fingers became caught, crushing his left-hand pinky, ring, and middle fingers.

An employee was opening the back of a trailer during product unloading when boxes from a pallet that shifted during transport fell on him. The employee sustained a fractured femur and a laceration to the head. The employee was subsequently hospitalized.
An employee missed a step and fell while walking in a stairwell.

On 5/10/16, at approximately 0900 hours, an employee was climbing a ladder that was set up on a meter pole when the pole began to crack. The employee began descending the ladder and the pole broke. The employee fell approximately 15 feet from the ladder to a stone/grassy surface, shattering the L2 vertebra and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was pushing an oxygen bottle on a cart when his leg gave out and he fell to the ground, suffering an acute right hip fracture.
The employee working as a machinist in Building 211 received a metal sliver in his right index finger on December 21, 2015, that he removed. The employee was later admitted into the hospital.
An employee fell while entering the facility and fractured the right hip.

An employee was using a table saw to cut a piece of build-up (countertop). While cutting the material, the employee's fingers came in contact with the saw blade.  The employee sustained serious injury including laceration and fracturing of the right forefinger and right middle finger.
An employee was positioning dunnage under a load when the load fell on the left hand resulting in the amputation of the left hand.
An employee amputated four fingers on the left hand while using a total positioning saw.

An employee was descending a fixed ladder on a de-ice truck and missed the last rung. The employee fell less than 2 feet and struck his head on the concrete ground. The employee has brain swelling and possible bleeding.

An employee was showing a second employee how to install a drive shaft onto a rotor plate. The drive shaft had to be aligned and seated onto the rotor plate by using a leather mallet and striking the drive shaft repeatedly. While attempting to stabilize the drive shaft, the second employee placed his index finger on the end of the shaft. The first employee struck the second employee's finger against the drive shaft with the leather mallet, crushing his left index finger, which had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was operating the bread line, where bread comes off the cooler line onto five different baggers. The bread goes onto a slide that pushes one loaf at a time into the guarded slicers.  After it is sliced, a metal guide pushes the bread forward to the next line for the bread to be bagged. Two loaves of bread, one behind the other, went into the slicer the wrong way. When the employee attempted to grab the bread, the metal guide pinched her right pinky finger, resulting in a distal amputation of her fingertip.

On October 18, 2016, at 4:15 p.m. a temporary employee was caught between the metal building insulation (MBI) machine and the push off bar on the machine while reaching over the machine to pull insulation. The employee sustained a fractured pelvis and was hospitalized.

An employee was using a table saw to cut some weed wacker cord when the cord became tangled and pulled the employee's left-hand fingers into the blade. Two of the employee's fingers were completely amputated, and one was partially amputated.

An employee was picking recyclable waste from a conveyor belt and placing it in the appropriate bins when the employee's left pinky finger became caught and amputated between the belt and the metal portion of the shoot.
An employee was packing potato chips into boxes and had a seizure. He fell and hit his head on a table and then the floor. The employee was admitted to a hospital.

An employee reached in to remove packaging materials from the six-line filler (yogurt machine). The machine was indexing and was not turned off at the time. She injured her left forearm, requiring hospitalization and subsequent surgery.

Employee was touching a boom truck used to deliver building materials while his co-worker was trying to lower the boom back into the truck. The boom struck a power line and the employee on the ground received an electric shock and was hospitalized.
An employee was using a meat saw when his hand slipped and his right middle finger engaged with the blade, lacerating his fingernail and fingertip.

On January 25, 2016, at approximately 4:30 p.m., an employee was completing rig service on the top drive. The service door was open and lowered with a winch.  The employee was positioned on the service door, approximately 8 to 10 feet above the ground, and wore fall protection. The remote for the winch developed an electrical short, causing the winch to re-spoil. This caused the door to raise back up. The employee was pinned between the service door and the top drive, resulting in two hairline hip fractures.
An employee was invited into the house by a customer to discuss Brighthouse products and services. The employee was stung on the back of the neck, requiring hospitalization.
On 1/20/2017, an employee was climbing a ladder to disconnect a service line when the cable he hooked the ladder on snapped, causing him to fall and break six ribs.

A worker was hospitalized on 01/06/2015 at 3:30 p.m. After doing some clean-up work on a roof, he fell approximately 8.5 to 9 feet while descending a ladder. The worker fractured his leg  and was hospitalized overnight at Athens Regional Medical Center. He underwent surgery, at which time a pin was inserted in the tibia of the fractured leg.
A letter carrier was bitten by dog. The carrier fell and injured a wrist.
While an employee was exiting the excavator, he missed a step and fell about 35 to 40 inches, fracturing his left femur.

Employees were setting up a piece of concrete block manufacturing equipment using a telehandler to raise a section of fabricated steel. A piece of shipping pallet that was still attached to the steel fell from overhead and struck an employee in the head knocking him to the ground. The employee was admitted to the hospital for a concussion.

While removing and replacing worn wire rope on a hydraulic tugger winch, the injured employee's left foot was caught in the wire rope while the drum was rotating.   The employee was hospitalized and had toes on his left foot amputated.
An employee on a ladder was installing cable at a residential home when he fell 17 to 20 feet and suffered multiple head injuries.
On 11/16/2016, at 3:30 PM, an employee was struck by an aircraft ground support vehicle and suffered severe head injuries.
An employee was operating an electric pallet jack when he lost control and was pinned between the jack and a metal storage rack. He suffered lacerations and a muscle injury to his lower left leg.

An employee was operating a front end loader inside of a cargo hold on a ship docked midstream. As he exited the cab of the loader, he lost his footing on the step and fell to the floor of the cargo hold, fracturing his right leg.
While walking to his car, the employee fell to the ground and suffered a laceration to the eye.
An employee was cleaning around the dough machine when the employee's gloved hand became caught in the auger, amputating the left and ring fingertips.
An employee was operating a forklift. While turning into an aisle, the employee lost control of the forklift and put his left hand out catching his left thumb between the forklift and the racking.

An employee instructed a coworker to reverse a forklift so he could use the back portion as a work platform. He then cut a piece of 1/4" manila rope to use as a tagline around the protruding end of a pipe. He attempted to tighten the rope, but when he cinched down, the 1/4" manila rope broke, causing him to fall face first into gravel. He suffered two fractured left eye bones and three fractured ribs.
An employee was hospitalized on 10/15/16 when diagnosed with advanced cellulitis on his right leg resulting from puncture wounds from thorny vegetation indigenous to the patrol area.

An employee was side loading an ATV onto a one-ton flatbed truck.  When loading the employee felt the wheels slip, hit the gas and subsequently traveled across the bed of the truck and hit the 4" bump rail.  The ATV flipped and propelled the employee over the handle bars and to the ground and the ATV fell on the employee.

An employee was moving a waist high, three foot long freezer to clean behind it. She was using the handle on the freezer to pull it away from the wall when her hand slipped off the handle causing her to lose balance and fall to the floor. She fractured her pelvis in two places.

An employee had attached braces to a tank using a ladder. He started to climb down and fell approximately 7 to 8 feet to the ground striking his head. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured skull and ribs.
The employee was putting paper products on a storage shelf and fell 2-3 feet from the step ladder fracturing a hip.

An employee was preparing to rig up a laydown truck using a rake. He was standing on top of the rake when it was activated. The rake then came back up and smashed his left foot between it and the laydown truck.
An employee slipped and fell on the wet floor while getting some cheese from a cooler, fracturing the left leg and scraping the right arm.
While rolling cans, an employee's right-hand fingers were caught in the roller, crushing/avulsing the fingers and resulting in a possible amputation.
An employee tripped and fell fracturing a hip.
An employee was working in a field environment and stepped near a hole where a rattlesnake contacted the employee on the lower leg.
An employee amputated the tip of his left index finger while working with the winder machine.
As an employee was rolling a 200-pound paper roll, another roll behind him became unstable and rolled onto his left leg, breaking it.

An employee was moving a large metal plate with a forklift. The metal plate was slung under the forks of the lift. As the employee guided it, the load fell and amputated the tip of the employee's left index finger.

On or about January 11, 2016, at 10:30 a.m., an employee was operating a CNC saw and made a trim cut. When he tried to remove the scrap piece, the front-side pressure device activated and trapped his left pinky finger, avulsing part of the skin. He was hospitalized with a partial finger amputation.

Two employees were removing a 4' x 3' part from the welding jig with an overhead hoist.  The part got stuck, then broke loose, and dropped on the employee's right pinky finger. The finger was amputated at first knuckle.
An employee fell approximately 3.5 to 4 feet from the bed of a shingle delivery truck to the ground and was hospitalized overnight.

On 10/20/2015 at about 11:45 AM, the injured employee was in the process of repositioning forks on a rough terrain forklift with his bare hands (no gloves). His right hand was near the tip end and his left hand at the heel end. He lifted with his right hand so that he could slide the fork along the fork bar. His right hand slipped and his left little finger got caught between the heel and the carriage. The distal end was crushed and severely lacerated (partial amputation).
An employee was helping a customer load merchandise into their vehicle. A forklift was backing up and crushed the employee's right foot. The employee suffered two fractured toes and required surgery.
While returning to the construction site from lunch, an employee slipped/tripped and fell onto the excavator blade lacerating the employee's right shin. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was trimming tree limbs when he was struck by a truck driven by a patron. He suffered right leg and head/brain trauma, requiring surgery.
An employee stepped on a spray nozzle and fell onto a concrete floor, fracturing and dislocating her ankle and requiring hospitalization.
Employee fell down a single step coming out of a meeting and broke a hip.
An employee was marking plates for framing on the 2nd floor while standing on a 6-foot ladder. He slipped and fell on his way down the ladder and struck his head, cracking the back of his skull.
An employee was handing out food samples at the store, fainted and fell to the floor fracturing an ankle.
A worker was off loading a truck and fell through the empty bay door resulting in a left hip fracture.

An employee was delivering mail on a mail route. She was moving the postal truck to the next stop when she heard loud engines approaching her vehicle. The racing car was unable to stop before hitting the rear end of the postal vehicle. After impact, the postal vehicle traveled approximately 40 feet. The employee was hospitalized for broken ribs and a broken collar bone.
While helping to place mats on a basketball court, an employee tripped on a stack of mats and fell on a flashlight and the ground, breaking the right femur.
An employee slipped and fell from a ladder while handling cattle feed. He broke his arm while attempting to break his fall.

An employee was cleaning a trailer with a steam cleaner. The vent was not working correctly and the steam turned to water splashing onto the employee. The employee received first and second degree burns on the arms and chest.
An employee was walking from the south end of the mill to the north end of the mill when he tripped and fell, causing a fracture to his elbow. The employee was hospitalized for his injuries.
An employee slipped and fell on an icy brick walkway, tearing her right ACL.
An employee fell while walking between his truck's catwalk and the trailer to get bungee cords to secure the trailer load. He broke three ribs, punctured a lung, and broke his collarbone.
An employee's left middle finger was pinched between a metal bin and a hopper, amputating the fingertip.
An employee slipped on ice while on foot patrol, fell to the ground, and shattered his pelvis.

The injured employee was helping another employee remove a three foot concrete wall from a hoist. When the wall was removed from the hoist it became unstable and fell onto the injured employee's right foot fracturing it.
An employee was using a chainsaw to clear vegetation from a customer's powerlines. He was hospitalized for severe dehydration and high levels of enzymes in the kidneys due to heat exposure.

On July 22, 2015, an employee was working inside a trench box, attempting to place dunnage under one side of the trench box to protect utility lines. The excavator bucket was used to lift one end of the trench box so dunnage could be placed underneath that section. The bucket unexpectedly released from the boom of the excavator as it raised a portion of the trench box. The bucket fell into the trench box, striking and crushing the employee who was hospitalized and had several surgeries.
An employee tripped on a portable monitor cord and broke the right patella.
An employee fell 12 feet from an aerial lift while laying ornamental sheet metal. The employee sustained a broken vertebrae.

An employee was doing maintenance work on a conveyor, checking to see if material or debris had fallen down under the conveyor. The conveyor was stopped and the employee went to grab something he saw underneath it.  When the person who controlled the movement of the conveyor saw the employee reach under the conveyor, he put the handheld control down to walk towards the employee. When he went to place it down, he accidentally dropped the control and it energized the conveyor. The employee was caught between the conveyor and a cross bar under the conveyor, crushing his abdomen. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was installing water irrigation piping and pivots. A pipe broke and hit the employee on the arm, breaking it and resulting in hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was changing a pulley on the feed roller conveyor. The employee's right index fingertip was caught in the pulley and amputated.

On September 7, 2016, at approximately 12:05 p.m., an employee was lifting a manhole lid when it slipped and pinched his finger between the cover and manhole opening, amputating his right middle fingertip.
An employee tripped over the leg of a coworker who was kneeling down and fell to the ground, breaking her pelvis.
An employee fell on plastic pellets from a hopper and broke his left hip. He was hospitalized.

An employee was standing on the edge of a metal tub approximately 1 foot from floor level when his foot slipped off the tub, causing an abrasion to his lower left leg. His injury became infected and required hospitalization.

On 1/21/15, at approximately 5:00 a.m., an employee was performing a torching operation when a piece of hot material entered his left safety shoe, causing a burn on the top of the left foot. Employee informed supervisor and supervisor performed first aid by applying burn ointment on burn and wrapping foot. The employee completed his shift. The employee returned to worked and completed his shifts on 1/22 and 1/23 and was not at work on 1/25. The employee came to the supervisor's office on 1/26/15 with a severely infected foot and was told to go to the occupational clinic. The employee went to the occupational clinic on 1/27. The clinic sent the employee to the emergency room and the emergency room doctor admitted the employee.
An employee working in a restaurant was traveling from the kitchen to the dinning room, slipped on a wet floor, and fell injuring her pelvis.

An employee was carrying a carton of eggs downstairs at the cafeteria. She missed the bottom stair and fell to the ground, fracturing her left ankle/foot and spraining her right ankle. She was hospitalized.
An employee's arm got caught in conveyor belt guide rollers while troubleshooting the equipment, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was unloading the truck, tripped in a rut and fell onto their right side rupturing the L4 vertebrae.

Two forklifts collided in the processing area causing one of them to tip over.  The employee in the forklift that tipped over sustained a broken arm and a broken ankle requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee developed an infection after having a sliver of metal in his hand.

An employee was spraying a colony of bees using an aerosol spray when he was stung by two bees on the face and arm. He suffered a heart attack after being stung. Proper PPE was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee fell from a ladder and struck the ground while painting/staining a log cabin, requiring hospitalization.

A cashier was walking through the kitchen area with papers from the front.  The cooks were cleaning the fryer.  They drained the oil from the fryer into a stock pot and set it on the floor in the aisle.  The cashier tripped over the pot and the oil splashed onto her feet.  She was taken to the hospital.
Two forklifts collided in a warehousing operation. One employee was injured by the fork of the other forklift truck.
An employee was cleaning an empty space at the job site when a recluse spider bit his lower left leg.

On or about 0530 hrs on the 2nd day of June 2015, an employee was injured when the vehicle he was driving overturned on a lease road approximately five miles east of Mentone Texas. The employee was hospitalized with three broken ribs on the right side of the thorax and a broken rib on the left side of the thorax.

Four employees were dumping fixtures from the platform on a forklift into the dumpster. An employee climbed up the side steps of the dumpster to pull fixtures from the platform and fell to the ground fracturing both shoulders, a knee and the nose.
A truck driver slipped on the concrete floor and fractured an elbow.
An employee's hand was caught in the plant removal roller and wrenched.
As an employee was attempting to put a screen back on a spin dryer, he stepped into an opening on an auger and his leg was crushed/fractured by the auger.

An employee was trying to help guide a load by grabbing onto a tag line. He tripped over the stands made out of wood that were holding the extension cords off the ground and landed on his left arm, causing a fracture.
Employee was offloading steel from a truck when the load shifted, pinning his right arm between the steel. The employee did not break any bones and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was operating a lathe on 08/04/2015 when he got some of the shavings in his fingers. He attempted to remove the shavings himself. His finger became infected.
An employee was troubleshooting a motor for air leaks when his fingers contacted the fan, amputating the tips of the left middle and ring fingers.
An employee fell 5 to 6 feet while moving material into a dumpster, fracturing ribs and bruising the lower back and left hip.
An employee sustained a fractured ankle when she was struck by an oncoming vehicle that entered the work zone.
An employee tripped on her chair and fell, fracturing her femur bone.
An employee was taking out the trash when the wind blew the fence into her head, fracturing her skull.

An electrician at the Ford Motor plant was driving a scissor lift. He stopped the lift to begin work on an electrical panel.  When he stopped the lift it rocked, causing his hand to get caught between the lift basket and the electrical panel.  His left pinky finger was crushed resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was attempting to drive a forklift off of a trailer bed when the forklift went off the side of the trailer bed and crushed the employee. The employee suffered six fractured ribs, a partially collapsed lung and a lacerated spleen.
An excavator backed over an employee's left foot, resulting in surgical amputation.
An employee suffered a hernia while cleaning the kitchen and lifting a floor grate.
A temporary employee operating a "Set Out Press" amputated half an inch of a finger while retrieving a metal part from the press.
An employee was unjamming a bagging machine and amputated the left index finger to the first digit.
An employee working in a boom lift came in contact with a 277-volt electrical line, suffering a third-degree burn to the left hand and a right-hand laceration.
A nurse was backing away from a bed ridden patient and tripped on a portable computer resulting in a fractured vertebrae.
An employee was doing maintenance work when a corrosive dip tank solution soaked into the employee's glove and caused burns to the hand.

An employee was on a stepladder installing a sprinkler pipe in a stairwell. He was on the fourth rung of an 8 foot step ladder tightening a fitting when the wrench slipped causing him to fall over the railing to the lower level, then roll down the stairs, ending up two levels below his starting point. He was hospitalized with a concussion, five broken ribs and a punctured lung.

A masonry contractor was helping to move a mattress in a home owner's 2nd floor condo.  The masonry contractor did not observe that a glassed area had the glass wall removed and he fell through the open area.  The employee was taken to hospital for a broken collarbone, three broken ribs and a head injury.

An employee working from a ladder was installing a pipe when a fitting came loose. The pipe fell, struck the employee's left leg, and caused him to lose his balance. He fell down the ladder and broke his right heel.
An employee was attempting to clear a backup on a fillet machine line when his right middle finger was severely lacerated.

Employee was hospitalized after a cleaning hose came loose from the clean-in-place system.  The employee was sprayed in the face with cleaning solution. He was treated in a local ER and then transferred and admitted to Wellstar Cobb.

An employee was tipping over (breaking open) a mold that contained liquid molten iron. The molten iron came in contact with the cuff of his leather glove and traveled down the inside of his glove to the palm and fingers, burning his hand.
While helping to install a metal hand railing, an employee suffered cramping due to working in the heat. The employee was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion.

On April 11, 2015, at approximately 0930 hours, an employee was unjamming several bottles passing through a coating hood at the hot end of the man conveyor. As the employee pulled the hot bottles towards himself to unstick them, they hit the floor and shattered. The shattered glass made contact with the hem of his pants, causing a flare up that ignited his clothing. He was burned on approximately 80 percent of his body.
An employee tripped on a cable ramp and fell to the floor, fracturing her right elbow and wrist.

On 07/18/2016, at approximately 11:30 a.m., an employee was operating a flour mill, a machine that consists of a hopper that goes into an airlock. The airlock moves air with a squirrel cage type system. The hopper became clogged, so the employee unbolted and removed a plate to try and clear the clog. The employee's right hand then hit the squirrel cage's assembly, amputating the middle finger at the first knuckle.
An employee was driving a standup forklift in the finished good aisle when he was pinned between the lift and racking, breaking his left forearm and fracturing his left ribs.
An employee was offloading product when he fell and hit his head. He was hospitalized for treatment and testing.

While reaching through a hole in a wall an employee stepped on a ladder that was leaning against the lower part of this opening. He stepped above the fulcrum of the ladder. Therefore, the ladder acted like a teeter-totter and the employee fell about two feet and broke his left ankle.

An employee grinded a steel pipe that was approximately 24" in diameter x 40' long. An excavator machine with a nylon strap then raised the pipe. One end of the strap was connected to the excavator machine and the other end of the strap was around the pipe. During the pipe raising, one end of the pipe came free and struck the employee's left leg, breaking it below the knee.

An employee was greasing a mill drum and trunnion. This procedure is performed with the drum running so the contact area gets completely covered. During the process, the employee tried to grab some grease that had dropped on the ground and lost his footing. When this happened, three fingers on his left hand became caught and amputated between the trunnion and the drum.

An employee was performing maintenance on skid steer equipment. The employee was changing the bucket and putting pins on. The lock pins were stuck so the employee used a pry bar to pop it loose, but it did not come apart. The employee asked another worker to tilt the skid while the pry bar was in the front of the equipment. The employee's left ring finger got caught between the pry bar and the skid steer carriage resulting in amputation of the finger.
Employee partially amputated index finger with sledge hammer.
An employee was walking down the stairs and tripped and fell breaking a leg. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell and broke her hip resulting in a hospitalization.

An employee was assisting another worker with transporting bricks to complete the job. The employee was climbing down from the scaffold when he slipped on one of the railings and fell approximately six feet striking another piece of the scaffold during the fall. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg.
An employee was hospitalized on 7/27/2015 for a bacterial infection in his calf that developed after contacting contaminated water that was in a pipe he was cutting.

An employee was loading a truck of cement when the loading process clogged. When the employee attempted to clear the clog, a large amount of cement dumped onto him, causing respiratory distress. He was hospitalized.
An employee was adjusting the dye in a press brake when the press brake came down and crushed his left hand.

On 7/4/15, at about 9:40 p.m., an employee was walking beside a push back vehicle while pushing back an aircraft. While the employee disconnected aircraft from the push back vehicle, the tow bar fell and peeled the skin back on the employee's left ring finger. The employee was hospitalized for a fracture and required surgical reconstruction of the fingertip.
An employee's hand was crushed while operating a dough machine.

An employee performing wheel dressing operations on the TGI Centerless Grinder was injured when he reached into the grinding wheel to extract the dummy plug. He sustained a right index finger amputation.
An employee was retrieving coins from a safe located behind the customer service counter. The safe door closed by itself, pinching and amputating the tip of the employee's left thumb.
A employee was hit by a car injuring both legs.
On August 19, an employee was feeding sod into a jammed plug machine. While trying to clear the jam, her finger got cut on the blades, which were still spinning. She later had the tip amputated.
Employee in the Machine Shop received second degree burns to the back of his legs after the torch he was using exploded.
An employee was preparing to clean the cheese cutter. As he was moving the machine, his right index finger got caught between the push plate and the post amputating the tip of the right index finger.
An employee cut three fingers while dadoing.

Employees were running rods downhole on a servicing rig when the pump hit a tight spot causing slack on the rods. The slack resulted in the rod elevator breaking and allowing the rods to come loose. The rod struck the employee in the middle, right side of the back and knocked him to the ground.
An employee suffered an amputation while working in the facility.

An employee was unclogging a pump. While tightening the lid, the lid popped off and water at approximately 180 degrees splashed onto the employee's body burning his upper extremities. The employee received second and third degree burns.

An employee climbed a ladder to assess the next level of a metal roof. He stepped on a shingle and fell 8 feet through the roof to the ground, breaking his right index finger, left middle finger, right hip, and back.
An employee was working from an extension ladder when he fell breaking his right ankle.

An employee was trying to separate a piece of angle iron on the pipe rack with his hands. He separated one side of the angle iron from the other two pieces. He was walking next to the pipe rack to get to the other side when the pipe rack collapsed and landed on him, breaking his leg.
An employee delivering mail tripped and fell, breaking his hip.
An employee suffered a broken forearm while changing a coil on a tire machine.

A temporary employee was operating a planer to cut a bevel on a 40 foot steel plate. The employee stepped off the planer to remove a metal chip on the plate as it was being automatically moved into the planer, which resulted in his left foot getting caught under the plate clamp. The employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment of his broken foot and leg above the ankle.

An employee was trying to put plastic up on a building to protect it against the elements. The wind caught the plastic and knocked the employee off the 12-foot ladder. The employee suffered a hairline fracture of the lower back.
An employee's arm was caught under the conveyor belt and broken.
On 12/2/15, at about 3:30 p.m., two employees got into an altercation. One employee was pushed to the ground and was hospitalized with a shoulder and back sprain/strain.
An employee was carrying a box he picked up from a pallet when he caught his shoe on the edge of the pallet and fell.
An employee was pushing a rolling cooler out of an elevator. The cooler started to tip over and fell on her left foot.
A maintenance employee was unclogging a sewer line when the auger cable twisted and wrapped around his left ring finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was working in the HT Unit changing a filter. The employee was sprayed in the face with hot water that could have been 100 degrees Celsius. The employee was taken to the hospital and treated for first degree burns to his face and neck.
An employee was installing a light fixture, contacted a live wire, and fell off a ladder. The employee sustained multiple skull fractures, facial contusions, and a burn on his hand and arm.

An employee was on top of a provisioning truck replacing snacks on an aircraft when his truck was pushed over by another aircraft that was being repositioned. He fell 10 feet and suffered a bruised lung and back injury.
Employee suffered an amputation injury to his right hand pinky finger while performing maintenance work on the Ferris Wheel located at the theme park.
An employee was cutting rubber parts on a bench cutter when the blade came down and cut her right middle finger (possible amputation).

An employee was receiving trimmed PVC membrane pieces from a calendar when his finger came in contact with the blade amputating a fingertip. He was wearing cut-resistant gloves at the time of the incident.
An employee was operating a meat saw and amputated the right index fingertip.

An employee was attempting to raise a load with an air hoist when the air hoist came loose from its anchor point and swung down, striking the employee's torso and breaking ribs. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was gluing magnet assemblies at a table with caster wheels. She unlocked the caster wheels and started rolling the table to another location. The table splintered and fell, along with all its contents, onto the employee's right ankle. She was hospitalized and required surgery for a compound fracture to her ankle.
An employee lost balance while walking up the stairs and fell backwards down the stairs. The employee sustained bruises and lacerations and slight bleeding on the brain.
An employee was cutting the pancreas from the gut when the knife slipped and cut the left forearm.
An employee was dismantling a furnace scraper when a part of the scraper weighing approximately 40,000 lbs. fell on his right foot amputating multiple toes.

An employee suffered severe burns to his nose, eyes, forehead, right forearm, and the frontal region of his neck when pressurized, hot product exploded and sprayed on him as he was looking in the cooker machine.

An employee had to walk around the end of a conveyor at the front of the line to retrieve a hose for cleaning. While walking by the conveyor, his hand was pulled under the fabricated guide. He suffered a fracture.
An employee received a finger amputation while attempting to trouble shoot a boring machine that would not start.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while operating a press machine.

The employee was trying to remove the mast from the forklift that was being held by a chain fall.  He bumped the stuck mast to lower it and it fell.  His arms were caught under the cross piece of the mast.

Employees were removing downed trees blocking a roadway. A pickup truck got stuck in the mud.  An employee used a dozer to remove the truck, which got wedged next to the tree. The employee used a chainsaw to cut the tree, and the tension caused the tree to snap and injure the employee. Three bones between the knee and left ankle broke. The employee was hospitalized.

A stack of plywood came out of a press machine and did not fully roll out onto the roller bed to be picked up by a forklift. An employee tried to manually complete the cycle on the machine to move the stack of plywood. The load of wood then smashed his hand, breaking his thumb and lacerating his hand.

Frac technicians conducting monitoring operations on water levels of gauging tanks during oil and gas drilling operations are potentially overexposed to air contaminants and respiratory irritants such as chlorine, hydrogen sulfide, and benzene.  Recently, an employee was admitted to the hospital for observation and treatment after suffering from an extreme coughing episode after working a monitoring shift at the worksite.  A second employee was treated and released.

An employee was loading wheel sets onto his flatbed truck trailer when one of them started to roll. The wheel struck him and caused him to fall off the trailer, resulting in a broken hip that required hospitalization.
An employee was injured while operating a pallet jack at Doyle's Wholesale. The pallet jack ran over the employee's foot, requiring reconstructive surgery.
An employee fell from a ladder to the concrete floor below, fracturing his left leg and requiring surgery.
An employee was injured when a fork truck backed into him, pinning him against a stand-up desk and crushing his abdomen. He was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a steel beam on non-gravity rollers when his left middle finger got caught between the roller and steel beam.

An employee was dumping bags of dry phosphoric acid into a mixer from an elevated platform that was 8-feet, 9-inches high off the ground. A forklift had a pallet of the dry phosphoric acid.  The portion calls for 40 bags to be dumped. The pallet was airborne, not sitting on the platform.  The employee finished dumping the bags, turned to look for something, and fell between the pallet and the platform. The opening between the pallet and platform was 35 inches. The employee was unconscious and required hospitalization.
An employee slipped off a conveyor railing while leveling cheese and his hand entered the tumbler resulting in a partial amputation without bone loss to the right pinky fingertip.

An employee was scanning a bundle of steel for inventory on a flatbed railcar. He was turning to step down from the railcar when he lost his footing and fell approximately 3.5 feet to the ground, injuring his shoulder.
An employee was pulling products to fill an order when a passing forklift ran over and broke his foot.
An employee was riding a horse in the feedlot and fell to the ground. He required surgery to repair the damage to his pelvis.

An employee was inside the block plant maintenance shop waiting for a coworker to finish cutting pieces of angle iron with an electric-powered reciprocating saw. While the saw was operating, the employee's finger contacted the belt running between the saw's electric motor and the flywheel.  The employee's left index fingertip was caught between the belt and pulley, resulting in a partial fingertip amputation.

An employee was sitting on the back of a pick-up truck throwing salt. When he dismounted the truck to retrieve something that had fallen, he lost his footing and fell, hitting the back of his head and requiring hospitalization.

On or about 3/31/2015, at approximately 9:50 p.m., an employee was hospitalized with a chin laceration. The employee was operating a mechanically powered hot trim press. After the press cycle, the work piece became stuck in the upper die of the press. The work piece then fell from the die and struck the hand tongs the employee was holding, which caused the tong's handle to strike the employee in the chin.
An employee was filling a bend with hot water when the hot water spilled on him, causing serious burns.
A letter carrier fell on an icy driveway at a customer's residence resulting in a broken left ankle that required an in-patient hospitalization and surgical procedure.
An employee was participating in equine training when he fell off the horse. He was hospitalized with fatigue.

An employee sustained a broken arm while cleaning a food production roller, which was energized and pulled him into the machine. The rollers were unguarded and not locked out at the time of the incident.

An employee was troubleshooting problems with the tooling on a mill roll. As part of the troubleshooting process, he had to feel the polished mill roll for imperfections as the machine was running. As he was feeling the roll with his hand, the roll pulled his hand into razor sharp sheet metal that is formed in the mill machine. Contact with the mill roll partially severed the tip of the employee's left index finger. The employee was hospitalized, and his fingertip was medically removed.

A BP employee and two contractor employees were conducting a pre-job assessment at the electrical sub-station when an electrical arc flash occurred from an electrical box, injuring all three employees. The BP employee suffered facial burns.

Employee was leaving a private residence where she had provided home health care and slipped on a snow-covered handicap ramp.  Employee was transported to the Hospital of Central Connecticut New Britain Campus where she was admitted and treated for a fractured left ankle.

The employee was delivering freight out of a bobtail.  He was using an electric pallet jack to maneuver a pallet of freight onto the lift gate and lower the pallet to the ground.  During this process, he fell approximately 3.5 feet off the lift gate to the concrete drive.

An employee operating a forklift was unable to stop the forklift from moving. His hand reached out of the cage to try to stop the lift. When that didn't work, he pulled his hand back in and realized it was injured.
An employee was working on a die cut machine that manufactures metal caps when the machine amputated his right pointer finger.
An employee installing conduit for primary underground wire was hospitalized for heat stress.

An employee was changing a Dayton-style wheel. While removing the lugs, the employee hit the tire with a hammer and loosened the wheel. As the employee removed the last nut, the tire blew out, becoming a projectile that hit the employee in the face.

The employee was loading parts onto a rotating conveyor system when the machine malfunctioned and the parts got wedged in the machine. When the employee reached into the running machine to remove the parts, his finger was pinched resulting in the amputation of the left index finger to the first knuckle.

An employee was helping to assemble a standard duty wrecker and was in the process of guiding a part into position when a component inside of the part shifted and pinched/partially amputated the employee's finger between two sections.

An employee was helping coworkers trying to undo tension on a 1.5 ton come-a-long. The injured employee struck the angle brace that the come-a-long was attached to. The hook of the come-a-long broke free, striking the employee in the lower jaw/face.
An employee conducting maintenance work was caught in the sprocket of a moving conveyor and fractured bones in his left wrist.
An employee tripped and fell while walking back from a meeting. She was hospitalized with a broken left hip.

An employee was performing maintenance on a trimmer saw. When the employee removed the chock block, the saw blade rotated, amputating a centimeter of his index finger (no nail or bone loss) and avulsing his middle finger.
An employee was changing the fuel filter on an all-terrain skid loader. The skid loader was turned on while the gear was engaged, causing the unit to roll over and crush the employee's legs.

On or about June 21, 2016, an employee was at a customer's residence to provide an estimate for a chimney repair. As the employee was climbing the ladder, he lost his balance and fell, injuring his back and ribs.

On or about October 8, 2015, at 1135 hours, a worker for Hilmar Cheese Company was unhooking a hose from a truck that he thought had finished unloading heavy cream. The truck was still loading and the hose was under pressure. When the worker unhooked the hose, the valve slammed shut on his finger. The worker was taken to Dalhart Memorial Hospital and later to BSA Hospital in Amarillo, where the distal phalanges of his right index finger were removed due to the extent of his injury.
An employee was lifting a man-hole cover with his hand when it fell and struck his right index finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was walking on a catwalk while sanitizing a de-stoner machine when he tripped and fell, landing on the edge of the de-stoner guard on the platform below. He lacerated his left forearm.
An employee injured his right hip that required surgery when the golf cart he was driving flipped.

An employee was troubleshooting a sheave (the mechanism that lowers and raises an elevator) when the sheave rotated. His right middle finger was then caught and amputated between the sheave and the elevator cable.
An employee was helping a resident when the resident pushed her. She lost her balance and fell to the floor, breaking two bones in her left forearm.

On or about September 12, 2016, an employee was repairing a vehicle when the unchocked vehicle rolled from its ramp and struck the employee in the head, causing lacerations that required hospitalization.

During a power outage, an employee was helping to clear a line of tree branches at an electrical substation using a pole pruner. A branch fell after it was cut, striking a live line and the employee.  The employee got shocked and was burned on his hands and torso.
An employee was feeding material into a Dado saw when the left and middle ring fingers were amputated.
While cutting chicken wings into segments using a back saw, an employee amputated the distal segment of the left-hand thumb.

An employee was taking out the trash on February 20, 2016. When she opened the gate to the dumpster area, the wind blew the gate back at her and knocked her down, breaking her left hip and requiring surgery.
An employee was climbing into a truck when he slipped and fell, landing on his neck. He broke two neck bones.
An employee fell 5 feet off scaffolding and fractured the left wrist. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was helping to set up a trellis from a man basket being lifted by forklift. The basket sat directly on top of the forks, approximately 14-to 16-feet-high. When the employee moved to the end of the basket, the basket tipped and he fell out. The basket then landed on top of him. He broke teeth, fractured multiple ribs, broke his back, and suffered internal stomach bleeding. The basket was not secured at the time of the incident.
An employee was using an alligator shear to cut a nickel alloy plate when his hand and thumb contacted the shear's nip point. The bone behind his knuckle was crushed/fractured.
During an operation in Odessa, Texas an agent received a gun shot wound to his right foot.
An employee was hospitalized and had his right thumb amputated after his hand was injured in the cooling fan of a chiller unit he was troubleshooting.

An employee was using a flight simulator and was attempting to slide the right seat (passenger).  The vertical seat adjustment lever was activated instead of the horizontal adjustment, and the seat went down while his right hand was searching underneath for the horizontal seat adjustment mechanism, amputating a fingertip.

On December 11, 2015 at approximately 11:00 AM, a staffing worker was asked by the host company to get on the roof to help take off fiberglass panels. The employee stepped on a weak spot and fell through twelve feet breaking his right femur and sustaining other injuries to his spine and ribs.
An employee suffered an amputation when their left hand (fifth digit) got stuck in a belt behind one of the bowling machines.
The employee amputated her right pinky finger when a trash room door shut on her finger.
An employee was moving chem-grate flooring through a door when the employee's fingers got pinched between the door and the metal plate, causing an amputation.
While on a ladder replacing a fiberglass boom in a mechanical tree trimmer, an employee was knocked off the ladder and fell to the ground. The employee suffered a fractured hip.
An employee was removing dough from the mixer and amputated a finger on his right hand.

An employee on a ladder was working on a circuit that he thought was de-energized. He grabbed the circuit with lineman pliers. He was knocked off the ladder by a coworker, sustaining a shoulder fracture and shock injuries.
An employee was struck by a 2,000-pound pipe while working on a service rig. He sustained damage to his left ankle.
An employee was retrieving a piece of meat from under a deli slicer when her right ring fingertip made contact with the blade and was amputated.
An employee was working in an aeration basin and attempted to retrieve a grappling hook when he slipped and fell breaking his lower left leg.
An employee was dumping items from a lugger into a metal dumpster. When the employee lifted the lugger and released the handle, the handle hit and amputated his left third fingertip.

An employee was climbing a ladder to access and repair a piece of air compressor equipment when the ladder kicked off and came in contact with the structural surface. The employee suffered three non-displaced rib fractures and contusions.

An employee was fabricating metal. He drew it over and was grinding off the weld when a tacked piece of metal used to clamp the weld shield came free and hit the grinder. The grinder fell over and cut his right forearm.
An employee fell backwards and hit his/her head on the ground while approaching a semi-truck to open the door. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell from a 3-foot high deck truss and caught an adjacent truss just under his ribcage causing a blood vessel to rupture resulting in significant internal bleeding. He was hospitalized.
Employee was walking on the sidewalk when she fell and hit her head resulting in a concussion.

Employees were laying a tarp over a section of a trench. Two employees slipped and fell approximately eight feet into the trench. Both employees were hospitalized. Employee 1 suffered broken ribs. Employee 2 suffered torn tendons/ligaments in his hands.

An employee was repairing a slicer and was pushing on the pulley when the motor started. His finger got caught between the belt and pulley, amputating his right middle fingertip and requiring surgery.

An employee was installing a steel plate on an inner-bottom using an overhead crane. As the employee lifted the steel plate with the crane, it became wedged between two steel frames. He continued applying lifting force with the crane and the plate sprang loose, striking him the face. He suffered multiple facial injuries, including trauma, a broken nose, an eye socket fracture, and a skull fracture.
An employee was struck by a car exiting the garage and onto a driveway. The injured employee was walking behind the vehicle as it backed up to change direction.
An employee was walking outside the warehouse when the employee slipped on a thin layer of black ice and fell to the ground breaking an ankle.
An employee was descending from a tree when the rope came untied from the saddle and the employee fell approximately 25-30 feet fracturing the left hip and several ribs.
While hanging chickens on shackles, an employee's right ring finger was caught on a shackle, resulting in a finger amputation.

An employee was walking by a pouch converting machine when she noticed a fold in the plastic and attempted to correct it. At the same time, the operator jogged the machine, which pulled her hand between two rollers and amputated her index finger and half of her pinky finger. The guard was not in place at the time.

An employee was operating a packer machine when he attempted to grab a piece of flex duct that was hanging from the back. His right index finger was caught and amputated by the machine, and his middle finger was cut.
On 9/27/2016, at approximately 3:44 p.m., an employee was performing foundation concrete forming work when he was struck by lightning and suffered burns, requiring hospitalization.
An employee drove a forklift to the maintenance area and parked in front of the maintenance door. As he was descending out of the cab, he slipped and fell fracturing the left femur.
An employee was pushing a die cart when a wheel got stuck in a hole. As he went to push it out, he felt a pop in his left calf muscle. He was later hospitalized when his left calf became infected.
An employee was washing dishes when she slipped, fell, and broke her hip.  She was hospitalized.

An employee was rigging up forms and installing a lifting hook when the crane operator inadvertently lifted the form. The employee's finger was then caught between the form and the lifting hook, amputating the first left-hand digit.

An employee and coworkers were using machetes to cut overgrown brush and grass to create a clear path to use surveying equipment. A coworker's machete struck the left hand of the employee, amputating the employee's left index finger.
A temporary employee was operating a packaging machine and amputated the right index finger. The guard was removed at the time of the incident.
An employee was adjusting the track control on a conveyor when his hand got caught by the chain, partially amputating his left middle and ring fingers.

At a delivery site branch, employee was unloading an 18-wheeler truck of milk into a delivery truck. The two trucks were parked next to each other and a ramp was landed between the two trucks' side doors. The employee was using the ramp to cross from one truck to another. While the employee was still standing on the ramp, the ramp fell from its holding place. The fall was approximately 4 feet. The employee was still standing when the ramp fell with him on it; however, after landing on the ground, the employee collapsed. Both of the employee's ankles were broken.  The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted.

An employee was on an extension ladder working on a cable TV system. The cable broke while he was climbing and the ladder shifted. The employee fell 12 feet landing on his right leg sustaining a compression fracture just above the ankle.

An employee was attempting to change the buffing blades on an automatic tire buffing machine. While he was using a wrench to remove the blade head, the machine turned on. The wrench became entangled in his clothing and pulled him into the machine, breaking his right wrist and lacerating his right forearm, bicep, and leg. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
Employee was moving pieces of wood into the hospital and incurred a splinter to his hand.  He removed the splinter and a cellulitis infection occurred, requiring hospitalization for treatment.
An employee fell to the floor while walking down a hallway, fracturing their right knee, wrist, and shoulder.
Two employees were in a feed mill man lift. Some component in the lifting mechanism failed, causing the car to fall to the ground. Both employees sustained fractures to both legs.
An employee was helping to fill an asphalt tar kettle when the line failed and the employee's face and arms were severely burned. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a forklift when the forklift tipped over. The employee's leg was crushed under the rollover protection cage. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg and other bodily injuries.
An employee fell down the stairs, rupturing a tendon in his right knee and requiring hospitalization.

On May 9, 2016, at approximately 2:30 PM, an employee was carrying a loaded, 25- to 30-pound tool bag while descending permanent, inclined stairs. When he reached the sixth stair tread from the bottom, he lost his balance and fell, striking his right foot against the bulkhead beneath the stairs.  He fractured his right ankle and required surgery.

An employee was gathering tree limbs from the ground and feeding them into a chipper. While he was feeding the chipper, a piece of rope was caught in the feeder wheels and wrapped around his right hand, amputating his fingers.

On January 3, 2016, an employee was using a manual pallet jack. The forks were not completely under the pallet being towed. When the employee tugged on the pallet jack, the brakes went on and the employee fell to the ground. She suffered a contusion to her right hip and was hospitalized.
Employee suffered a puncture to his right ring finger from a thorn on a tree he was cutting down.  The injury later resulted in the employee's hospitalization.
A floor stripping cleaning chemical was spilled onto an employee and the employee received a chemical burn on the left hand and leg and the right foot.

On or about August 18, 2016, an employee was standing on a desktop while screwing an LED bulb into a new light fixture when he fell 39 inches to the floor below. He was hospitalized for a back injury.
An employee's hand was caught and injured in a laminating machine, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell 14 feet through a hole in the floor. The hole was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was cleaning the deck and noticed a 10' piece of angle iron in the way.  The employee attempted to move the angle iron when the left side of it became wedged between concrete and a metal support.  The employee was standing next to an I-beam support structure.  As the employee tried to move the angle iron back and forth, he slammed his right hand between the angle iron and the I-beam, pinching his right pinky finger and amputating the fingertip.
A Journeyman electrician was making an electrical connection on top of an above ground storage tank and fell twelve feet to the ground below injuring his back.
An employee suffered a left wrist cut while cutting trim with a miter saw when the employee's coat sleeve was caught in the guard.
An employee's finger was pinched between the housing and saw blade while setting up a band saw. The employee's fingertip was cut off, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning a power tool with break-cleaner spray and then activated the tool. Cleaner on the employee's hand and forearm was ignited causing possible second and third degree burns.

An employee was moving pallets with a forklift when it became stuck in the mud. Two coworkers attempted to pull the forklift out of the mud by tying two straps of fastener together with a clevis and attaching it to a truck that was pulling the forklift. The clevis then broke and swung back, striking and lacerating the employee's head.
An employee working on the roof fell and was hospitalized for vertebrae fractures.
An employee was under a house checking the propane line for leaks. While he was under the house he was bitten by a snake.
An employee fell from a ladder or the top of a truck to the ground, suffering broken ribs, a punctured lung, and head lacerations.
An employee fell to the dock floor and fractured his left elbow during delivery at the VA Hospital in East Orange, New Jersey.
An employee was walking on a railroad swing bridge platform carrying a wrench when he lost balance and stepped between bridge ties injuring his knee.
An employee operating a milling machine was hospitalized with a broken leg after being struck by the door of the machine.
An employee tripped over a halogen light stand and suffered a knee injury, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was about to install a fascia board on a roof. When he climbed out of a lift bucket onto the roof, he lost his footing and fell approximately 13 feet to the ground below. He broke his ankle and required surgery.
An employee working for Tecnico Corporation at the BAE facility stepped off the ladder and broke his leg.

The injured employee, a semi truck driver, left the company in Woodward to deliver a load at various locations in Oklahoma.  He left Woodward around 3:00 AM to go to the site in Laverne, OK.  When he got to the site, he opened the door and got a forklift truck out to unload the truck by himself. Someone came to the site later and found him on the ground.  He may have fallen from the back of the truck.  He had 3 broken ribs, a fractured skull and bleeding in the brain.
An employee fell from a job-made ladder while accessing the upper deck at a work site, suffering foot injuries.

On 10/21/15 at approximately 3:30 PM, an employee was cutting banding material off a stack of steel beams. The steel beams were 3 feet high and 20 feet long and came in stacks of two. They had wood blocking that held the two beams and steel banding material together. The employee was on the ground between two stacks of beams and was using a circular grinder to grind off the banding material. When he cut the last beam, the beams fell on him resulting in his hospitalization for a broken pelvis, right femur, and right tibia.

On or about 1/5/15, at 7:45 AM, an employee supervising the first shift noticed material buildup in the conveyor and decided to clean it.  She got caught in one of the belt conveyors, breaking both her bones from her forearm.

An employee was injured while unloading a bumper car. The employee was struck-by and crushed-by the material being unloaded. 

The employee suffered a broken leg and a concussion. 

The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was working on a motor house belt system when her arm got caught between the belt and the metal beam of the conveyor system.

An employee stuck her right hand into the covered (stout) part of the snow machine to remove stuck crushed ice. As she was removing her hand, the right middle finger was cut by a sharp metal object, resulting in a partial amputation of the fingertip.

On September 7, 2016, at approximately 8:38 PM, an employee was driving across the yard in a golf cart when his left hand was smashed between the cart and an adjacent garbage dumpster. He suffered two broken bones and an open wound, requiring hospitalization.
An employee lacerated his left forearm from the elbow to the wrist on a dovetail anchor as he poured concrete in formwork. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was getting up from a chair when the chair broke, causing the employee to fall and injure his right ankle.
An employee was walking to her car in the parking lot, tripped over a concrete parking block and fell breaking the right arm.
An employee was bitten by a copperhead snake while picking up loose material.

A temporary employee was operating a reach truck when the truck started heading straight toward a pedestrian guardrail. When the employee attempted to dismount the truck, the employee's foot became pinned between the reach truck and the guardrail, resulting in a left foot amputation.

While breaking down a hydraulic crane, an employee was in the process of removing the outrigger pad while the outrigger was retracting and got his left hand caught in a pinch point fracturing the middle and ring finger in two places.
An employee was seriously injured when he was struck by a pressure cap while performing an air pressure test on a 20-inch pipe.
An employee was delivering a pizza in a resident's driveway when an assailant sprayed her in the face with pepper spray. She experienced difficulty breathing and an upper respiratory issue.
An employee was installing insulation when he grabbed a truss that had a nail, puncturing his hand through his gloves. He required surgery when the wound became infected.

On 3/15/16, at 8:18 AM, an employee was operating a dock stacker when his thumb became pinched between the stacker and a bollard while leaving the staging area for automation. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery for crushing injuries to his thumb.
Two electricians came into contact with live parts which resulted in an arc explosion.
An employee fell to the ground while coming down a ladder, fracturing his right wrist.

On 6-16-2015 at 4:45 PM an employee was injured while dismounting a forklift inside a trailer. The  employee rolled an ankle which caused a dislocation and fracture to his toes requiring hospitalization and surgery to his left foot.

An employee was helping the lead repairman remove the fan drive from a truck. Both were using a long handle torque wrench. The employee was assisting for leverage. The lead repairman was pushing down the wrench and the employee's right hand was in the way. The employee had 3/4 inch of the tip of his right hand ring finger amputated.
An employee was working at a decorative line when the tip of the right pinky finger was amputated by the Rademaker machine.

An employee was scanning vehicles on a rail car and was descending a ladder when he lost his balance and fell approximately 12 to 14 feet to the concrete surface below. He broke his left hand, left wrist, left hip, and two ribs.
On Thursday, July 30, 2015, an employee suffered a left-hand index fingertip amputation while using a 130-ton hydraulic press brake with another operator.
An employee was hospitalized due to heat stress.

An employee fell through a drop ceiling while servicing the condenser on a cooling unit. The employee struck a 3'x4'x5' cart and then fell to the concrete floor below, fracturing the L1 and L2 vertebrae.

An employee fell approximately 15 feet from a fiberglass extension ladder while cutting a cable line at the mid line. The employee was wearing PFAS, but the positioning belt was not connected to the line. The employee sustained a broken collarbone and shoulder.

On February 24, 2017, a temporary employee was using tongs with his right hand to remove the hot metal/stamped piece from the point-of-operation on the forging punch press and placed it on the nearby heat belt (conveyor). Then, the employee sprayed the point-of-operation with his left hand holding the sprayer bottle. The employee reached into the point-of-operation with the sprayer bottle and his left hand was caught and crushed by the closing dies of the forging punch press. His left index finger was amputated at the middle knuckle.

An employee severed the right-hand index fingertip while cleaning a mixer used for batter at a food concession. The mixer was still plugged into an electrical outlet and was turned on at the time of the incident. The fingertip was severed when it got caught in the shaft.

On or about 16 April 2015 at approximately 0830 hrs an employee suffered an amputation of the distal phalanges located on the thumb of the left hand. The employee was retrieving keys from a safe when the door was accidently closed pinning her thumb between the door and the frame of the safe.
An employee slipped on the weather deck of a docked vessel and suffered a left shoulder/arm injury.
An employee suffered a fractured femur when he fell from a scaffold after the spreader beam that he had tied his fall protection to fell to the ground.
An employee was admitted to the hospital with a fractured femur after being struck by a piece of metal.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion after cleaning his tote area on the belt system.
An employee was trimming trees when his left index finger was pinched and amputated between a fallen branch and the bucket of the bucket truck.
An employee got a splinter in his finger that later became infected. The finger was amputated as a result.
While starting a pumping unit at a well site, an employee felt ill and asked for assistance. The employee was hospitalized for heat stroke.

An employee was troubleshooting the fourth filling spout on an assembly line machine. While attempting to fix it, the employee made contact with the machine and his finger got pinched. He sustained a left-hand fingertip amputation.
An employee was using a band saw to cut meat and amputated the right index fingertip below the last knuckle.
