An employee experienced heat-related symptoms, including dizziness and low blood pressure.  He was hospitalized for dehydration, acute renal failure, rhabdomyolysis, and hypotension.
Two workers were passing windows from an elevated trash box on a forklift to a balcony and fell approximately 3 stories, suffering back and head injuries.
An employee was between a bolster and a press frame when the bolster rolled on and crushed his right foot and ankle.

An employee was working on a flat roof rolling out the rubber roofing and fell off the edge of the roof to the ground approximately 24-26 feet below. The employee suffered a fractured skull, shoulder and wrist.
An employee's wrist was severely lacerated by a running miter saw.

While climbing down a military vehicle (MMPV) access ladder, the employee's wedding ring on his left hand got caught on one of the anti-slip barbs on the step.  When he dismounted the last step, the flesh was pulled from his ring finger, resulting in its ultimate amputation.
An employee was threading bale wire through a paper scrap baler when the baler was activated. The employee's index fingertip was amputated.
An employee's left third and fourth digits were amputated while removing a jam from an extrusion line shear.

An employee was using a food processor in the Trim Room of the Salad Bar Department to slice/cut raw broccoli for a pasta salad. A piece of broccoli become lodged in the processor. The employee used the right hand to clear the jam resulting in the amputation of the right index, middle, and pinky fingers.
An employee was adjusting a conveyor belt when it caught his hand, amputating the right ring and middle fingertips. The conveyor was in operation at the time of the incident.
An employee working on the shipping line conveyor got his right hand caught in the conveyor belt pulley amputating the tip of his fifth digit.
An employee sustained a fractured pelvis and right leg after being ejected from a personal basket attached to a telehandler and falling approximately 15 feet.

On or about May 20, 2016, at 8:10 a.m., an employee was operating a walkie rider pallet jack in walkie mode when the pallet jack backed over him. His left leg was pinned between the jack and a large metal tank, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was delivering packages on his route when he began to feel nauseous and experienced cramping due to heat stress.
An employee was working on a salt auger when his arm got caught in it, causing an injury.
An employee was stung by a wasp on his right torso and had an allergic reaction while cleaning tree limbs.
Worker fell about 42 inches from a scaffold when a scaffold plank broke.

An employee was cleaning a conveyor well when the cuff of the employee's coat became caught on the conveyor and pulled the employee's right arm into the sprocket, fracturing it. The conveyor was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.
An employee's left index fingertip was amputated when he was removing a clamp from a part in the mill. The finger was pinched between the clamp and a bolt.
An employee was exposed to a live electrical wire while on a ladder installing insulation to the ceiling. The employee came in contact with the wiring.

An employee was putting print plates onto the drums of an open machine on site when the drum moved and the employee's hand was caught in the machine. The employee's hand was crushed, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was cleaning dishes and slipped on water on the floor and fell.
An employee was struck by an object that swung while it was rigged to a forklift, suffering a possible spinal fracture.
An employee slipped and fell in the parking lot and was hospitalized with a fractured femur.

An employee was neutralizing an empty railcar that had carried sodium hydroxide. While the employee was cleaning the tank, sodium hydroxide splashed on his face and arm, causing 2nd degree chemical burns.
An employee driving a walkie ran into a stock picker in an aisle. The employee's left leg and ankle were injured, requiring surgery.

An employee climbed onto his dump truck to retrieve some information. While descending the ladder, he lost his footing and fell to the ground level below, striking his head. He was hospitalized with a skull fracture.
A valve cap, under pressure, struck an employee in the upper left arm resulting in a fractured arm and flesh loss.
An employee was shoveling out a garbage truck at a landfill. The wind blew the side-hinged access door shut on the employee's right thumb, amputating it between the thumbnail and the first knuckle.
An employee slipped and fell while descending from a damp porch at a residence, rupturing a quadricep tendon in the left leg.

While performing dozer operations in a skid loader/grader, the employee was placing top soil dirt into a beach bulkhead. The skid loader/grader backed off the bulkhead and fell 3 feet to the ground. Broken glass from the rear window lacerated the back of his head and the safety (lap) bar caused bruising to his chest.
An employee tripped on a water hose and broke her right ankle that needed surgery to repair.
An employee was ascending a ladder with a work light to access the roof when he fell off and struck the ground, suffering head, nose, and ear injuries, as well as loss of consciousness.

An employee was operating a radial arm saw when a piece of wood became caught in the travel slot behind the saw blade. When the employee attempted to remove it, the blade lacerated his right index finger. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was operating a powered industrial truck when his ankle was caught between the truck and racking in the warehouse. He fractured his fibula and ankle.
An employee fell off of a step ladder as she was descending it. She fell and broke her right arm. She was hospitalized on 7/22/15 at approximately 9:45 a.m.
On 10/21/2015, an employee was removing shrink wrap from a pallet and got her feet tangled in the shrink wrap resulting in a fall.  She fractured her left leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was trying to remove a piece of geo-fabric while installing a 24-foot stormwater pipe when his hand got caught between two sections of the pipe. He partially amputated his left ring finger and lacerated his left middle finger.
An employee's left pinky finger was amputated.
While an employee was attempting to unstop a jammed hopper, the still-rotating blades at the bottom of the hopper amputated the first two fingers on his left hand.
An employee suffered a back injury while securing a strap on a trailer with a ratcheting strap and bar.
An employee slipped on ice formed on steps of a residential home when delivering mail, which resulted in a broken arm that required hospitalization.
An employee suffered a lower back strain while lifting and placing boxes of material onto a dry wall cart.
Employee working on a ladder was knocked off and landed in a pile of construction debris. Employee sustaineda broken collarbone, eye socket, and skull.
Employee was walking near the loading dock at a Giant Eagle Store. He tripped over the dock lowering lever, fell, and broke his leg, requiring surgery.

Employee was driving a combat ASV vehicle form a dock area to a staging area.  The vehicle has a hatch.  When the employee was exiting the vehicle, he hit the button to close the hatch.  He pinched his finger in the locking mechanism resulting in the loss of the right ring fingertip.

An employee was using a gas-powered cutoff saw to cut a 2-foot section out of a 42-inch diameter storm drain pipe when the saw kicked back. The saw blade struck and lacerated the employee's right facial cheek, requiring hospitalization.

On October 4, 2016, an employee was positioning a mold that was to be lifted by a gantry. The employee's hand was on one of the chains attached to the mold. When the chain was tightened, the employee's left thumb was caught and partially amputated by the chain (tissue and nail loss; no bone loss).

An employee was performing an inspection on a bearing housing that was attached to a forklift by a strap.  The housing came loose and fell onto the employee shattering his left knee and breaking his ankle.
An employee suffered a left index fingertip amputation.
The employee was working on a ladder.  The ladder broke causing the employee to fall 8 feet to the concrete.  The employee broke his left femur.

On 1/27/15, the employee was getting a cat out of a carrier with the assistance of another person.  The other person was holding the box and she was getting the cat out.  The cat bit her hand.  After it continued to swell, the employee was admitted on 1/28/15 overnight for IV antibiotics.
An employee was working in a trench when it collapsed on the employee, breaking the employee's femur.
An employee slipped on ice when walking to the employee parking lot, injuring an ankle and resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was shot while on the job.
An employee became ill and was hospitalized due to dehydration from possible heat exposure after working with patients to get them connected to their dialysis units.
An employee was assisting a patient and suffered a strain injury to her leg. The employee was hospitalized with a blood clot.

An employee was helping a coworker change out a plug catcher. After re-inserting the screen, the employees attempted to attach the connection. As the connection cap was pushed forward to prepare it for threading, the loose bolts on the cap allowed for significant play and crushed the employee's left thumb between the cap and flange bolts. The employee's left thumb was partially amputated below the fingernail.
While installing metal decking, an employee slipped and fell 15 feet to ground level, suffering broken ribs.

A crew worked doing line clearance tree trimming.  An employee not involved in the tree felling operation stood 35 feet from a cherry tree to be felled.  Employees working from bucket trucks limbed the cherry tree to a height of 18 feet.  Then, an employee manually felled the cherry tree.  The cherry tree had a small limb that remained on the back side.  When the employee felling the cherry tree made the back cut and the cherry tree fell, the remaining limb on the cherry tree struck a nearby ash tree.  The ash tree stood 40 feet high.  Because the ash tree was dead, it became uprooted when struck by the falling cherry tree.  When the ash tree fell, it struck the employee standing 35 feet away from the cherry tree.  This employee suffered a dislocated hip, contusions, and a possible concussion.  The employee was hospitalized for his injuries.
On June 8, 2015, an employee suffered a partial amputation of their right-hand middle finger.

An employee was using a handheld band saw to cut an old thread pipe. He held the pipe with his left hand while cutting with the right. When he cut through the pipe, he also cut his left index fingertip.
An employee was walking up a conveyor belt and fell resulting in a head injury.
An employee was closing the bulk mail container's metal door when it fell on his right hand, amputating his middle fingertip.

Employee's finger got caught in a machine's drive belt resulting in an inpatient hospitalization and surgery. 

Temployee may lose the finger.
An employee injured her back while wheeling a stretcher.
While stepping off a ladder, an employee missed the last step and fell to the ground, injuring his left knee and requiring surgery.
While walking and holding a box, an employee tripped and fell to the floor, fracturing his right hip.
An employee was exiting a room and closing the door when the sliding door handle amputated the employee's right little fingertip.

An employee was walking down a dry dock, performing inspections of the work being completed, when a strong wind blew a ladder off a customer's boat. The ladder struck the employee, who suffered a broken nose, as well as a contusion/laceration to the nose.

An employee was cleaning a concrete mixer when the mixer's blade pinched the employee's finger. The employee sustained a partial finger amputation and compound finger fracture on the right-hand, third finger. The mixer was not locked out at the time.
An employee was driving a small tug machine called a mule when he ran into a pole and suffered a broken shin bone.
While cleaning the rolls of a mill machine with a rag, an employee's hand got pulled into the rolls, amputating a finger.

An employee was attempting to clean the glue eye on a paper-covered wire machine when his left ring finger was pulled into the machine, amputating it. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee reached across a conveyor to straighten a 14 lb. bag of dog food that was coming down the conveyor when he slipped and his hand went through the rollers on the transition conveyor. The rollers continued turning and rubbing against the employee's arm causing severe skin burns to his left forearm.  Employee was hospitalized overnight for skin graft purposes.
An employee was loading equipment into a truck when his finger became lodged between a road case and a piece of wood, amputating his left second fingertip.
An employee's right hand was amputated while rigging new hoisting cables on a crane.

While attempting to set grating to weld it into place, an employee fell approximately 30 feet from a mid-point rest platform and suffered a broken collarbone and nose. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was on an A-frame ladder troubleshooting the sawmill conveyor system. He fell from the ladder and his left pinky finger was crushed by an unguarded chain and sprocket gear, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was performing maintenance on an engine when some of the fluid got on his hands and burned them.

After repairing a diesel truck, an employee climbed off the truck and stepped on the battery box. The lid on the battery box was unsecured, causing the employee to fall 2 to 3 feet onto the concrete floor below. He also struck the battery box during the fall. He fractured several vertebrae and a left rib.
An employee was delivering furniture when he started having severe cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was collecting debris at a construction site when a large piece of clay came off the debris and hit the employee's left shoulder, lacerating it.
An employee was loading a trailer with a covered wagon (all-purpose container) when she looked down and saw that she was bleeding. She was wearing gloves. Her fingertip was amputated.
An employee's right hand was amputated while cleaning out material from a knife gate.
While removing a flex hose from a machine, an employee's hand slipped and contacted a moving part. The employee's left-hand index and middle fingertips were amputated.
Employee sustained a head injury when a bread bin hit her head.

While working on the rotary valve of the tumbler machine, an employee attempted to clear out a clog with his hand; his first four fingers were amputated. The machine was still running at the time of the incident.
An employee was bringing a boat to the dock when the boat tower used for water skiing came down and pinched the employee's finger, partially amputating it.

While replacing a damaged metal carport awning, an employee fell approximately 6 feet from the awning to the ground below. The employee suffered head, face, neck, and mouth injuries, requiring overnight hospitalization.

On February 17, 2016, an employee was installing a fascia and fog lamp on a car. As he was pulling on the wire to connect the fog lamp, he struck the car and punctured his right hand between the index finger and thumb. The injury became infected and required hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning up debris and creating a drywall barrier. When he shifted the drywall, it fell on him, breaking his right tibia and fibula.
An employee working on the picker conveyor was hospitalized after cutting his arm between the wrist and elbow on March 6, 2015.
An employee was pulling on a light chain to get an alignment for a pavement edge. The chain broke, causing the employee to stumble, misstep, and fall. He broke his left tibia above the ankle.

An employee was guiding an 8" PVC water pipe that was attached by a synthetic sling to the bucket of an excavator. The pipe was being set in place when the sling slipped from the pipe. The pipe rolled on the ground and struck the employee in the leg, fracturing the employee's upper thigh bone.
A employee jumped and/or fell off a box truck and fractured his ankle.
An employee's right-hand index and ring fingertips were lacerated by a machine blade while the employee was threading film.
An employee was sweating profusely when he came out of the painting booth where he was working. His condition worsened and he was hospitalized overnight.
An employee fell out of a golf cart and struck her head against the ground, suffering head trauma and loss of consciousness.
The employee was coming down a ladder after placing media in a nitrogen generator. Employee missed a rung, fell about 10 feet to the floor, and sustained a compound fracture to the right arm.
An employee was on a ladder rewiring an electrical ballast in the ceiling when he received an electrical shock and fell 15 feet, hitting his head on the surface below.
An employee was pulling on a wild grape vine that was up in a tree. The grape vine broke and he fell to the ground, breaking his tibia and fibula.

While jacking up a pallet of fixtures and using 2x4s for bracing, an employee had his right index finger and thumb amputated when the pallet came down and smashed the employee's right hand between the pallet and the 2x4s.
On 2/4/17, at 2:30 p.m., an employee was checking for an air leak inside the cabinet of a bag machine and amputated his left ring fingertip.
While stocking pharmaceutical items, an employee came into contact with cinnamon residue on a pallet and suffered an allergic reaction.
An employee was attempting to rig a solid web rafter beam when the beam leaned toward the employee and fractured the employee's right foot.
An employee was replacing the motor and bearing on a cooler unit/fan when his left thumb was caught between a belt and pulley on the unit. He suffered a left thumb distal tip amputation.
An employee was manually lifting a roll of fabric material with a metal pole. The employee placed the pole into its holder and pinched their left index finger resulting in a partial amputation.

An employee was performing a custodial task outside when he felt light-headed. He went back inside and was standing on the dock area with his hands and head resting on the shovel he was holding when he fainted, falling to the ground and striking his head. He was hospitalized for stitches and plastic surgeon care.
An employee fell when her heel was caught on the carpet.  The fall resulted in an ankle fracture that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was clearing cartons off the ground when a stack of cases riding on a chain tipped over and struck his back, causing contusions.
An employee was bitten on the left forearm by a giant mother panda while swapping twin baby pandas. The employee had surgery for nerve and artery damage.
An employee was stacking plastic tubs and had a seizure. The employee fell to the floor striking his head and elbow causing contusions to both. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was unloading a bundle of flat bar iron from a truck using an overhead crane. The bundle became unstable and the material shifted and struck the employee on the head.
On November 07, 2016, an employee who had been servicing a circulating water pump began to feel ill. The employee sought treatment at a local hospital and was diagnosed with legionellosis.
An employee was repairing the rod on a bore machine when a clamp closed on his left hand, amputating his middle fingertip.

A temporary employee was operating the protein mixer when the extruder stopped extruding. He began pulling out the protein when he contacted the mixer's metal blade, amputating his middle and ring fingers to the second knuckle and index finger to the first knuckle. The mixer was running at the time of the incident.
While working on a grain barge, an employee was struck by a loose mooring cable, suffering bruises and a possible concussion.
An employee was uncoiling chain and got their fingers caught between the sprocket and chain resulting in the amputation of the right index and middle fingers.
An employee fell from the mezzanine while installing a permanent guardrail, suffering a pelvis fracture and elbow injury.
An employee was wrapping a box of tomatoes when he was struck by a forklift, fracturing his right ankle.

An employee was standing on a step ladder and reprogramming an overhead garage door in the company shop when the garage door opened and knocked him off of the ladder to the concrete floor. He suffered a facial fracture and right arm laceration.
An employee was walking next to the location where a carbon anode got stuck on the end of a conveyor. The anode dislodged and fell onto the passing employee's right foot fracturing it.

On or about November 28, 2016, at approximately 1:40 a.m., an employee was loading a new roll of plastic film on a winder machine when his left hand was pulled into a nip point. His lower left arm was fractured and required hospitalization.
On or about 5/23/16, an employee sustained serious injuries while cleaning inside a tank. He was hospitalized with a laceration on/near his abdomen, a left-side puncture, and bruising.
On or about September 4, 2015, an employee working in the small sort area injured the skin on her right middle finger when her hand contacted the conveyor belt.

The employee had just completed a drywall delivery and was walking down the entrance ramp to clean the area when his feet got caught in the green strapping material. The employee fell onto a piece of metal pipe and broke his lower right leg.
An employee was walking out of an office into the lobby when she slipped on a wet floor. She fell, breaking her left hip.
An employee was repairing a leak on a roof when he fell 45 feet to the ground, injuring his torso and pelvis and requiring hospitalization.
On October 17, 2015, an employee was operating a table saw to cut decorative strips of metal and cut his right thumb. He was admitted to the hospital and had surgery the next day.
An explosion occurred at the plant and an employee was burned, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was electrocuted while attempting to change a fuse in the electrical panel.

An employee was attempting to lift a concrete slab/rock into the bucket of a front-end loader. The slab slipped, and the employee's right index fingertip was crushed and amputated between the slab and another slab.
An employee was stepping over a barricade, tripped on his lanyard and fell approximately 2-3 feet to the floor. He suffered a broken right tibia that required surgery to repair.

At an oil and gas well drilling site the injured employee was standing on the well bore cover while a forklift was attempting to pick up the well bore cover.  The employee fell and fractured the right fibula and lacerated the right side of the head.
On July 28, 2016, an employee experienced a finger amputation when using a wrench and hammer to clear a jammed rock from a running conveyor.
An employee was replacing heat tape on the head of a plastic film bagger when the machine head cycled and pinched his left hand, partially amputating his third and fourth fingertips.
An employee was changing the die on a press. The wrench slipped off a bolt and the employee fell breaking a hip.
Two employees received second degree burns to the arms, face, and neck while installing a switch on a pole.

Employees were going to remove an aeration pipe (18 inch in diameter and 10 feet long) that had potatoes on it with a 3/8" chain & a skid steer with forks.  The chain was secured around the pipe and around both forks on the skid steer.  After the pipe was free of the potatoes, the skid steer driver began to back up, while another employee guided the pipe.  While backing up, one of the skid steer forks hit one of the bulkhead tubes (75-80#) that was sitting in its slot. The tube came out of its slot and fell roughly 7'8" striking the employee on the head.  He fell backwards into the potato pile and suffered a head laceration.

An employee was placing a part into a sizing press. While the employee's hand was in the point of operation, the tooling engaged and pinched the employee's right index finger between the tool and die. The employee suffered an amputation of the right index finger as a result of the incident. The light curtains installed on the press were bypassed at the time of the incident.
An employee was hospitalized overnight after slipping and hurting their back.
An employee was working on a roof when debris came in contact with an overhead wire causing an arc flash that struck the worker. He fell from the roof.
An employee was operating a crane or hoist that malfunctioned and was knocked 20 feet from a platform to the ground, breaking legs, ankles, hands, and arms. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was changing a valve on a trailer when the valve popped, causing the hose to disconnect and swing. The employee was exposed to propylene, requiring hospitalization for chemical burns.
While cleaning the bagel machine, an employee suffered an amputation after being caught in the point of operation. The machine was not turned off at the time of the incident.

An employee was inspecting freight he had just placed in the aisle using a forklift when a forklift driver backed up and pinned the employee between the two forklifts. The employee sustained a broken hip.
On 11/08/15, an employee attempted to clear wood debris from a knot saw when the blade amputated the first digit of his right-hand middle finger.

An employee was cutting wood wedges with a skill saw on a boom lift when the saw jumped and cut the three middle fingers on his left hand. His middle finger was amputated from the bottom of the fingernail up.

An employee was installing batten bars onto the sheeting panel during the installation of an aluminum dump. His safety harness rope got caught in the aluminum panel and while he was trying to free it, he fell roughly 20 feet to the ground.

An employee was in the hatch of a maritime vessel attempting to hook up to a bundle of pipe to lift it out of the hatch. The employee began to experience severe body cramps and was hospitalized with severe dehydration.

An employee was standing on the ground and tripped on a fallen tree. The employee was trying to cut a vine when the chain tip hit the wooden fence, causing the chainsaw to kick back. The chain hit and lacerated the employee on the top of the left shoulder.
While reaching for a package, an employee's hand was caught in a conveyor, de-gloving two fingers.
An employee's upper left arm was surgically amputated at the shoulder after it was pulled into the cubing machine during sanitation.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a piece of plywood and amputated the right index fingertip.
Employee fell from a step ladder while assembling furniture.

An employee was operating a tube winder when three of his right-hand fingers were caught in the main winding belt. His pointer finger was surgically amputated to the first knuckle, and his ring finger broke and required surgery.
An employee was cutting carcass with a brisket saw and lacerated his left hand and thumb.
An employee was using a hand grinder to fabricate a piece of metal when the disk exploded and lacerated his face, requiring surgery.
An employee was working on overhead powerlines when an arc flash occurred, causing second degree burns to his face, neck, and arm.
An employee was inspecting a roof for pesticide application on the building. The employee slipped and slid off the roof to the ground floor, breaking two legs and shattering the right ankle.

On the morning of 5/27/2015, an employee was bitten on the right hand by a stray cat while on break in the dock area of the plant.  Later that night his right hand and arm were swollen and he was in pain.  He was admitted to the hospital overnight for treatment.
An employee was cleaning a roll of steel when the roll cycled and amputated his right index finger.
An employee slipped and fell while walking through the bottom of a cyclone (large tube) interior, breaking her ankle.

An employee was lowering a load of glass panels onto a manual pallet jack and amputated the tip of his right index finger when his finger was pinched between the load and the handle of the pallet jack.
An employee was using a forklift to place a mold on a pallet. The injured employee was removing a 4"x4" post from under the mold. The mold tipped, crushing the injured employee's left thumb.

An employee was installing/performing work on an HVAC system and had to enter the attic for an undetermined amount of time. The employee came down into the lobby of the facility where work was being performed, collapsed, and lost consciousness.
An employee was operating an engine lathe and was pulled into the lathe.

On 05/04/2015, at approximately 12:45 PM, an employee was assembling tools to hammer down some parts in the shop area of the work facility. His hand slipped, and the tool struck his right hand, amputating the right little fingertip. He was hospitalized.

An employee suffered third and fourth degree burns to the arm while installing a rubber gasket in the wrap weal #8 machine when the machine closed on the employee's arm that then contacted the 250 degree heated surface.
An employee was calibrating equipment when his fingers were caught in the rollers. He sustained broken left-hand fingers and was hospitalized.

On or about February 21, 2016, at approximately 9:40 a.m., an employee operating a wool separator machine was attempting to clear a jam when his hand was caught in the machine. He suffered an avulsion that required hospitalization for stitches.

An employee was operating an excavator machine approximately four feet from an above ground power line when the power line arced out and electrocuted the employee who suffered second degree burns on the right arm and a broken wrist.
On August 24, 2016, an employee stepped onto a pallet to retrieve a box, lost their balance, and fell to the ground breaking the left hip.
On August 26, 2016, at approximately 10:30 AM an employee was cutting a barrel. The barrel exploded and the employee suffered several burns and broke his left leg.
An employee was using an air hose to blow off debris around the forklift radiator. He removed a forklift radiator cap and hot anti-freeze spewed out of the radiator, burning his arms and face.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after experiencing what appeared to be heat related illness.

An employee was cutting material on a radial arm saw. As the employee attempted to grab material with the right hand, the saw was activated with the pneumatic foot pedal. The saw contacted the employee's wrist and amputated the right hand.
An employee was walking to her station and tripped on the leg of a shot blast screen (welding screen). The employee fell and fractured her right hip. She was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was loading pallets into a trailer using a pallet jack . Some of the pallets started to fall. His hand got caught in the pallet jack's handle when he tried to catch the falling pallets and his left index finger was amputated.
An employee was cleaning up her work station when she tripped over the end of a pallet and fell to the concrete floor, breaking her hip and requiring surgery.

An employee was operating a table saw to cut a piece of wood when the wood became bound in the saw blade and kicked back, causing the employee's left thumb to contact the blade. The thumb tip was amputated with some bone loss.
An employee's left ring and middle fingers were amputated when caught in the chain of a horizontal glass washer machine.

An employee was pressure-washing a metal belt using a diluted solution of Oxofoam (a corrosive material). The spray contacted the employee in the neck/shoulder area, causing chemical burns to the skin.

An employee was loading a well with hot oil. The employee had turned valves off and started to fill the well. The pressure in the tank filled due to the hot oil. The pressure release valve released flammable vapors and/or gases. The flammable vapors and/or gases ignited, burning the employee's face (cheeks and ears). The employee was wearing flame resistant clothing, a hard hat, and safety glasses at the time.
An employee was stacking materials in a storage bin while a nearby coworker operated a wood saw. A flying wood chip escaped and struck the employee, avulsing the employee's neck.
An employee leaving the facility around 6:30p.m. was shot in the upper chest and face by an assailant.

An employee was working from a cable tray 15 feet above the ground. The employee was utilizing a fall protection harness in conjunction with a PFAS. As he tried to move from one location to another, he fell to the floor, shattering his right heel and fracturing his left ankle. His lanyard was not tied off at the time of the incident.

An employee was operating a skid pusher to push freight into a trailer while he pulled the door down. The door came down fast and caught his hand between the door latch and the edge of the skid pusher, amputating a fingertip and causing a fracture.

On Saturday, August 15, 2015, at approximately 2:00 p.m., an employee was operating a forklift at a roofing project jobsite. He was reversing the forklift when he made a sharp 90-degree turn with the boom extended, causing the forklift to overturn. He sustained injuries to his toes on the right foot and was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a mast climber work platform cord when the machine turned on and the railing pulled in his hand, crushing his right forearm.
An employee was cutting a piece of plywood on a table saw when the saw cut his right thumb above the knuckle.
An employee cooking in the kitchen opened a pot that was on the stove. The liquid spilled on the employee, burning their wrist and feet.
An employee was cutting paper with a large paper cutter when her left thumb entered the cutting area. The paper cutter then amputated the tip of her left thumb.

An employee was using a grinder to cut a clamp on top of a tank that was being de-gassed. The sparks from the grinder contacted the gas fumes from the tank, starting a flash fire. The employee suffered burns all over his body, requiring hospitalization.
The employee was using an air wand to spray off excess shot from the steel beam. The steel beam rolled over onto the tip of his right middle finger causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee was climbing into a bulldozer when wind caused the door to shut on and amputate his thumb.
An employee was struck by a forklift transporting materials while controlling traffic at a construction site. The employee suffered fractures to lower extremities.

The injured employee was operating an electric pallet jack in an aisle of the warehouse. Another employee who was operating a forklift struck the side of the pallet jack resulting in fractures to the injured employee's lower legs.
An employee fell five feet from the loading dock to the ground and fractured two ribs.
An employee was struck by falling concrete cinder blocks while walking underneath a bridge and sustained a skull fracture.

An employee was stepping off an A-frame type ladder. As he placed his weight on his back foot, he slipped and lost his balance. He fell backward and landed on top of an elevated welded pipe gas line, breaking three ribs and suffering a slightly collapsed lung on his right side.
An employee was working in the edible cutting section using a conveyor fed belt saw. His thumb made contact with the saw blade, removing the tip of his left thumb halfway down the thumbnail.

An employee was operating a stand up counterbalance in the case pick area when she collided with pallets in the racking. The corner of the upper Chep pallet penetrated the operator compartment, striking the employee in the upper hip area and fracturing the pelvis.
An employee was installing shingles on a roof approximately 20 feet above ground level. The employee fell and was hospitalized. Fall protection was in place at the time.
An employee had a hole in his safety shoes and water from working with the concrete soaked his foot resulting in chemical burns.  He was hospitalized and scheduled for skin grafts.

Employees were attempting to insert a section of U-adjuster shackle into a chain link using a sledge hammer. The injured employee was holding the shackle. As a coworker swung on the hammer, the injured employee's hand slipped and got struck by the hammer. His left index finger was partially amputated.

An employee was on a walkie rider and approaching another walkie rider. The employee stepped off before the unit came to a complete stop and a foot was caught between the two units resulting in a broken ankle.
An employee was hospitalized for dehydration and other injuries due to physical training in preparation for fire season. Heat may have contributed to the injury.
An employee's finger was partially amputated when it was caught in a strap being used to rig pipe.
An employee was cutting vegetables with a knife when his left index fingertip was amputated at the fingernail.
An employee was injured after tripping over a fence.
An employee suffered a thumb amputation while cutting meat on a band saw.

Employees were installing a fiber optic cable along a rural roadway and were cleaning up the site at the end of the day when a vehicle approached the work site, left the road, and traveled through the ditch, striking two employees. The first employee suffered lacerations and contusions, while the other suffered a fractured leg. Both were hospitalized.

An employee was on the ground with a power unit. Another employee was backing up the tug to hook up to the ground power unit.  The employee backing up the tug hit the gas and pinned the injured employee between the tug and the ground power unit.

An Ironworker was tying rebar 8 feet above ground. He hooked the rebar onto a wall with a hook and then leaned back and the wall hook slid off the rebar and the ironworker fell backwards approximately 8 feet to the crushed gravel ground injuring the right leg.
An employee received an electrical shock while performing maintenance on a room HVAC unit.
Employee was hospitalized after falling 21 inches through a drain while cleaning. Employee suffered a fractured right knee, fractured rib, and punctured right lung.
An employee sustained a laceration to the hand while cleaning the drywall finisher sprayer.

An employee was working on the production floor and began experiencing heat illness related symptoms, including abdominal and muscle cramping as well as decreased sweating.  He was admitted and treated for heat exhaustion at the hospital.
An employee slipped and fell and hit his head.

Employee received a crushing injury to the right-hand thumb when the collapsible railing on a crusher plant's catwalk vibrated loose and pinned his thumb between the railing and catwalk. The thumb was partially severed and the bone broke. His thumb was later amputated at Rochester Mayo Clinic because blood flow to the thumb could not be re-established.

An employee was operating an aerial lift to torque the bolts on a connection point of the steel girder to a bridge. His head was pinched between the aerial lift control panel cover and the bottom of the steel girder above him. He suffered a laceration to his right ear and a skull fracture, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut an 8-inch, old clay pipe to replace it with a PVC sewer pipe. The saw kicked back and the blade went through the employee's face shield, lacerating his skin from his right chin to his right ear. He was hospitalized.

Employees were offloading pipe onto a pipe stand. An employee's hand was resting on the pipe stand and when the pipe came down, his hand was pinched between the pipe and the pipe stand, breaking his left index finger.
An employee climbed atop the asphalt drum in an attempt to clear recycled asphalt from the chute and fell 12-15 ft. to the ground. The employee was knocked unconscious and possibly broke a leg.
An employee was adjusting rollers that were not lined up to move boxes of plastic pellets when his finger was caught between the rollers resulting in an amputation.

While loading an electric pallet jack onto the back of a trailer, an employee slipped and fell approximately 4 feet off the lift gate and onto the parking lot asphalt, fracturing a bone in the elbow area.
An employee was measuring wind turbine blades on a scaffold when the scaffold hoist malfunctioned, causing the employee to fall approximately 140 feet to the ground and suffer severe body injuries.
An employee was working in the saddle pack department taking product off the test line when the actuator activated and amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employee was troubleshooting electrical equipment and suffered an electrical shock resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was trying to troubleshoot a case sealer when his left finger was caught in the belt and pulley drive, amputating his left ring finger.
An employee was operating a boom lift during painting operations when it tipped over and fell to the ground while the employee was still inside. He was hospitalized with fractured ribs.
An employee tripped and fell, while walking to her car on a public street. Employee was on work time at the time of the accident. The employee was hospitalized with a broken shoulder.

An employee at a remote Marathon Oil jobsite was pressure testing pipe when he was struck-by 9500psi of water when bolts broke on the flange connecting two pipes causing the high pressure water to strike the employee and one other sub-contractor's employee who were standing approximately 15 feet away.

An employee tripped and fell. As she was getting up from the fall by grabbing onto a tire rack, another tire rack shifted and crushed her left hand. Her middle, ring, and pointer fingertips had to be medically amputated.
A press operator was removing a print unit from a press and placing the unit onto a cart when their hand was caught between the cart frame and the print unit.  The left middle finger was amputated.

While an employee was working on a utility pole to run a TV cable to a house, the pole broke and the employee fell about 15 feet to the ground. The employee sustained a broken left femur and a lower back fracture.
An employee hit her head on a fitting room shelf while throwing away trash. She felt dizzy and went to the break room to sit down, where she had a seizure. She required overnight hospitalization.
An employee was struck on the back by a large metal pole, cracking two ribs.
While an employee was unloading a trailer of media cabinets, product fell on him and broke his lower right leg.

Employee retrieving parts from a shelf was struck in the head by a part weighing approximately 40 to 50 pounds when the bottom of the box it was stored in gave way. Employee sustained a compression fracture of the vertebrae.

Employees were in the man basket of an articulating boom truck when a sudden movement caused the man basket to come in contact with the bridge. An employee sustained a broken nose and eye socket and was admitted to hospital.

An employee was mounting a spare tire onto a wheel that was brought in by a customer. The employee began airing up the tire when the bottom of the wheel blew out and launched the wheel into the air. The wheel hit the employee in the arm and hand. The employee was hospitalized with a broken arm and thumb.
An employee was on a tubular pile adjusting straps. The pile rolled, catching his foot and causing him to fall, fracturing his right leg. No cribbing was used at the time of the incident.

An employee was pressing a small steel bracket against a rotating sanding wheel with his hands and fingers to smooth the edge. The bracket flew out of his hand and amputated the right index fingertip.

An employee was adjusting a belt on an energized conveyor with a wrench. The employee's hand slipped making contact and becoming entangled with the conveyor fracturing bones in his hand that required surgery.
An employee was descending a fixed ladder attached to a vessel. She slipped around the fifth rung from the bottom, breaking her ankle and requiring surgery.
An employee was lowering a dock leveler to unload a truck when the dock leveler closed unexpectedly, breaking the employee's finger.
An employee fell while walking in the medical clinic area, breaking the left elbow and requiring hospitalization.
On July 14, 2016, an employee sustained a broken foot when the outrigger on the truck landed on his right foot.
An employee was hospitalized after dust blew into her eye resulting in an infection.
An employee twisted and fractured his ankle while stepping off of a step on his mail delivery route.

On April 22, 2016, an employee was removing a grill from a trailer that was on a powered industrial vehicle (PIV). The employee's head/neck became caught between the PIV and the trailer, causing head/neck injuries that required hospitalization.
An employee was starting a new run of fiber. As she went to pull the fiber from the oven, her right hand and arm got caught in an adjustable conveyor. Her hand and arm were severely burned.

An employee removed a forged bolt and tossed it in a nearby keg. The bolt hit the rim of the keg, bounced back, and slid down between the employee's jeans and aluminized PPE pants. She suffered a third-degree burn on top of her left ankle.
An employee was shearing a U-shaped piece of metal when the metal folded over and pinched his right index fingertip, amputating it.

An employee was walking a cart in the parking lot toward the soccer field when the cart started to roll away from him.  The employee tripped and fell, hitting his head/neck on the curb in the parking lot.

On or about July 2, 2015, an employee was operating a press brake when it had a mechanical failure.  The bolts holding the press up sheared off, and the press came down on the employee's right hand, amputating several fingers.

An employee was using an electric pallet jack to put a load on top of a conveyor when the forks of the pallet jack became stuck on the conveyor and lifted the back of the pallet jack. The back of the pallet jack then landed on the employee's right foot, causing fractures.
An employee was heating a paint spray can with a heat gun when the can blew up, burning his hands, wrists, neck, and face.

Worker was attending a training. When it ended, she was assigned to remove the decorations. She stood on a chair, fell, and fractured her tibia. She was taken to the emergency room where she was admitted for surgery.
On 09/28/2015, about 4:30pm, a temporary worker fell from a trash pile/landfill and broke her ankle.

An employee was troubleshooting the box taping machine. The employee's hand was caught in the chain drive resulting in the amputation of the left thumb's distal joint. The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee was cutting food with a knife when the blade amputated the employee's left thumb. Personal protective equipment was not worn at the time of the incident.
A steel sheet struck an employee's left heel while he was unloading material from a truck. He suffered a soft tissue laceration.
An employee was prepping a tank trailer for cleaning and received second degree burns to the back and neck from steam.
On or about May 19, 2015, an employee was cleaning a moving roller on an extrusion machine with a rag when the machine pulled his left hand in. His left-hand index finger was injured.
An employee was adjusting an elbow machine when their left-hand fingers got caught in the machine's clamp, dislocating and fracturing the second and third fingers.
On 11/04/2015 at 9:00 pm, an employee was putting up a Star Wars display with a scissor lift when he touched a metal beam that sparked and burned both of his hands. The employee was hospitalized.
On September 21, 2016, an employee was hospitalized after receiving burn injuries while operating a tempering/polishing machine.

An employee fell from an 8 foot high staging (pedestrian screen). 

Employee injured his tail bone and was hospitalized.
An employee received electrical burns to his forehead when he leaned into a live electrical box and contacted the 480V electrical panel.

After checking sulfur levels in a fertilizer building, an employee fell while descending a fixed wooden ladder and sustained a broken pelvis, broken ribs, broken C-3 vertebra, and internal bleeding as a result of the fall.
On or about May 16, 2016, an employee was riding a mountain bike on a bike trail when he hit a jump and fell onto his bike. He was hospitalized and required surgery for possible internal injuries.
An employee who had been performing decking operations suffered spinal injuries after he fell 12 feet through a guardrail to the plywood below.
An employee was struck by a pressurized 4-inch hose when it was disconnected from his truck. The employee suffered broken ribs, a collapsed lung and a right arm laceration.
An employee fractured his ribs, sternum, back, and shoulder when a tree fell on him while he was clearing it off a power line.

An employee was trying to clear a piece of jammed wood from a machine. The machine was running at the time. The employee's hand was exposed to the point of operation, lacerating the middle finger, which had to be amputated at the middle joint.

Two employees were moving a refrigerator from the second floor to the first floor. One employee lost his grip on the refrigerator while going down the stairs. The refrigerator struck the injured employee, breaking three ribs and requiring hospitalization.
While moving a stack of doors, an employee's finger was caught between doors resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was walking up a hill while a pickup truck was backing up the hill from the other side. The driver did not see the employee. The employee attempted to get out of the way but fell and was run over by the truck. The employee suffered broken ribs, a collapsed lung, and a fractured ankle.
An employee was trying to access a tool box located on company pick-up truck by climbing the back bumper. His foot slipped and he fell to the ground injuring his hip.
On December 26, 2016, an employee was hospitalized for surgery on his dislocated left foot when he was stuck by a customer vehicle in the parking lot.

On January 18, 2016, an employee's finger got caught in the cross auger (screw type auger) while clearing a product jam. The employee initially received an avulsion injury to the right ring finger. The finger was later surgically amputated.
An employee was climbing an extension ladder to access a single-story roof when he slipped at the roof edge and fell 8 to 9 feet, sustaining a broken leg and facial trauma.
An employee was operating a yard tractor when he tripped and was run over by the tractor. He sustained a chest and abdominal injury.
Employee received an embedded tack in her thigh when walking by a pintacker. Employee had the micro pin tack surgically removed from her thigh and was admitted to the hospital overnight.
While washing a skid steer with a pressure washer, an employee's left wrist was cut by the water pressure. The employee began to feel sick later that day and was hospitalized.
An employee was unloading blocks when his leg got caught in the groove of the block as it lifted resulting in a fractured left tibia and fibula.

An employee was moving walkboards. The employee slammed a walkboard to clean off excess mortar which caused an outlooker to break. This caused the scaffold to tilt and the employee fell sustaining a neck injury.

An employee entered a walkway that was near a portable dust collection system. The system created a blind spot, and a forklift struck the employee, who suffered a fractured right elbow and crushed right foot.

Employee was standing on a pile of metal pipes. He was directing a forklift operator to remove one of the bars. As the forklift operator moved the bar, the employee's legs got caught under the load, injuring both.
An employee was dumping sacks of rice back into the cutback system when stepped into a floor-mounted hopper and made contact with the auger system, amputating his left lower leg.
An employee was caught between the drilling rig and the mud pit and was injured.
An employee was ascending a ladder, supporting himself with a grounding L-bracket, when he fell. He struck the concrete floor and suffered cuts and abrasions, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was painting from a ladder when the ladder shifted and the employee fell breaking a femur.
An employee was operating a utility task vehicle and going uphill when the vehicle rolled over backwards and rolled down the hill. The employee suffered a lacerated head and four fractures.
An employee was operating a wrap saw to cut cardboard when the saw jammed. As he attempted to unjam it, the saw blade lacerated his arm. The saw was guarded at the time.

An employee was installing coping while working from an extension ladder when the ladder kicked out at the bottom, causing him to fall approximately 10 feet. He hit the ground and broke his left arm and left leg.
An employee was changing out a coil using an indoor crane and rigging chain. His hand was caught  between the coil and rigging chain amputating his right index finger.
An employee was using a 12-inch miter saw to chop scrap wood from 4-foot to 2-foot pieces when the saw amputated his left index finger between the first and second digit.
An employee was driving an unloaded forklift when the forklift came into contact with a railcar staged at the dock. The employee's arm was caught between the railcar and the lift's roll cage.
An employee was placing printing cylinders into storage and got caught between the hand cart and guard railing resulting in broken ribs.

On February 22, 2015, an employee working for a home healthcare service was going up an icy set of stairs, slipped, and fell.  The employee injured her neck, shoulders, and both thighs.  Employee was hospitalized.
The employee was working on the conveyor system from the catwalk and fell 12-15 feet resulting in fractured vertebrae and ribs.
An employee was loading product onto pallets. The employee's leg was caught between two pallets after a pallet jack pushed a pallet into the employee's leg. The lower left leg was fractured.
An employee was climbing a ladder, slipped due to a faulty grab bar, and fell approximately 12 feet. He was admitted to the hospital for a broken wrist and a bruise to the head.
An employee was changing the grinding stone on the grinding  wheel when the grinder came on and the stone broke striking the employee. The employee had surgery for internal injuries.

Employees were cleaning up the warehouse area when a bundle of boards fell onto an employee striking their head. Two hours later the injured employee suffered stroke-like symptoms and was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell against the wall and floor while trying to assist a falling patient, breaking her left arm.
An employee was setting up scrapers to clean the floor. The scrapers were in a cart and when one of them was falling off the cart, the employee tried to catch it and lacerated his right thumb.

An employee on a second-level platform was opening a slide gate at a height of approximately 14 feet to place a pallet on the deck. The slide gate was 4 ft H x 12 ft W on the exterior wall, attached by a sliding mechanism. The employee fell to the ground along with the gate, suffering multiple fractures to the femur, pelvis, ribs, right leg, and arm.
Employee was putting a lock on the trailer door in the parking lot and slipped on ice, fell and broke the right ankle.
An postal service employee slipped on ice while delivering mail. The employee suffered a broken leg and was admitted to the hospital overnight.
An employee was struck in the head by a piece of plastic piping.

On May 29, 2015, an employee was working inside a sulpha treat reactor vessel using a high pressure (5000 PSI) water sprayer gun to cut off the congealed catalyst material inside. The employee slipped and fell; the high-pressure water sprayer hit the employee's right foot and punctured a hole through the rubber boot. The employee sustained a puncture open wound on the right foot, second toe. The employee was hospitalized and received treatment.
An employee was injured on 3/26/15 while working on an inactive, disengaged brake. The employee tripped and was struck by a counterbalance in the chest and abdomen.
An employee tripped and fell, striking his head against the corner of the house. He was admitted to hospital for head lacerations and overnight observation.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet from the second level while stocking materials, suffering head and back trauma.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet from a ladder while ascending to the main deck. The employee was hospitalized with fractures to the number 10 and 11 ribs and a cracked L1.
An employee injured his wrist and head when he slipped on a three-rung ladder. He was admitted to the hospital and treated.

The wiring for an argon oxygen decarburization (AOD) motor caught fire and the AOD had to be operated manually. An employee attempted to insert a crank handle into the AOD crank. As the employee was manually tilting the AOD, it moved beyond the center of gravity and the crank handle started spinning rapidly. When the employee tried to grab the crank handle, his right middle finger was caught in the chain and sprocket, de-gloving the fingertip. The chain and sprocket was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was putting out a fire that occurred in an auto body paint booth and fell, shattering the right elbow. The employee also suffered burns to the arm and torso.

A crew was putting together a slide rail-style protective system. In the process, the injured employee was positioned on the right-hand side of the retaining wall. While the crew was positioning the wall into the positioning slots, the wall jolted to the right-hand side and pinched the employee's hand between the retaining wall and the slide rail. His right pinky and middle fingers were lacerated.
On 05/04/15, an employee stepped on a screw, which punctured the employee's boot and foot. The employee was later hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was inspecting an out-of-service water pipe.  The pipe had accumulated high alkaline water.  The employee received chemical burns to the feet, ankles, and calves.
An employee was working in the ingot cooling and stacking area when he became overheated. The employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

An employee was operating a hydraulic-activated torque wrench to bolt up a flange. The hydraulic hose to the wrench developed a leak. The employee was injured when high pressure hydraulic fluid penetrated his right hand. The hydraulic wrench was a rental unit. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was operating an Accupress press brake and the tooling pinched his middle and ring fingers on his right hand.

An employee was working with formwork that has pins and telescope. The finger was in one of the scaffold pin holes and when the scaffold collapsed it took off the tip of his right middle finger. No bone was lost.

On or about 10/18/2015 an employee was attempting to clear a jam in a parcel bundling machine and climbed on top of a rolling wire cage container approximately 41" high x 48" long x 40" wide.  The employee slipped from the cage and fell to the floor fracturing their ribs and collarbone.
An employee offloading rebar from a flatbed truck lost his balance and fell off the truck, breaking both bones in his leg and requiring surgery.

An employee was electrically shocked when his right hand made contact with a power line that was inductively charged. There were three power lines, two outer lines with 138kv and a center line that was disconnected but not grounded. The employee grabbed the center power line when he stumbled while trying to exit the tower. He suffered exit wounds to the right shin and a right toe.
An employee was cutting sheet rock in an auditorium when an existing wall gave way and fell on the employee, breaking his right arm and a rib.

An employee was fishing coax wiring through a drop ceiling from a 4-foot, A-frame step ladder. The employee fell from the ladder and struck his head, causing a laceration to the back of his head, bleeding on the brain, and a concussion. He required staples to close the laceration.

An employee and his coworker were holding a 3-feet-long pipe that was 4 inches in diameter and approximately 30 pounds to move it inside a ship. As they set the pipe inside the boat, the employee felt a pull in his groin. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

While conducting maintenance on the battery charger of an order picker, an employee's right index fingertip was caught between the chain and cog of the order picker and amputated when the order picker was activated.
While conducting a routine valve cleaning operation, the employee inserted his finger into the valve body then activated the valve causing the ball valve to sever the tip of his finger.

An employee was crawling in a space near the tilt devices to retrieve skimmers that he had placed under the platform in the work area. The tilt device in the molding area came up and crushed the employee between device and the floor.

On 7/31/2015, at approximately 7:30 a.m., an employee in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) was helping a patient turn her body, so that the file film for x-ray preparation could be placed beneath the patient's body. The employee began to walk around the patient's bed when she tripped over IV tubing and fell to the floor. She sustained a right-leg femur bone fracture and bruised her face.

An employee had greased a chain drive on a label machine. He was cleaning excess lubricant with a paper towel when the towel got caught in the sprocket and pulled his finger in, amputating his fingertip.
An employee tripped and fell to the floor fracturing the left hip.

While walking to the HR desk, an employee tripped over the lower part of a vertical stanchion at the same level and fell to the ground. The employee suffered head and back injuries, as well as a fractured femur that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was operating a walker stacker when the stacker reversed over the employee's foot. The employee was hospitalized with a foot injury.
An employee was exiting a parked vehicle on the jobsite, slipped on ice, and fell onto concrete. The employee suffered a concussion and a compression fracture to the back.

An employee backed the shuttle bus into its assigned parking spot. The employee then opened the bus door and exited the vehicle, however, the vehicle was still in reverse. The bus continued to reverse and the bus door struck the employee, knocked him to the ground, and a tire ran over his right leg. The employee suffered a broken tibia and fibula and was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
While digging a hole for a fence post installation, the employee struck a live 277V electrical line and was shocked.
On October 1, 2016, a forklift operator ran over and crushed an employee's right foot.
Worker was working off a 6 ft scaffold that had been erected the day before. He adjusted the scaffold so he could pour concrete and fell. He was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was on the roof removing snow when a fiberglass portion of the roof gave way and the employee fell 10 to 12 feet to the concrete floor below.
An employee was transferring a patient into the Cat Scan ER room when she closed the cat scan door (double door) on her hand; her left index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was repairing loose, serrated, expanded metal grating. When he lifted a piece of grating, his middle fingertip was caught between the top piece of grating he was moving and another portion of grating. His fingertip was amputated (no bone loss).

An employee who was driving an unloaded stand-up forklift turned down an aisle. To avoid hitting an unoccupied forklift, he quickly turned the forklift and placed his right hand out to brace himself. His right hand struck the non-moving, unoccupied forklift, fracturing his wrist and the area between his index finger and thumb. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting frozen Cornish hen with a band saw when he amputated the tip of his left ring finger.
An employee received an electrical shock while unplugging a power strip, suffering sweating, tingling, and nausea.

On or about December 30, 2015, the employee was working on the plastic extruder on the production floor. The employee's right index finger was amputated after being caught in the machine while flushing the extruder. The guard was not in place at the time.
An employee was setting a piece of casing in a trench when the line-up tab broke, swung off the pipe, struck the employee in the head and chest, and pinned him between the pipe and wall.

An employee was operating a saw to cut pieces of wood. The employee reached in to get a piece of wood out and stepped on the peddle, activating the saw and amputating the tip of the second finger on the left hand.
Two employees were trying to do preventive maintenance on a line. The line broke and they were exposed to hexane spray on their faces and in their eyes. One employee was hospitalized.

An employee entered a robotic palletizing area to adjust tape that was sticking to boxes. The employee was struck by a robotic arm, suffering pain and contusions on the right side of the ribs and neck area. The system was not de-energized at the time of the incident.
An employee was tied off on a beam while working inside a hoist way. The employee lost their balance and fell into an exposed drywall stud causing a laceration on the elbow/forearm requiring surgery.
An employee was getting up from her desk, tripped over a cord, and fell striking her head and breaking a hip.
While descending from the back of a flatbed truck, an employee fell to the ground and hit his head.

On September 23, 2016, an employee was installing a fire sprinkling system in the attic of an office building when a 110-volt wire hanging down touched his shoulder and shocked him. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hanging sheet metal from a ladder when he fell from the ladder and broke some ribs.
An employee was operating a milling machine while wearing gloves when the machine bit lacerated the employee's fingertip. The tip was surgically amputated.
An employee amputated four fingers in a meat grinder.  The grinder was guarded at the time of the incident.

On 10/25/2016, at approximately 12:00 p.m., an employee was injured as the press crew began webbing the paper through the press rollers at the beginning of a press run. During the "web up," an excessive amount of paper built up in the area. The employee attempted to push the paper through the energized machine with her right hand resulting in the laceration and fracture of the middle finger.
An employee was struck by a motor vehicle while crossing the street to return to his vehicle.
An employee was attempting to free a jam in an auger and amputated his middle and ring fingers.
On 12/13/16, an employee was cutting a piece of wood on a table saw when the wood jumped and the employee's thumb was pulled into the blade. His left thumb was severely lacerated.
An employee was making a sales call/visit to his customer when he slipped and fell down the stairs.  He was hospitalized with a dislocated knee and fractured femur.
An employee reached onto the top of a piece of equipment to get a tape measure and his thumb was caught in a pinch point resulting in amputation of the thumb between the knuckle and finger nail.

A crane operator was lowering material and an employee went to remove the hook from the material when the crane moved, causing the chain to tighten and pinch the employee's right index finger between the hook and material. The employee's fingertip was amputated.
On 11/09/2015, an employee suffered broken bones in his left wrist when it was caught in a press brake.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet and broke his right wrist and left forearm. The employee was hospitalized.

At 11:45 a.m., a piece of lumber kicked back while an employee was fitting board through a machine. Three pieces of the lumber got stuck in the employee's forearm, requiring overnight hospitalization.

An employee was standing in front of a pallet of product to place it in the bin when a coworker on a turret truck ran into the pallet, jolting the employee's foot between the pallet slats. He suffered a broken right ankle.
An employee was operating a front loader. His right hand was caught in the door when it closed and 1/3 of his right index finger was amputated.
An employee was operating a double pallet jack and wanted to move it in reverse. He put the pallet jack in the forward gear instead of reverse and became pinned between the pallet jack and a spur.

An employee was repairing wooden pallets and placing the chain back on the sprocket when his left hand became stuck between the moving chain and sprocket, crushing and severely lacerating multiple fingers on his left hand.
An employee was operating the forklift and suddenly lost control. During impact, the operator was struck in the ankle by a piece of wooden pallet. The employee was bleeding profusely.
An employee was cleaning crumbs/crust from a catwalk and got her right hand caught in an unguarded chain and sprocket conveyor.  Her right hand was amputated during surgery.
An employee sliced off their fingertip while operating a meat slicer.

A welder was using a 4 inch handheld carbon tooth cut-off saw to cut an aluminum block off a Bradley vehicle when the saw bounced back and hit him approximately 2 inches above his right knee causing a severe laceration.  The employee was taken to the hospital for surgery to repair the injury.
An employee was repairing an AC unit while working from an A-frame ladder. He fell off of the ladder and struck his head and shoulder on the ground.
An employee was knocked off a loading dock by a general purpose container, suffered head injuries from the fall.

On Friday November 4, 2016, at approximately 5:30 a.m., a temporary employee was working with a coworker to hand feed fabric into a fabric cutter machine. At some point during the operation, fabric entangled the employee's hand and pulled it into the point of operation. The employee suffered a partial right ring fingertip amputation and lacerations to the right middle and pinky fingers.

On July 14, 2016, at approximately 1:40 a.m., an employee was located at the end of the line where aluminum was being rolled onto a coil. Wearing cotton gloves, the employee was checking for edge cracks and used sand paper when he observed a spot. The roll was moving at approximately 900 feet/minute when the operator of the machine saw the coil buckle and hit the E-stop to prevent damage. While using the sand paper, the employee's left hand/fingers were severely crushed between the moving coil and the roller, requiring hospitalization.
On or about 11/3/15, an employee suffered a knife wound to their left forearm resulting in surgery.
An employee's foot was caught in a transfer auger for a corn bin, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was drilling a metal bracket onto a machine and was struck by the bracket, suffering an eye injury.

An employee was delivering a forklift when part of it broke off at the weld and the forklift fell 3 feet. The employee then hit his head on the bar support for the roll-over protection and suffered a laceration that required hospitalization.

The forklift operator got his hand caught between the top roll bar of the forklift and a piece of framing that was protecting a hydraulic fluid line resulting in a laceration to the top of the left hand, a broken ring finger, a crushed little finger and hospitalization.
An employee was attempting to open a gas cover/cap when a flash fire occurred and burned the employee's face.
An employee was helping a coworker replace struts. They were lining up pins when the supportive strap broke. The truck cab fell and crushed the employee's left hand, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was operating a mechanical punch press and amputated the left index finger.

An employee lifted a rare earth magnet from a materials hopper. He handed the magnet to a second employee.  The second employee took the magnet and began to set the magnet down on an adjacent piece of equipment.  As the second employee set the magnet down, the magnet pulled itself to the piece of equipment that he was going to place it on. His left-hand ring finger was crushed between the magnet and the equipment and had to be surgically amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee was conducting repairs on the horizontal expander. The equipment was not locked out. The gear energized and crushed his left index finger, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was holding a pin while another employee was driving the pin in with a hammer.  The employee's finger was struck by the hammer resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was working on a molding machine that was alarming. The machine was not locked out at the time. The employee's hands were in the machine when the molds closed on his finger. Half of the first joint of his right ring finger (including the nail) was amputated at the hospital.
An employee was fighting wild fires and was bitten by an insect. The employee suffered a reaction requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee tripped on a shelving unit and broke her pelvis.

Two operators were attempting to clear a "down bottle error" on the blow molding machine. They opened an interlock door and were looking into the bed area. One employee leaned on a metal plate that guides the bottles. The pressure from the leaning employee released a metal flap that caught the employee's right middle finger.
An employee thought the motor for an interlock had kicked out. When he went to reset the contactor from within a control panel, it arc flashed and caused electrical burns to the employee.
An employee was wearing gloves to handle a hot hose to clean out an auger. The gloves snagged on the auger, amputating the left ring fingertip.
An employee reached into a Ward die cutter machine while it was IES to set it up. The employee degloved three fingers on his right hand.
An employee was helping a coworker who was using a sledgehammer when the sledgehammer ricocheted and hit the employee's face. The employee was hospitalized with head trauma.

A helper began raising the powered dock plate. While the dock plate was in motion, the injured employee walked onto it and shut the trailer door. He slipped, and got his legs stuck between the dock plate and the back of trailer. While he pulled up on the plate to get if off his legs, he told the helper to pull the truck out to free him.  When the truck was pulled forward, the plate snapped downward and severed the ends of the helper's left index and middle fingers.

On January 8, 2015, at approximately 8:40 PM, an employee's leg was caught between a tugger and rolling stock another employee was moving.  The employee was taken to the hospital where he was admitted due to a possible fracture and swelling.
An employee was crushed between a forklift and a battery changing machine, injuring his torso area, chest, and back.
An employee was walking in the hallway when she tripped on a mat.  She fell to the floor, hitting her arm on the wall on the way down. She fractured her right arm.

An employee was preparing to cut a skin sliver with a meat saw. The meat slipped and the employee's fingers contacted the saw blade resulting in the amputation of the right middle and index fingertips.

An employee was responsible for loading rail cars with peanuts. The employee climbed to the top of the rail car to position the shoot for the loading process. The employee was wearing a retractable harness at the time of the incident. The train began moving forward at a slow rate of speed, causing the retractable lanyard to become fully extended. The employee was pulled from the top of the rail car and impacted the ground resulting in serious injury (bleeding on the brain and a shoulder injury) requiring hospitalization.

An employee got up on a stepladder to remove debris from inside an ~8-inch by 8-inch window opening on the chill roll machine. The employee's fingers contacted the rotating parts of the machine, amputating some fingertips (no bone loss) and requiring hospitalization. The machine was not shut off at the time of the incident.

An employee was servicing an internal hangar door when it traveled beyond its limit point. His hand got trapped between the hangar door and a hose reel assembly on the adjacent wall and was crushed. His left ring finger was amputated.
Employee was using a band saw in the commissary's butcher shop area to process meat for resale when he amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employee was walking to the building when he tripped on the uneven surface and fell to the ground, injuring his back.

The employee was working in the assembly line on the day of the incident. The employee notified his immediate supervisor that his hands were cramping. The employee was drinking water throughout the time that he was working, but the cramps began to get worse and he notified his supervisor. The employee was admitted to the hospital for dehydration and renal failure.

On or about December 04, 2015, a worker was working on a tie machine when a jam occurred. The worker called the injured employee for assistance. The injured employee disconnected the energy source, a pneumatic airline, and proceeded to clear the jam manually. As the employee tried to clear the jam, the machine's cutting knife was actuated, amputating the employee's right fingertip.

An employee who had just parked was walking through the parking lot toward the building when she slipped and fell on ice, fracturing two ankle bones. She was transported to the hospital and had surgery the same day.
An employee, who was unloading a truck, slipped on ice, fell, struck his head, and was admitted to hospital.
An employee was working on a vertical mill. The mill was running and the employee's glove was caught by the cutting tool pulling his hand into the machine and injuring the right thumb.
An employee of a tree service company fell approximately 30 feet while trimming a tree.
An employee fell on ice, causing an abrasion on his left elbow. The abrasion was followed by cellulitis and a bursal abscess.
An employee cutting manufactured parts with a vertical band saw lacerated their left index finger, requiring surgery.
An employee was clearing out the auger on the Zamboni and got their hand caught in the auger. The employee suffered torn ligaments and fractured fingers.
An employee was injured while cutting rebar with a Quickie Saw. The saw kicked backed, striking him on the right side of the face. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
Employee was walking, rolled on his ankle, and broke his ankle.
