An employee raised the hoist arm on a conveyor to pull a pallet that had stopped. The hoist arm then fell down and struck the employee, causing contusions and abrasions.

An employee was monitoring the flow of flour bags along a conveyor on a packaging machine.  He noticed a bag that had gotten caught at the top and attempted to reach in to pull it through. His gloved hand got pinched in the machine, lacerating the right middle fingertip.
On 1/20/2016 at approximately noon, an employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell, striking her head. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was walking outside when his leg gave way and he fell, breaking his left leg and requiring hospitalization/surgery.

An employee was completing a rig down and had finished cementing. He was attempting to remove the cement plug of the plug container by lowering the plug to the ground using a wench. The plug shifted and the employee's left wrist was caught between the drill pipe and the manifold on the plug container. The employee was hospitalized with a dislocated left wrist.
An employee was removing a tree limb with a chainsaw when the chainsaw kicked up and cut his left arm, requiring surgery
An employee suffered chemical burns to the arms, back, chest and legs when LBX-106 splashed onto the employee as the employee was preparing to mix products.
An employee was performing duties as a derrick hand at an oil/gas production site when his right index fingertip was pinched and amputated between a pipe and a latch.
An employee fell from a rack and fractured his hip and ankle. He also received a concussion and a shoulder strain resulting in a hospitalization.

An employee was tightening packing on a load pump with the truck pump drive shaft engaged. The employee's clothing became entangled in the drive shaft and pulled the employee's arms in resulting in multiple fractures to the left arm, skin abrasions on the left hand, and bruising to the right arm.

An employee had installed a valve stem extension on a tractor trailer rig and was crossing the roadway when he was struck by a truck that was leaving the area, fracturing both legs/ankles and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was inspecting a disassembled actuated ball valve on a workbench. The employee placed a finger on the valve when it cycled and amputated the left middle fingertip.
An employee was loading insulation into an insulation blower machine. The employee's left arm was injured when it got caught in the equipment's metal bars.

On or about September 29, 2016, an employee was operating a brush chipper. The employee began to dismount the chipper by grabbing the winch rope. At the same time, the winch rope control switch was activated, causing the rope to tighten around the employee's left index finger, crushing and partially amputating it.
An employee amputated the pointer and index fingertips while operating the Macbee 30 draw machine.
An employee was using a band saw to manufacture pallets for an engine when the saw amputated his middle and index fingers and fractured his ring finger.
While operating a standup forklift, an employee struck a concrete wall, crushing her left foot.
A brace holding up a tilt wall sheered off and swung out of place, striking an employee in the legs.

On 05/06/2015, at approximately 4:30 PM, an employee was loading a railcar with finished product using an overhead crane. He was adjusting the lifting attachment for the crane when the load shifted, causing the employee's left thumb to get caught and crushed. He was hospitalized.
An employee was loading a duct jack in a pickup truck with other employees when he slipped and got caught on the truck's tailgate, injuring his right shin/leg. He was hospitalized.
While pulling glass off a conveyor, an employee mis-stepped, slipped, and ran into a wind box, lacerating his lower leg and requiring hospitalization.

The forklift operator was lifting the bin of tootsie pops. The bin slipped and the injured employee was trying to remove the bin that had fallen when his left index finger was caught between the bin and the steel rail. The left index finger was amputated between the first and second joint.
While performing routine food preparation inside a kiosk, an employee fainted due to heat stress, then suffered right forearm pain after falling.
While shrink wrapping a roll of fabric on a re-roll machine, both of an employee's hands and arms were pulled into the machine resulting in bruising. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was helping to place chocks under a rail loaded on a truck. The rail fell off the truck and fractured his left leg.

An employee was relocating the skidder digger.  While turning around, the vehicle was half on, half off the blacktop.  The right side of the skidder sunk into the soft dirt and it started to tip over.  The employee was pinned under the skidder cage. The employee sustained lacerations to the left ear and eye and a left shoulder injury. The employee was not wearing a seat belt at the time.
An employee was exiting a truck when he missed a step and fell to the ground. His elbow hit the ground and broke, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting a masonry block when the saw bounced off the block, kicked back, and cut his collarbone.
An employee was pulling a hose apart when lime got on and burned the employee's chest, face, and neck.

An employee removed state bolts from one of two supporting flanges while working on railing. Both flanges, as well as the equipment they supported, then collapsed on the employee. The employee suffered four broken ribs and a broken tailbone and pelvis.

An employee was changing the oil in a car while down in the oil changing pit when a jug of brake cleaner ignited, causing second degree burns to both of the employee's legs and the right forearm. The employee was hospitalized.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting an automatic tool changer (ATC) on a lathe. The employee thought the ATC was stopped when he stuck his hand in to check the alignment. At that point, the ATC cycled, nipping the tip of his left 2nd finger.

A kiln cart struck an employee, breaking the employee's tibia and fibula bones when the employee's leg got caught between the moving cart and a stationary object. The employee was hospitalized and received emergency surgery.

An employee was removing a lift (Genie AWP-36S) from inside the church (main aisle, towards back of the church). The employee was lowering the lift when another employee heard a "snap" noise. The lift started to fall. The employee moved away to avoid being hit; in the process, he fell backwards, hit his head, and lost consciousness.
An employee was operating a stack loader forklift to move product when his left foot got pinned between a light pole and the lift truck. He experienced left foot swelling.
An employee fractured a femur while parachuting into a wild fire.
On 2/17/15, an employee operating a manual drill press got a glove caught in the drill bit and suffered an amputation to a portion of the pinky finger.
On 8/3/2016, at 1:00 p.m., an employee was holding a boat board with her left hand and using a utility knife to cut it. She slipped and partially amputated her left thumb, requiring stitches.
An employee fell from a ladder while installing new HVAC units. The employee sustained a fractured skull and brain swelling, two fractured vertebrae, a displaced sternum, and fractured ribs.

An employee was cutting lumber to size using a swing saw in the pallet shed. The saw blade caught his right glove as it passed and pulled his right arm underneath, amputating his right hand at or above the wrist. He required surgery to amputate his right arm 3 inches below the elbow and was hospitalized.
An employee was transferring wash material from one level to another using a scaffold ladder. He  fell backwards and fractured his back. He as admitted to the hospital.
An employee was hospitalized after a tire fell on his right leg.

An employee was unloading a truck when the dock plate did not extend completely. As the employee pulled it out to extend it, his finger was caught between the plate and the trailer, amputating his fingertip. He was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was trimming an ornamental pear tree with a pole saw when the pole saw came in contact with an electrical line. The employee suffered an electrical shock and received a burn on his right hand and on each foot, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was removing the cutter head of an auger when his left arm got caught between the auger and the casing. His left arm was amputated.
An employee fell from a beam he was standing on, down to a catwalk below, when he was removing rust from another beam. The employee sustained neck and back injuries.
An employee suffered an amputation while working on a hydraulic cylinder.
An employee was coming down a ladder to leave the roof when he slipped off and fell approximately 6 feet, suffering ankle and back sprains.
Two employees were injured by an explosion at the worksite, suffering bone fractures, burns, and internal injuries.
An employee was injured and hospitalized after attempting to gather stored racking that was to be installed in the store.
An employee was setting up the bagged milk production line when a clamp activated and caught his fingertip, amputating the finger tissue.
An employee experienced heat stress while edging a concrete sidewalk. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee received second and third degree burns to the left hand and wrist while cooking a piece of fish.
An employee was delivering mail and began cramping. The employee was hospitalized for heat stress.

Employees were cleaning a secondary breaker, 440 volt. A 13.8kv inlet seed is a higher volt that transforms it down to a 440 volt.  An employee was walking in the area and got close to the 13.8kv inlet seed and received third degree burns on his hands and lower arms.

An employee's right ring finger was smashed between hydraulic tongs and a truck bed while running rods. The employee lost the finger from the nail to the end. The employee was transported to the hospital and treated.
A temporary employee was running a punch press when the punch press tripped, amputating his left-hand at the wrist.
An employee slipped on the wet concrete floor and fell, fracturing two bones in her left foot/ankle.
An employee fell one level through an unmarked hole in a roof while he was removing debris and plywood. He was hospitalized for spinal and rib fractures, abrasions, and a cut to the head.

An employee was cleaning up hot pulp that had spilled on the floor (approximately 6-inches deep).   The employee's rubber boots became stuck in the pulp. As he tried freeing himself, his left foot came out of his boot. His unprotected foot landed in the pulp, causing second degree burns up to his ankle.
An employee was assisting in a dowel drilling operation and attempting to steady the drill when his glove was caught in the drill bit. His left fourth fingertip was then amputated by the drill bit.
An employee was conducting a basic horsemanship training course when he fell off his horse during a warmup drill, injuring his head and chest.
An employee was helping a disabled client up the stairs when the client lost his balance and fell backward, landing on the employee. The employee suffered a fractured pelvis.
An employee was cleaning the LMC machine's (glue machine) rollers and caught his right index finger in the chain and sprocket apparatus. His finger was amputated at the first digit.
An employee fell and suffered a hip injury requiring inpatient hospitalization.
An employee was working on the rooftop, using a material hoist, when he was struck by the hoist. He fell onto and injured his back.
An employee laying blocks outside was not feeling well and kept asking for rest and drinks. The employee later experienced cramping and was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

An employee was struck by a section of traffic guardrail. A backhoe was being used to remove the section. When it pulled on the guardrail, a portion of the guardrail flung and struck the employee in his legs.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the right middle finger.
An employee tried to open a gate while on a forklift truck when his finger was pinched between the gate and a concrete wall. The distal phalange on his right ring finger was amputated.
An employee slipped while walking up the stairs on a train car. He fell approximately 24 inches and landed on his right elbow, requiring elbow surgery.
An employee's golf cart drove 5 feet off the golf course's retaining wall into a pond. The golf cart landed on top of the employee, who suffered ankle, wrist, eye socket, and rib fractures.
An employee using a table saw amputated the tip of the right index finger from the first and second knuckle.
An employee was walking down the stairwell and fell. The employee was hospitalized with a head injury.
An employee was performing framework in high temperatures and was hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee was replacing a missing shingle on the cedar shake roof of a 2-story residence. He  stepped on a loose shingle, slipped, and fell 20 feet to a cobblestoned area of ground below. He sustained three cracked vertebrae and a bruised lung.
An employee was hospitalized for a heat related illness.

An employee was adjusting the projection welder machine. The employee's right hand was on the working surface of the machine when the steel shaft came down and amputated the employee's right middle finger.
An employee was walking through the workplace parking lot to go in to work when an individual drove up, got out of their vehicle, and shot the employee in the back.

An employee was standing between a pickup truck and a wagon attempting to connect the two together, when the truck rolled back pinning the employee between the truck and wagon. The employee suffered a broken shoulder, left arm, left clavicle and four ribs on the left side.
An employee slipped and fell inside a walk-in freezer. The employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair a fractured ankle.
While an employee was climbing a scaffold, his foot slipped and he fell to the ground, breaking his foot and lacerating his head.

A crane operator and another employee were lifting two steel beams. The crane operator did not notice that the other employee had his hand between the beams. When he began lifting the beams the other employee's hand became caught between the beams resulting in amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee worked on his knees on the subfloor of the IT room for two days. He developed knee pain, knee swelling, and fever.
An employee was sawing laminate on a table saw and amputated three fingers on the left hand.
An employee was held at gunpoint while taking the store's trash out at 12:02 a.m. The armed robber forced the employee back into the store and shot the employee in the abdomen.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell fracturing the left femur.

A Ski Instructor was instructing a group of students down the trail.  He caught an edge of his ski, and went into the woods, where he fell and fractured his ribs, two vertebrae, his elbow (which will require surgery), and possibly his hip.  He also had puncture wounds on his thigh from the sticks/branches.
An employee was attempting to uncouple a railcar. The car rolled forward, trapping and crushing the employee's left ring finger. The employee required surgical amputation.
An employee was assembling 5-pack boxes, cutting the plastic strapping from a bundle of cartons using a retractable snap blade utility knife, when his left wrist was lacerated.

On 9/7/15, an employee was cleaning out top flash and trimmings that had fallen on the floor beneath an auto-trimmer. His finger entered the stroke path of the lift cylinder, and his right middle fingertip was amputated.

On Friday 12/4/2015, at 6 pm, an employee was scooping flux from a galvanized zinc kettle. As he was putting the excess flux into a 55-gallon drum, the hot flux boiled up and popped. The splash from the flux went down into his leather glove, resulting in second degree burns on the left hand and wrist.

Employee was changing a wheel on an ice cream dipping cabinet, which was turned on its side. The cabinet was on a dolly while the employee was working on it. The cabinet slipped or shifted and crushed/smashed the employee's finger, causing a laceration. Employee was taken to the hospital for treatment and was kept overnight for further observation.
An employee fell from a ladder and was injured.
An employee fell approximately 2 to 3 feet down a set of stairs at the loading dock and suffered a broken hip.

An employee was operating a press brake and attempting to remove a piece when the clamp came down and amputated his left middle fingertip and avulsed his left ring finger. The machine was cycling at the time of the incident.
An employee was applying sealant on the edge of a roof when he lost his balance and fell 28 feet to the ground below, dislocating his right hip.
An employee was participating in a team building event and fell breaking his hip.

An employee working on a oil and gas drilling rig fell from a height of 85 feet due to icy conditions on the derrick board.  The ladder safety device did not engage properly resulting in the employee's fall. The employee was hospitalized with multiple broken bones, internal injuries, and lacerations.

An employee was attempting to stop his assigned vehicle from rolling when he was hit by the door, knocked to the ground, and dragged. He suffered right hip and ankle injuries, as well as left knee abrasions.
An employee on a bakers scaffold fell while attempting to remove a light fixture. The employee's head struck the floor and suffered a contusion, requiring hospitalization.
After completing a round of deliveries, an employee experienced heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.
An employee sustained a partial amputation to the left thumb while offloading steel from a truck. The hoisted material shifted, pinching the thumb between the load and the hook.
An employee pinched a nerve in his back while pulling pallets and moving boxes. He was hospitalized.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after receiving a laceration from a concrete saw.

On September 17, 2015, at approximately 6:30pm, a worker was injured when the tip of his right index finger was pinched while changing the blade on a horizontal band saw.  Lockout was used to de-energize the machine.  As the employee manually turned the wheel to engage the blade, his finger was pinched between the wheel and the blade, resulting in amputation.

An employee was taking the bolts out of an 8-inch flange when the 40 lb. flange fell 1 inch onto his left pointer finger, resulting in a laceration. The finger had to be amputated at the knuckle at York Hospital.

An employee was cleaning out a jam on the lint cleaner machine. The machine was turned off, but the blades were still turning when the employee's hand got caught in the machine amputating the tip of the ring finger.
While driving a work bicycle, an employee was struck by a moving vehicle, suffering bruises and scrapes on the legs, shoulders, and arms.
An employee was operating a table saw when he cut his left thumb and was hospitalized.
An employee standing on the back of a trailer during an offload lost their footing. The employee fell to the ground and rolled their right ankle. The employee was hospitalized with a broken ankle.
Employee fell and broke her right leg. This resulted in an overnight stay in the hospital.
An employee was walking down a hallway and fell striking her head on the tile floor. The employee suffered a head laceration, a fractured elbow and a fractured finger.
An employee was placing a tire on a tire changing machine when the machine was activated via the foot pedal. The machine then caught and amputated the employee's fingertip.
An employee was walking from one deck to the deck feeder. As he crossed the gap between the two, his foot became caught in the chainway, breaking his right ankle.
An employee amputated the left ring fingertip while operating a deboning machine.
An employee suffered a heat related illness while working at or near a furnace.
An employee's middle finger was partially amputated while using a table saw, requiring reattachment surgery.
An employee was burned by hot water during plumbing activities.
An employee was repositioning a gift shop display from inside the door to outside the door when the employee fell and broke the left hip.
A crane operator was moving a load, which was secured by choker slings. An employee on the ground was struck in the head by the pole/rod while the lift was taking place, fracturing his skull.
An employee was shutting the door to a forklift. His fingers were caught in the door, amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was delivering mail to an industrial company site when he was struck by the swinging forks of a mini loader, breaking his left leg in two places and requiring hospitalization.

An employee attached a counter-weight to a chain that was being adjusted. The employee's glove was then caught on the chain and pulled into the sprocket, amputating the employee's right index fingertip.
While bending parts on a brake press, and employee's right index fingertip was amputated between the part and the press.
An employee was walking in the work area, tripped and fell breaking the left hip.
An employee was removing traffic cones from the parking lot when they slipped on ice and fell hitting their head and neck. The employee was hospitalized with head, neck and back pain.
An employee was attempting to clear a clogged fryer line. Chemical had been left in the drain line and when the hot oil hit the chemical and water, the employee was burned on the upper body.
An employee was working on the line, got bumped by another employee, stepped back and lost her balance falling and breaking her left wrist.
A temporary employee was cleaning out a running saw and amputated the right pinky finger.
A worker was lifting a 42-pound part onto a shelf at chest height. The part fell onto his right-hand fifth digit and partially severed it at approximately the location of the cuticle.

An employee was observing a packer/hopper assembly that he had just finished when the hydraulic fitting failed and he was struck by the hydraulic hose and sprayed with hydraulic fluid. He then fell backward and struck the back and top of his head on a solid square object located approximately 5 feet behind his observation point. He suffered a small cut to the skin on the right side of his neck, bruising from the cut down across his right clavicle, bruises to the back of his neck, and a scrape to the top of his head.
A roll-off truck driver was trying to untangle the automatic load tarp and fell approximately 8-10 feet to the ground. The driver suffered trauma to the head, back and shoulder.
On June 2, 2015, an employee was struck by an 18-wheeler truck while flagging traffic on the highway. The employee was hospitalized for multiple injuries.

An employee was helping a forklift operator straighten the cardboard dust cover on a pallet. The top three pallets in the stack collapsed, causing several hundred cans of green beans to fall on the employee, breaking both of his lower legs.

While operating a forklift, an employee struck a truck that was being repaired. The employee then attempted to reverse the forklift while a hand was on the outside of the roll bar, but went forward instead. The employee's right pinky finger was caught and amputated between the forklift's roll bar and the truck.
An employee was delivering mail when they experienced dehydration, kidney failure, and heat illness due to heat exposure. The employee was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee fell out the driver's side door of a truck and fractured a hip.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut boards to size and amputated the tips of three fingers on the right hand.
An employee was working on a module feeder and his hand contacted the belt resulting in the amputation of three fingers.

On March 29, 2015, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee sustained an injury to the middle finger and index finger on his right hand, resulting in amputation. The site port cover was removed from the door-facing press to blow out the fiber incline conveyor. The conveyor was not shut down at the time. An air wand got caught between the conveyor and tail roller, and the employee's hand was pulled into the framework between the air wand and the conveyor housing.
An employee was looking down and reading while walking. She tripped on materials and fell on the right side of her body, fracturing her hip.

An employee was adjusting the forks on a forklift when a fork popped off the frame and pinched the employee's left middle and ring fingers. The employee's middle finger was partially amputated, and the ring finger required sutures.
An employee was erecting a wall and became disorientated. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working under the hood of a vehicle suspended above him by a hydraulic automobile lift. The vehicle unexpectedly started moving forward while on the lift and struck his shoulder area. He was hospitalized.
An employee strained their lower back while pulling a power cable up a cell tower.

An employee was tightening the chuck on a lathe using a T-handle when a second employee turned on the lathe, causing the T-handle to spin. The injured employee's right ring finger got caught between the machine and the T-handle, resulting in a soft tissue amputation.

A worker was cleaning the chain of a tenter frame machine. A second worker was jogging the machine for the first worker. The first worker's right hand was caught in the machine resulting in the amputation of the index fingertip.

An employee was installing an LED light fixture in the light circuit when he was shocked. He suffered burns to his left and right hands, broken ribs, a head laceration, and a possible fractured rib. The light circuit was not locked out and personal protection equipment was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was servicing a tire when the equipment hub shattered and the mounted tire struck the employee on the left arm.
An employee was hospitalized after sustaining injuries during a snowmobile incident where they struck a tree. The employee broke an ankle, requiring in-patient hospitalization and surgery.
The employee was a passenger in a golf cart and fell out as the cart went around a corner.
An employee suffered a head and back injury when kicked by a patient.

At approximately 6:20 AM on November 12, 2015, an employee was opening the third ball valve in a system of six to operate the plasma cutting machine.  There was a failure at the pipe or the valve, and a spark ignited the gas. The employee was positioned at the compressed gas cage when this occurred, sustaining second-degree burns to his upper right chest, right arm, and left wrist.
An employee fell off an 8-foot ladder and fractured his hip on the concrete floor.
An employee slipped and fell entering the restroom and broke her hip.

An employee fell approximately 18 feet to a concrete driveway from a ladder while installing cable television line from a pole to a home, suffering fractures and soft tissue damage to the feet and ankles.
An employee cut his finger on a lawnmower blade while clearing a clog and was hospitalized.
An employee was a passenger in a UTV that a customer was driving. The UTV overturned and the employee's right arm was fractured.

An employee was reaching for boxes while on top of a pallet. When she turned to step off of the pallet, her foot got caught in shrink wrap, causing her to trip and fall. She landed on her left wrist and broke it, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized following a workplace accident that involved contact with chemicals.  While opening a container of pressurized ammonia, the chemical released into the employee's face.
An employee was washing a process line that had a phosphate blockage. The chemical splattered and burned the employee's legs.
An employee was shot by an active shooter at a truck stop.
Three workers were raising the structural wall frame of a single family house when the wall fell onto an employee, fracturing his upper leg.

An employee working as a metal sorter on the discharge side of the Vezzani Sheer grabbed a hold of a steel cable and pulled it causing material to fall and strike his left hand. The employee sustained a laceration and broken left index finger.

An employee was working on a highway, pouring concrete on a part of the road, when a car sped into the construction zone. The car hit a wood plank, which ejected toward the employee, striking him in the face and causing major swelling and bruising. He was hospitalized.
An employee was walking in the aisle, turned a corner and was struck by an electronic shopping cart driven by a customer. The employee sustained a broken hip.
An employee was repairing an A/C unit. While performing maintenance, the unit started and cut the employee's right hand. He had surgery and was hospitalized overnight.

On November 25, 2016, at 2:30 PM, an employee was watching a coworker set up a die in a full revolution mechanical power press when the employee's left hand entered the top ejection post that was attached to the platen. The coworker then jogged the machine and the top rod crushed four fingers on the employee's left hand. The middle and ring fingers had to be medically amputated below the first joint.
An employee was climbing over a pallet of product when he got his foot caught and fell off the pallet breaking his knee cap.
An employee was hospitalized due to extreme heat.

An employee was removing a jam under the pusher bar when the bar came down on the employee's arm, pinching and severely bruising it. The employee required surgery. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was opening a box of office supplies when she tripped and fractured her lower back.

An employee was using needle nose pliers to close up the safety cable's compartment located underneath the right side of the aircraft by the aileron when he hurt the left side of his face and eye. The injured employee did not know what hit him. He was admitted to the hospital overnight for surgery.
An employee had delivered mail to a mailbox at the front door of a home. As she turned away, two dogs appeared and attacked her, biting her head, right and left arms, and right and left legs.

On 4/18/15 an employee was changing doctor blades on tissue machine 2. As the blades were positioned, the employee suffered an amputation injury when his left right finger was caught between a cylinder and the clevis.
An employee took packages off a conveyor, stepped back, and fell, severely fracturing the ankle.
A technician was discussing the job with a customer and was bitten by the customer's dog causing lacerations to the right forearm and muscle damage.
An employee suffered a heat-related illness while moving dirt piles.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet through an unsecured hole on a parking garage roof and was hospitalized with multiple fractures to the wrists and pelvis.

Worker operating a small press brake was struck in the neck by the piece that was being bent. The worker passed out, fell over a stool/chair, and struck his head on the concrete floor. He was transported to the local hospital in Parsons where he was treated, and then transported to Via Christi in Wichita where he remains hospitalized.
An employee stepped on a tack while walking in the work area. The employee was later hospitalized for an infection in his foot.
An employee was fixing a sin fin motor when his arm got pulled by a belt. He lost his ring fingertip on the right hand.

An employee was using a lift to reach items above the floor in a warehouse. As the lift was being lowered, a ring on the employee's right pinky finger was caught on an object outside the lift. The finger was amputated.
An employee was bending a piece of rebar when the employee's glove was caught between the rebar and the table, causing an amputation without bone loss.
An employee was clearing debris from the line. The blower did not come to a complete stop and the employee's left hand was lacerated.

Two maintenance employees were troubleshooting a switch gear at an unmanned pipeline compressor station when an arc flash occurred.  One employee was hospitalized after receiving burns on his hands and face.  Another employee was treated, but was not hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a vehicle while setting up a work zone on a state highway. The employee suffered rib fractures and a punctured lung.
One employee was moving logs and one log rolled and caught his foot between the log and a chain.
An employee was installing an eave on a manufactured home using a pneumatic staple gun when the gun discharged a staple into his left kneecap.
An employee was walking when he slipped and fell, fracturing his left arm and dislocating his left elbow.
On February 26, 2015, an employee suffered severe injuries while operating the A-line machine.  The employee's hand and arm were pulled into the pinch rollers during operation.
An employee was unloading a truck at the dock area at the end of the day. He fell in between the truck and the dock breaking his right leg. He was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
An employee was retrieving merchandise from a layaway storage area and felt groin pain. He was hospitalized for hernia surgery.
An employee working from a ladder suffered an electrical shock. The employee fell from the ladder and suffered fractures to the face and back/neck, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was a passenger on a baggage tractor traveling from one gate to another. When the tractor made a left turn, the employee fell off. The employee sustained a left knee fracture and a right shoulder dislocation.
An employee was struck by a forklift while returning to his forklift, breaking his right lower leg and ankle. He required surgery.
An employee was removing wall flashing when he fell approximately 30 feet from the roof to the ground below, bruising his right-side ribs.
An employee was installing a mirror when a piece of it broke off and impaled the employee in the chest, causing a laceration to the chest/abdomen.

An employee was cleaning and adjusting the chain on the stationary fixed gear bike (35 pound flywheel) when the towel in his right hand got caught in the chain pulling his right hand in between the cog and chain and amputating the right index fingertip.
An employee suffered left arm swelling after a suspected insect bite and was later hospitalized for treatment.
An employee stepped into a hole and fell 14 feet while welding on an I-beam, fracturing the right shoulder and tailbone.
An employee was sliding an industrial ladder off a truck when his left pinky finger was caught between the end of the ladder and his steel-tip boot, amputating his fingertip.
Employee was walking into work when she fell breaking her leg in two places.  Employee was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a block of cheese and the knife slipped and punctured the employee's abdomen.

An employee was bringing a steel plate down onto a pillow block. While he was adjusting a piece of sheet metal, the block turned and pinched his finger between the block and plate, amputating his left index fingertip (part of nail).
An employee collapsed at the fuel pumps for unknown reasons.
An employee was struck by a passing vehicle while he was unloading merchandise. Both of the employee's lower legs were fractured.
A maintenance worker suffered a crushed arm when he was struck by the moving parts of a tray stacking machine.
A delivery driver fell off the back of the truck, landing on the pavement below, and broke the left hip.

On or about April 5, 2016, at 4:00 p.m., an employee was  attempting to insert a plate into a shell core machine when his hand became caught in the machine, severely burning his left thumb and first and second fingers. He was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was driving a forklift to move materials when a piece of material rolled off the stack, causing the forklift to pitch forward and then return to the ground. The employee struck the windshield, rupturing his discs.
An employee was walking in the parking lot when she slipped on ice and broke her ankle, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was looking for parts while walking and talking on the radio.  The employee tripped on a safety barrier and broke the left leg above the ankle.
The employee was stacking pipe when he was struck by a pipe. His ear was amputated resulting in an overnight hospitalization.

On January 28, 2015, an employee was using an 8-foot A-frame ladder to change out pipe fitting at the Hydro Cracker Unit.  The employee fell from the ladder while descending, breaking his lower right leg in the ankle area.  Employee was transported by ambulance to Pauls Valley, then transferred to the Norman Regional Hospital where he had surgery to set the bone.
The incident occurred at a press, which rewinds rotating shafts and cycles out. The employee's arms got caught in the rewinder.
An employee was cleaning the hopper on a combine with an air hose when the employee's right leg was caught in the combine auger, amputating it mid-calf.
An employee was tack welding pipe fittings. A 95 pound fitting fell onto the employee's foot breaking the bone of the big toe.  The employee was hospitalized overnight for surgery.
An employee received an amputation injury from a latch installation machine after accidentally activating the machine.

An employee was operating a pipe grooving machine when the employee's glove and hand were pulled into the point of operation, partially amputating the right index finger to the second knuckle and the middle fingertip to the first knuckle.
An employee was assisting a coworker with carts. While stepping away, the employee tripped over the coworker's foot and fell on the left side, breaking the left arm and hip.
While pulling on some belts to unchoke the lint cleaner, an employee got his ring finger caught in the belts resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was performing maintenance on a machine and removed a pin.  A part fell and struck the employee on the leg causing a fracture.
On September 3, 2015, an employee sustained a head injury. While he was looking at a piece of wood, he tripped and hit his head, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was loading a refrigerator into the back of a truck when the blade that pushes debris into the truck caught his gloved left hand and partially amputated his middle and ring fingers.
An employee was restraining a resident when the resident bit the employee's right hand.

On June 29, 2015, an employee was speaking with a supervisor in the packaging area. Following the conversation, she started to return to her work area at the ovens. She crossed through the transparent curtain adjacent to the packaging area. She crossed into the walkway where it intersects a forklift route. 

A forklift driver was also approaching the intersection. He reported that he slowed and used his horn as he approached the intersection. He did not see her due to an obstructed view. T
he forklift driver continued driving through the intersection. The employee was struck by the forklift and fell to the floor. She suffered a compound fracture to her left ankle and lacerations to her forehead. Her foot/leg was amputated 5-6" below the knee.
An employee was operating a standup powered industrial truck. The employee tried to stop the truck with their foot and broke the left leg.
An employee was crushed-by a concrete structure when it was being placed along the southeast section of the lake's shores/bank. The employee's pelvis was broken.

An employee was cleaning a conveyor. The floor of the immediate area was wet due to cleaning. The employee slipped and attempted to catch himself by grabbing the conveyer. His thumb and forefinger became caught in the conveyor, which was operating in cleanup mode. His left index fingertip and thumb tip were amputated.
While lowering a swivel arm/gate, an employee's fingertip got caught between the heavy equipment. The fingertip was later amputated.
An employee was pressure-washing a propane truck in a garage when a fire explosion occurred, burning the employee's hand and arms.
Employee slipped and fell on an icy sidewalk resulting in a compound fracture of the leg.
A truck driver fell off the truck bed and sustained severe head injuries.

An employee was cutting straps from boxes at the loading dock with a knife. The employee's hand slipped and he cut himself in the lower, right abdomen.  The employee was hospitalized for treatment of small perforations in the small intestine.
While making a delivery, an employee slipped on ice at the customer location. The employee fell to the ground and broke a leg in two places, requiring hospitalization.

During rigging down of a drilling rig, two employees attempted to lift/move an I-beam by hand. The I-beam shifted and crushed one of the employee's right middle finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip/print pad.

An employee was inspecting a weld on the outside of a 32" diameter, 80 ft. long pipe. The employee's foot and lower leg were caught between the pipe and a rotator roller.  The employee lost tissue on the right heel, calf and leg.
An employee was attempting to lift a part when the chain/hoist slipped off the part and the chain struck the employee in the face fracturing facial bones on the left side just below the eye.

On 2/20/2015 a worker was using an overhead crane to move a 200lb lift gate.  The crane fell from its support and landed on the employee's back. The employee broke several ribs and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was helping to unload cable reels when his finger got pinched between a forklift fork and a trailer. His right ring finger was amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee fell down the stairs and broke the right ankle.
An employee was offloading steel when the steel rolled off the forklift and struck the employee's leg, breaking the ankle.
An employee dropped a piece of PVC conduit on his thumb, breaking it and damaging tendons.

An employee was helping a three-man crew with a backhoe to lift a walk-behind saw approximately 6 inches and move it forward approximately 3 feet. The employee attached rigging from the walk-behind saw to the backhoe and stood to the side of the forks approximately 4 feet away. As the backhoe operator lifted the saw, the backhoe forks disengaged and struck the employee's hard hat. The employee was hospitalized for a head injury.

An employee was attempting to fix a registration issue on a machine's fill and seal line. As he went to remove a cover off the stretch cylinder, the machine cycled. His left middle finger was crushed between the machine's collar and the stretching cylinder, amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was walking and tripped and fell breaking the femur bone.
An employee received a partial right thumb amputation while strapping lumber on the dry chain.

While an employee was laying pipe, a piece of 36" concrete pipe became disconnected from an excavator. The pipe rolled down the slope of the excavation and up against the employee, striking and breaking his lower left leg bones.
An employee cut his wrist while operating a polishing wheel and was hospitalized overnight.
On or about February 8, 2016, an employee suffered a pelvic injury after being caught in/crushed between form work and a precast panel.
An employee was walking on the property. When the employer opened the metal gate, it came off its roller and struck the employee, breaking several vertebrae in his back.
An employee slipped and fell on the floor resulting in a left wrist injury.
Employee slipped on a wet floor and grabbed onto a fryer to stop himself from falling.  When doing so, his arm went into the fryer and he sustained severe burns to his right arm.
On 12/2/2015, at 12:00 to 12:30 pm, an employee was hand washing the inside of a drinking glass using a rag. The glass broke and cut her hand.
An employee was servicing an oven. As he was leaving after the service was completed, he felt pain and pressure due to a hernia.
An employee installing a metal roof on a pole barn fell through a plastic skylight approximately 15 feet to the ground and was hospitalized.

A work crew was wrapping the steep tank with poly to protect it against the weather. To do so, the crew was moving the grating away from the tank so that they could slide the poly down and tie it to the tank. While setting down the end of the grating, the injured employee's left fifth finger became caught between the grating and the I-beam.  When he went to pull his finger out, he partially severed the fingertip, which had to be surgically amputated.
An employee's finger was caught between the top and bottom of the top drive track causing an acute traumatic amputation of the left distal index finger.

An employee was climbing a fixed ladder with a cage inside of a containment unit when she lost her footing and subsequently lost her hand grip and fell approximately eight feet breaking her right ankle. She had surgery to repair the damage to her ankle.
An employee was exposed to carbon monoxide from two forklifts while working at the grading table.
An employee was holding a chain attached to a gopher machine being lifted by a forklift. The employee's hand was caught in the chain as it was being lifted, fracturing the right ring fingertip.
An employee at the facility was hospitalized after being found unresponsive in the subfloor area.
An employee was seriously injured when a vehicle slipped off of an automotive lift while the employee was working underneath it.
An employee slipped and fell through a ladder hole to the next lower level while performing lashing on the upper deck.
An employee was walking by an applicator when the coupling blew off, spraying anhydrous ammonia that burned the employee's chest and eyes.

An employee was working from a 10-foot platform, tripping tubing, when the elevators made contact with a stub on the next joint of tubing. The employee dismounted the platform and landed on the ground 10 feet below, breaking both legs.
An employee was on an 8-foot step ladder installing fire caulking. The employee tried to re-position, lost his balance, and fell. He was hospitalized overnight with a possible broken pelvis.
Employee fell approximately 15 feet. No fall protection was being used at the time.

An employee was working on a 12-foot A-frame ladder, attempting to thread a piece of pipe. While pushing the pipe to align it, he was thrown off balance and fell forward approximately 4 feet (from the 4th or 5th rung) to the concrete floor, suffering a head laceration, two broken wrists, dental trauma, and a bruised knee.
Two employees were taken to the emergency room at Denver General for oxygen and observation after being exposed to carbon monoxide from a propane heater being used indoors.
An employee was working on a press machine when he got caught in two nip points, degloving his right hand. The guard on the folder section was bypassed at the time of the incident.

An employee was off his lift checking on a pallet of product. A forklift driver was coming toward the employee and did not see him until he was too close. The back of the forklift struck and fractured the employee's right foot.

On or about 8:15 a.m. on October 27, 2015, an employee was operating a com cutter machine when he incurred an amputation to the tip of his left ring finger.  The machine rotates, smooths and cuts commutators that are a component of DC motors.
An employee was working from an 8-foot ladder when he lost his balance and fell onto an arcade machine, breaking multiple ribs.

An employee was trying to unjam two steel bars on a conveyor when the photo sensor sensed movement and began to cycle, causing the employee's right hand to be dragged into the conveyor. The employee suffered a fractured right hand and was hospitalized overnight. The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee was injured when working on a conveyor.
An employee cleaning the x-ray conveyor in the Bakery Department got her arm caught between the roller and the belt breaking her arm in two places.

An employee was setting up press rolls. He was between quests and changing the width of the spider arms on the press to install a different roll on the rotating spider arms. He left one roll on top and removed the bolts that keep the spider arms in a fixed position.  The weight of the roll fell down and hit him in the left shoulder as he was jumping out of the way. His foot got caught on the transfer table, and he twisted and fractured his right ankle. He also bumped his chin and received several scrapes on his right leg.
An employee was participating in a team building event and fractured their right leg.
An employee was drilling holes with a drill press when his glove got caught in a drill bit, amputating two fingers.
An employee was struck on the hand by a piece of concrete that fell from the ceiling while sweeping the floor. The employee suffered a partial amputation to the left ring finger.
An employee helping with drywall construction became overheated, felt dizzy, and had a light headache. He was hospitalized overnight and given fluids.
An employee was running a rib/navel saw in the fabrication department and amputated the tip of the left middle finger.

An employee who was using a cordless circular saw to install wood panels around an elevator lobby received a partial amputation of his left index finger when the tip of his finger became caught in the saw.
An employee was using a hand drill to drill a hole through a header when the paddle bit went through the wood and drilled into his right index finger.

Employees were standing in front of an extrusion machine studying a test run of material while other employees were grinding on the mold. A sudden release of pressure forced material and components out of the mold. As a result, an employee suffered multiple face fractures, a laceration above the right eye, broken fingers, and broken ribs.
An employee's left index fingertip was amputated by a closing freezing door.
An employee was injured when an excavator rolled over while moving material.
On or about 6/11/15, an employee's left middle fingertip was amputated by a moving chain conveyor.

A dump truck from another company, broke down in front of the plant, and employees helped to pull it into the yard with a front end loader. The dump truck had a broken V joint. The injured employee kicked the drive shaft back towards the center of the truck while the vehicle was in motion, and the truck's back axle ran over the employee's legs and feet.
An employee was looking for frosting in the freezer and slipped and fell.
An employee was struck by a vehicle while picking up a traffic control flag from the middle of the street, suffering multiple bodily injuries.

An employee had lifted a vehicle 4 inches off the ground to make sure it was sitting on the pinch rail. The vehicle slipped off the cleat and pinched his right middle finger between the vehicle and the lift. He suffered a phalangeal amputation of his right middle finger.
An employee was operating a pallet jack. A coworker operating a forklift with the forks up ran into the pallet jack. One of the forks struck and cut the employee's upper right thigh.
On July 24, 2015, an employee was adjusting a roll-forming machine when his hand was pulled into the running die. He broke his left thumb and sustained a left index fingertip amputation.

An employee hurt his back while placing a roll of plastic onto an uncoiler.  The roll of plastic weighs approximately 40 pounds.  While placing the roll onto the uncoiler, the roll slipped and fell.  The employee attempted to catch the falling roll of plastic resulting in a lower back injury.
While an employee was walking back to his work station, he slipped on a piece of potato that was on the walkway, fracturing his left leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a ladder while splicing lines between poles and was hospitalized due to a fractured lower right leg.

An employee entered a freshwater, 3000-gallon tank to replace spray nozzles and was exposed to steam mist and residual chemicals that were left in the tank from the clean-out process. He experienced nausea from inhalation exposure and was hospitalized.
The employee was exiting a patient's private residence and slipped and fell on the wet wheelchair ramp.  The employee broke her left leg.  The incident occurred on 1/10/15.
An employee was pinned between a reversing truck and a wall, suffering a punctured left lung and eight broken ribs.

An employee was feeding material into the moulder during the setup process. The employee fed a thin piece of material into the moulder and then thought it was jammed in the machine. When she went to the operator to point out where it was jammed, her glove was pulled into the cutter head and her index and middle fingertips were amputated.

An employee 

amputated the right index finger to the first knuckle when his right hand was caught in steel double doors in an attempt to keep them from closing.

An employee was working on an enclosed balcony putting up flashing between the balcony and the porch. The employee went on the outside of the balcony. He was holding on to the railing when it became loose and he fell approximately nine feet to the ground below injuring the hip, shoulder, ribs and lung.

Two temporary employees were working to stand up paperboard tubes 18 inches in diameter, 240 inches in length, and 105 pounds in weight.  As one employee turned to walk away, one of the tubes fell and struck the first employee in the head, knocking him to the floor.  This employee sustained a fracture to the second vertebra in his neck, which required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was admitted for in-patient hospitalization on July 12, 2016, due to heat exhaustion.

An employee was making sure that packages did not fall off the unload belt when a flat package slipped between the unload belt and a transfer plate. When he attempted to retrieve the package, his glove became caught on one of the belt rollers, pulling his hand between the roller and a piece of angle-iron located near the belt. His right hand was crushed, especially his right ring finger.
An amputation injury occurred on June 4, 2015, to a temporary employee working in the Forming Department.
An employee was at table saw cutting wood when the saw began kicking back. The employee attempted to stop the kickback and made contact with the blade, cutting her palm up to her middle finger.
On 12/2/16, a temporary employee fell from a ladder to the concrete floor, suffering a laceration to the back of the head and a compression fracture to the spine. The employee was hospitalized.

On January 31, 2017, an employee was removing teeth from a core barrel that was used to drill a 30-inch diameter eight-foot deep hole. The employee was facing towards the hole when he was witnessed as experiencing seizure type symptoms. The employee turned around and looked upwards. The employee then backed up and fell into the hole. The employee suffered a broken neck.
An employee connecting structural steel fell approximately 17 feet, suffering a broken pelvis.
On 2/6/16, an employee was hospitalized with a fractured right elbow after losing control of an ATV and rolling it over.
An employee was operating a loader. A bus drove by the loader causing the door to slam closed on the employee's thumb and amputate 1/4 inch of the thumb.

An employee was hospitalized for respiratory issues after working in the building throughout the day while the elevator was painted from the roof of the building. The paint fumes were pulled into the building via the ventilation system.
Employee experienced an amputation to the right thumb when exposed to an unguarded pulley.
An employee's thumb was caught and partially amputated in a closing bagger machine door.
An employee was standing on top of a stack of feed bunks, untying a bundle, when the bunks shifted and he fell off. The bunks then fell onto his leg, breaking his right femur.
An employee fell approximately 16 feet through an elevator shaft resulting in broken ribs and a punctured or collapsed lung.

On July 12, 2016, at approximately 1:45 p.m., an employee was attempting to remove a stairway from a 100-barrel tank that was also being prepped for removal. The stairway was held to a platform by two bolts. Standing on the ground, the employee removed one bolt, which allowed the stairway to swing towards the tank. The employee was pinned between the tank and the stairway, suffering a collapsed left lung, contusion to the back and right shoulder, and friction burn to the trunk and right ear. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was attacked by a dog while delivering mail to a private residence. Her right forearm suffered puncture wounds, fractures, and tendon damage, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was attaching hydraulic clamps to cattle hide when the employee's left hand was caught in the clamps, fracturing all of the fingers.
An employee fell 12 feet from a platform, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was walking near an operating bobcat skidder while supporting the load. The bobcat's track ran over the employee's left foot resulting in broken bones and soft tissue damage.

On August 23, 2016, at approximately 11:30 a.m., an employee was removing the sheath from a telecommunications cable 
using needle nose pliers. The pliers slipped and struck the employee's left hand between the index finger and thumb, causing a laceration/cut.

An employee had the tips of his ring and middle fingers amputated above the fingernail during an outlet valve installation.  The outlet valve moved suddenly during the installation, causing the injury.
On August 18, 2016, an employee was ripping plywood when the material kicked back and pushed his hand forward into the rotating blade of the saw, amputating fingers.
An employee was positioning an ingredient barrel on a pallet when he lost hold of the drum. His finger was pinched between the drum and a diagonal I-beam. His index fingertip was amputated.
On or about February 23, 2015, employee amputated three fingers while operating the bandsaw.
An employee was creating a new chemical inside a fume hood when the beaker exploded. The employee received multiple lacerations to the face from the beaker glass.
An employee had just finished loading a truck and was stepping out of the vehicle when he fell and struck his head on concrete. He was hospitalized with a head injury.

An employee had trimmed tree branches and was descending from the tree. The employee's descending rope was tied to a branch that broke, causing the employee to fall approximately 25 feet to the ground. The employee suffered a fractured pelvis, a lacerated spleen, fractured ribs, a collapsed lung, fractured vertebrae, and a fractured left elbow.
An employee was working in the receiving area of the store. A pallet with metal shelving on it fell approximately 12' striking the employee on the head and causing a head laceration.

The employer reported an amputation that occurred on 1-21-2015 at approximately 3:00pm.  The employee was working on a coil end welding machine when his left index finger was caught in a hydraulic clamp.
The employee was utilizing a knife to cut a plastic roll and amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employees finger was partially amputated while he was cutting Formica on a table saw.

An employee was delivering a cylinder of gas to a customer.  The cylinder was being moved with a cylinder cart.  As the employee was walking the cart and cylinder to the customer's door, he slipped in the snow.  His hand got caught between the cylinder and the concrete parking lot.  The employee crushed the tips of his index and middle finger on his right hand.  In-patient hospitalization was required for surgery on the fingers.
An employee was operating a lift and was pinned between the rail and the lift injuring his left toe.

An employee was standing inside a 2-foot high box. When she stepped back, the back of her feet hit the inside of the box, causing her to fall backwards and hit her head and back. She suffered eight fractured ribs and a vertebra fracture.
On February 10, 2015 at 9:30pm a truck driver fell off the back of a truck's lift gate and was hospitalized overnight.
Employee was breaking a bolt with a crescent wrench and it slipped.  The employee fell back and rolled onto the leg fracturing the ankle.
An employee was waiting for an elevator. The elevator stopped higher than floor level. When the employee entered the elevator, she tripped and fractured her leg.

An employee was attempting to change the bearings on a fertilizer tender truck's auger and was using a garden hose to loosen the product. The hose became tangled in the auger, which drug his hand into the auger. As a result, his right pinky and part of his ring finger were amputated. He was hospitalized.

An employee was operating wire pulling equipment when the glove on his left hand was caught in a rope, which pulled his arms and body into the equipment. His left thumb was amputated and he required surgery for right wrist and arm injuries.

An employee was standing on a pallet holding an accumulator (equipment) in place while waiting for another employee to pick it up with a forklift. The employee standing on the pallet stepped in between the gaps of the pallet and fell down causing the equipment to fall on his right leg and fracture the femur.
An employee was loading mattresses on the roller pack machine and got caught in the machine resulting in head and back injuries.

An employee was closing an overhead door when the rope he was using to pull the door closed broke, causing him to fall to the concrete ground and strike his head. He suffered a head laceration and concussion.
An employee suffered a broken left arm when a large tool being unloaded from a forklift rolled onto his arm.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated while he was cutting flooring material using a retractable knife.
On or about February 17, 2015, an employee slipped and fell in the employee parking lot injuring her hip.
An employee was walking a dog. The dog lunged forward to chase a lizard and the employee lost balance and fell breaking her left femur.

On May 19, 2016, at approximately 3:30 pm, an employee was working as a flagger assigned to handling traffic control in a street renovation/construction work zone and was struck by a vehicle. The employee suffered a fractured ankle and was hospitalized.
An employee received a deep cut/laceration to the hand while operating a band saw.

An employee was checking the sensor of a valve. As he was closing the lid, he lost control of it. When he attempted to grab the lid so it did not slam, it crushed and partially amputated his right third fingernail.

An employee was using a pry bar to guide the base of a jib crane over the bolts in the floor. The base was suspended by straps attached to a forklift. The base slipped in the straps and pinned the employee's right hand between the pry bar and the floor, breaking his right index finger and requiring hospitalization.
Six 150-pound boxes fell over on top of an employee, causing injuries to his lower extremities, which included breaking both legs.

An employee was attempting to remove a cardboard corner post on a pallet. He was using his right leg as leverage on the pallet. As he was bending the corner post, it released, and the pallet slipped out from under his foot. He fell back onto the concrete floor, breaking his left hip bone.
An employee was pulling ash off of an ash truck with a clam rake and fell, suffering  a leg injury. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on a torn muscle in the right knee.
A patient care technician was helping to move an obese patient when the employee hurt his back and groin.
Employee attempting to correct a fault on the canning machine labeler fell when the guard bracket she was standing on came loose. She was about 3.5 feet from the floor and broke her elbow.

An employee was using a hoist to transfer a heat treat basket which was approximately 3 ft. by 4 ft. long from a staging rack to a conveyor. The basket was loaded with castings that go into the heat treat operation.  The employee detached the hoist and noticed the basket wasn't sitting flat on the cart.  As she manipulated the basket her right middle finger was pinched between the basket and the conveyor resulting in a partial amputation of the fingertip with loss of fingernail and subsequent revision of the tip of the finger. Stitches were used to close the wound. No surgery was required.
An employee amputated the tip of his right index finger while operating a Kaster Vertical Saw in the saw department in the morning on 1/13/15.

An employee wearing a harness and lanyard was accessing the third-story roof. He stepped from the ladder to go to his tie-off anchor point, but slipped in the process. He fell approximately 30 feet to the second story and then to the ground and was hospitalized with a compressed disc.
An employee was taking out the garbage when wind caught the door and closed it on the employee's finger. The employee's left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee tripped over a pallet jack at the mail distribution facility, suffering several fractures/lacerations.
A worker slipped on oatmeal in the staff lounge and fell breaking an arm.
An employee slipped and fell in the parking lot, suffering a broken right ankle.
An employee was fire-taping above the ceiling when his arm brushed against a pipe, scratching his right elbow. His elbow experienced pain and swelling, requiring hospitalization.

An employee visually determined that a metal flange on a transfer had become disconnected from a metal plate, allowing a transfer roller to fall. When he touched the flange, the metal plate became loose and smashed his right ring finger between the metal plate and flange. The transfer was locked out at the time.
An employee was pushing lumber through a table saw when his hand slipped and made contact with the blade, amputating his left middle finger.
An employee placed a carbon steel tube into a hydraulic tube bender and was activating the bar clamps to hold the tube in place when the second clamp crushed and amputated three left-hand fingers.
The employee was climbing the asphalt distributor tank to take measurements when a fire occurred. The employee was burned on the hand, face and upper torso.
An employee was cleaning the engine of an excavator with starting fluid when an arc sparked and triggered a fire on his sleeve. He was hospitalized with burn injuries.
Employee was performing inspection and preventive maintenance on a conveyor line.  His fingertip was amputated in a chain and sprocket when the line started up.
While performing powerline maintenance, an employee received first, second, and third degree burns to his back and arms due to an electric arc flash.
An employee was moving a pallet of bags using a hand pallet jack when someone called her name. As she turned around, the hand pallet jack ran over and fractured her left foot. She was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over a curb while delivering mail, injuring both legs and requiring surgery.

An employee was attempting to manually unjam the pleating machine. The stripper bar broke free of the pusher bar and cycled down to the table before returning to and resting in the up position. The employee's left hand was caught between the stripper bar and table during the down cycling of the bar. His left hand was sliced between the index and middle fingers to the wrist, and half of his hand was amputated.
An employee was washing the inside hood of a transformer. As he was closing the hood, his hand slipped off and the hood came down and smashed his left middle finger. His fingertip was amputated.
An employee delivering packages complained of cramping to his supervisor and was taken to the hospital where the employee received fluids and was admitted.

An employee was operating a press to remove a cylinder rod from a piston when a spring released its tension, causing the employee's finger to be caught between the piston and the press. The employee's right index finger was amputated up to the first knuckle.
An employee amputated approximately a quarter of an inch of a fingertip and also lost part of another fingertip on the same hand.
An employee descending a step-stool missed the last step, losing balance and falling to the floor. The employee suffered a possible broken hip.

Two employees were lowering a part from a mast of a ship. As the employees were lowering the part with a pulley and a tagline, the part got caught in something. The injured employee pulled hard on the tagline, cutting the line and the part fell on his right index finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
A Baker Boy Bake Shop, Inc., employee was hospitalized after receiving burns from hot water measuring approximately 180F while cleaning a conveyor oven.

An maintenance worker, inserted his left hand into the mower chute to remove grass while the mower blades were engaged and cut two of his fingers.  He was admitted to the hospital for surgery to reattach the fingers.
Employee cut his finger while he was cleaning the meat slicer in the deli.
On or about March 31, 2016, at 9:00 a.m., an employee in the meat department suffered a fingertip amputation while cutting meat on a band saw.
On 4/15/16, an employee was operating a cutter machine when his right index finger was amputated to about the second knuckle.

An employee was unhooking a cart from a tug that contained three carts. The tug operator put the tug in reverse, pinning the employee between two carts. The employee suffered a collapsed lung, broken clavicle, and broken rib.
A telescopic Kelly bar dropped on an employee's hand while he was digging a hole with an auger, crushing his left index finger.

An employee was hooking a winch cable from a truck to a crane while standing between them. The truck was positioned up hill from the crane. As the employee was connecting the winch line, the truck slid down the icy hill and pinned the employee against the crane. The employee suffered soft tissue damage in the left shoulder.
An employee suffered three fingertip amputations while unclogging a sandblaster.
While walking on a sidewalk near construction, an employee tripped and fell, breaking their elbow.
Cutting a piece of plexiglass with a table saw when the employee's right hand was pulled into the blade, amputating the ring and middle fingers at the first knuckle.
On June 22, an employee suffered the amputation of three fingers due to a chipper accident.
An employee amputated the middle and ring fingers of his right hand while operating a mixing machine.
An employee suffered a right middle fingertip amputation (no bone loss) while using a band saw to cut pork belly.

The employee was operating a mill machine to put flats on round bar stock. The employee reached behind the stock to check on a radius and was caught between the bit and the stock amputating the right index fingertip.
An employee was hospitalized with a lower back strain/groin strain after welding small parts.
Half of an employee's right pinky finger was amputated by a lumber planner he was operating.
An employee was hospitalized after being shocked while servicing electrical equipment.

An employee was standing on a step ladder installing temporary lighting. The employee was handed an electrical whip/flexible conduit. The wires in the conduit were live, 277 volts. The employee received an electric shock from the wiring and fell off the ladder. As the employee fell off the ladder his left foot went between two rungs and he fractured his lower left leg.

An employee performing service and maintenance on a conveyor system injured his calf muscle on his left leg when it got caught between the conveyor sorter slat and a cross brace. The conveyor was not locked out at the time. The employee's leg required surgery.
An employee tripped and fell over a floor mat that was rolled up on the floor near the locker room entrance. The employee struck the wall and fractured their right-eye orbital bone.

An employee sustained blunt force trauma injuries while testing an aerial fire apparatus for certification The employee was adding weight to the end of the ladder when an out rigger on the driver's side failed causing the ladder to fall and pin the employee.
An employee was injured when he reached to retrieve a piece from a 100-inch cutter and slipped on oil. The employee struck his face against the frame of the machine, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was adjusting a bag of salt while it was held up by a forklift when his left ring finger was pinched between the load and the forks, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was opening doors to a recycling shed so that a garbage truck could be loaded. The garbage truck rolled back and pinned the employee between the back of the truck and the recycling bin/shed. The employee suffered a stomach/abdominal aortic tear.

On the morning of February 20, 2017, at approximately 7:37 AM, an employee was using an emery cloth to polish a small copper electrode part on a lathe. His glove or the cloth became caught in the lathe's rotating chuck, which then avulsed his left ear and face, caused an abrasion on his left hand, and broke his left clavicle.
An employee amputated the tips of the right middle and ring fingers when a metal plate fell onto his fingers.

A scaffold board was removed to load mortar onto the scaffold. As the scaffold board was placed back into position, an adjacent scaffold board fell from the third tier, striking an employee in the head. The injured employee was on the ground loading custom bricks into a bucket.  He was taken to the hospital and admitted.
At the facility when an employee was loading a trailer with cream, the valve closed and amputated the left index fingertip.

An employee was bending and cutting rebar on a rebar bending machine when the machine cycled twice, causing the rebar to bend twice. The rebar punctured the employee's right foot, fracturing the fourth metatarsal.

An employee was putting rivets on the nose of a trailer while working from a platform. The work platform is approximately 36 inches wide, 6 feet long, 36 inches off the ground, with two steps to access. He was stepping down from the platform when he lost his balance and fell backwards, breaking his legs between the ankle and knee.

An employee was cleaning the powder filler machine. In the process, a conveyor belt pulled in the cloth she was using to wipe down the machine and the tip of her middle right hand finger was amputated. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee's right index finger was partially amputated above the first joint when it was caught in the case machine while unjamming it.
An employee was using a high-pressure water line (6,000 psi) lance to clean out a tar line when the lance kicked back and lacerated his neck and upper chest. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
As an employee was closing two bi-fold doors his right arm got caught between the two doors causing puncture wounds to his lower bicep.
An employee was operating a power washer when the high-pressure water lacerated the employee's foot.
An employee was in the shop using a permanently mounted punch machine, which makes 1-2" diameter holes in steel, and amputated his left index fingertip.
An employee suffered a groin hernia while trying to lift a toppled 55-gallon drum, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was using an overhead crane to unload wooden floor boards onto the sub-assembly of a tractor-trailer frame when his left middle fingertip was caught between a load spreader bar and a sub-assembly cross member, requiring medical amputation.

A carpenter employee received multiple fractures to his leg when he was struck by and pinned by a section of concrete form.  The employee was climbing down from the top of a stack of concrete forms when he stepped on an L bracket on one of the forms causing the form to move and strike the employee.

On August 25, 2016, an employee unstrapped a concrete form to remove it and as they were lifting it with the crane one of the filler forms fell and struck the employee. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right collar bone, facial abrasions, a head laceration and a contusion on the right shoulder.
An employee was changing the battery on a forklift. The battery shifted and smashed the employee's left middle finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was standing on the rig floor of a water well drilling rig when a block came down, hitting and breaking the employee's left foot.
An employee fell while walking into an office.
An employee was installing electrical conduit using an extension ladder.  He fell about 14 feet and broke his left ankle.
An employee was exiting a forklift when his ankle was crushed between the vehicle and a raised dock plate. He suffered a broken ankle.

Employee was attempting to close a manually propelled gate associated with a fence system.  The conditions were cold and icy.  The weather conditions were making it difficult for him to close the gate.  The employee had to get extra leverage on the gate to get it closed.  He reached up around/near the gate's rollers as he applied extra leverage to the gate with his body.  The gate suddenly gave way and the employee's finger became trapped in a pinch point created by the gate's roller and the horizontal bar the roller slides across.  His fingertip was amputated by the pinch point between the roller and the bar.
An employee's gloved  hand got caught while operating a lathe, resulting in a broken wrist and laceration of the left pinky finger.
Employee suffered a fractured neck after falling from the back of truck and landing on the head.
Employee was walking through the facility, tripped over her foot and fell. Employee sustained a hip injury and was admitted to Warren Hospital.

An employee was closing a side door of a trailer when another employee was starting up another truck. The truck rolled back and struck the employee in the mid-section pinning him between the truck and the trailer, causing internal injuries.
An employee was on a scaffold preparing an area for masonry work when the employee fell from the scaffold and onto some bricks, suffering a back injury and head laceration.
A JP Hogan employee had three fingers amputated on 1/9/2015 while working with a Husqvarna walk-behind concrete saw.
Employee was hospitalized due to injuries sustained from rolling over a landfill dozer.
Nine employees were exposed to high levels of carbon monoxide from a boiler in the hotel basement. The employees felt ill and experienced headaches. One of the employees was hospitalized.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while the employee attempted to straighten a box in a vertical box conveyer system.
An employee was hospitalized due to dehydration.
An employee climbed a 6-foot ladder to trim a tree branch. The branch fell and knocked him to the ground. He broke his leg and fractured his skull.
