Two employees were moving an electrical panel board, sliding it across the floor. The first employee was holding the panel from the front and the second employee was holding the panel from the back. The floor was slick, and the panel slipped out from under them. The panel struck the first employee on the top of his left foot, right behind the steel toe of his boot. The big toe and second toe on his left foot were amputated.
An employee fell to the ground while climbing out of his truck, fracturing his lower back.
An employee was repairing a barrel threading machine and amputated the left index fingertip when it became caught between the gun barrel and a clamp.
An employee was carrying a bucket of hot asphalt when he tripped. The hot asphalt splashed on and burned his face, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a portable grinder on site when the grinder wheel shattered. The employee's right hand was lacerated by the wheel particles.

On 08/01/2015, at 0700 a.m., an employee was removing chilled iron from a cupola moat when he sustained burns to his hands, arms, and face. The employee drove the bucket loader into the moat after water was applied to hot sand, which caused steam to burn the employee.
An employee was working on a scaffolding system when he slipped and fell 5 to 6 feet, breaking his ankle. He was wearing fall protection at the time.

A temporary employee was standing on the forks of a forklift, helping to move and load tile-making equipment onto a semi-trailer, when he fell off the forks. The forklift then ran over his right leg, requiring surgery.
An employee suffered a hand crushing injury requiring surgery and hospitalization while cleaning the filter press.

An employee was standing on a flat bed truck while a transformer was being loaded onto it with a sky lift. Outriggers were not used at the time. The sky lift tipped over and struck the employee on the head causing a laceration to the ear and abrasions to an arm and leg. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was heating a 40-foot steel beam to adjust its camber when the beam fell over and struck the employee's right leg, breaking the tibia and fibula.
An employee was operating a fuel-loop maintenance truck. While fueling a bulldozer, he stepped over the fuel hose with his left foot. His right foot twisted and broke at the ankle.

An employee was standing to the left side of a truck adjacent to the lift gate with his right hand stabilizing a window and left hand on the edge of the truck bed when a coworker raised the lift gate. His left thumb was caught between the lift gate and the truck's tailgate, causing a deep cut that required hospitalization.
An employee tripped walking down stairs when exiting the building and broke the left ankle.
While cutting metal baseplates on a band saw, an employee attempted to sweep shavings from the cut. His left index finger came into contact with the band saw blade, amputating the fingertip.
An employee reached into a packaging scale to clean out polyethylene packaging pellets and the pneumatic gate closed on his right hand.
An employee amputated the tip of his thumb while attempting to help dock a motor boat.

Employees working on a roof took an extension ladder apart. The piece with the feet was being used on the roof to access another portion of the building while the other piece of the ladder was being used on the ground. The piece of the ladder being used on the ground was not tied off and fell when an employee used it. The employee broke his leg and was hospitalized.

An employee kneeled down in a narrow, guarded area to clean around a tank that contained zinc. His right leg slipped and became partially submerged in the tank, causing second degree burns to the employee's right leg (from the upper thigh to the ankle), right arm, and right abdomen.
An employee suffered a leg amputation after being pinned by a metal extrusion machine.
An employee was lifting a bale on the deck of a ship and got a finger caught between the deck lifting eye and the bale resulting in partial amputation of the finger.
An employee was adjusting the rollers of the rip saw to unjam a piece of wood. The piece of wood kicked back and hit him on the stomach causing a laceration.
An employee fell about 15 feet off an extension ladder resulting in a fractured back.
An employee was closing off a pressure release valve when hot water sprayed his left arm and stomach.

Maintenance employees were using a forklift to lift a pallet jack to check the wheels. While the pallet jack was being lifted, the battery fell out and struck one of the employee's in the right leg fracturing it.
An employee fell down a utility pole to the ground, breaking his heel and lacerating his hand. He was hospitalized.
An employee was in a man basket spooling wire rope using a chain. The employee's hand was on the rope when the chain moved and caught his right thumb resulting in an amputation of the thumb tip.
An employee was climbing off a baker's scaffold when his foot slipped and he fell breaking his femur.
Employee installing drywall suffered a broken leg when a slab of drywall fell. Employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was servicing a chilled water line by cleaning the line with hydrogen peroxide. There was a combustible reaction and the pressure blew the lid off the stream filter housing unit. The lid struck the employee on the right hand that was being used to protect his face, causing multiple hand fractures requiring surgery. Minor burns were also incurred on the right hand/arm.
An employee was climbing down a ladder from a stage and fell fracturing the tibia.
An employee amputated their right index finger on the staple machine.
An employee was operating a forklift and moving pallets. The employee's foot got pinched between the forklift and warehouse racking, breaking bones that required surgery.
An employee had trouble breathing and was hospitalized for possible heat stress.

An employee was cutting wood using a chop saw when the guard became stuck in the up position. As the saw was powering down, the employee's jacket was caught on the blade, which then pulled the employee's left forearm into the machine, lacerating it.
A machine stopped feeding. The employee reached into the machine and amputated three fingers. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee was operating a cold press and amputated the right index finger from the second knuckle.
While exiting a security vehicle, an employee slipped on ice and hit the right knee and arm on the pavement. The employee suffered abdominal pain, vomiting, and a headache.

An employee was cleaning parts for the Piab system (pneumatic transfer system for raw materials) using sani-wipes as part of the allergen clean process on the bar line. Parts were stored on a cleaning cart along the side of the bar line room away from the production line. The cleaning process includes cleaning two rod magnets. Six magnetic rods of varying lengths are arranged in parallel with 1" spacing between each rod. The rods are connected by brackets to form a singular circular magnet approximately 13" in diameter. During an earlier shift, the two rod magnets got stuck together. The employee attempted to separate the two magnets with his hands. During this process, the magnets shifted and pinched the tip of his left middle finger. When the employee jerked his hand away from the magnets, his fingertip was amputated.
An employee's left middle and ring fingers were partially amputated by the knives on a cutter machine.

On September 20, 2015 an employee was working in spice room #1 adjusting the flow of seasoning and amputated his left middle finger when it came in contact with a rotating auger at the end of the feeder tube.
An employee suffered a nasal fracture on 5/8/15 after being hit on the nose by a baseball. He was hospitalized.

An employee was walking away from the tank that feeds the cleaning lines with a water and caustic solution. The vent from the tank blew off and splashed the employee with the solution. The employee suffered burns on the face, back, legs, arms, and stomach.
An employee fell in the parking lot while getting out of a car. The employee's head hit the pavement, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was unhooking a trailer from the truck and was pulling the 5th wheel pin to drop the trailer. The trailer was on a slight incline and when he pulled the pin, the trailer slid and dropped catching his right hand and causing lacerations.
An employee tripped over the arm of the dump truck and hit his head.
An employee was driving on his route and felt ill. He hospitalized and treated for heat illness.
An employee was hospitalized with cellulitis after repeatedly handling 30-pound furnace rollers.

An employee was situating a ladder to dust the window ledge and wash the windows. While attempting to center his feet on the ladder rung, he lost his balance and fell approximately 8 feet, fracturing his right pelvis.
An employee sustained a right arm laceration while feeding poultry into slitter equipment.
A customer was trying out a golf club and an employee was hit in the head by the golf ball.
An employee was walking around a service counter to help a customer when her left hip hit the counter. She fell to the ground and fractured her left hip.

An employee was walking while carrying a tub of mail. The employee's foot got caught on all-purpose container webbing, and the employee fell to the concrete floor. The employee was hospitalized for a broken rib on the left side and a collapsed left lung.

An employee sustained an abrasion to his head and right hand when he tripped over a pallet while attempting to move a sofa in the warehouse on 5/29/15. He was hospitalized for an infection related to the hand laceration.

An employee was working inside an engine index cell and was standing in a pit approximately 2.5-3 feet below ground level. The employee went to move from the inbound part of the cell pit to an area between inbound and outbound. He stepped up and out of the pit, over guiderails, and onto a roller ball surface. His foot caught on the guiderail and he tripped and fell forward, fracturing his femur.
An employee was injured by a 40 foot tie rod that fell from a trackhoe excavator onto the employee's head and shoulders injuring two vertebrae in the neck and bruising the right shoulder.
An employee was installing rubber protection (hoses and blankets) on a 13.2-KV powerline when an arc flash occurred, causing second and third degree burns to his upper right back and left upper leg.
An employee was bringing down a pallet of merchandise with a reach truck. While lowering the merchandise, her right harm caught a piece of metal, lacerating her right elbow.

While attempting to investigate the cause of a hot wood pulp stock overflow, an employee stepped into pulp stock that was higher than his rubber boots. The stock was approximately 135 degrees and caused second degree burns to the employee's right leg and foot, requiring hospitalization.
The employee was working off an 8 foot step ladder to replace a light bulb in an outside fixture. The employee fell off of the ladder and was hospitalized with a concussion and head/face trauma.
Employee fell approximately 10 feet while climbing down an extension ladder located inside a 6000-gallon tank.
While attempting to rope a calf, an employee got his finger caught in the rope and amputated.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot while helping a customer bring groceries to their car, suffering a left leg injury.
An employee fell approximately 3 feet when descending from a 1-tier baker scaffold being used for insulation operations on a residential construction project.
An employee was lifting a bale of trash to place it in the dumpster when he dislocated his left shoulder.
An employee welding a cable guide pipe to a tank containing road tar suffered burns to his right side legs, arm, neck, and face when the contents of the tank caught on fire.
An employee sustained an amputation to his index finger while using a metal lathe.

On November 4, 2015, at approximately 8:45 an employee smashed three fingers on his right hand which resulted in hospitalization to surgically repair a broken right pinkie finger. The employee smashed the fingers when his right hand became caught between the rod elevator and tubing in the wellbore.
An employee was attempting to adjust the handle on a case packer when he lost balance and leaned his left index finger into a pinch point, partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee walking in a corridor was struck by a swinging door. The employee fell and suffered a hip fracture.

An employee was dispensing propane from a main propane tank into a smaller tank. As he unscrewed the nozzle from the smaller tank, a burst of propane came out from the main tank and burned his hands and forearms.

Employees were installing grating that consisted of 4 sheets (approximately 4 feet by 5 feet), cumulatively weighing approximately 800 pounds. When the employees disconnected the load from the crane, they realized the corner of the grating rested on the edge of an existing guard rail toe plate. The injured employee attempted to lift the grating upwards while his coworker used a spud wrench to shift the grating off the toe plate. The grating shifted and caught the injured employee's left index finger between the grating and structural steel. He suffered an avulsion to his left index finger flesh beneath his fingertip, which was crushed and cut. He required surgery and was hospitalized overnight.

While placing springs into a grinding machine, an employee contacted the guide edge of the grinding machine, amputating the right index fingertip. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was using a pickaxe to poke and break up clumps of material inside a hopper when the spike end of the pickaxe was caught by a rotating auger in the hopper, causing the other end of the axe to strike and scrape the employee's face. He sustained a severe injury to the right side of his face. His lip was severely traumatized and lacerated, his facial skin was ripped and peeled, and his cheekbone broke.

An employee was preparing to load a truck of emulsion. While he was lowering the stairs, the truck's loading arm drifted, catching his hand between the loading arm and spring mechanism. His ring finger was partially amputated.
An employee was working in a scissor lift with a grinder. While grinding on the conveyor, the employee lost control of the grinder, which lacerated the employee's right forearm.

Employee was moving pallets by hand, wearing heavy cloth gloves. A piece of wood penetrated his glove and cut his left thumb.  The incident was not reported at the time of the incident.  On January 20, 2015, the employee called his supervisor and reported that his thumb was infected and he had been admitted to the hospital.
An employee was changing a roller on a coding machine. His left hand made contact with the roller and the left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee was walking toward a stainless steel table in the room when she tripped and fell over a hose containing product, breaking her hip.

An employee was attempting to load a gearbox onto a container vessel. His hand was between the gantry crane spreader bar and the box when the crane lowered, catching and amputating the employee's left middle fingertip.
An employee was attempting to help a PIV operator move a crate when his finger got caught between the crate and the PIV forks.
An employee was sliding T-beams from a staging area to a forklift when a beam pinched and amputated his left fingertip.

An employee was walking on a steel beam when his personal fall protection got hung up on a wire rope clip while anchored to a horizontal life line. He fell approximately 10 feet to the steel deck below and broke his leg.
Two employees sustained severe burns after coming into contact with hot molasses as it overflowed from a holding tank in the production area.

An employee was removing bolts from the bottom of a cylinder bottom core when the core fell and struck the employee. The employee sustained a compound fracture to the upper right arm and a fractured right thumb.

An employee was driving a stand-up forklift down the main travel aisle in the warehouse when he struck some racks. His left foot became caught between the racks and the forklift, sustaining a laceration that required hospitalization.
An employee got his foot caught in a pallet on the truck that he was moving and fell to the ground breaking his right arm and wrist.
An employee fell off a ladder while installing lightning protection on the roof, fracturing a left rib, the left tibia, and an ankle.
An employee slipped on a piece of tape and fell approximately 11 feet from the roof resulting in two broken ribs and a fractured scapula.

The employee was performing maintenance on the PMB SUK Cigar Over Roll Machine when he accidentally hit the jog switch which turns on the machine. His right hand was then caught between the wrapping device and the wrapper die roller assembly. He was admitted to the hospital for surgery to repair the laceration and fracture to his right hand.
An employee was walking up the attic stairs in a house to install an AC unit. One of the steps gave way and he slipped and fell resulting in a concussion and 2 cracked ribs.
An employee injured a thumb while clearing a clogged drill head, requiring hospitalization.
On or about October 20, 2015, an employee's hand got caught in an auger while servicing it.
An employee pulled the cord on a small water pump motor and their hand was pulled into the flywheel amputating a fingertip (without bone loss).

An employee engaged in automobile wiring activities under a raised truck body was crushed when the air line supplying air to the air bags, which raise the truck body, released and caused the truck body to come down on the employee.

An employee was cleaning the oven. She sprayed degreaser and then put the oven in the self-cleaning cycle. When she opened the oven, she was exposed to the fumes inside and experienced lung irritation, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was fitting the engine cylinder into its fixture and got his right hand pinched between the 150 lb. cylinder and the fixture resulting in the amputation of the right thumb and ring fingertips.
A forklift was lifting three employees inside a trash box to the third floor. As they were stepping off, the box tilted and the employees fell to the ground. Two of the employees were hospitalized.

An employee was dismantling a crate that was housing a small boiler unit. While his right hand was between the boiler and a board of the crate, the board kicked another part of the crate. The force of the kick caused the board to move and amputate his left ring finger between the board and the boiler.
An employee was sedating a cat for a procedure when the cat broke out of its carrier and bit the employee on a finger. The bite became infected.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and suffered a fractured hip.
An employee was unstrapping packs from an A-frame railcar when a pack of five railroad ties fell from the railcar and struck the employee's leg.
An employee was up approximately 8 to 10 feet on a roof when he fell through an uncovered skylight opening to the ground and sustained serious head injuries, spleen injuries, and nine broken ribs.
An employee was cleaning a screw auger when the employee's hand got caught in the machine amputating two fingers on his right hand.
An employee was injured when a cardboard bail weighing approximately 700 to 900 pounds fell on top of him. He was hospitalized.
An employee stood on a plastic table to hang Christmas decorations, lost her balance, fell to the floor, and broke her left arm. She was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was welding near waste motor oil.  The waste motor oil caught fire and the employee sustained first to third degree burns to the legs while putting the fire out.
While operating a forklift in a sequence cell, an employee struck a column and lacerated the left foot.
An employee received third degree burns on his back while using a plasma cutter to repair a trailer.
An employee was connecting the air hose to the saw. The saw was on and amputated fingers on the employee's left hand.
As an employee was driving his delivery truck, his hands began cramping possibly due to dehydration due to heat. He was hospitalized.
An employee was disconnecting a dolly from a trailer when the dolly kicked up and smashed the employee's right thumb.
On 6-25-2016, at 8:00 a.m., an employee was fueling his truck in the rain. When he went to step on the fuel island, he slipped and fell on his right hip, fracturing it.

A Ski Patrol worker was found in the middle of the Rainbow Run trail with no signs of a collision with any customers or objects aside from the ski run.  The worker suffered a fractured C1 vertebrae and was hospitalized.
An employee turned the wrong way while operating a standup forklift.  He stepped off of the forklift and wedged his foot between the forklift and pallet. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was preparing to sweep the floor with a push broom when he stepped on the broom, slipped, and fell, fracturing his left hip.
An employee fell down the stairs injuring a leg and cutting an ear.
An employee was installing filters on a paint booth and fell seven feet off the ladder, breaking ribs and a collar bone.

An employee was on the stabbing board to hang the tong line. He unhooked the derrick climber from his harness and when he let go of it he was hit in the mouth, lost his footing, and fell even though his lanyard was attached. His face hit the standpipe of the derrick and the 3 foot fall injured his back.
On 6/13/16, an employee was packing ceramic parts onto a pallet when he tripped over another pallet on the floor. He sustained lacerations on the back of both arms and was hospitalized.
An employee fell from a scaffold after a cable line broke, breaking his leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting meat on a band saw and amputated a middle fingertip.
An employee fell off the roof at a jobsite at New River Marine Corps Station, hitting his head and hurting his back.  He was hospitalized.

An employee climbed to the top of an ergonomic stand and started talking to a coworker while his right forearm rested on a support bar. When the machine (line) started to come back up, his arm was pinned and fractured.
An employee was cleaning a jammed outlet pipe on the spin dryer and amputated a fingertip.
While an employee was holding an air conditioner blower shaft to change the belt, his left hand slipped. His left index finger got caught by the air conditioner blade, amputating his fingertip.
At an HEB in McAllen, an employee lifted a case of product, which consisted of six 3-Liter bottles, and strained his back.

On 1/22/15, at about 9:20 a.m., an employee was standing by a flat bed trailer while a Roll Off Of America forklift driver backed up. The forklift driver ran over the employee's left lower leg.  The employee was transported by ambulance to Texoma Medical Center in Texas and admitted as an in-patient.
While exiting a room an employee slipped on a tray that was left by the door causing her to fall and break her right arm.

An employee was participating in annual emergency egress aircraft training. The toe of the employee's left boot caught the top portion of the inflated slide, causing the employee's leg to bend slightly at the knee. As the employee landed on the emergency egress slide, the left leg became wedged under the body and twisted. The employee's left leg and foot were fractured, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was helping to move a 5-foot-long pipe when the pipe smashed the employee's left pinky finger, requiring hospitalization for surgery.

An employee was standing on a step stool while applying a surgical dressing in the operating room. While stepping down, she stepped into a table-side bucket and fell, fracturing her left ankle. She was admitted and had surgery to repair her ankle.
Employees were in a fist fight when one employee fell and hit his head on the ground, suffering a minor concussion.
An employee skied into an area with little snow and skied onto rocks that were under the snow. The employee suffered a broken left arm and left patella, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a platform roof, injuring his pelvis and breaking a wrist and arm.
An employee fell while walking to the office from her car and sustained arm injuries that resulted in hospitalization.
An employee was taking a glass door off of a stove when the door shattered.  The employee was wearing safety glasses; however the employee brushed his face with his hand and glass entered his eye.
While operating a meat band saw, an employee amputated the tip of his right index finger.  The incident occurred in the cutting room within the meat department.
An employee was operating a roll-off truck trying to load a container onto the truck when it dropped on and crushed his foot.
An employee was walking onsite, tripped and fell breaking a leg.
On June 20, 2016, at about 9:30 a.m., an employee contacted live electrical parts during a service call and received a shock and burns to 50% of his body. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working from a pallet raised on the forks of a powered industrial truck when he fell approximately 6.5 feet while emptying a tray of spoiled tomatoes into a dumpster. He fractured his head and pelvis.

While holding a pipe by hand, an employee actuated a machine used to connect the pipe to a coupler. The employee's finger got caught between the pipe and coupler, amputating the right hand index finger down to the first knuckle.
An employee was entering the training room when she tripped on a raised landing, fell and broke her wrist.
An employee was inspecting a hotel room when her right-hand pinky finger was caught in a closing door, lacerating her finger and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was walking down some outside steps when he missed a step and fell fracturing three ribs and suffering a punctured lung.

On July 15, 2016, an employee was skimming slag off the top of a pot of molten bronze when some of the slag and molten bronze dropped onto his coveralls. The molten bronze and slag, with a temperature over 2000 degrees Fahrenheit burned through his coveralls, seriously burning his shin, ankle, and foot before his boot could be removed.
An employee was reaching into a flour hopper when his left hand became pinched in a pneumatic gate and was amputated.

An employee was standing next to an excavator.  The excavator turned and the employee was struck by the excavator's counterweight.  The employee fell over into a sump hole and struck his body against a steel plate.  The employee suffered a broken jaw, broken ribs, punctured lung, and broken left elbow.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was installing a fiberglass grating when he fell off a platform, injuring his head. His harness was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee was moving a mobile food tray rack from one area of the scullery to another. The employee lost balance and fell, suffering a broken hip.
An employee fell off of an electric pallet jack onto the concrete floor after turning into an aisle.

Incident occurred right outside the test bay in the Conroe Facility.  Employees were working on a pump unit skid simultaneously. The lead man and assembly technician were working on the control panel. The injured employee was laying on the left side between the radiator housing assembly and the fan belt assembly. Injured employee reached up to grab and hold the wrench (to "hold backstop") at the same time that the assembly technician hooked up the airline from the start exhaust to the throttle exhaust. As soon as the engine started (by plugging in the airline), the injured employee jerked his left arm back. The motion caused the injured employee's right arm to move up. The sleeve of his shirt was caught by the fan belt. When he went to pull away from the fan belt, his hand got caught in the fan belt. The fan belt ran his hand through the pulley, causing partial amputation of his right ring finger, an abrasion to his middle finger, and bruising/abrasion to his right arm.

An employee was trying to dislodge a rusted brake pad on a logging truck by striking the brake with a hammer. The truck then rolled and struck the employee, causing bruising, strain, and sprain injuries to his legs, hips, and pelvis.
An employee was assaulted by a patient (choking) resulting in a multi-day hospitalization.
An employee became overheated and suffered heat stress/dehydration while using power shears.
An employee slipped on a wet floor and fell breaking an arm.
An employee was using a punch press and attempted to remove the gasket from the point of operation. The employee's right index and middle fingers were amputated.
An employee was injured when a rack of tables being pushed down a lift gate began to travel too quickly. The tables fell off the lift gate and onto the employee.

An employee was pouring hot fryer oil into the fryer oil bin when he slipped on oil on the floor and spilled hot oil onto himself. He received second degree burns to his arms, legs, stomach and part of his face.
An employee was working on the rooftop exhaust unit. When the employee removed the top case of the unit, the belt began spinning and partially amputated the employee's right index finger.
An employee's fingers were crushed while fabricating metal (e.g., bending metal flashing) on a brake press machine. The employee was hospitalized overnight for surgery.
An employee was removing a part in a metal stamping die press and once the part was dislodged, it fell onto the employee's left ring finger causing a fingertip amputation.

On January 14, 2015, an employee was pinned between a 4,000 lb motor and the wall of an elevator, when the motor and cart slid from the forks of the truck. The employee suffered a fracture to the right femur.

An employee was working on top of a conveyor cover, 3 feet above the ground, when his right foot was caught in a gap between a piece of fire suppression pipe and the conveyor top. He lost his balance and fell while his right foot was still hung in the gap. He suffered a compound fracture of the right lower leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was unjamming a log stuck in the slab deck. His hand was caught under the log when his coworker restarted the machine. This caused the log to smash his right ring and pinky fingers, leading to a medical amputation of his fingertips.

On or about July 28, 2015, around 10:00 p.m., an employee slipped on coolant in the machining center. The employee's right wrist hit a milled surface and was cut. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
While slicing ham with a bone saw, an employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.
A piece of rebar was lifted with a front end loader. The rebar slid off and struck an employee causing neck and shoulder injuries.

An employee was feeding two strips of narrow pieces of steel into a reel. There were some cracked edges on the strip of metal. His hand was pulled toward the spacer causing his finger to get caught in/between the spacer (metal disc) and the steel strip that cuts the steel in the over arm (part of the reel/guide to keep cut straight). This occurred at the 72 slitter on the exit reel.
An employee slipped on ice and fell suffering a broken wrist which required surgery.
An employee was walking when she twisted her ankle, lost her balance, and fell, fracturing her right wrist as she braced her fall.

An employee was operating a table saw with a dado blade. While he was leaning down in a crouching position, he pulled back and his finger contacted the blade, amputating his fourth fingertip with bone loss and a fracture.

An employee's hand was in the danger zone of a Hydro machine when a coworker powered up the machine. Three of the employee's fingers were crushed, and one was surgically amputated. The machine guard was not in place at the time of the incident.

An employee was wearing an N-95 dust mask and mopping the floor at the end of her work shift when she experienced shortness of breath due to breathing in tezacaftor (chemical compound). The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was waiting for a sliced roll of paper to emerge from a paper machine winder. When the sliced roll emerged, the employee removed the side roll from the back roll and used tape to secure the side roll to the back roll. The employee then turned to get a core to place in the winder, at which time the side roll fell over, striking and fracturing the employee's lower left leg and foot.
An employee was attempting to unjam the Manchester machine (shapes copper tubing) and amputated the third finger on the right hand at the first joint.
A worker slipped on ice and fractured his ankle. The injury required surgery and admission to the hospital.
An employee was relocating sprinklers above the ceiling and was shocked by live wires resulting in hospitalization.
While removing a submersible motor from a hydro testing tank, an employee came into contact with the 3200-volt cord running from the motor to the Hipot/Megohmmeter, resulting in an electrical shock.
An employee was using an 8-foot ladder to remove a recessed "can" for lighting when he lost his balance and fell to the concrete floor, suffering a head injury.
An employee was struck by a tractor trailer while it was backing up to another trailer to transfer product resulting in severe trauma to the abdomen requiring multiple surgeries.

Two employees were attempting to change the tire on an elevated trailer when a portion of the trailer broke apart and struck them. Both employees suffered head injuries. One was treated and released, while the other was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee re-aggravated a prior back injury while bending over to pick up an item, experiencing pain and falling to the floor. She was hospitalized.

An employee was sweeping the area in front of a work site when a flatbed truck containing post tension cables arrived. The truck pulled in through a gate and stopped to begin off-loading the post tension cables. The forklift operator unlatched the post tension cables and then noticed that the truck had stopped near a mound of dirt which the operator could not access with the forklift. When the truck moved forward, a post tension cable shifted and fell off the truck striking the employee who was sweeping in the face causing multiple lacerations and severing the top part of his left ear.
An employee was pinned between a roll-off and a large construction dumpster.
An employee with a sledgehammer struck the injured employee's left middle finger while he was holding a board. The injured employee's fingertip was amputated.
An employee experienced dizziness while mixing bone cement containing methyl methacrylate.  The employee was hospitalized due to a low heart rate.

The employee was helping to secure a concrete wall panel that a backhoe was putting into place. The panel was secured and then the backhoe released the load, but the bottom of the panel came loose. The panel fell and struck the employee in the chest and left hand. The employee sustained broken ribs and abrasions on his hand.
An employee was on a rooftop installing metal. While adjusting his harness, he slipped and fell off the roof, fracturing his back.

An employee was lowering an irrigation pipe into a trench when the pipe slipped from its rigging. The employee's knee was caught between the falling pipe and a coupler screw, requiring surgery to remove shattered bones from the knee.

An employee was moving pallets in the warehouse with a forklift. As the employee exited the forklift, it rolled and pinned the employee between the wall and forklift. The forks broke the employee's leg.
An employee was moving a switch gear into place when it fell on him. He was hospitalized with a head gash and broken ribs.
On or about February 20, 2015, an employee's middle two left-hand fingers were amputated just above the first knuckle when a stainless steel guard came down while working on the auger.
An employee fell 8 feet from a 10-foot step ladder while installing an acoustical ceiling grid.
An employee fell from a ladder, striking his head.

An employee was cleaning a running conveyor system with a compressed air wand when the wand became stuck in the conveyor system at a junction between a section of roller conveyors and a belt conveyor.  While trying to free the compressed air wand, the employee's right middle finger either got caught in the conveyor or caught by the compressed air wand, resulting in a partial amputation of the right middle finger. The injury occurred above the right knuckle and involved bone. The employee required surgery to reattach the finger.
An employee was troubleshooting the power source for equipment when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's upper extremities and causing facial abrasions.
During the cleaning process, an employee's hand came in contact with a moving piston located near the bottom of the bakery depositor machine, amputating her left middle fingertip.

An employee was felling a tree. After the tree was cut, the top of it landed in a hickory tree, causing the felled tree to spring back and break the hinge. The base of the felled tree kicked back and hit the employee, injuring the ribs and the left ring and pinky fingers. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was severely injured and hospitalized after she fell from the top of a load of industrial fans inside the back of a semi-trailer.  The fan fell onto the employee. The employee suffered a T12-L2 back injury requiring a two-level fusion.
An employee attempted to walk around a downspout in the parking lot. When she stepped down from the sidewalk, she slipped on ice and fell, fracturing her right ankle.

While driving a straddle carrier, an employee collided with a second straddle carrier being driven by a coworker. The employee's carrier tipped over, amputating the employee's left leg above the knee.
An employee was pushing a 4-wheel cart to the exit door. Her foot got caught under the wheel resulting in a cut on the lower right leg.
An employee was climbing down from a pot carrier when he lost his balance and fell to the concrete floor. He landed on his feet, twisted his right foot, and fractured his heel bone.

An employee was climbing up an extension ladder to caulk a wood soffit which was 10 feet above the ground when he slipped and fell about five feet onto the concrete sidewalk resulting in a left wrist fracture and possible bruising to the left leg.
An employee used a step cart to get a box of gallon jugs from the top shelf for a customer. She lost her balance and came down awkwardly, fracturing her right leg and requiring surgery.
An employee was cutting neck bones in the pack room with a band saw when the saw amputated his left index finger.
An employee working in the storage area tripped over a box on the floor, fracturing their left femur.

An employee was lifting the roll-up door of a trailer when it buckled back, pinching/catching the employee's finger in the gap of the roll-up panels. The employee's right index fingertip was amputated at the first joint.
Employee was walking through hallway and injured right knee requiring hospitalization.

A light-duty pickup truck struck and ran over an employee from behind. The employee was  struck in the hip and fell to the ground; the truck's rear wheel ran over the employee's knee. The employee was hospitalized.

Two employees were resurfacing part of an interstate when a car entered the construction area and struck a nearby work trailer. The trailer then struck the employees. The first employee suffered a broken left leg, and the second employee suffered left leg lacerations.
While clearing a chemical hose line, an employee was sprayed/splashed with concentrated sulfuric acid. He suffered chemical burns on his left thigh.
While tripping pipe on a derrick, an employee's left index finger was pinched between a metal beam and a driller collar, amputating the fingertip.
An employee fell off of a ladder while waterproofing wall between the 25th and 26th floor of the Drexel building. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured small bone in the back.
An employee was setting up a vertical lathe machine. The employee was adjusting the tool holder when it dropped, striking the employee's left pinky finger and amputating the fingertip.
An employee tripped over the edge of a skid and fractured his knee cap.

An employee was backing into an aisle with a motorized power jack when he lost balance and stepped off the jack. His right foot was then pinched between the power jack and a rack, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was working from a ladder scrubbing the frame wall of a blender machine when he lost his balance and fell into the blender. He amputated the first two toes on his right foot.

On September 19, 2015 at approximately 2:30 p.m., two employees were working together to empty a trash container into a dumpster. One of the employee's fingers was smashed between the trash container and the dumpster resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was working from an 8 foot ladder to hang an air hose reel weighing 44 pounds. As the employee was trying to lift up the hose reel, he lost his balance and fell hitting his midsection on the metal lathe chip guard.

A retail associate was walking to the front of the store through clothing racks.  She tripped on a comforter that was left on the floor by a customer and fell.  She fractured her right femur and required surgery to repair the fracture.

An employee was going to install concrete forms on the range in the air force base. While he was putting a piece of plastic into the concrete form, his right-hand middle finger was bitten by a snake. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was operating a lift on the back of a truck. When he reached for a chain that had fallen, the ramp came down on his hand and severed his right middle and ring fingers.

An employee climbed a portable ladder and was fixing the motor on an overhead door. One of the portable ladder's feet was inadvertently placed on the lip of the overhead door. The employee activated the switch to open the door. As the door opened, the ladder tipped backward and he fell. The ladder fell on top of his left leg, breaking it in several places.
An employee was using a spanner wench to remove a cylinder when he slipped, falling to the ground. He fractured his left hip and was hospitalized.

A cold saw operator received an amputation to his right pinky fingertip (distal phalanx fracture). He placed a brass bar on top of the machine.  The bar was grabbed by the saw blade and pulled into the machine. The employee grabbed the end of the bar to pull it out while the machine was running, pinching his finger between the bar and a vise.

An employee climbed a tree and tied off during tree trimming activities. The employee cut a limb, which fell and broke the limb he was tied off onto. He fell approximately 40 feet to the ground, suffering a fractured skull, a blood spot on the brain, and fractured bones around his right ear. He was hospitalized.
On January 11, 2017, an employee slipped and fell while preparing food. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured hip.

An employee was using a spud wrench to loosen bolts on a steel form panel. The nut was on very tightly, so he placed his foot on the wrench to loosen it. He lost his balance and the point of the wrench went up through the sole of his work boot, puncturing and fracturing his right foot.

An employee was being lifted on a pallet with a forklift when the pallet broke and the employee fell approximately 8-10 feet to the concrete below. The employee suffered a brain bleed, fractured eye socket, broken wrist and broken ribs.
A home health aid slipped on ice on a driveway at a client's home which resulted in a ligament sprain in both knees and a patellar tracking disorder of the right knee requiring hospitalization.

The employee was watching a vacuum truck.  For shade the employee sat underneath a gangway.  A tanker vessel traveled by where the barge was stationed.  The waves rocked the barge allowing the gangway to fall on the employee.  The employee's entire right side, upper torso, back and pelvis sustained injuries.

While adjusting the die on press brake #2524, an employee placed his fingers over the die. The back-gauge/positioner moved and caught the employee's finger between the die and the back-gauge/positioner.
On December 31, 2015, an employee slipped and fell on ice after making a delivery at a business and shattered his right ankle in three places.

On 8-15-15, at 1330, an employee working in the seafood department received a puncture wound in her right index finger from a yellow tail snapper fin bone while scaling the fish. She was hospitalized.
An employee tripped and fell while walking up a ramp, breaking his right arm.

On February 26, 2017, an employee was driving a forklift and was turning around in a small area. There was another forklift that was non-operable in the same area. The employee backed up the forklift and struck the forks of the non-operable forklift. The forks penetrated the employee's right heel and tore tissue from the bone.

An employee was removing plastic tote containers from a tractor trailer. As the employee pulled on the totes, they caught on a piece of the trailer and tumbled over on top of the employee. The employee was taken to the hospital and given a medication that caused an allergic reaction. He was  held overnight for observation due to the allergic reaction.
On 4-25-16, an employee fell through a floor opening between two joists on the second floor while attempting to glue the subfloor down.
An employee was driving south on the highway when a tree branch fell on top of the car breaking the windshield. The employee suffered head, neck and shoulder trauma and facial lacerations.

An employee was doing maintenance on a dough sheeter in the bakery department. The machine's housing was off at the time of the incident. His finger got caught between the chains and the housing, amputating the fingertip below the fingernail.
An employee tripped and fell while walking down an internal staircase resulting in a broken leg and in-patient hospitalization.
On April 10, 2015, an employee was bitten by a spider on the right ankle while standing under a tree and patrolling the parking lot.
An employee exited the cab of a truck when the truck began moving. He attempted to stop the truck and became pinned between the truck door and roll-up door, suffering a broken pelvis.

A maintenance employee removed the fuel tank from truck, set it on the ground and then began pressurizing the tank to located an air leak.  A portion of the tank exploded from being over-pressurized. The employee sustained facial injuries and damage to the left arm.
On March 4, 2015, an employee spreading ice melt slipped on ice and fractured his right ankle.
On or about August 8, 2016, an employee was exposed to excessive heat while tearing off a flat roof and was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

An employee was setting up a machine and was de-beaming.  During rethreading, two of his fingers became caught in the hooks and injured the right, middle finger.  He was taken to the hospital and his fingertip was re-attached.

An employee was walking across a resident's driveway while delivering mail when the resident backed up a vehicle and struck the employee. The employee was knocked unconscious and hospitalized with a head injury.
An employee was hiking on a trail when he lost his footing on uneven terrain and fell to the ground, striking his head.

An employee was operating a crane to load grain onto an ocean-going ship when a hydraulic hose failed and caused a fire after contacting a muffler. The employee exited the cab of the crane and landed on a catwalk, breaking the right leg.

An employee suffered a serious injury to his right hand while positioning a 1700 pound could blade onto a table.  The injured employee suffered a broken index finger and cuts to three other fingers on his right hand when the part shifted as it was being moved with an overhead crane.  The injury occurred in the weld shop.
On February 24, 2015, at approximately 7:00 AM, an employee tripped on a call cord and fell.  This fall resulted in a fractured hip, requiring hospitalization.

An employee on a ladder was removing wiring from a junction box in the ceiling while doing demolition. He removed the wires and placed wire nuts on them. The white neutral wire was hanging down. When the employee started to climb down the ladder, he touched the wire with his hand and it shocked him. When he pulled away from the shock, the fast motion broke his scapula.
An employee was placing a part into a brake press machine to form it when the machine activated before he removed his finger. The top die pinched off the end of his left index finger.
On January 24, 2015, an employee was injured at a plastic extrusion line.
While unloading items from a pallet, an employee tripped over the pallet and fell to the floor, breaking the right hip. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was performing maintenance work on the cotton gin when a piece of the equipment shifted and amputated the left index fingertip.

An employee was driving a flat bed from the south and collided with a forklift truck travelling east in a 3-way stop intersection. The employee in the flat bed was going to make a left hand turn and did not see the forklift truck. Due to the sudden stop, the employee's leg contacted the steel in the cab resulting in a fractured leg.

An employee was carrying a sheet of cardboard while walking towards his work station when he tripped and fell over a raised floor (10-inch difference), injuring his head and shoulder. He was hospitalized.

A driver was preparing an empty dump trailer to be loaded. He unsecured the rear gate, then unfastened the tarp connections.  As he walked back to the rear of the trailer, the wind caught the gate, swinging it open and striking the driver on his left side, driving him into the side of the trailer on his right side.
An employee was pulling a walkie pallet jack from under a pallet when his right-hand thumb was caught and crushed between the handle and the unit.

An employee had his left thumb tip amputated while performing final assembly on an awning.  His left thumb was caught in the winding machine which wraps the awning cloth onto the metal bars that hold the awning.
An employee became ill and was subsequently hospitalized that same afternoon due to a noxious odor in the building.
The employee was conducting a pressure test of a Blow Out Preventer (BOP) when a high pressure water spray contacted the employee's right armpit causing a 1/4 to 1/2" laceration.
An employee was using a riding lawn mower to cut grass when the mower turned over on a hill and broke the employee's arm.
On August 19, 2016, an employee fell from an extension ladder and hit his head on the floor. He also broke a tooth and injured his ribs and wrist. He was hospitalized.

An employee was driving a forklift toward a conveyor when he noticed an error light at the tote scanner. He traveled on the lift toward the tote scanning area to manually scan the tote in and clear the error. He attempted but was unable to slow the machine using the plugging method or the dead-man switch. He then attempted to exit the machine. In that process, he struck the racking and his left foot became wedged between the rack and the forklift. He suffered a broken left foot and deep abrasions.
An employee sustained a left middle fingertip amputation when the finger was caught inside a material bin/hopper.
An employee was attempting to descend from a scaffold that tipped. He fell 5.5 feet from the scaffold onto a 3-foot ladder and suffered a laceration.
An employee received a finger amputation 5/6/2016.

An employee was driving a utility vehicle out of the north side of the large transfer building when he turned and struck a parked roll-off truck. The employee struck the roll-off truck with his chest and was hospitalized.
Two employees were checking a dust collector when a flash fire occurred, seriously burning their faces, necks, shoulders, and hands. Both employees were hospitalized.

Employee was cleaning out a pre-breaker feed and reached into a rotating auger to remove debris. The auger caught his right index finger. This caused a laceration and an amputation to the tip of his right index finger's first knuckle.

The driver drove a chassis with a container up to a crane to have the crane lift the container from the chassis. The pins were not disengaged from the chassis and the crane picked up the chassis and the yard jockey (half-cab). An employee was lifted and dropped and sustained two broken vertebrae.
An employee doing maintenance on a machine suffered a contusion on the top of his left foot when an outrigger was set on it.
An employee attempted to remove a jammed bag from a machine. The machine activated, clamping the employee's finger. A knife came down and cut the tip of the finger.
An employee fell through a roof and injured his back. He was wearing a PFAS at the time.
An employee was steaming a pipe when steam burned the employee on both legs below the knees.

On 11/29/2016, at 4:00 p.m., an employee was in the machine room when he saw debris on the sheave where the elevator cables wrap around. He started to clean the sheave using a screw driver. When the elevator started to move, the cable caught his left hand and pulled him, causing him to tip over and fall to the ground. He sustained three finger amputations on his left hand, broken teeth, and lacerations to his face, requiring hospitalization and surgery. The elevator was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was helping a forklift lift a metal brace that was frozen to the ground when the brace became free and popped up, hitting and breaking the employee's ankle.
An employee suffered heat stress while doing landscaping work.
An employee was using a handheld portable grinder to grind a vehicle bracket when the grinder came apart and struck him in the face, causing facial lacerations and multiple avulsed teeth.
An employee amputated his left finger while using a table saw. The saw blade guard was removed at the time.
An employee working in the basement of the paper machine was exposed to a hot, humid environment and was hospitalized for heat stroke.
An employee amputated the tip of their right index finger and their middle finger when they were caught between a casting and a machine apron while trying to remove the casting from the machine.

An employee was walking down the ramp of a delivery trunk using a hand dolly to carry five cases. He slipped and the metal part of the dolly landed on his two right middle fingers lacerating them both down to the bone.
An employee was hospitalized after his right index finger was cut to the bone while operating a table saw to cut a particle board.
An employee was repairing an overhead light in the emergency room when the cover collapsed on his right thumb. The cover cut through the employee's glove and amputated his right thumb tip.
On 03-21-2016, an employee was cleaning the rotary valve section of a cheese de-weigher when the valve's rotating paddles amputated the employee's left-hand ring and middle fingers.

An employee was attempting to lift a metal grate off of a burn table for cleaning purposes. Using a two-hook chain sling, the employee used one of the hooks with the other being left to dangle. The other hook got caught under the frame of the burn table. When the employee went to lift the grate, the hook that was unknowingly caught came free, flying across and striking the employee in the face. The employee suffered contusions to the face, nose, left cheek, and right forehead.
An employee was working from a ladder when it slid from under the employee. The employee fell, fracturing the left ankle and a bone under the right knee.
An employee was climbing a job made ladder, lost his grip and fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete floor below sustaining injuries requiring hospitalization.

An employee was clearing a pipe line using nitrogen to pressure the line. The employee disconnected the nitrogen line, which was not clear or de-pressured at the time. Product sprayed out on the employee, causing first and second degree burns to the left side of the employee's head, the left arm, and both legs from the knees down.

An employee's gloved left hand became entangled in a rotating metal drill bit/chuck while he was trying to sweep off metal shavings from around the drill bit. His left ring finger was surgically amputated.
An employee was working on the packing line. The employee's right hand got caught in the conveyor, and the index and middle fingers were amputated. The guard was not in place at the time.
An employee was overcome with heat stress symptoms while unloading a trailer.
A maintenance employee slipped from a railing 18 inches from the floor and fractured his elbow.

An employee was setting up the electronic fuse on a non-lethal sting ball grenade. An electronic fuse is placed in the grenade and electrical wires are set up on the electronic fuse. The grenade went off as it was being set up for the test. The employee suffered multiple broken bones in his left hand, a laceration to the left hand, and multiple contusions to his stomach and chest.

Two employees were taking measurements under the Route 219 bridge to prepare for their next cut on the bridge. The bridge collapsed. One of the employees was hospitalized for head, neck, and spinal injuries. The other employee was treated for a broken ankle.
An employee was stung by a bee while delivering packages and had a severe allergic reaction resulting in overnight hospitalization.

Employee was working on a sorting platform approximately 8 feet off of the concrete/ground. As employee descended a fixed ladder, he lost his grip and fell to the ground in a standing position, fracturing his right leg.
A door hit an employee's elbow and forearm, causing a hematoma.
An employee sustained a thumb amputation when he attempted to unclog a rotary valve. The machine was not locked out at the time.
Employee stepped on something (possibly a plastic cap used for shipping) and fell on her hip. She was admitted to Capital Region in Jefferson City, Missouri with a broken hip.
An employee was moving dirt with a skid-steer when it contacted a hard object. The employee's left leg got caught in the bucket resulting in a facture requiring inpatient hospitalization.
An employee was inspecting a conveyor belt. The conveyor restarted and amputated three fingers.

Two employees were power washing the interior of a bath house with a fuel powered pressure washer. The door was shut and the employees were overcome by carbon monoxide.  The employees were admitted to the hospital.

Two employees were injured when they fell to a lower level. The first employee had rigged a draft of pipes in the hatch of a cargo ship and was proceeding to the designated safe area. Before she made it to the safe area, the draft was being picked and started to spin. The second employee saw her freeze up and ran and tackled her before she could be struck by the pipe. They both fell approximately 4 feet. The first employee suffered three broken ribs and a collapsed lung. The second suffered a concussion and head laceration. Both were admitted to the hospital.
An employee was stepping over APC units when she tripped and fell to the floor, fracturing her right hip.
An employee injured his hand when it was caught in a ribbon blender.
On or about 3/10/2015, at approximately 7:00 a.m., an employee was injured on a stationary miter saw, which resulted in an amputation to the left ring finger.
On May 15, 2015, an employee walked through an area being mopped, slipped, and fell. She injured her knee, requiring surgery and overnight hospitalization.
An employee was searching for a tool under a maintenance work table. He suffered lower back pain when getting up off the lowered position with bent knees.
An employee was lifting a section of metal roller conveyor when it fell on his left pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was drawing blood from a patient when she felt a pop in her back as she stood up.

An employee was carrying a ladder on his hip when he tripped and fell, landing on top of the ladder. He later experienced irregular breathing and was hospitalized with nine fractured ribs, a collapsed lung, a broken collar bone, and shoulder and hip sprains.

An employee was cleaning a bolt on a piece of equipment when a coworker who was tightening a bolt on the same piece of equipment dropped a bracket. The bracket struck and amputated the employee's left pinky fingertip.
An employee tripped over a lobby cart and fell breaking her right arm. She was hospitalized.
An employee was walking down the hall when her foot caught the floor causing the employee to fall on her left knee and right arm. She broke her knee and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was cleaning the grate on an attrition mixer. A coworker moved a lift truck and accidentally pinned the employee's foot between the forks and the mixer, lacerating his right foot arch.
The employee was riding a pallet jack while loading trailers. The handle of the pallet jack jerked and the pallet jack moved quickly pinning the employee against the trailer wall.
An employee was cleaning the kitchen. A cutting board fell onto the employee's hand breaking a finger.
While cleaning snow off of a roof, the employee fell through a skylight.
An employee was servicing a heating system (boiler) when it pre-ignited during purging. A fire ball came out of the inspection door and burned the employee's right and left arms.

An employee was injured when the brakes on a flatbed truck did not work. As a result, the flatbed collided with an A/C unit on the ground. The employee hit his right knee on the dash. As the employee walked upstairs to report the incident, the employee fell and injured his other knee.

An employee made contact with a live electrical utility wire during construction of a 3 phase line. The energy entered the right hand and exited the left big toe, leaving a 1/2 inch exit wound and causing cardiac arrest.
The employee slipped on the job while wearing shoe coverings and fell breaking her wrist.
While operating a bandsaw, an employee caught his metal glove on the blade resulting in the amputation of one inch of his left thumb.
An employee experienced heat stress symptoms after performing jobsite cleanup, requiring hospitalization for acute kidney injuries and dehydration.
An employee was emptying material from a medium-sized kettle in a popcorn machine. Hot oil and popcorn from the kettle fell on his right forearm and hand, causing second degree burns.

An employee had been framing the roof deck and was tied off using a personal fall arrest system.  A violent  thunderstorm occurred, and the employee began to exit the roof.  He unhooked his lanyard when he got within 2 feet of the extension ladder used to access and exit the roof. He slipped and fell 12 feet to the concrete floor below and sustained a head injury.
An employee jumped from the catwalk (approximately 30 feet from the floor) and suffered injuries to his spleen, kidney, and vertebrae.
An employee lost the tip of his right ring finger when it was caught in the trailer door.
An employee was struck by a passing forklift and suffered a left leg injury.
An employee stepped off the back of a truck and was struck by an oncoming vehicle. The employee suffered fractured ribs and bruised lungs and a fractured leg.
An employee tripped and fell down four steps to the ground, lacerating her head.

An employee was attempting to relocate a pallet of car batteries while operating a forklift with the forks elevated. As he attempted to turn, the forklift flipped over and pinned him beneath the roll-over protector and the ground. He suffered blunt force trauma to the upper torso and ruptured his spleen, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working on an outside sand belt when the belt slipped and pulled his hand back, resulting in a left ring finger amputation.
An employee was walking by a log pile when one of the logs slipped and rolled down the pile, hitting the employee in the back of the leg and breaking it.
On or about 3/24/16, an employee slipped/tripped while stepping over a 2-foot-high masonry wall.  He was hospitalized with three fractured ribs and a punctured lung.

An employee was working from a 19-foot electronic scissor lift (set at 11-feet high) to cut a large structural brace using a torch. As the brace was cut loose, it struck the top of the scissor lift and fell onto plastic storage containers. The back of the employee's head hit the scissor lift guardrails and was lacerated, requiring hospitalization.
An employee crushed his thumb between a door jamb and the railing on a scissor lift while lowering the lift from inside the basket.
An employee was hospitalized with a broken hip after falling to the floor at work on August 31, 2015. The injured employee required surgery.
An employee was riding a horse when the horse stopped abruptly. The employee was thrown over the front of the horse, sustaining a broken back.

On May 13, 2015, at approximately 12:00 midnight, an employee suffered a concussion and was hospitalized after being struck by a 1.5- to 2-inch flex steel hose. The employee was working in the cellar while a rig hand worked on the rig floor 30 feet above. The rig hand disconnected the hydraulic hose, which fell 30 feet and struck the employee in the head.

An employee suffered an avulsion to the left index finger when it was caught underneath a pipe.  The employee was inspecting a pipe when he/she lost his/her  footing and the pipe fell, catching the left index finger.

An employee was helping to load cargo pallets onto an aircraft. The pallets were placed onto a K-loader, and the employee was preparing the cargo to be pushed onto the plane. He lost his balance and fell 8 feet from the work deck onto the asphalt tarmac. He was unconscious and bleeding from the nose, head, and mouth. He also broke his wrist. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was standing in a sewer ditch while guiding a 10-foot steel pipe into position when the device holding the pipe slipped due to the plastic cover. The pipe struck the employee on his right tibia, causing a fracture.
An employee fell down the stairs from a walkway to the parking lot en route to their personal vehicle at the end of the work shift.

An employee was standing on the DOT bumper observing a concrete chute. He slipped and in his attempt to restrain his fall, inserted two fingers into the roller on the concrete ready mix truck. Two fingers were crushed requiring amputation.

Three employees attempted to repair a fill slide on the lower part of a die, which would not actuate during production. The lower die was mostly disassembled; it is air-powered when installed. They used air pressure to manually troubleshoot the issue. They further disassembled the die. The injured employee placed his hand on the die shoe, which activated the die, crushing his left-hand pinky and ring finger.

Two employees were at the paint storage room replacing a container pan underneath a paint pail. One employee passed out; later, the second employee passed out.  Both employees were hospitalized. The levels of CO in the paint room were elevated at the time of the incident.
An employee was lowering the frame of the bread rounder back into place on the conveyor and pinched their right thumb resulting in amputation of the thumb.

An employee was starting up an extrusion machine when the machine "kicked out" or faulted. The employee's gloved hand was caught in the auger. The employee sustained a partial amputation of the right index finger between the first and second digit.

An employee was driving an excavator up a mountain road. The excavator hit a patch of ice, slid off the side of the road and rolled over. A tree stump came through the cab and pinned the operator's leg between the stump and the controls.
An employee slipped on ice and suffered a broken leg.

An employee was working on a folder line. The folder line has two rotating cylinders that apply a stamp. The employee's right hand was caught between two running cylinders resulting in the amputation of the middle, ring and pinky fingertips.

Employee was sitting at the kitchen table of a customer's house filling out paperwork when the chair broke underneath him.  The employee fell and hit his neck, suffering a herniated disk in his neck that will require surgery.

An employee was helping another employee lower a walk-behind pallet jack that had been stood up on it's back end. The employee's right hand had a hold of the forks and his right index finger got stuck in the wheel well as it was lowered to the ground. The finger was smashed and the tip was amputated at the hospital.

An employee was unloading utility poles from a trailer using a self-unloading boom. As the employee swung the pole to the left, the pole slipped out of the grapple and struck the employee's right hip area, fracturing it.
An employee broke a leg while driving a forklift between piles of pallets.
An employee tripped over a board left on the floor to cover newly installed tile flooring.  The employee fell and injured their back resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was performing walking cuts on the kill floor. As he attempted to make a cut, he missed and contacted the knife of a coworker, lacerating his right forearm.
An employee tripped and fell in the dining room, fracturing his leg and requiring surgery.
On February 9, 2017, an employee slipped and fell on ice while walking from the maintenance shop to a delivery truck, fracturing the left hip.
A temporary employee fell from the second story of a building under construction and was transported to the hospital with a back injury.

An employee was preparing paint in the stern thruster room of a vessel tied up to the pier. He had to kneel and crawl on steel surfaces. He wore knee pads, but not all of the time. His left knee became sore, and he was diagnosed with bursitis with a possible infection.

An employee was brushing plastic shavings to one end inside the CNC machine so that the shavings could be removed. The auger inside the machine started, and the employee's hand came into contact with the auger, breaking bones.
Two employees were moving a metal computer-server stand down a steep flight of stairs. The upper employee lost his grip and the item fell and hit the lower employee's foot, breaking bones.

In February 2016, an employee was injured while repairing a loader.  The loader was turned on and the employee tripped and fell into the moving parts. The employee sustained two broken bones and skin lacerations on the left arm.
An employee was diving for 63 minutes at a depth of 37 feet when he felt ill. He surfaced and showed signs of carbon monoxide poisoning from a breathing air compressor.

An employee was operating a backhoe to place trimmed pecan tree branches onto a trailer. The employee struck a tree that had trimmed branches still suspended from it. One branch came loose and fell, striking the employee's head and causing a traumatic head injury.
An employee was unloading material and set it on the floor to put a pallet on it. When he picked up the pallet, he stepped back and hit the material, causing him to fall and injure his right hip.
An employee suffered an avulsion of his left thumb that was later amputated in the hospital.

An employee was working on a brake caliper bolt that was stuck on the brakes of a school bus. The employee applied force to the ratchet, which freed the bolt and caused the employee to fall, roll, and break his right ankle. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee fell eight feet from a roof.
While walking to the building, an employee slipped on a patch of ice in the parking lot and broke her left leg. She was hospitalized.

An employee was entering the plant through another building when a door closed on her right ring finger. The doctor diagnosed the injury as an amputation of the distal portion of her right ring finger.
An employee received burns from hot cream.

An employee was positioning steel casing with a synthetic web sling. As he removed the sling from the casing, the casing shifted and pinched his left middle finger between the casing and the clamp set to receive the next piece, partially amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was using a band saw to cut curry chicken (small chicken with bone) when his right index finger contacted the blade and was lacerated. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was in the hallway when a patient ran up and began hitting her in the face. The patient then grabbed the employee's leg and pulled her into a room. The employee fell, injuring her elbow.

On 2/5/16, at approximately 6:12 p.m., an employee was checking to see if a plate was loose in a case packer when his hand entered a pinch point on the running machine. He suffered two fingertip amputations.
An employee fell from a drop off, approximately 10 ft., while taking down a tent.
An employee tripped and fell while using a two-wheel dolly, breaking ribs.

An employee was assisting an air conditioning contractor position an air conditioner for the crane lift. The employee's right hand was caught between the air conditioner unit and the curb/asphalt causing the amputation of the right middle fingertip and a fractured finger.
An employee was operating the wire-forming machine when the wire got hung up on the end of the machine. The employee pushed the wire to the machine's form, which amputated his right index fingertip.
An employee was operating the flex-nip machine. His shirt got caught in the machine and the employee suffered lacerations to the hip and chest.
An employee was using an overhead crane to position pipe into a steel holding area. The employee's left hand was caught between the pipe and steel structure, amputating the left thumb tip.
An employee fell off of a ladder and injured her back while attempting to fix a banner in the store window.
An employee was cutting top sirloin on a meat saw and amputated the right index finger.
An employee attempted to open a jammed gun locker that then fell on her finger and amputated the tip. She was hospitalized.
A dough chunking machine blade partially amputated an employee's right middle finger and completely amputated the employee's right index finger.
An employee was operating a band saw when the saw bound up on him, kicked back, and pulled his hand into the blade, amputating his left-hand, first thumb digit.
An employee received arc flash burns while cleaning off insulators on a transformer.
An employee amputated his fingertip when it became caught under the clamp on the cutting machine.
An employee got up to quickly address a patient's alarm. She tripped and fell, lacerating her head and fracturing her arm.

An employee was using a water hose to spray a conveyor. He observed a piece of meat in the conveyor and was attempting to remove it when his left arm was caught in the sprocket. He was hospitalized with a fractured left arm.
An employee was hospitalized for a cut on her left forearm while emptying the Horizontal Mixer.
The employee was manually handling plastic pallets when the employee's left thumb tip was caught in between two pallets resulting in the amputation of the thumb tip.
Two employees who were operating pallet jacks collided with each other. One employee was hospitalized overnight with back pain.

An employee was descending some stairs from a platform when he lost his footing, put his arms out to break his fall, and caught his pinky fingers on both hands in the "V" formed by the railing. Both pinky fingers were amputated.
An employee was cleaning a meat slicer and did not realize that the machine blade was spinning. She amputated her middle and ring fingertips on her right hand.
An employee was descending a ladder when he fell from the second rung closest to the ground, suffering a head injury.
An employee was retrieving a check from a safe in the manager's office when she closed the safe door on her right ring finger.  Her right ring fingertip was amputated.
On 3/24/16, at around 2:00 PM, an employee amputated an index fingertip while operating a punch press with pull-back devices.
Employee was performing underwater manufacturing of lead styphnate when initiation occurred, causing second degree burns and contusions to the employee's face.
An employee was working outside around a stationary pipe when his lower left leg contacted the pipe, breaking his shin bone.

On or about January 6, 2016, an employee was removing roller tables. The employee stacked one table on top of another other table. When the employee turned to retrieve straps to secure the tables for transportation, the top table slid and struck the employee's left leg, breaking the tibia and fibula and requiring surgery.
An employee was walking on a catwalk when he tripped on an object that protruded from the floor of the walkway and broke his left femur.
A maintenance employee was cutting 36-inch pipe with a cutting torch when his right hand was crushed between the pipe flange and the cutting table. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
On June 27, 2016, an employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee was caught between a forklift and a racking system, fracturing his pelvis and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was injured when the steel plate (3000 pounds) he was fitting became unattached, striking him and pinning him between two steel plates. He suffered injuries to his right arm and the right side of his abdomen, requiring hospitalization.

Four Treco, Inc. employees were cleaning tank bottoms at a facility. During the course of bolting a man way cover onto the tank opening with hand tools, an unknown ignition source caused two of the tanks to ignite. One employee suffered second and third degree burns to his face.
An employee fell while using crutches for a previous non-work related incident, fracturing the left side of his hip.
An employee was hospitalized after being involved in a rollover accident while riding as a passenger in an ATV. He injured his right knee and required surgery.
An employee was attempting to cover a stack of lumber with a tarp because it was going to rain when he slipped and fell from the stack, fracturing his pelvis.

An employee was helping to install the top of a fiberglass well when the side wall of the well cracked and allowed the lifting strap to come loose. The tank then dropped, striking the employee and injuring his hip.

An employee was standing on top of an excavation area flagging a trench box in when the ground gave way. The employee fell inside the trench, hitting the left side of his head and back, breaking four ribs, and bruising his head.
An employee was operating a maintenance cart, clearing off areas of the golf course, when the cart rolled. The employee suffered a broken pelvis and internal injuries.
