An employee's pinky fingertip was amputated when a door shut on it.
On 11/11/2016, an employee tripped over a cable tray that was sticking out of a doorway and fell to the floor, suffering broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee was setting up seine equipment to harvest fish from a pond when his hand was pulled into the chain and sprockets, injuring two fingers on his left hand.
A forklift battery fell on and broke an employee's left foot as he was changing the battery.

On Wednesday, 01/07/2015 at 3:45 a.m., an employee working on the 180 L Differential Assembly machine and the conveyor belt system dropped a wrench. In an attempt to retrieve the wrench from between the conveyor system and the 180 L Assembly machine, her right arm was caught by the 180 L machine, resulting in a laceration and an overnight hospital stay.
An employee was flagging traffic when he was struck by a vehicle. He suffered cuts to his head, fractured vertebra in his neck, a broken collarbone, and a broken left leg.
An employee was injured while attempting to remove a cat from a kennel. The employee was bitten on the left thumb, causing two puncture marks on the left thumb.
An employee suffered the amputation of four fingers on his right hand while operating a miter saw.
A worker was hospitalized for smoke inhalation while winding copper coils.
Employee dragged her foot on the carpet and it caused her to fall.
Employee suffered an amputation on his left index finger while cutting conduit on a portable band saw.
An employee amputated his finger in the back room while stocking product.

A "Yard Horse" vehicle with a shipping container on board was moving in the yard and accidentally bumped into a rail car.  An employee was standing on that railroad car, locking down containers.  The "bump" caused the employee to fall off the railroad car, and he was caught in a pinch point between the railroad car and the shipping container on board the "Yard Horse." He suffered a crushing laceration to the back of his right leg.
On February 10, 2017, at approximately 5:10 p.m., an employee was attempting to move a nitrogen tank when his fingers were smashed.
The employee was over head structure welding from a scissor lift at the height of approximately 18 feet. His head became caught between the scissor lift railing and the structure.
An employee slipped and fell on water that had dripped onto the floor from a wet shower bed, breaking his left knee and requiring hospitalization.

Two employees were pulling wire from one panel to another panel. One panel was energized; the other panel was not. The employee who was working at the energized panel came in contact with the live wires and suffered electrical burns to his hand (277 volt).
An employee was working on the motor of the scrap out conveyor when his glove was caught in the chain amputating the right index finger.

A trailer sub-frame assembly was sitting on three jack stands and an employee was using two bottle jacks to raise the axles so he could install the wheels. The trailer became unstable and shifted, causing the assembly to fall on and break the employee's femur.
An employee was riding a walking stacker. His right foot slipped off the walking stacker and was caught between it and a pallet resulting in a broken right tibia and fibula.
An employee was filling a lawn mower tire with air when the tire popped and struck the employee's hand, fracturing it.

An employee was attempting to light a handheld propane torch when an explosion occurred. The employee received second degree burns to the face, hand, and other body parts. A second employee also suffered injuries.
An employee was using a power wash to clean a rebuilt gas compression unit when a flash fire occurred. The employee sustained 2nd degree burns on the hands, face, neck, and ears.
An employee was prepping a recreational race course surface by side-slipping his skis.  The employee caught his downhill ski edge and fell, fracturing several ribs and rupturing his spleen.
While installing metal sheets on a roof, an employee fell through an old sheet of roofing material to the concrete below, suffering a left arm injury.
An employee was moving a post-con cart when her foot got caught in the cart webbing. She fell onto the ground and hurt/broke her left hip.
A decoiler slipped off of forklift straps and crushed an employee's right-hand pinky and middle fingers, amputating them.

An employee was assembling piping (10 feet long, weighing approximately 100 pounds) on a pump skid. When the pipe was set down, the employee's finger was caught between the pipe and the flange, amputating the tip of the left ring finger. The employee required surgery.
An employee put his finger in a small 1-inch hole in the side of an enclosed conveyor. His fingertip was struck by a conveyor flight.  One-eighth of an inch of his right index fingertip was damaged.

An employee was installing a sign for a newly constructed gas station and was using a 14-foot extension ladder along with some hand tools. When he began to descend the ladder, it slid to the side. He then fell 12 feet to the ground below and injured his back, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was delivering groceries. He fell and broke his left ankle while pushing a dolly down a ramp, requiring surgery.
After detaching a portable ladder from a rooftop, an employee fell from a ladder approximately 12 to 18 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken right leg and fractured right elbow.
An employee slipped and fell down the stairs, fracturing the right arm.
The employee was measuring the thickness of the granite and got caught between the granite and the roller on the conveyor. The employee's left index finger was amputated.

An employee was working outside on a very hot day, helping another employee pull 4-inch coiled plastic pipe off a trailer when he started feeling sick, vomiting, and experiencing muscle cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee was cleaning the disk of a tractor used for tomato-growing operations with a rag when an insect bit him on his left leg on 5/26/2015. He was later hospitalized when the bite became infected.
An employee fell off a loading dock and injured his knee.
An employee's left ring finger was pinched and partially amputated between two parts while stacking parts on a rack.
An employee was pushing a BiPAP machine into the store room of the respiratory department and cut their thumb on the edge of the machine. The employee was later hospitalized for an infection.
An employee was operating a lathe when his arm became stuck in the machine. He was hospitalized with a possible amputation.

An employee was using a table saw to cut plywood to size.  The employee's right ring and middle fingertips were amputated at the first joint when the fingers came in contact with the table saw blade. The saw was not guarded at the time of the incident.

The employee was checking the ink level on a print department machine without shutting it down.  As the employee reached in to check the ink tray, the employee's shirt was pulled into a roller or shaft.  The employee's left arm and shoulder were subsequently pulled into the machine.  The employee was able to pull the arm free, but suffered lacerations to the left arm and injured the shoulder.  The employee was transported to Freemont Medical Center and then transferred to a hospital in Omaha.
An employee was cutting meat with a band saw and amputated his right thumb at the first knuckle.

An employee was preparing to offload a compressor from a delivery truck and slipped on snow that had accumulated on the lift gate.  The employee fell into the bed of the truck and the compressor landed on and fractured his ankle.
An employee was changing a belt on an air conditioner motor when his right hand was caught between the belt and pulley, amputating his ring finger and fracturing his middle finger.

An employee was handling a squeezer and had his left hand on the roller. When he pressed the controlling panel with his right hand, his left middle finger got caught by the roller on the squeezer resulting in a broken and lacerated finger.
An employee was pulling a wheeled metal cart when a wheel became stuck. As she was trying to dislodge it, the cart fell on top of her. She was hospitalized.

An employee was using an extension brush to paint over a group of racking uprights. The uprights started rocking back and forth and one of the uprights fell towards him, causing four more to fall. The employee's leg was pinned under the four uprights. His leg was broken and required surgery.
An employee lost his balance and fell from the third step of an A-frame ladder while attaching tie wraps to a lift cylinder. He was hospitalized with head and back injuries.
An employee was exiting a forklift when he stepped on a nail. He was hospitalized with an abscess in his left foot.
An employee was involved in a physical altercation with a coworker, suffering a fractured vertebra.
An employee was replacing a belt on an electric motor when his left hand was caught between the belt and pulley, cutting and fracturing his hand and ring finger.
An employee was hospitalized when a conveyor that he was moving into a trailer fell on him, fracturing his left fibula and causing a contusion on his right hand.
An employee suffered a back injury and required hospitalization after the employee's chair broke.
An employee was using a band saw to cut boneless pit hams in half to run them through a slicer. The band saw motor ran in reverse, and the employee's middle and ring fingertips were amputated.
An employee was cutting wood with a table saw when the blade amputated two fingers.
An employee was cutting a piece of flat bar stock using an ironworker machine. The machine's hold down jaws caught and amputated the employee's left middle fingertip.
An employee fell while walking in the parking lot, breaking her left femur.
On or about January 19, 2015, an employee received a partial finger amputation while using the shrink wrap machine.
An employee walking down the hallway with non-skid shoes. The shoes stuck to the tile floor and  the employee fell fracturing the left hip.
An employee had the left index fingertip amputated while trying to clear a jam from the tissue paper convertor machine on February 27, 2015, at 2:00 pm.

An employee was hospitalized overnight after being struck in the mouth by a hand-held power angle drill. The accident occurred at the job site at approximately 8:00 a.m. on 01/31/15. The employee sustained massive lacerations to his cheek and jaw and broke two teeth.
Employee was pulling shavings on a winder at the trim chute and contacted the trim slitter suffering an angled cut to the nail bed and tip of the right index finger.
An employee's finger was crushed by machinery when it was inserted into an unguarded hole. The employee was admitted with a broken finger.
An employee was helping passengers load luggage when he tripped and fell forward, landing on and fracturing his right hip. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was moving a large air compressor that was in front of the metal recycle bin behind the store. The air compressor moved faster than anticipated and smashed the employee's left ring finger between the compressor and recycle bin. The finger was surgically amputated.
An employee suffered a pinky finger amputation while repairing a case sealer.
An employee was trying to correct loose taping on boxes that were on a moving machine when his right middle finger became caught in the machine's moving chain and was amputated.
An employee was climbing the ladder on the trailer to install a tarp. The employee fell from the ladder and fractured the right hip.
An employee stepped into an open pit and fell 4.5 feet to the concrete floor, breaking the right femur and requiring surgery.
On or about February 8, 2016, an employee was delivering a water heater to a homeowner when he slipped on snow-covered ice and broke his leg, requiring surgery.

A postal carrier was delivering mail on his normal walking route when a customer yelled at him and he turned to look at the customer. The customer was yelling at the carrier in a threatening way. The carrier ignored him and turned to walk away. The customer then threw a brick at the carrier striking the carrier on the head. He was admitted to the hospital for a laceration on his head.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell breaking her right hip.

An employee was attempting to remove a belt from a conveyor. He used a bar for leverage to remove the belt from the pulley. The motor was on at the time. As the motor caught the bar, it jerked him back and his hand made contact with the other belt, potentially amputating his left middle finger.

On Friday, August 14, 2015, an employee was bracing a dump truck tailgate. When he removed the pins, he lost his balance and the tailgate fell over and crushed his big toe on the right foot. The toe was surgically amputated.
While an employee was moving a fan and floor mat, the fan was knocked over and the screen and blade came off and struck her left hand, cutting her fingers and breaking her ring finger.

On December 16, 2015, at approximately 2:52p.m., an employee was hospitalized after receiving burns to his neck, ears, head, and hands.  The employee was preparing to unload a coal tar pitch railcar.  The line on the railcar was opened without relieving pressure and material sprayed onto the worker.
An employee was removing items such as boxes from a shelving rack. While attempting to retrieve an item, he fell 7 feet to the floor, breaking both wrists and fracturing his skull.
An employee was performing preventive maintenance on the conveyor motor and amputated the tips of the right thumb and index fingers.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the right thumb when his finger was caught between a metal table frame and a metal box that was raised by a forklift to be moved.
An employee attempted to move a lawnmower that became stationary. His right foot slipped and fell into the blades, amputating his toes.
An employee tripped over a cone and fell on her right hip.
An employee was cutting lumber with a Skill saw when he hit a knot in the wood, which caused him to lose control of the saw. As a result, the tip of his left thumb was amputated.
An employee injured his ring finger after his ring got caught on the edge of the Kustner machine while descending a step ladder. The finger was later amputated.
An employee was riding a bicycle at the jobsite, swerved to avoid striking another employee and hit a containment wall. The employee fell from the bicycle and fractured the left hip.
An employee was hospitalized for a hip fracture after breaking up an altercation between two hospital visitors.

While delivering mail on a rural route, employee slipped and fell due to snow and ice. This resulted in a right lower leg fracture of both bones. Employee was hospitalized and needed emergency surgery to repair the leg.
An employee was cutting a fallen tree limb when it became unstable, rolled, and knocked him off of a deck to the ground roughly 11 feet below. The employee sustained broken ribs.
Employee's foot was run over by another employee who was backing up a forklift.
An employee was attempting to stop a whistling noise on a machine when his finger was caught in the point of operation, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was using a band saw to cut metal pipe. The pipe slipped and the employee's right thumb was amputated.

On Friday 6/26/2015, at 9:00 a.m., a maintenance employee was driving, putting a brand new pin into the backhoe/excavator bucket with a slug hammer. A piece of metal from the new pin broke off, struck him and was imbedded in his shoulder. The injury required hospitalization.
An employee was attempting to put a part on a shelf when the part hit an end cap and bounced back. He put up his arms to protect his face and the part lacerated his left arm.
Employee was walking through the department and fell.  Employee suffered fractures to the arm and knee and was admitted to the hospital.
On February 13, 2017, at about 4:30 PM an employee was visiting a patient in their home and slipped and fell fracturing an ankle. The employee was hospitalized.
On December 30, 2016, an employee was burned on the face, arm and left hand while cleaning a jiffy mixer in a solvent tank when the solvent vapor ignited.
An employee was handling boxes of potatoes when he experienced pain. He was transferred to the hospital where he was scheduled for a possible hernia operation.

An employee attempted to hurdle a cart return stall in the parking lot and fell fracturing the lower left arm and sustaining facial lacerations. The employee was admitted to the hospital to set the fracture and is scheduled to have rods placed in the arm.

An employee was operating a Solbern conveyor. The products being transported on the conveyor became jammed at the end of the conveyor.  The operator attempted to clear the jam by reaching underneath the conveyor and removing the product that was stuck between the conveyor and a tray. The operator's right ring finger was caught in a belt underneath the conveyor and the skin was peeled from the tip of the finger. The finger was amputated just below the finger nail at the hospital.
An employee was opening a window when it fell down and pinched the employee's right index finger between the metal sash and the bottom of the window, amputating the fingertip.
On November 17, 2016, an employee who works in plastic recovery sustained a fingertip amputation.

An employee was operating a press and encountered a problem with the machine. The machine was powered down to adjust the hardness wheel. When the machine was powered back up, the employee's left index and pinky fingers were amputated.
An employee suffered lacerations to his head when it was caught in an elevator gate.
A boom section fell and struck an employee who was disassembling an 80-ton crawler. The employee suffered a fractured right leg and was hospitalized.
The employee was cleaning pieces of metal off a magnet. The magnets drew together and pinched the employee's right ring finger resulting in amputation.
Employee's left hand got caught in a conveyor belt and pulley while increasing the tension. The employee's left index finger was amputated.
An employee was performing sanitation activities when his sleeve got caught on a roller. The machine rollers then pulled his hand into the machine, amputating it.
An employee was using a pry bar to align a flange when the bar slipped, causing him to fall backward and fracture his left ankle. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was removing a steel pot that was in the upright position. The steel pot was supported by its own weight on the ground. In trying to do so, the steel pot shifted and leaned to one side. The steel pot landed on a piece of cement wall that was adjacent to the steel pot. The employee's finger was caught between the steel pot and the cement wall. The employee's right middle finger was amputated at the last knuckle.
An employee was repairing a trailing arm bushing and pinched his finger between the trailing arm and a tool. The medical report later classified it as an oblique amputation.

An employee was part of a crew performing work during the temporary shutdown of a boiler. He was raising a wash beam from inside the boiler by using an electric powered winch.  He was operating the pendant controls of the winch and raising the beam.  While raising the beam, his right hand was on the cable of the winch. The spool of the winch caught his glove, causing his hand to became caught in the winch.  He pulled his hand back, amputating his right ring fingertip just below the nailbed.
An employee's right middle and ring fingers were amputated when his hand became trapped between cooling rolls while checking for defects in the web.
An employee was attempting to clean a machine. While trying to clear chips away, his glove got caught and his left hand was pulled into the cutter, fracturing and lacerating his left hand and wrist.
After delivering mail on a walking route in extreme heat, an employee became ill and began throwing up. He was hospitalized for heat stress.
An employee was cleaning loose cotton from around a banding machine when he was knocked into the machine. He sprained his ankle and suffered leg abrasions, requiring hospitalization.
One employee was hospitalized after a sample port on a sodium hydroxide line failed, showering the employee with sodium hydroxide at 190 degrees Fahrenheit.

On Monday, February 8, 2016, at approximately 12:15 PM, an employee was operating a double rider (powered industrial truck). She pressed the wrong button and moved the truck forward instead of backwards, and she was pinned between the truck and a rack upright. She fractured her pelvis and was hospitalized.

An employee was cleaning off a container when he tripped over an air hose in the dust containment room. He fell and hit his head on a rail, requiring hospitalization for two broken ribs, a back injury, and a cut above his left eye.
An employee amputated two fingertips, pinched a third finger, and fractured a finger on the right hand while cleaning ink off print rollers on a machine that had not been shut off and isolated.

An employee was conducting preventive maintenance on a conveyor motor when his left hand was caught between the gear box and gear box housing, amputating his left pinky fingertip and lacerating his left index finger. He was hospitalized. The motor was still running at the time of the incident.
An employee sustained an amputation while operating a rolling stainless steel plate machine.

On 11/28/2016, an employee was unloading a 53-foot trailer using a forklift. As he was attempting to enter the trailer, the tractor and trailer rolled forward, causing the forklift to fall to the ground.  As the forklift was falling, the employee jumped out of it and hit the ground, breaking his hip and requiring hospitalization.

On or about April 9, 2015, at approximately 1300 hrs. an employee suffered the amputation of the distal phalanges on the right hand pinkie finger. The employee was attempting to load a bundle of angle iron onto a vehicle when the load shifted in his hands and pinned his right hand to the structure of the vehicle.

An employee was checking cooler chillers. When he passed the chiller blower, the chiller blower's fan sucked his left hand in, cutting off the tip of his index finger. The blower was unguarded at the time because the guard had fallen off.

An employee was attaching drill pipe to elevators using his hands. His fingers got stuck between the elevator and the drill pipe, which broke two fingers (pointer and middle finger of the right hand).
An employee was walking out of the cold storage area when a forklift backed up over his left foot, bruising it.

An electrical contractor was installing a 480 volt electrical panel at a customer location. The employee pulled wires to the panel the day before the accident, but did not finish the job. When he returned to the facility the next day, he got on a ladder and touched the panel that he thought was cold. At some point between the time he left the panel and returned to finish the job the wires were energized. The employee was shocked and thrown from the ladder. He received burns on his hands and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was drilling into a pipe in the hydrogen process unit when the line flashed. He was hospitalized with second degree burns on his hands, neck, and chest and third degree burns on his fingertips.
An employee fell off her bicycle while commuting to work on shipyard property. The employee fractured the left wrist and was hospitalized for surgery.
A line cook amputated the tip of his left thumb while chopping broccolini.
An employee was parking an electric cart. When she stepped on the brake, the vehicle accelerated and collided with the side of the building, breaking her leg.

The employee was washing a stripper filler machine with a 4 to 5 inch diameter flexible hose that hung down from the ceiling. The employee noted a sharp pain in the back during the cleaning operation and heard a pop when the employee bent over to pick up the tool.
While an employee was removing two rolls of paper from a winder, the stops came up and twisted one of the rolls. The employee's left forearm was caught and fractured between the rolls.
An employee operating an order picker unit was t-boned by another employee operating a second order picker unit. The injured employee was hospitalized and treated for a fractured hip.
On February 1, 2015, worker cut tip of finger, resulting in an amputation.

The employee was pulling a safety pin out of an outrigger on the telebelt and had his finger pinched in the outrigger. The employee sustained a flesh amputation to the fingertip of the right hand middle finger.
An employee was knocked to the ground when the cab of a mulcher fell on him.
On or about February 13, 2015, an employee amputated the tips of 2 fingers on the right hand while attempting to remove a jam in the packaging machine.

An employee was removing a baffle plate to set in the support arm with cable come a-longs. The employee's finger got pinched between the baffle plate and support arm, resulting in an amputation to the right ring fingertip.

An employee was lowering a lid to a machine when he tried to quickly remove a tool that had been left inside the machine. The lid then smashed two of his fingers on his left hand. His middle and ring fingertips were surgically amputated.

On 10/10/16, employees started a prescribed fire in a national forest to help the vegetation in the area. One employee was refueling a chainsaw to cut trees. When he uncapped the fuel tank, the hot oil boiled out of the tank and onto his right wrist, right arm, and belly, causing second and third degree burns.
An employee was loading equipment and tripped on the lip of the loading ramp and fell breaking a hip.

An employee and a coworker were at servicing a truck. The employee was under the truck close to the fuel tanks when the coworker started the truck. The truck moved forward and the rear tandem caught the employee and drug him an unknown distance.
An employee fell and broke his pelvis while performing roofing work.

While working in a ditch, an employee cut a test header off a piece of steel pipe.  The test header was being lifted out of the ditch when it tipped to the side and some methanol, which had been used to clean the pipe, leaked out and onto the employee's legs. The methanol ignited and caught the employee's legs on fire. The employee was hospitalized with leg burns.

An employee was mowing a bank horizontally using a John Deere zero-turn commercial riding mower. The mower flipped onto the employee, puncturing a lung and breaking three left ribs, five right ribs, and the clavicle.
While bagging product on the packing line, an employee attempted to remove debris from the bagger. The employee's thumb got caught in a roller, amputating the tip.

An employee pulled onto a metal-surface truck scale and stepped out of his truck while carrying a pint-size sample bottle of the materials he had just picked up. It was raining and he slipped. The sample bottle fell to the ground and broke. He then fell onto the bottle, which severed the ulnar nerve in his right wrist.

An employee was inside the Line 25 cooler doing a clean-out to prepare for the next batch.  The machine was locked out, but the key was left in the lock and wasn't turned to the off position. Once the materials are loaded into this machine, it starts up again automatically if it has not been turned to the off position. He was caught in the machine and sustained extensive injuries to the right foot, burns to an arm and back and a possible broken neck.

An employee stepped onto an electric pallet jack and lost footing.  He reached for a handhold and accidently grabbed the throttle. The jack lurched forward, crushing his foot between the jack and a pallet.
An employee was performing maintenance on a molding machine when his right arm got caught and injured. He was hospitalized.
An employee cut their right little finger with a circular saw.

An employee was hospitalized after they slipped and fell approximately 15-20 feet through a scrap cavity located beneath the AP-8 mechanical power press while pushing scrap into the cavity. The employee suffered a fractured ankle, broken nose, lacerations to the face, and is scheduled to have surgery on a fractured elbow.
Employees were replacing equipment to install a cannon ball. As they were replacing the equipment, an employee bumped one of the valves. Pressure was released, spraying onto the employee's neck.
An employee became pinned between the handle of a double pallet jack and warehouse racking, sustaining internal injuries.
An employee was using a 12-foot step ladder when the pin on the ladders bracing broke causing him to fall to the ground. The employee suffered cracked ribs and a fractured coccyx.
An employee was performing MIG welding operations in the hopper department for 4 hours when he became overheated. He passed out and was hospitalized.
An employee had the right middle fingertip amputated while making adjustments on a moulder that was in operation.

On or about 1300 hrs on 31 May 2015, a One Source Industrial Services employee was hospitalized when the employee's vehicle overturned on CR 5000 in Andrews County, Texas. The incident occurred as the employee attempted to turn onto CR 5000. The employee lost control of the vehicle, causing it to overturn and resulting in a broken arm, bruised ribs, and a possible concussion.
An employee was preparing to fabricate a clamp for a pipe. As he was rotating the pipe, it pinched his left finger to the knuckle resulting in amputation.

On Tuesday, 9/22/15 at approximately 6:30 PM, an employee suffered a laceration to his right thigh when he backed into a motor's fan that was being repaired. The fan's protective shroud had been removed for the repairs. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee working with a pry bar was checking if a bolt hole was properly aligned on the axle of a garbage truck. The axle slipped while his finger was in the hole, amputating his fingertip.

On March 18, 2016, at approximately 6:15 a.m., an employee was operating a stand-up forklift and traveling toward the battery changing area when his left hand made contact with the overhead racking system, amputating his left pinky finger near the knuckle.
An employee was working at the diaphragm crimper when his finger was caught in the point of operation. His right middle fingertip was pinched and had to be amputated.
An employee was securing a strap on a trailer cover when the strap became unattached, causing him to fall and break his left wrist. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
On August 5, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., an employee exited the cab of his crane and fell to the ground, fracturing his right hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was installing an air conditioner when he fell approximately 30 feet, suffering a fracture.

While operating a sorter, an employee attempted to clear a board that was hung up on the back side of the sorter. The board slipped and pinched the employee's right index finger, amputating the fingertip.

A maintenance employee was investigating a suspected defective roller on a conveyor belt. The machine must be running to hear defective rollers. His hand was pulled into the machine, and the rollers rolled up onto his forearm. He suffered compound fractures to his radius and ulna and required surgery.
An employee was servicing an aircraft engine when he fell off a ladder and injured his wrists, requiring hospitalization.

On 2/23/16, an employee sustained an amputation of the ring and middle fingers on his right hand while operating a cutting shear.  The employee was holding a piece of metal in place while another employee operated the pedal for the shear.
An employee was using a miter saw. As he pulled the miter saw blade down to make a cut, his thumb was in the path of the blade and was amputated below the first joint.
The employee was installing a fence when he slipped and fell. He grabbed the fence and cut his right middle finger on the fence.

An employee was walking back to her van after an outing with a client when she fell off a curb and onto the parking lot pavement. She fractured her left wrist and right shoulder, requiring overnight hospitalization.
On 6/16/15, an employee was injured when he slipped off the forks of a forklift and fell 5 to 6 feet. The employee was hospitalized with cracked ribs and a groin injury.
An employee fell off the peanut trailer ladder while a taking moisture reading and broke his left foot/ankle.
On April 17, 2015, an employee in the laundry room stepped behind laundry equipment and was injured when caught between the machine and the wall.
An employee was getting supplies from the supply closet when she tripped over the cord of a portable fan. She fell and injured her hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a backhoe to lay down a steel beam when the beam broke through the backhoe's glass window and struck his left kneecap. He was hospitalized with a broken left kneecap.
An employee was unhooking an RV. The RV rolled back and ran over the employee.

A maintenance employee was storing the extruder track that is used to move the extruder to and from the die. He was wearing a cut resistant glove that caught on a bur. As he was sliding the track into the storage area, his finger got caught between the sliding rack and storage area.
An employee was unwrapping a pallet of cardboard boxes when he stepped back and his left foot was run over by a forklift, requiring surgery.
An employee was inserting wires through electrical conduit and fell from an A-frame ladder. The employee fractured his skull and two ribs and suffered four compressed discs.
An employee was moving a trailer when the tongue dropped and landed on his finger resulting in a partial amputation of the right ring finger.
An employee was tightening a clamp on the top of a mixing drum. The drum moved, and the employee fell more than 6 feet to the ground below, breaking both ankles and requiring hospitalization.
On June 16, 2016, an employee was attempting to enter a tractor-trailer rig when he fell backwards to the ground, fracturing ribs and vertebrae. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell approximately 30 feet to the ground while installing a truss, suffering facial fractures, as well as injuries to the spleen, liver, and kidney. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was unloading baggage tubs from a cart when he lost his balance and fell over, striking his leg on the baggage conveyor and fracturing his right femur.

The employee was attempting to rig a steel beam with a chain sling and overhead crane. While attempting to rig this elevated beam, it fell towards the employee. The employee tried to brace/stop the beam with his hand and the fore of the beam pushed him back, striking his face and chest as well, knocking him into another steel beam.  The employee was admitted to the hospital with a broken wrist. Surgery was performed to correct the injury to the employee's wrist. 

The injury occurred in the Welding/Fabrication shop.
An employee amputated the left index finger while operating the wire mesh looming equipment.
An employee was working on an embosser on the extrusion line when his left index fingertip was crushed, resulting in an amputation.
An employee pinched a finger when standing up a steel drum. Soft tissue was torn from the finger tip with no bone loss.
An employee was struck by a personnel transport vehicle in the cast member corridor and suffered a fractured ankle and leg.

The employee was helping another subcontractor unjam the lock on the dump truck's gate. The employee put his hand on the latch and when it became operational, the lock struck his fingers and amputated the right pinky and ring fingertips.
An employee was struck-by a manually operated pallet jack as he was moving a load of boxes.

An employee was helping a customer troubleshoot the customer's automobile. The employee was leaning over and looking into the car's engine compartment when the hood of the vehicle fell and struck the employee in the head.
On February 9, 2016, an employee's left thumb was amputated to the first joint while the employee was operating a brake press to bend steel.
An employee was removing a cash drawer from the safe. Her right hand was on top of the safe; when the safe door was shut, it took the top portion of her right middle finger off.
An employee was hospitalized for a fractured C2 vertebrae when he fell from the bottom step of a front-end loader.
An employee was troubleshooting a conveyor and amputated the right thumb.

On 9/22/2016, an employee was pulling a skid (hand jack) with product on it from a side aisle to the main aisle when he was struck by a passing forklift, injuring his right leg and requiring hospitalization.

Employee was walking in the very center of 10-feet tall racking on plywood and then stepped down to the next level on a piece of plywood that had no center support. It collapsed and he fell 6 feet to the next level.  

He was disassembling the racking system just before he fell

An employee was using a tractor with a front-end load bucket to remove bark from under a log deck. The tractor unexpectedly started to move forward and the employee's head got caught between the log deck and a bar on the tractor. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was moving a board inside a trash truck hopper. The blade was moving at the time. The employee's left ring fingertip was amputated between the compactor blade and the side wall of the hopper.
An employee fell in the parking lot and broke his right hip.

On or about April 30, 2015, an employee was helping a second employee position a fallen log so that the grapple of the front-end loader could pick the log up from the ground. The second employee struck the log with such force that the log moved horizontally in a right-to-left sweeping motion, striking the first employee in the leg area and resulting in two breaks to the left leg and a broken right ankle.
An employee was breading a hopper machine when it fractured and de-gloved his right hand and forearm. The machine was unguarded at the time.
An employee was walking with a paint booth blasting gun in his hand and tripped over the hose. The blasting gun caused a deep laceration to the employee's left thigh.

After delivering mail to various businesses, a city carrier assistant (CCA) was walking through a shared parking lot to the delivery truck when the CCA slipped on snow covered ice and fell.  The CCA suffered a fractured right pelvis resulting in hospitalization.
An employee mowing lawns was hospitalized for heat stress.
An employee was stepping away from his tool box, tripped on a wire cable, and fell to the floor breaking his right hip.
An employee slipped on ice and fell while walking to their work truck in the company lot. They sustained injuries to their left knee that required surgery.
An employee fell off and hit the dock while putting freight in a trailer, resulting in shoulder and knee injuries.

An employee was replacing the filter of a duct cooling fan when the filter moved, causing the employee's hand to strike the fan. The employee suffered lacerations and fractures to the left ring, pinky, and index fingers.
An employee was on a ladder to hang a banner on the exterior of the building. He fell from the ladder and suffered a broken forearm. He was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was threading yarn through the winder with his right hand on the aspirator. The traverse (yarn holder) grabbed his left pinky finger and lacerated it. His left ring finger was also lacerated. The pinky finger had to be surgically amputated to the first knuckle.
An employee fell 13 feet, 6 inches, to the ground while inspecting a roof. The employee cracked several ribs and was hospitalized.

An employee was working near the wash line conveyor in the production area. She reached to remove a bucket from the conveyor when her right-hand pinky and ring fingertips were amputated by a chain and sprocket.
An employee was bitten by an insect during her break and experienced swelling. The bite was lanced at the emergency room. The lanced area later became infected and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a part with a forklift when he struck a storage rack. A brake drum fell from the storage rack and struck his right ankle, breaking it. He was hospitalized.
An employee was lifting a battery when he heard a "pop."  The employee had cellulitis of the arm and the wound began oozing.  The employee was sent to the hospital for treatment.
An employee's hand was pinched between a man basket and the frame of a conveyor.

On 1/15/2015, employee injured two fingers on his right hand after catching it under a bundle of rebar while operating a side-loader in the yard. Part of the bone of his right ring finger was surgically removed on 1/20/15.
Am employee was walking by a steam cooking kettle and slipped on the water that was on the floor, breaking the hip and bruising the wrist.

An employee accessed the roof to attach his fall protection at the peak so he could start loading shingles. He stepped on a toe board, which dislodged and caused him to fall 10 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with a back injury.
An employee was installing asphalt shingles when he accidently shot himself in the foot with his nail gun.

On or about August 23, 2016, at 6:00 p.m., an employee was observing an apprentice associate on the reach truck during training. As the apprentice associate completed a transaction and was moving the reach truck to another aisle, the apprentice struck the employee, fracturing his pelvis and kneecap. He was hospitalized.

A maintenance employee repairing a metal entrance gate was moving a vertical fence post.  He attached one end of a rope to the post and the other end to the bucket of a skid steer vehicle.  He was standing between the post and the skid steer vehicle when the vehicle's operator lost control of the vehicle.  The vehicle lurched forward and trapped the employee's head between the post and the bucket of the skid steer vehicle, breaking his eye socket and cheek bone.
On October 31, 2016, an employee's fingertip was amputated when he was attempting to use tongs on the screw casings.
An employee was roofing when he stepped backwards and his heel struck a skylight cover. He then lost his balance and fell 25 to 30 feet through the acrylic cover to the concrete ground below.
While attaching a drop wire to the side of a residential building, an employee fell approximately 14 feet from an extension ladder.

On May 28, 2015, a truck driver entered the scale platform from the opposite direction of its designed use.  The scale platform was designed with a walking surface on the driver's side and a guardrail on the passenger side.  The driver exited his truck and stepped onto the top rail of the guardrail system.  It was raining at the time.  The driver slipped and fell to the ground.  The driver experience a compound fracture to his left arm.  The driver was taken to the hospital, treated, and released the day of the accident.
An employee was standing next to a pallet containing a box of yarn. The employee fell after twisting while unloading the box and broke his hip, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was troubleshooting a press. The powdered metal is gravity fed through a tube into the die and the die shoe was not moving properly. The press was put into set up mode and the employee attempted to jog the shoe slightly. While the arm was jogging, a small metal arm of the shoe caught the employee's finger and pinched it between the shaker and the shake stop box. The fingertip was later amputated.

An employee climbed up a vertical fixed ladder to verify lengths of material in the loft and as the employee was coming down the ladder, he missed a step and fell approximately seven feet to the ground, injuring his hip. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee broke his left foot while operating a forklift.

The Zamboni driver was shoveling shaved ice off of the ice rink.  While shoveling the shaved ice, the driver slipped, fell, and fractured his hip.  The driver was hospitalized and will undergo surgery.
An employee was cleaning an Etnyre Maintenance Distributor when he was sprayed with hot tack coat. He suffered second degree burns on his torso and first degree burns on his arms.
An employee was hospitalized and sustained an amputation after having his left index finger pinched between a pallet jack and load.

The injured employee along with his co-worker were lining a farm implement onto the farm tractor's hitch. As the farm implement was being aligned with the ball of the hitch, the employee's right pointer finger got caught between the implement and the ball of the hitch resulting in the amputation of his finger from the nail up. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was operating a fiber optic rewinder when his right index finger was caught and pulled by the machine. His finger was amputated above the knuckle.
A temporary employee was pulling plastic from behind a stack of boards. The boards fell and broke his leg.
An employee was found at the bottom of a wooden ladder with a fractured skull and left wrist.
While collecting soil samples, an employee using an ATV struck a cable stretched across a gate opening, suffering chest and neck trauma.

An employee was operating a tugger to pull racks to the warehouse while a coworker on a forklift was stacking finished product in the warehouse. The coworker sounded his horn upon backing up and attempted to take a right turn around a stack of knockdowns. The employee was heading into the warehouse area at the same time and came around the stack of knockdowns. The coworker's forks hit the front left side of the employee's tugger. The left fork hit the front left side, spinning the back of the tugger towards the lift and allowing the right fork to strike the top of the employee's foot. The employee suffered a fractured left foot.
Employee got his left arm caught in moving equipment and went to the hospital.

An employee was installing light fixtures when he came in contact with live electrical wires and sustained a shock. He then fell approximately 14 feet from a 16-foot ladder, breaking his ankle and requiring surgery.

A positive displacement pump that marinates chicken was clogged. An employee removed the hose that was secured with a clamp and stuck his finger into the pump. The impellers on the pump amputated the tip of the employee's finger.

On the morning of 5/29/2015, employee arrived at work at 6:00 am.  At about 6:05 he was securing a line to roll a cover on a barge. The hook somehow dislodged and became airborne striking the employee in his left upper arm. The hook was 4" and weighed approximately 3 pounds. The cover of the barge became wedged and put tension on the line and then the hook became dislodged striking the employee.
An employee was lifting a part with her left hand when the part slipped and struck her right hand, amputating the first right-hand fingertip.
An employee was attempting to light a pilot light on a gas oven when a flash fire occurred. The employee sustained first degree burns to the hands and face.

An employee opened the cleanout on a screw conveyor that had stopped. As he was removing the super sack string that had bound it up, the screw conveyor continued turning and amputated his right ring finger.

On July 19, 2016, at approximately 7:10 p.m., an employee was loading a tube in the tube bender when a clamp closed on the employee's right fourth and fifth fingers. A portion of the fourth finger was surgically removed the following day.
A Room Operations Executive Assistant was walking near the kitchen when she slipped and fell causing her to facture her knee. She was hospitalized as a result.
An employee suffered a left index finger amputation below the joint while cutting with a band saw.
An employee fell and broke the left ankle.
An employee was putting a trench box together.  The employee's finger got stuck between the wall and the horizontal spacing bar when the box was lifted.
An employee's hand was caught under the grinding wheel of a surface grinder resulting in a left middle finger avulsion. The fingertip was later amputated.

An employee was raising the slide gate on his truck with one hand on the controls and the other hand free. He slipped and his left hand was caught between the truck and rising gate, amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee fell and broke his knee after slipping on spilled liquid in the hallway.
An additional 480V service for a step-up transformer was being installed. When the circuit was tested, an arc flash occurred, resulting in lacerations to the employee's hand.

On February 9, 2017, an employee was delivering mail to a customer's home. As she made the turn onto the home's front sidewalk, she slipped on ice and fell to the ground, fracturing her right fibula and dislocating her ankle.
While stepping onto a joist on the second floor of a commercial construction site, an employee fell 13 feet to the ground below, fracturing the left pelvis and elbow.
An employee was assisting a visitor while standing on a curb. When he stepped off the curb, he rolled his ankle and fell onto the asphalt driveway, breaking his left femur.
While an employee was attempting to slice a meat product using a knife, the blade lacerated the employee's abdomen just above the belly guard.

An employee on a ladder was unwiring a spindle motor from a grinding machine. The employee fell from the ladder to the concrete floor, fracturing the left wrist and left hip and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was sandblasting structural steel. He was using supply air from an air compressor when he felt lightheaded. He was hospitalized for carbon monoxide exposure.
An employee was repairing an underground propane tank gauge when the propane ignited a fire. The employee sustained second and third degree burns requiring hospitalization.
While walking down a steep slope in the woods and crossing a gully on a log, an employee fell and landed on their back, suffering a ruptured spinal column and requiring hospitalization.
An employee on a production line was installing a chassis bumper when the chassis from down the line pinned him between the two chassis, crushing his back.

An employee was standing on the fifth rung of an A-step ladder while installing a piece of plywood to the ceiling. The plywood slipped off his hands and pushed him back, causing him to lose his balance and fall on the ground. He broke the lower portion of his right leg.

An employee had just delivered a load of steel to the galvanizing plant to be coated, and a load of galvanized steel had been loaded onto his trailer for the return trip. He climbed onto the flatbed trailer, positioned the tie down straps used to secure the load, and was climbing down the rear step/bumper to get off the trailer when he slipped and fell, breaking his right leg.
An employee fell from a ladder and broke a leg.
An employee was working from a scaffold driving metal studs into the wall. A metal stud kick-back struck the employee causing a laceration over the right eye.
An employee was cleaning a mixer using acetone when a flash fire occurred. The employee received burns to both hands.
An employee was walking down the hallway and around a corner when her knee gave out.  She fell and broke her left femur bone.
An employee was moving a paper roll with an overhead crane. Her right pinky finger got caught and was amputated between the paper roll shaft and the bracket.
An employee was counting products when a forklift ran over his left foot, breaking toes.
An employee was attempting to set an extension ladder on a house when it started to fall. He was unable to catch the ladder, and his right pinky finger got caught in a pinch point.
An employee was shot by a customer while working.

An employee was beveling a pipe with a grinder. The employee put down the grinder after beveling the pipe, placed his hand on the elevated skid, and looked into the pipe. The pipe started to roll and crushed his right index finger, which was partially amputated.
The employee was driving a forklift and pinched their right hand on the warehouse rack resulting in an amputation injury to the right middle finger.

While taking measurements in the heat treatment furnace, an employee stepped onto a non-load bearing support and fell into a vat of 220-degree quench oil.  The employee suffered second and third degree burns.
An employee was walking in front of an electric pallet jack. The pallet jack ran over the back of his foot when the employee stopped suddenly.
An employee was mowing a lawn using a riding mover. He struck a wire and fell off the mower. The mower ran over his right hand severing it.
While walking, an employee tripped and fell over the forks on a parked pallet jack, injuring the right leg/knee.

An employee was working on the compressed air line for a vessel and connecting a 2-inch hose to a valve in a bilge in order to flush a new pipe. He then stepped on the valve, which opened and released air that knocked off his safety glasses and blew metal debris into his eye. He was hospitalized.

An employee was standing outside on a wooden walkway next to an entrance door. It had been raining and the wooden walkway was wet.  The employee opened the door for a student. The student walked into the building. The door was about to slam shut so the employee twisted to grab the door and slipped on the wet walkway falling to the ground and breaking his tibia.
An employee was setting floor trusses using a ladder when he fell from the ladder and broke his ribs.
While making copies, an employee turned, caught the left foot on the copy machine, and fell fracturing the left femur.

The employee reached into a poultry skinning machine to push meat through. The metal mesh glove she was wearing became caught and pulled her hand into the machine, amputating her middle fingertip and nail.
An employee was hit by the blast of a sand blaster, which injected media into his leg.
An employee was seriously injured after hitting the third digit on his right hand with a hammer. The employee suffered soft tissue trauma.
An employee was struck by a section of rebar panel  26' wide by 40' long when the straps used to lift it came loose. The employee suffered a broken leg.
An employee operating a stand-up forklift was backing up when his right foot got caught between the forklift he was operating and a parked forklift.
An employee was closing a 480 volt disconnect switch when it arc flashed and caused third degree burns to the right hand and first degree burns to the face.

An employee was working in an excavation, tightening flange bolts on a pipe, while an excavator operator was changing the excavator bucket nearby. The bucket came loose, hit the ground, and rolled approximately 10 feet into the excavation, striking the employee and pinning him underneath it. He suffered a lower leg injury.

An employee was working on the deck of the barge assisting with securing the dredge swing anchor. The employee placed his left hand between the anchor and the side of the barge. While lifting the anchor, the employee's left thumb was crushed and suffered a partial amputation (above the knuckle).

An employee was troubleshooting a press machine. The machine completed its cycle while the employee's hand was next to an air cylinder, partially amputating the employee's left middle finger and fracturing the left ring finger.
An employee was hospitalized after being shot in the forearm with abrasive material from a pneumatic sand blaster.
An employee was converting a cupper machine by removing the die set when the die set slid back and amputated his left ring and pinky fingers.

On 10/22/2015 at approximately 10:10 pm, a forklift operator stopped his forklift and placed it in park. The employee took a drink of water that caused him to cough and presumably choke. The coughing, caused the employee to lose consciousness and fall from the forklift suffering eight broken ribs and a lacerated spleen.

Four employees were burned by hot plastic while working in the vicinity of a plastic extruding machine. One employee required hospitalization. The employees were purging an extruder machine and cleaning the die when they were sprayed with hot, melted PVC material. The hospitalized employee suffered first and second degree burns to the face and neck.

An employee was attempting to connect a drill stem to a drill rod inside a bore hole. He was straightening the rod in the hole with his right hand and was using his other hand to run the controls. The cable was still connected at this time.  He lowered the drill rod and used his hand to connect the slipper or hoisting cable from the drill rod in the hole. The cable and the drill rod started to spin around, pulling in and causing an amputation to his right hand and arm.

Two employees were clearing a tree that had fallen on a utility pole in order to put the pole back in service. A limb from the tree broke off and fell onto the two employees. The first employee suffered broken ribs and a punctured lung. The second employee suffered a broken hip, broken ribs, and a punctured lung. Both employees were hospitalized.

An employee fell from a step ladder while drilling holes to blow insulation into a house. He hit an air conditioning unit on the way down and ended by hitting his head on a stone retaining wall. He was hospitalized on 3/16/15.
An employee was taking down a crane when he slipped and fell 14 feet off the crane to the ground, suffering facial scratches and fracturing both hands and his left elbow.
An employee fell while entering the building, fracturing both of her legs.
Employee was hospitalized after burning his legs while welding structural steel. Hot slag caught the acetylene tank on fire.
An employee was operating a pasta press and amputated three fingers.
An employee was placing an epoxy mixture in a hole.  Because of vibration, the employee was struck by the epoxy grout under his right arm and side.

A glass shelf was leaning against the employee's leg. The employee lost balance and fell to the floor and some of the glass shelves fell on top of her. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis and a bruised right leg.
An employee suffered a right-hand middle finger amputation while cleaning a lint filter.

An employee was attempting to connect two dollies. The rear dolly gained momentum, causing the employee to lose control. The dolly tongue crushed and amputated the employee's right-hand ring fingertip.
An employee was lifting stone material with a suction cup when the slab came loose and crushed the employee's right middle finger, amputating the fingertip without bone loss.
An employee was slicing meat on a meat slicer and amputated the tip of the ring finger.
An employee received an electrical shock of 277 volts while installing commercial light fixtures.
An employee became stuck in the hot tar and was struck by paving machinery while working on the highway.
An employee was working in the production area cutting pineapples with a knife and amputated the left index fingertip.

An employee was greasing the motor and drive bearings inside the main air handler. He lost his balance and caught his finger in the slow turning pulley and belt, resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was changing a knockout on a press die when a chain came loose. The employee's left ring finger was then pinched between the die stem and the die knockout, amputating the fingertip.

On or about August 27, 2015, an employee suffered the amputation all four fingertips of the on the left hand.  The employee was using a concrete molding machine and in the process of inflating the interior core pinched his/her fingers between the core and the mold.
An employee suffered a left ring finger amputation when loading a damaged vehicle onto a tow truck.
An employee was pulling a king pin to release a trailer and slipped and fell fracturing his right ankle.  Employee was hospitalized.
An employee was standing behind a forklift and was pinned between two forklifts resulting in a leg injury.

The employee was attempting to rework the alignment on a seam in a rolled metal cylinder when the spot welds broke. The metal struck the employee, resulting in a fractured left leg and numerous fractures to both feet.
An employee was walking in the manufacturing yard when he tripped on a rock and twisted/fractured his right ankle. He required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was trying to unjam the slide gate on a conveyor when the slide gate contacted and amputated his left middle fingertip. The device was not locked out at the time.
An employee was climbing on the back of an 18-wheeler tractor trailer stacking tires and fell breaking the left wrist and hip.
An employee was hospitalized after they missed a step while dismounting a bulk semi-trailer. The employee fell 2 to 2.5 feet to the ground, fracturing their right hip.
The employee was supervising the expansion of a high school and suffered heat exhaustion/dehydration.
An employee was kneeling down to hand grate or hand shovel when a bobcat operator struck the employee, injuring his right tibia.

An maintenance employee opened a closed panel of an energized motor which activated unexpectedly catching the employee's index, ring and middle fingers in the pulley system and causing an amputation injury.

An employee was laying a metal deck with another employee when he lost his footing and fell approximately 20 feet over the leading edge. He suffered several fractures to the back and neck bones and a gash on the side of his head.

On January 9, 2015, an employee was walking down the steps at the customer's private residence when he slipped and fell, landing on the sidewalk.  The employee suffered a broken back and five broken ribs. He was hospitalized as result of the accident of January 9, 2015.
On 6/8/15, an employee received an amputation to the left thumb while operating a band saw.

An employee was standing near a burn barrel fire outside the floor truss building and received third degree burns from his thighs to his stomach, second degree burns to his chest and first degree burns on his neck when hot denatured alcohol was added to the fire and spattered onto the employee.
An employee was walking through a metal door when it closed on the employee's right pinky fingertip, amputating it.
An employee was standing on the floor while plumbing a line on a wall when a passing scissor lift struck the employee, breaking the employee's left fibula and left shoulder blade.

On or about 01/30/2015, an employee amputated his finger while cutting lumber with a power tool. The lumber was covered with ice; when the blade struck the lumber and ice, it kicked backed and cut the tip of the employee's left thumb.
On Monday, December 21, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee slipped and fell down the stairs after delivering mail.  The employee was hospitalized with four broken ribs.
Employee was power washing a building and the hose had disconnected causing severe facial lacerations. Employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was removing a lineup clamp from a piece of pipe when his finger was caught between the turtle clamp and a metal ring. The tip of his right middle finger was amputated.
An employee amputated his finger while cutting a piece of wood with a table saw.

An employee was treated at the hospital after falling approximately 5 feet to the concrete floor below while descending nine-foot portable stairs. The employee tore his rotator cuff and received stitches to his left elbow. The employee was attempting to dislodge a chain attached to an overhead crane at the time of the incident. The employee was unloading wire mesh from a delivery truck in the Blue Building garage door area.

An employee was removing cookie packages from the conveyor belt when his finger was caught in the bridge of the conveyor belt and pulled under the belt of the machine. The distal phalanges (pinkie) were amputated. The incident happened on 5/6/16 at 8:45 AM.

The metal shelf inside a wheeled container of mail was loose and fell on an employee's finger while the container was being pulled, causing a serious laceration. The finger may have to be surgically amputated.
An employee was making a delivery when he was pushed to the ground by an unknown assailant, suffering two pelvic fractures.
An employee was cleaning out the floor scrubber using a water hose. He went to turn off the fountain and slipped, injuring his left hip.

An employee was operating a cement mixer that was covered with a tarp due to extreme cold temperatures. The tarp covered the mixer's exhaust and trapped carbon monoxide vapors, which the employee inhaled.
On or about August 26, 2016, an employee was walking on rebar when the tie wire broke causing the rebar to come up and cause a puncture wound.
Employee fell from the roof while descending a ladder and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking between a patient's stretcher and computer when she tripped on a rolling stool. She fell and fractured her right arm.
The employee was holding a microphone when a football player collided with her. The employee suffered a broken leg.
An employee was repairing equipment. The equipment was not locked out. The reciprocator arm contacted the employee's right arm resulting in a laceration that severed an artery requiring surgery.

On February 24, 2016, at approximately 4:00 p.m., an employee placed a 64-inch post in the saw. The blade hit a knot in the post and pulled the employee's hand into the blade, amputating the left thumb tip.
An employee's hand was caught in a tray pack machine, resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet from a scaffold. He knocked out some teeth and possibly broke his arm.
An employee was stacking weights when a weight fell on and partially amputated his finger.

An employee was using a 6-foot pry bar to move a bent piece of pipe (4.5" .290 wall) that would not roll down the starwheel discharge ramp. As the employee pulled on the pry bar, which was partially inserted into the pipe, the bar slipped and caught the his right ring fingertip and part of his pinky finger between the pry bar and a post supporting a pass-line chain. He was hospitalized.
Sparks from a grinding operation made contact with an open container of flammable liquid, causing it to ignite. Two employees were burned as they attempted to move the container outside.
An employee suffered a ruptured ear drum and a fractured cheekbone after being struck in the head by a below-the-hook lifting device while changing a forklift battery on February 10, 2015.

During moving activities, three employees unsecured and then lost control of the end piece of a gantry crane. The piece rolled out from under them and struck the injured employee's foot, amputating his right big toe and requiring hospitalization.
On December 22, 2016, at 11:30 am, an employee was bagging product and suffered a left index finger amputation.
On 3/31/16, an employee walking in the hall stepped in a water puddle and slipped and fell to the floor, fracturing her left arm.

An employee was helping to install an 8-inch water line, working approximately 4-feet, 8-inches deep, when the dirt underneath the concrete of the street gave way and hit the employee on the right-side hip/pelvis.

Two employees installed a new mud press belt. The employees were in the process of installing the mud wash box. In the process of removing the bolts from the bearing pillow block on the redirect roller, the remaining tension on the new belt and residual in air bag belt tensioning system pulled and twisted the redirect roller forward into the water flush line union. The force and motion of the redirect roller bearing pillow block pushed the employee's hand between the adjustable wrench (crescent wrench) and the water flush line union. The employee immediately removed his hand from the leather glove and noticed the pinky finger was smashed and suffered a partial skin amputation.

On September 27, 2016, an employee was unhooking the safety chain from the hauling trailer when the truck driver started to pull ahead. The employee's right-hand middle finger was pinched and amputated between the safety chain and the trailer's hitch.
An employee was bitten by a copperhead snake while moving a dolly to a storage room. The employee was treated with antivenom and admitted to the hospital.
An employee was struck in the temple by a hydraulic hose fracturing the eye socket and skull.
An employee was removing the existing membrane from the roof deck when he fell approximately 25 feet through metal decking to the ground below. He suffered a broken arm and broken facial bones.

An employee was painting on the roof of a building and fell approximately 20 feet through a skylight.  The employee was hospitalized.  The incident happened at approximately 1:45pm on October 8, 2015.

An employee working in the parts department was dragging boxes from the outside to the inside of a warehouse when the boxes got caught on a stack of tires.  The employee lost his balance and fell to the ground.  The employee was transported by ambulance to Baylor Hospital Dallas where he was hospitalized with a hip fracture.
An employee was lifting and emptying trash cans when he experienced stomach pains. He was hospitalized with a hernia and required surgery.
An employee was working at the drive through window collapsed due to heat stroke.
An employee was struck by a forklift while working on the loading dock.  The employee was hospitalized for a right ankle fracture.
An employee was on a roof loading a blue tarp onto a forklift when he fell approximately 15 feet to the ground.
While moving supplies upstairs, an employee fell approximately 9 feet.
An employee was clearing a jam on the tack machine and fractured the right thumb.
A steel gate came off its tracks and fell on an employee. The employee suffered a broken left hip, a cut to the back of the head, and a broken jaw.
An employee was using a carpet grabber to pull up the carpet. The machine slipped/kicked out, which caused employee to fall and fracture his right hip.
An employee slipped and fell on the left side of his back while shoveling snow from the loading dock. He fractured three ribs and suffered bruising.
An employee was troubleshooting a malfunction on the walking floor near the baler and amputated the left thumb when the door closed on his hand.
An employee was cleaning out a machine during the brick-making process when the machine's blade amputated his right thumb.
An employee was working from a mid-stand ladder that was hooked to a cable when the cable broke. The employee fell to the ground and suffered lower vertebrae fractures, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was hanging a horsehead on a pump jack. As the employee swung the horsehead into place and reached up to grab the weight, the weight was released. The employee's finger got caught between metal, and the fingertip was surgically amputated.

An employee was running products and laying parts down for sensors to operate. The employee stood a part up, which bypassed the sensors. Four parts were in the catcher and one was being crushed in the machine. The employee attempted to pull the part out and his ring finger was amputated by the stamping machine's lock seamer.
An employee suffered burns to 45% of his lower body when a plastic bottle of diesel fuel blew up near him while he was trimming logs.
On May 27, 2015 at 14:30 the employee amputated four fingers (all except the thumb) on his right hand while operating a press brake machine.
A guard was hit in the head, neck and chest by a combative patient in the emergency room.
An employee driving a cart (similar to a golf cart) struck an oncoming forklift, causing severe internal injuries.
An employee amputated the right index fingertip while operating a hydraulic press brake.
An employee fell down a flight of stairs while showing an apartment. She sustained ankle injuries that required surgery.
On May 12, 2015, an employee's lower left leg was burned by a space heater while sitting at their desk.
An employee was picking up a bag of laundry weighting 10-15 lbs. and strained her back. She was hospitalized.

Site Safety Manager reported that this VPP Facility had an incident in which an employee was cut while adjusting a belt with an Allen wrench. This resulted in surgery and amputation of the employee's right index finger up to the first knuckle.

On 8/8/16, an employee was cutting metal on a shear. The employee's gloved hands became caught in the metal hold-down pads that push the metal into the shear. The employee suffered a right-hand middle fingertip amputation, as well as left-hand middle and index fingertip amputations.
On September 13, 2016, an employee was placing concrete when he became ill due to dehydration and lost consciousness. He was hospitalized.
An employee's index finger was cut by a conveyor belt. The belt was unguarded at the time.
An employee was checking a vehicle and had his left hand in the motor belt when a coworker started the vehicle. The motor belt then moved and amputated his left middle, ring, and pinky fingers.

An employee was putting duct tape on a press machine. The operator jogged the machine, and the employee's finger got caught in the perforation wheel. The employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.
The passenger door of an automobile shut on an employee's left hand, amputating his ring finger at the nailbed.
A roofing employee slipped and fell from a 12 foot ladder resulting in internal injuries and possible fractures.

An employee operating a Wrangler (front-end loader) to unload the pebble line backed into an open area. The rollover cage struck a doorway where a door swings up into the dry fertilizer area. The door came off of the latches that were holding it up and struck him in the back.

Employee had just finished unloading a truck into the paving machine. He had his hand on the gate of the truck. The truck operator latched the gate from the cab, crushing the pinky finger on the employee's right hand.
An employee fell from a ladder and injured their back.

On March 6, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee climbed up a ladder to inspect a roof. The ladder slid sideways, and the employee fell 10 feet to the driveway. The employee sustained a fractured left elbow and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating the panel roll forming machine and was measuring a piece of panel that had to be cut. As he was running the piece through the machine, his left ring and middle fingers were amputated.

An employee was bending over to pick up a 10-foot stick of 3/4" electrical metallic tube (EMT) when he felt and heard a pop in his back and experienced a sharp lower back pain. He was hospitalized with a compressed back disc.
An employee was cutting pieces of wood using a table saw. A piece of wood slipped and his right hand contacted the blade, cutting three fingers.

Employee was returning from break to the Quality Control Room and was walking around the corner. She caught her toe on a protruding corner of a baseplate of the guardrail and fell. The employee fractured her hip.
Employee was cleaning paper underneath the Core Machine while it was running. The belt drive snagged her arm and broke it.
An employee was cutting wood using a table saw when a part of his thumb was amputated.

An employee was moving a pasta cooker when a wheel on the pasta cooker hit a floor drain grate resulting in hot water spilling onto the employee.  The employee suffered second degree burns to the head, neck, back and face and was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a display rack. When he stepped back, he tripped and fell fracturing his left hand.

An employee notified the press operator that he was ready for the press table to be lowered. As the table was lowering, the employee leaned over on the table; his first, right-hand finger got caught between the die strap and the table.
Employee cut the second finger on his right hand while operating a panel saw and pushing through some balsam wood components.
An employee was on an 8-foot ladder hanging wire supports when he lost his balance, fell off the ladder, and struck the concrete floor, fracturing his elbow, hip, and vertebrae.
An employee filled a mop bucket with hot water. When the employee moved the bucket, hot water splashed onto and burned his right shin, ankle, and foot.

An employee was cutting frozen meat with a band saw. The meat moved and the employee's fingers contacted the saw blade resulting in a partial amputation of two fingers on the right hand. The saw was not guarded at the time.

On October 20, 2015, an employee's left index finger got caught in a flywheel while setting up a mechanical power press. Her finger was amputated to the first knuckle. The flywheel was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee fell and struck a scaffold while climbing a ladder to the roof, suffering a fractured cheek bone.
On October 22, 2015, an employee tripped and fell over the plug and cord to a Xenex robot after plugging it in. The employee fractured a hip and elbow.

The employee was operating a stand-up forklift and wanted to stop it. Before it came to a complete stop he dismounted the forklift, then realized it was not stopping and attempted to jump back onto the forklift.  His foot and ankle got jammed between the forklift and a metal pole resulting in foot and ankle fractures.
An employee was using their right leg as a work rest while cutting tubing with a razor blade. The employee sustained a severe right leg laceration and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was walking in the front door, tripped, and fell resulting in injury to her left side and elbow.
An employee amputated a hand while operating a cement delivery vehicle.
An employee was lifting a tire onto another tire when he felt pain in his neck. He was hospitalized with a neck injury.
An employee was called to provide assistance with controlling a patient. During the struggle, the employee suffered a heart attack.

An employee slammed his left ring finger while attempting to close his truck's double doors.  An approximately 1/4" piece of his left fingertip was amputated (flesh only, not bone), and he sustained a minor fracture in the same fingertip.
An employee injured an arm while cleaning a machine.
An employee was bending over to open a box with a knife and his back popped resulting in a herniated disc.

An employee and a coworker were trying to introduce air into a condensate line to empty it. When the employee went to remove a plug from a valve on the condensate line, hot water splashed onto his left shoulder, arm, and back, causing second degree burns.

On Monday April 6, 2015, an employee sustained a right index fingertip amputation after her finger got caught between inspection racks.  The employee was operating a machine that is actuated by a foot pedal.
