An employee was injured by a customer's automobile when the car jumped the curb and pinned the employee against the Red Box movie kiosk on the convenience store's sidewalk.
An employee was egressing from a 12 foot A-frame ladder and slipped and fell. The employee suffered a concussion, a thoracic sprain and minor lacerations.

An employee was cleaning out the grinder for a spray dryer when a finger got caught in a pinch point between the fan blade and the opening to the fan blade housing. The employee sustained a left ring finger amputation.
An employee's right index finger was amputated in the pinch point on a drive tire while the employee was performing maintenance on a lift truck.
On July 31, 2015, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee was hospitalized after experiencing dizziness, cramping, nausea, and severe sweating due to possible dehydration.
An employee was cleaning a portable packing machine when it was inadvertently powered-on, resulting in the amputation of four fingertips on the left hand.
An employee's left hand was caught in the outfeed roller while straightening lumber on the lumber deck with a metal pole.
An employee was riding a horse at the worksite and fell resulting in a broken tibia.
An employee sustained a right ring finger amputation.

An employee was hooking up a strap to connect a small excavator to a concrete saw. While a coworker was picking up the saw with the excavator, he attempted to readjust the straps at the moment the two pieces of equipment came together. His left ring finger was caught and amputated from the nail between the excavator bucket and the concrete saw.
An employee was moving a load of pipes when it fell and broke his left index finger. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the right pinky finger and injury to the right ring finger while attempting to clear a paper jam in a machine.
An employee was walking in the office when her foot was caught on the edge of a floor mat. She tripped and broke her right femur.
An employee suffered back and pelvic fractures when a piece of machinery fell on him.
An employee was hospitalized after coming in contact with a racking system while operating a powered industrial vehicle.
An employee was cutting a piece of metal on an ironworker machine when his right index finger contacted the underside of the metal piece, amputating the skin from the bottom of his finger.
An employee was restarting a machine while standing in front of the vent of the RTO and was burned on his upper extremities.

An employee was on the roof unloading the asphalt shingle bundles from the conveyor. He stepped backwards and fell from the second-story section of the roof to the one-story section of the roof fracturing his shoulder and ribs.
An employee fainted during farming operations possibly due to heat stress and was hospitalized.
An employee caught her left hand in the fiber picker machine. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was exposed to work place violence.
An employee using a 4-foot A-frame ladder fell while reaching to dust. She broke her arm, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee sustained left chest trauma when a sand blaster he was operating shot steel pellets under his left armpit.

An employee was working in Department 24 at the "B" line boxing station.  Welding rods were moving on the indexing cooling conveyor that carries them from the furnace.  The employee was assisting the movement of the rods along the conveyor with his left hand when his right thumb was caught in a pinch point in the conveyor resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was emptying a hopper on a forklift when his hand slipped from the release lever. His finger got caught between the forks and the hopper. His left index fingertip was pinched off, requiring surgical removal to the first knuckle.

An employee was lowering a 300-pound refrigeration compressor from the tailgate of a pickup truck to a steel dolly with a helper when the employee's finger was caught between the compressor and the dolly. The employee suffered a bone fracture of the right pinky finger and an open wound on the top and bottom of the pinky.

Employee was changing out a hydraulic ram on a rig when a swivel on the come-along broke and pinched the employee's thumb. First aid was performed at the local hospital and then the employee was transported to Denver. An artery in the thumb was damaged and the right hand thumb was later amputated at the first joint.
On July 8, 2016, at 1:30 p.m., an employee was operating a table saw to rip pieces of wood when the employee's left thumb contacted the blade and was amputated.
An employee slipped and fell on a wet floor in the kitchen area of a fast food restaurant, hitting his head and dislocating his left knee.
An employee was hospitalized with a broken right hip after exiting elevator bank 3 on the first floor of the J. Edgar Hoover Building.
On March 23, 2015, an employee pinched their finger between a side section and a support, suffering an avulsion. The employee went to the hospital and received stitches to their left ring finger.
An employee fell backwards (5 to 6 feet) off a ladder on 8/14/15, breaking the tibia to the right knee.
An employee was trying to readjust a trailer hitch when the employee's finger was caught and partially amputated between the trailer hitch and the ball of the truck.

An employee was changing a tire in one of the presses when he reported that he had a light headache. His condition worsened to include nausea and blurry vision. The employee was taken to company healthcare provider and then to the emergency room. His illness was a result of dehydration.
An employee was putting a stone slab on the transport cart when the crane clamp became caught on the top of the cart and kicked out the slab, which hit and fractured the employee's leg.

On April 16, 2016, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee was playing a softball game as part of a leadership retreat. While attempting to catch a fly ball, the employee ran into a foul pole and struck it head on. The employee was hospitalized with a facial injury.
An employee's finger and thumb were fractured when he put his hand into the paper face bead machine.
An employee suffered an amputation of his right hand (to mid-forearm area) when he crawled under the soil sort conveyor to retrieve a cell phone.
An employee, who was wearing a life vest, fell from the deck of a barge into the waters of the Mississippi River and lost consciousness.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee missed a rung while climbing a fixed ladder and fell 15 feet. He suffered multiple right leg fractures and shattered his right ankle.

An employee walked close to an elevator opening. He rested his hand on the barricade (chain) that didn't hold his weight. He fell twelve feet resulting in a non-displaced fracture of his lower back and a possible fracture of his right foot.
An employee was hospitalized after hitting his head on the edge of an escalator pit and possibly contacting live electrical parts.
An employee tripped and fell in the school parking lot while walking backwards resulting in a broken hip.
A USPS employee was struck by a car while crossing a street on foot. The employee suffered a fractured wrist and knee.
An employee was working in the middle foundry molding area when he stepped in a hole and broke his left ankle.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a corrugated plastic pipe when the saw kicked back, cutting the employee's face and right armpit.

On December 16, 2016, an employee was inspecting a ball valve for correct assembly and testing it using air. When the air was applied, it caused the valve to close on and amputate his left index fingertip.
Employee was wrapping a tarp onto an articulating boom bucket mounted and stored on a service truck. Employee fell approximately 6 feet to the ground and suffered fractured ribs.

An employee was servicing a forklift at a customer's site when the employee's hand was struck by the forklift motor cooling fan blade. The employee suffered hand and wrist lacerations and a broken middle finger. The forklift was not locked out at the time of the incident.
While stepping out of a construction vehicle, an employee suffered a foot laceration and two fractured toes.

An employee was struck in the head while removing a concrete form used to manufacture burial vaults. The form was being removed when a bar swung and hit the employee in the head, knocking him to the ground. The employee was standing on the floor at the time and was wearing a protective helmet. He was hospitalized after being knocked unconscious with a cut to the head.

An employee was a passenger in an open cab, flatbed utility cart (golf cart type) that was transporting a load. She was ejected when the driver made a sharp turn, striking her head on the pavement. She suffered a fractured skull and was hospitalized.
An employee was helping a forklift operator unload blanks onto a metal pallet when his hand entered a pinch point, amputating his middle fingertip.

An employee was sprayed with hot product causing third degree burns to his neck, upper torso and legs. He also sustained a dislocated right shoulder in the incident.  The employee was admitted to the burn unit for treatment.
An employee slipped and fell on ice after washing off oil and grease from a pump the employee had recently pulled out of a process pit. The employee sustained a fractured ankle that required surgery.
An employee was loading a semi trailer when his right middle finger was caught on an E-track inside the trailer, amputating his distal phalanx.

An employee was operating a pallet jack and was driving through the curtains to the freezer. As he used his right hand to open the curtain, his left hand was caught between the pallet jack handle and a post, smashing his left thumb. He was hospitalized and required thumb surgery.
An employee was operating the blow molding machine and bypassed the guard to clear a jam and amputated a finger.

An employee was underneath the trailer tongue frame of a portable abrasive blasting unit, attempting to straighten a bent pin in the jack stand with a crowbar. As he pried on the pin with the crow bar, the jack fell, pinning him beneath the trailer tongue frame. He punctured his lung and broke five ribs, his sternum, and his left shoulder blade, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a Segway and injured her right leg while preparing to leave the office to start her work day.
An employee was working at a sub-station when he experienced cramps and fatigue from hot weather conditions. He was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was assisting in the positioning of a table that is used to guide steel forms. A crane and signalman were used to pick up and position the table. The employee went under the table to ensure that it was going to set level and the table was set down on the employee's left middle finger. Later that day the tip of the finger was removed by a doctor.

An employee was using a driveline tube over a wrench to gain leverage to remove a tie rod end. The driveline tube over the wrench slipped off and hit the employee in the head. The employee sustained a 3" cut requiring stitches.
An employee slipped and fell hitting his head, resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was venting a container with water and condensation at an oil site when a vacuum truck at the site caught fire in the engine compartment or cab. While retrieving a fire extinguisher from the truck, the employee received first and second degree burns and required overnight hospitalization.
On April 17, 2015, at approximately 7:00 PM, an employee smashed his hand while changing the knock out machine hammers, which resulted in the amputation of his left middle finger.
An employee was outside salting and sanding the property, slipped on ice and fell breaking his pelvis.

An employee was overseeing a natural gas line repair contractor at the intersection of West Glen 7 North Monroe, Ridgewood, New Jersey. The employee experienced dizziness and light-headedness and was hospitalized for treatment of dehydration and low sodium.
On or about January 9, 2015 an employee went to warm up their vehicle and while returning into the facility, slipped on ice.

On September 21, 2016, around 3:30 a.m., an employee was changing out a 1,400-pound seal-in roller with a hoist when the roller rolled on to his left thumb tip. The thumb tip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee's arm got caught in the rotating parts of a machine during machine operations.
An employee was using a hand-held blower to clean when his thumb was partially amputated by the impeller on the bottom of the equipment. The impeller was unguarded at the time.

On or about 9/15/15 at approximately 2:30 pm, an employee was removing a rear tire of a dual wide trailer when one of the tires blew and the employee's left hand was knocked into the wheel well causing a fracture. The employees was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was setting a fan unit into position on a foundation plate when his fingertip became pinched between the two surfaces resulting in a fingertip amputation without bone loss.
While working from the roof of a house, an employee fell approximately 20 feet from the roof eave to the ground. The employee suffered a fractured right heel and was hospitalized.
An employee was changing a breaker in live panel. The panel shorted out and an arc flash burned the employee's hands.
An employee was climbing down the rail car ladder and fell sustaining head and back trauma.
An employee slipped and fell 2.5 feet off the semi-truck. The employee was hospitalized for broken ribs and a punctured lung.

An employee walked up the plywood decking on a new construction residential home to install an anchor point. The employee then slipped on roof sheathing and fell to the ground, suffering a fractured right leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was loading product from a cherry picker onto a rack when the lift malfunctioned and the platform fell to the ground. The employee fell with the platform and fractured an ankle.
An employee suffered the amputation of four right hand fingers after their hand was caught in the smooth mill.
A maintenance employee was troubleshooting batteries for a sprinkler diesel pump when the battery exploded acid into the employee's face. The employee sustained burns.
An employee climbed up on to the roof to power wash a mounted air conditioning unit when he fell 7 or 8 feet and was hospitalized. No fall protection was worn at the time.
An employee was digging a ditch to lay conduit when he began to feel ill. He was taken to the emergency room and was diagnosed with heat illness.
An employee was straightening wood near a saw when he was struck by a wood board, fracturing his left femur and requiring hospitalization.

On 8/4/15, an employee riding the back of a waste collection truck operated the sweep blade control. The truck was in motion at the time. His foot got stuck between the sweep blade and the truck. Three left-foot toes were amputated.
An employee's left pinky finger was partially amputated.
An employee was clearing a jam on an assembly machine when the machine cycled and amputated the employee's right middle fingertip.

An employee in the hot food processing area had an aerosol can of cooking spray (an industrial size can of "Pam") that was placed next to a burner.  Approximately 1 to 1/2 hours later, the aerosol can exploded and ignited into a fire ball. The employee received first and second degree burns on the hands and neck, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was wrapping meat using an automatic wrapper and putting the meat into a tall/mini shelving rack in the refrigerated market/area. The employee then transported the meat to the sale floor area.  On her way back to the market area, the employee slipped and fell to the floor.  The floor was wet from condensation.

An employee was removing broken pieces of concrete from a recently demolished road deck. He was flipping the lagging boards when he slipped and fell through the boards 28 feet to the ground below. He suffered a broken pelvis, ruptured spleen, and broken ribs and was hospitalized.
An employee leaving work at the end of a shift, was walking down a set of interior stairs, tripped and fell breaking the lower left leg.
A nail from a pneumatic nail gun struck an employee's eye.  The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.  The incident occurred on 7/15/2015 at approximately 10:30 am.
An employee operating a high-reach lift truck became pinned between the lift and a racking system, suffering a fractured rib.
An employee was constructing a display for the fair. While using a circular saw, he amputated the tip of his second left-hand finger.
Employee slipped on ice and broke the left leg.

On 12/1/16, an employee was standing next to a 40-liter glass carboy that was being tested for integrity when the carboy shattered. Flying glass hit the employee, who suffered minor cuts on the leg and serious lacerations to the hand, requiring surgery.

An employee was using a lashing rod to bend a piece of metal when it sprung backward, struck him in the jaw and fractured it. He fell to the ground where he also sustained lacerations to the head, eye, and neck after contacting the metal deck.

Employee was in a boom lift elevated approximately 7 ft. high and was maneuvering the lift backwards when he became pinned between an aircraft wing and the lift.  The employee was hospitalized with trauma to his abdomen that required surgery.
An employee was working on a water trailer pump that was under pressure. A part of the pump released and struck the employee in the lower leg causing a fracture.

An employee was scooping ice pellets from the APC machine while it was running and the press came down and caught his right ring finger amputating it above the 1st joint near the base of the fingernail bed.
While reloading the stock on the plastic film winding machine, an employee's hands were caught in the in-going nip point, requiring hospitalization.

While cleaning a buildup of dough from the conveyor roller, an employee's left hand was caught between the roller and the conveyor belt. The employee sustained left-hand injuries and a left forearm laceration that required surgery.
An employee was running underground conduit and began cramping. The employee was hospitalized for possible heat-related illness.
An employee was performing maintenance on a machine when a finger contacted the belt and pulley resulting in a fingertip amputation with bone loss.
An employee was working on a metal plate when the machine was activated and caught the employee's right hand, requiring hospitalization.

On Monday, March 2, 2015, at approximately 7:00 pm, an employee was operating a blow molding machine. The employee reached past the guard, and the machine cycled and smashed four fingers on the employee's right hand. The employee sustained an amputation of the fourth digit, partial amputation of the fifth digit, and a full thickness burn to the right middle finger. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
While performing pump maintenance an employee's right hand was caught in the pump area and crushed.

The employee was kneeling down in front of a control cabinet for approximately 20 minutes installing and rewiring a relay device. The employee could not get up. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured femur at the hip joint.
An employee was tending to a patient lying in a bed when the employee's body twisted. The employee then tripped and fell to the floor, breaking the left hip.
An employee was hospitalized after his arm got caught between two rollers in the slitter machine.

An employee loosened a four inch compressor line that was still charged. The line blew out and knocked employee backwards. The employee was hospitalized with a head laceration requiring stitches and a possible concussion.
An employee carrying a ladder slipped and fell. The employee sustained injuries to his head.
An employee was removing yarn from a machine roller when his finger got caught and partially amputated by yarn. The machine was turned off with the power button on the control station at the time.

An employee was using a portable hydraulic tool to separate flanges on a hollow flight auger. During separation, the tool slipped off the shim, causing the shim to hit the employee in the face. The employee suffered fractured facial bones.
An employee in the carpenter shop was ripping 2x4's into to smaller slats when they made contact with the blade, resulting in the amputation of finger(s).
An employee tripped and broke her leg while walking.
On 5/2/16, an employee suffered the amputation of the end of his right middle finger while working on a molding machine.
An employee suffered a heart attack after shoveling snow and salting the sidewalk and was hospitalized.
An employee was coming down from the roof in a caged ladder when he lost his footing and fell to the ground below.
Employee was delivering mail on foot when he was hit by a vehicle while crossing the street.
An employee's fingers contacted the blade of a band saw, sustaining a laceration and requiring a possible surgical amputation. The saw was unguarded at the time.

An employee was leaning over the CNC machine to see how the part was cutting. The door to the machine was open and the spin spindles were spraying oil onto the floor. The employee slipped on the oil and his knee hit the rail of the door. When he put his hands in front of his face, the pick-off tool on the CNC machine lacerated the right middle finger.
An employee was testing a valve with a finger when the valve closed, amputating the left index finger to the first knuckle.
An employee was working from a scissor lift at a jobsite and fell out of the scissor lift onto the concrete below fracturing ribs, a leg and vertebrae.
On or about May 28, 2015, an employee's left index finger was amputated when it was caught in the cutter bar while setting up a pneumatic cutter.
An employee was putting together steel with another connector when his right thumb was caught between the vertical column and the horizontal beam. He broke his right thumb and was hospitalized.
An employee's finger was amputated in the point of operation of a brake press.
An employee was climbing over a railing and fell breaking his femur.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet through the roof to the ground while performing roofing work.

An employee was clearing the bottom of an underpinning excavation when the ceiling collapsed and he became pinned under a large granite rock from the old foundation they were underpinning.  The employee was hospitalized and received surgery to repair broken bones in his back.

An employee was operating a reach forklift truck when he struck a steel column while turning. His left foot was pinned between the reach truck and the steel column, and he fractured his lower left leg.
A employee was hospitalized for heat stress.
An employee was operating a chop saw to cut wood studs when the chop saw activated via the foot pedal, amputating the employee's left mid-forearm.
An employee tripped and fell to the ground while walking to the building, breaking her right arm.

An employee was helping to move aluminum tubing and frame-filled crates. The employee was signaling the operator when his left pinky got caught between the board and the crate. His left pinky fingertip was amputated, removing mostly skin and the fingernail.

An employee was cutting a tree stump.  A strong gust of wind caused a large branch from a nearby tree to break off and fly toward the injured employee.  The branch struck the employee in the back of the head causing a severe head contusion.

A housekeeping employee received an eye injury while mopping the floors.  The employee had placed the mop in the bucket and turned away.  While the employee was turning back around to get the mop, the handle slipped from its original position and struck the employee in the eye.

On March 18, 2015, at approximately 12:05 p.m., an employee fell from the tracks of the track truck while unloading straw bales from the truck bed. He fell 2 to 3 feet and struck his head on the ground, resulting in hospitalization for chest-wall bruising and head injury.
An employee fell while walking to the restroom, suffering lower leg/knee pain and a hip fracture.

An employee was using a pneumatic grease gun to grease a trailer chassis when the gun began to malfunction. As he lifted the unit attached to the grease drum to troubleshoot the problem, his left hand slid. The moving piston then amputated his pinky fingertip between the first and second knuckle.

An employee was adjusting the blade on a horizontal coating machine when the spring popped off. The employee and a coworker tried to fix the machine by holding up the blade and reattaching the spring. The spring then partially amputated the employee's finger in a pinch point.
An employee was injured after being struck by a forklift that was backing up.

The employee returned to the cement plant and was washing the back of the mixer truck with the cement hose.  The fold down ladder part fell down as the employee was rolling up the water hose striking the employee on the left hand and fracturing the left index finger.  The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted.
An employee sustained injuries to his left index finger while rigging down.
An employee fell to the ground while walking down the stairs from a loading dock to a snowy/icy parking area, suffering a broken back (in two areas) and a neck injury.

An employee was moving a glass rack with a pallet jack. While lowering the rack of glass, the employee had the handle of the pallet jack in a vertical position. When the rack was lowered, the employee's thumb was caught and partially amputated between the rack and the handle of the pallet jack.

An employee was walking in a designated walkway though the warehouse on her way to the break room. A forklift driver drove a forklift into the walkway and did not see the employee. She was struck by the forklift blade on her ankle, and then fell to the concrete floor. She suffered lacerations and contusions to her ankle and thigh, as well as an unspecified head injury. She was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was offloading a unit train when a rail genie ran over his left elbow, causing a laceration and muscle tear to his left bicep.
An employee driving an ATV flipped and broke a leg.
An employee ingested Tilex cleaning solution.
While an employee was grinding metal materials with a side grinder, the wheel of the grinder kicked back and lacerated his left arm.
An employee hit a rack with a forklift during training, breaking his leg.

After an employee the shooter from another company shot and killed a colleague, he shot an employee as he tried to make his escape.  A second employee attempted to subdue the shooter and was assaulted.
An employee was pulling a cart full of patio door frames and the cart turned over striking the employee.  The employee was hospitalized for a fractured left hip.
On or about October 27, 2015, an employee was standing at his work station resting a foot on the bottom shelf of a rolling cart. The cart moved and the employee fell breaking the right hip.

An employee was attempting to move a pumping system out of a paint booth. A coworker assisted by lifting the pumping system with a forklift while the injured employee was observing/spotting. The pumping system slid off the forklift forks and pinned the employee between it and the wall of the paint booth. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right leg, broken right forearm, and a cracked sternum.
An employee was delivering mail to a resident's home when a dog attacked him, causing an amputation injury to his left index finger.

An employee was standing in a room next to the shaft alley of a boat on a dry dock where two employees were heating a steel coupling (shaft that holds the prop on the boat) using two rose buds with forced air and exhaust ventilation established. They were heating the coupling so it would expand and pop loose. After his shift ended, the employee called and reported difficulty breathing. He was admitted to the hospital where he was diagnosed with possible chemical pneumonia.
An employee's foot got caught on a pallet in the lumber department; he fell and injured his left hip.

On October 28, 2016, at 6:30 a.m., an employee was removing a piece of stuck steel from the shear. The machine was activated and a 1 inch diameter piece of angle steel was propelled into the employee's left forearm. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was stripping concrete form work. The employee was tied off to the concrete form work when it moved and fell to the ground. The employee was pulled by the falling form work and hit the ground. The employee fell 14 feet and was hospitalized with head and back injuries.
An employee was using a glue gun and felt an electric shock. The employee fell on the floor hitting his head. He was hospitalized due to possible head concussion.
An employee securing a piece of trim from a ladder in an automated car wash missed a rung and fell off the ladder resulting in admission to a hospital for a broken hip and surgery.

An employee was showing a coworker a problem with a handgun that would not eject its cartridge. The employee was able to pull the slide back when the cartridge went off. A portion of the bullet went through the employee's hand. A bullet fragment also struck a second employee in the left ankle and heel.

On Wednesday, February 3, 2016, an employee was getting into the passenger's side of an aerial lift truck when he slipped on ice. He attempted to grab the side of the truck, and a ring on his left ring finger got caught on a bolt on the side of the aerial lift. His left ring finger was amputated.

An employee was performing maintenance on a chain drive, lubricating it with a rag. The rag became entangled in the chain, drawing the employee's hand into the sprocket. The employee injured four right-hand fingers and was hospitalized.

An employee was using a vacuum pressure hose to clean out water from a sump hole and the suction of the vacuum hose caught the employee's left arm. The resulting arm injury needed a surgical pressure release.
The employee was removing panels from a roof during building demolition. He stepped on a weak section of the fiberglass roof and fell through breaking his femur.
An employee was walking to his work trailer when he was struck by a work truck, breaking his left tibia and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working on the pipeline. A pipe came off of the trough and coiled on the floor. The employee tried to straighten out the coiled pipe. His feet became tangled in the pipe, causing him to fall to the floor. He fractured his hip.

An employee had his hand on a screen printer while another employee was performing a calibration. The machine went to park and caught the employee's left thumb. The left thumb was amputated from the nail forward.
On or about September 13, 2016, an employee's right hand became caught in a tag line that was attached to the butt of a 40-foot pole. The employee suffered a broken right arm and femur.
An employee stepped on a sample hole causing him to fall and injure the left ankle. The injury required surgery.
On or about January 18, 2016, an employee was walking from a control room on a concrete walkway and slipped on ice falling down four steps and breaking an ankle. The employee was hospitalized.
A reversing forklift struck an employee and ran over his right foot.
An employee was cleaning a paper machine former with a wash-down hose when his ring and middle fingers were amputated.

Employee dislocated his right ankle while stepping off of a rail car. Employee was sent to the hospital where they admitted him because his ankle kept popping out of place after they set it. They had to perform surgery on the ankle.
An employee fell at a loading dock and suffered a broken leg.

At approximately 7:30 a.m., an employee was working around a flower bed, pulling weeds at a recreation center, when he was bitten by a snake (copperhead) on his right hand/ring finger. He was hospitalized overnight due to severe swelling.
While trying to stop three patients from escaping an area of the facility, an employee was kicked in the leg by one of the patients. The employee suffered a broken tibia.

An employee was adjusting a pedestal fan when his fingers went through a gap on the underside of the fan and contacted the running blades. His left middle finger was amputated and his index finger was cut.
On 9/4/15, an employee was injured when she tripped over another employee's foot and fell. She broke her hip and required surgery.
An employee was inspecting the water pipe from a fire hydrant for leaks. The pipe burst and hot water burned the employee's stomach and legs.
An employee was walking up the ramp of an equipment trailer when the grating on the ramp suddenly gave way and his foot fell through the ramp grating fracturing the lower right leg.
An employee was helping to cut a hole into a roof to install a new air conditioning unit when he fell through the hole about 10 to 12 feet.
An employee was polishing a piece of a metal rod in a lathe. The employee's right hand got pulled into the lathe, amputating the ends of the two middle fingers.

An employee was lifting a power assembly out of a locomotive when the assembly slipped. He reached for it, and his left hand got caught between the assembly and the locomotive engine. The top of his left pinky finger was amputated.
An employee was moving boxes on the conveyor when his right-hand middle finger came into contact with the belt, amputating his fingertip.

On 5/6/2016, an employee broke his left femur while installing a tire on an 18-wheeler. He used a torque wrench to tighten the lug nuts. The torque wrench slipped and the employee lost his balance, fell forward, and broke his left femur. The employee was hospitalized as a result of the injury.

An employee was spotting moving equipment when he noticed a piece of iron that was sticking out from the equipment. He reached up to swivel the iron when his finger got caught between the iron and the parked equipment.
An employee was helping to unload crane when equipment came down on his right foot, breaking it.

An employee was operating a stack truck to move a pallet of materials from the racks. When he backed up the truck to reposition it, his arm became jammed between the truck and a pallet of materials on the racking behind him. His arm broke.
An employee fell from an unknown height to the ground, breaking both ankles.
An employee was injured while cleaning a surgical table when he stood up and struck his head. He was hospitalized.
An employee was standing in the hallway. A resident walking alone (non-assist resident) in the hallway lost her balance and fell into the employee, knocking her down. She fell and broke her pelvis.
An employee working on a ship was installing a valve into a pipeline.  The employee slipped and a toe was caught between the valve and pipeline.
An employee was loading baggage into a tractor's passenger side when the tractor operator began to drive and ran over the employee's foot, injuring her right ankle.
On March 4, 2015, an employee was hospitalized due to an electrical shock.

An employee was hooking up airlines to his truck from the trailer. He was 3 feet off the ground when he fell from the truck to the concrete parking lot. He suffered rib injuries and a concussion, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working in the mold department with the mixing machine. While the employee was pushing the mixing machine, his hand slipped into the mixer. His left index, middle, and ring fingers were amputated.

On Sunday, October 9, 2016, at approximately 6:15 AM, an employee was exiting her vehicle in the parking lot when she lost her balance and fell to the ground. She was hospitalized for a fractured hip.
An employee was inflating an inboard tire mounted on the rear of an RV when the tire exploded. The employee lost consciousness and suffered right shoulder pain, hearing loss, and blurred vision.
An employee operating heavy equipment was backing a unit into the trailer when the employee lost control of the unit. The employee was hospitalized with head, mouth, and nose injuries.
An employee fell approximately 16 feet from the stairway of a drilling rig onto the ground below. The employee suffered multiple fractures and a collapsed lung.

An employee was applying a dry-film lubricant with a spray can and nozzle extender onto a conveyor to eliminate/reduce package slippage. The employee's coat got caught in the rollers and pulled his right hand/forearm in. He sustained ligament and tendon damage.

While pouring concrete, an employee felt dizzy and lost his balance, possibly due to heat exposure, and fell backwards striking his head on an unknown object. He was hospitalized and required stitches.
An employee's index finger was lacerated and partially amputated while adjusting a timing belt on a bagging machine. The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee was replacing a suspension spring on a rig. He had to insert a pin in the spring as he let out the jack. His fingertip got caught.
An employee was trying to center a vehicle on a lift ramp by moving a tire rim when his left middle finger was caught and amputated between the tire rim and the caliper.
Employee was exiting his tractor trailer cab and fell to the ground, breaking 5 ribs and bruising the spleen.

An employee was changing a shear's die using a hoist. The die became lodged by a piece of dowel. As the employee reached to check where it was stuck, the die dislodged while still under the tension of the hoist, causing the die to move upward and pinch his middle and ring fingers.  Approximately 1/8" of the employee's left middle finger was scraped.

Three employees were installing a steel reinforcement sheet on the top of a paint line washer dry-off oven. One of the employees lost his footing and fell approximately 16 feet backward. 

He sustained multiple facial fractures, a broken arm, and a broken leg.
An employee was operating a horizontal milling machine when his right arm was caught by the spindle blade and severely lacerated. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee servicing an AC was working from a 10-foot A-frame ladder. While descending, the ladder gave way and the employee fell to the ground.
An employee amputated three fingers on the right hand while operating the mixer.
An employee was trying to lift a granite countertop out of a pick-up truck bed when he twisted and injured his lower back.
An employee was visiting a patient's home. Upon entering the fence of the patient's yard, one of the patient's dogs attacked the employee. The employee received several dog bites.
An employee tripped over a cord hanging from the deli scale and fell fracturing their pelvis.
An employee was hospitalized due to cleaner splashing into the face and eyes.
Employee was stepping onto the roof from the ladder and slipped off the roof onto the ground fracturing his right heel.
An employee fractured the little finger when a piece broke off from a 1-inch steel plate.
An employee tripped and stepped into an open manhole. He fell across the manhole, fracturing two ribs and puncturing a lung.

An employee operating a forklift stopped because he thought the forklift was overheating. When he removed the radiator cap to check the water level, the hot water caused first and second degree burns to his chest and right arm.
An employee was cleaning the chuck machine with a green pad when his right index fingertip slipped into the chuck and was amputated. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
While operating a tow bar, an employee's right thumb was crushed between two metals.

An employee was helping another employee line up two heating plates that weighed approximately 2,000 pounds. The second employee signaled the forklift operator to set the plate down. When the forklift operator lowered the plate too quickly, the injured employee could not get his left thumb out of the way, causing the tip of his thumb to be amputated between the plates.
An employee was unloading students from a chair lift when one of the students skied over the employee's skis, causing him to fall and fracture his hip.
Employee was using a ladder to get parts from a shelf when he slipped and fell a few feet to the floor. He broke his left leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating an overhead hoist using "J" hooks when his left middle fingertip was pinched between a shaft and a "J" hook. He suffered a partial amputation of his left middle fingertip and a possible fracture of his left ring finger.
While loading heavy brake parts into a machine, an employee suffered a herniated back disc and was hospitalized.
An employee was carrying product down a flight of stairs when he tripped and fell, hurting his knees and elbows.

An employee was flagging traffic with a stop sign. A motor vehicle failed to stop, left the roadway, and struck the employee. The employee sustained a broken tibia and fibula, as well as facial lacerations.
An employee was standing outside a tank that was being cleaned. The cleaning head came out of the tank through the manway and struck the employee causing a laceration to the abdomen and shoulder.
An employee was stacking pieces of granite about 4-feet high when the stack became top heavy and fell, crushing his left foot.
An employee was operating a baler. When he hit the hydraulic switch for compaction, the baler door was pushed open and hit his right ribcage, fracturing four ribs requiring hospitalization.
An employee sustained a broken arm after reaching into a conveyor.
An employee was moving materials when his finger was caught between a forklift and a glass recycle container, amputating his fingertip.
An employee tripped over a concrete bumper and fell in the parking lot while walking to her vehicle at the end of day. Her left kneecap was fractured.
On or about January 1, 2016, an employee's left index finger was partially amputated when the employee attempted to clear some stray tablets from the packaging line.
An employee slipped on ice, sustaining a concussion, broken right femur, and crushed knee.
While changing a street light, an employee contacted the electrical filament and suffered an electrical shock. He was knocked unconscious and required hospitalization.

An employee was cleaning the air-lock machine attached to a cooker. The equipment was not locked out and it energized while the employee's hand was in the machine resulting in the amputation of the left index finger to the first joint.
An employee was checking the fluids on a forklift when he lost his footing. His right arm was impaled by the forklift's muffler guard, tearing an artery, tendons, and muscles. He was hospitalized.

On November 11, 2016, at approximately 1:30 p.m., two employees were hospitalized after receiving second degree burns to the face and third degree burns to both arms from a flash fire that occurred during a natural gas leak at a wellhead.
Employee's finger got caught in the jaws of the bagging machine located in Line 3 of the plant. This resulted in the partial amputation of the tip of the left index finger.

An employee was stripping/unloading a trailer. There was a deck bar in the trailer towards the top of the vertical tracks. The employee was trying to remove the bar, but it was not coming loose. He then walked under the deck bar towards the front of the trailer and it released striking him on the top of his head, causing a laceration to the top left side of his head.
During a baseball game, an employee was struck by a line drive to the head, suffering a skull fracture and dermal hematoma.
An employee was operating a punch press and crushed a finger in the point of operation resulting in a partial amputation to the right index fingertip.
While cutting vegetables with a knife, an employee sustained a left middle fingertip amputation.
An employee was walking into work when she slipped on ice and fell in the parking lot fracturing the right ankle.
The employee was sharpening a tool on a large bench grinder and his right thumb got caught in the grinder causing a partial amputation.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet from the roof during painting activities.
At 7:30 a.m., an employee was possibly stocking inventory on the second floor when he fell 12 feet to the ground below, severely fracturing his ankle.
An employee was removing a hose connector from a conveyor when the hose became snagged on the conveyor. The connector came flying back, hitting and breaking the employee's hand and wrist.

Two employees were working at a food preparation and heating cart when a flash fire occurred as they opened the door to the heating compartment, shooting flames out at the employees. One employee received second degree burns to the hands and face; the other employee received third degree burns to the hands and face.
An employee fell approximately 40 feet through the roof of a building.

An employee was placing stones on each side of a waterfall when his hand became pinched between an excavator bucket and the 'thumb' of the excavator as he was undoing a strap for setting the stone.  His hand was lacerated and bruised.

An employee was unloading a wire basket from a flatbed truck. As a crane began to lift the basket, he got caught by it and was lifted approximately 6 to 8 feet off the ground. He fell to the ground, breaking his leg and nose.
An employee fell from a rack in the warehouse.
An employee was working from a scissor lift that fell. The employee sustained critical injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee was using an excavator to load concrete slabs into a dump truck. The employee's right leg got caught between the concrete slab and truck tailgate, causing soft tissue damage.
An employee was attempting to unplug a sausage grinding machine when the grinder amputated four of his left-hand fingers.

An employee was operating a manual assembly cell and placed a connector into the machine. The placement of the part was incorrect, so she attempted to reposition the connector. At the same time, a ferrule nut fell onto the finger activation switch, causing the machine to operate and partially amputate the employee's right index finger.
An employee was walking around the corner of the furniture department, tripped and fell breaking his humerus and radius.

An employee was working in a winding station and applying tape to a cardboard core (on a rotating spindle). The employee's gloved hand made contact with the double sided tape pulling her arm into the spindle. The employee sustained multiple fractures to the arm and ribs resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was working on the roof of a building when he noticed a crack in a concrete deck panel. As he attempted to remove the deck panel to patch it with wood, the panels he was standing on also broke. He fell almost 20 feet to the concrete floor below, cracking his L2 and L3 lumbar vertebrae. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was operating a core pusher machine when her left index finger got caught between a hydraulic ram head and the machine itself, resulting in a partial finger amputation.

On May 17, 2016, an employee operating a forklift drove off the dock between the dock and a truck trailer, suffering a broken ankle. At the time of the incident, chocks were not placed behind the trailer wheels and the truck was in neutral.
On or about January 4, 2016, an employee was working from a cherry picker when he lost his balance and fell 17 feet. He fractured his wrist and face and lacerated his left eyebrow.

An employee was operating a carton filler machine when the machine began to jam. While attempting to clear the jam, the employee's hand contacted the moving chain conveyor system. The employee's left-hand thumb fat pad, first index finger knuckle, and middle finger middle knuckle were amputated.injuring his head
An employee closed their right thumb in the safe door resulting in amputation of the thumb tip.
An employee was walking down a flight of stairs when he tripped and fell down three stairs. He struck the handrail and suffered a contusion to the lower chest/upper abdomen on his right side.
An employee suffered a partial finger amputation while using a cutting machine.

An employee was carrying a pan of hot brisket drippings towards the dishwasher of the meat area and fell while holding the pan of drippings.  The hot drippings spilled and splashed onto the employee.  The employee received serious burns and was hospitalized.
An employee was attempting to free a dock door when the object that was holding the door came loose; the door hit him and broke his ankle.

An employee was torch cutting a railcar at a scrap yard when the railcar's cushion unit was punctured. Hydraulic fluid spewed out and caused second degree burns to part of his back and the back of his legs.
While using a dolly to deliver a package to a home owner, an employee fell out of the back of the delivery truck and onto the roadway, breaking three ribs and an elbow.
An employee received 2nd and 3rd degree burns when operating a forklift truck to unload polystyrene rolls from a trailer. It is believed a propane pocket was ignited by static electricity.
An employee was testing a newly assembled dough divider. While the employee cleared the machine of dough, the guillotine activated and cut the employee's fingertip partway down the nail.
An employee was helping to remove tie-downs on a flatbed trailer when two steel frames fell on him, fracturing his left leg and left wrist.

Employee was injured while demolishing a walkway on a barge.  Employee was working on the second level of the barge when the board on which he was standing broke. He fell through the board, hitting his abdomen on a metal I-Beam as he was falling.
An employee was walking alongside a Bobcat when he tried to mount the vehicle for a ride. The vehicle then ran over him, breaking his leg.
An employee was cleaning the blade of a power tool when it activated, partially amputating his right thumb. The blade was unguarded at the time.

An employee injured his leg while delivering some pipe to the Rio Blanco laydown yard off of County Road 5 in Mesa County, Colorado. The employee was helping the driver remove the pipe from a flat bed. When he removed the pipe bindings, one of the pipes fell off and struck his leg.
An employee was hospitalized due to heat exposure.
An employee experienced an electrical shock and then fell from a platform.
An inmate was slicing onions with a vegetable slicing machine when he amputated his left middle fingertip and lacerated the side of his left index finger.

On or about November 4, 2015, at 9:00 am an employee was fusing 24-inch diameter plastic pipe in a field when the excavator operator tried to adjust the alignment of the pipe and caused the torqued pipe to swing into the employee, knocking him to the ground.  The pipe then crushed and broke his lower right leg before it was lifted away.  The employee was hospitalized for pin placement and overnight observation.
On August 21, 2016, an employee was removing a locking pin in the bead room when the employee's left index finger was pinched and partially amputated between the drive shaft and locking pin.

On or about May 21, 2015, at approximately 1:15 a.m., an employee was injured when a 4,000-pound cart carrying a helicopter transmission rolled over the employee's foot. The employee sustained a deep laceration, resulting in stitches, and a few fractured toes.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut a granite curb. When he set the saw down, the blade was still rotating and made contact with the curb. The saw then kicked back and struck the employee in the right shoulder and forearm, slicing his skin.
An employee was filling up a propane tank when a splitter valve became unscrewed and liquid propane leaked out, burning the employee's right hand.
An employee's left index finger was cut by a kitchen knife while the employee was preparing salmon in the kitchen.
On October 26, 2016, an employee was operating a punch press and suffered the  amputation of the left 4th and 5th fingers.

Employees were moving a vehicle on to steel rims in the salvage yard when an employee's hand was caught between the car and the bumper. The employee suffered an amputation to the soft tissue pulp of the left pinky finger.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion and dehydration.
While clearing the line #2 plastic dicer machine, an employee suffered an amputation of the middle and ring fingertips of the right hand.
An employee's right index fingertip was smashed and amputated before the first joint while cleaning chicken parts out of a machine conveyor area.
An employee fell and broke both wrists while on a skating field trip.
An employee fell through the roof, breaking his leg.
An employee in the spiral freezer production department was taking the tunnel pan cover off the spiral chain when the cover came down and amputated the employee's left hand middle fingertip.

The freight elevator door was left open, which causes a buzzing sound (alarm). The employee walked over and attempted to close the door to stop the alarm. As she pulled the metal door down, the door caught and amputated her left index fingertip.
Employee walking on the top of a form tripped and fell resulting in a broken left forearm.
An employee was working on an HVAC system when the fan blades cut his right middle finger, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while operating a trim press machine.

An employee using a pallet jack, which was trailing behind him, attempted to walk through flap doors while a forklift operator was driving through the doors from the opposite direction.  The forklift had a pallet on the forks. The operator drove forward, blew the horn, and continued to drive through the doors, hitting the employee on the left leg with the pallet.

An employee was wrapping a finished pallet on a stretch wrap machine. While attempting to cut the excess stretch film from the pallet, the employee's left index fingertip was amputated between the pallet and the guarding around the turntable. The machine was still running at the time of the incident.
An employee injured her back while lifting packaging film.
An employee was adjusting a press machine when the ram fell and crushed her right ring finger, amputating it at the knuckle.
An employee was burned on the hands and feet while breaking slag loose from the side of Furnace-A with a slag rod.

An employee's glove got stuck when loading a part into Shear # 3.  When the employee used his left hand to pull his right hand out, he kicked the foot pedal and cycled the machine, pinching the end of the middle finger on his right hand between the part and the machine.
An employee amputated a fingertip (no bone) while slicing onions with a knife.
An employee was removing snow from a tarp covering a trailer when the spring loaded tarp arm shut and caught the employee's finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was on a 6/12 pitch roof tearing off shingles from a single story residence. The employee was wearing a harness and attached to a lanyard that was anchored on the roof. At the time of the incident, the employee was preparing to get off the roof and disconnected his lanyard from the harness. He was transitioning to the ladder and lost his footing falling 6 to 8 feet to the ground below. The employee fractured a bone in his back and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee's foot got caught on a rack inside a trailer, dislocating his left big toe and requiring hospitalization.
On 1/29/2016, an employee was attempting to dislodge a rolling bay door when he fell approximately 12 feet, fracturing his left leg.
An employee suffered several broken vertebrae after being struck by a "cuber" machine while repositioning brick pavers on a board.
An employee was slicing meat in the deli for a customer when the employee's hand slipped off the guard and struck the rotating blade, amputating the right thumb tip.

An employee was pushing a pallet jack onto a trailer when the wooden floor plank of the trailer broke. The employee then lost his balance and fell backwards, hitting his head on the floor and suffering a concussion.
A maintenance employee was troubleshooting a machine when his right middle and ring fingertips were amputated by the machine's unguarded chains and sprockets.
On 5/25/2016, at 1:15 p.m., an employee was cutting a stair rail with a saw when the safety guard malfunctioned. The saw then jumped and cut the employee's left forearm.

While delivering letters and packages, an employee went up a set of stairs to a customer's house and rang the bell. Suddenly, the employee passed out due to dehydration and fell down the stairs, puncturing his left lung and fracturing a rib. He was hospitalized.
Employee fell from ladder while painting.

On or about April 24, 2015, at approximately 1:18 PM, an employee fell approximately 10 feet while working from an elevated platform attached to a fork truck. The employee sustained serious injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee was in the bucket getting ready to go up to do work on the powerline when he contacted the energized line, suffering third degree burns to both arms and second degree burns to his hands.
An employee was moving hot oil in the kitchen when some of it spilled on her and burned both of her hands. She was hospitalized.
An employee was experiencing cramps throughout the day. The employee was hospitalized with heat stroke.

An employee was untangling the cable from the block of the crawler crane.  Afterwards, the crane operator raised the block of the crane while the employee's hand was still on the cable.  The employee's left ring and middle fingers were amputated.
An employee fell and ruptured his spleen while unjamming the cyclone on the roof.
An employee was exiting a ladder to a rooftop when he slipped and fell 10 feet to the ground, breaking his ankle.

An employee was backfilling sugar from a sugar silo into a tanker truck when a lock on one of the trailer hatches gave way and released significant air pressure, throwing the employee to the ground. The employee broke the lower left arm and right wrist, requiring surgery.
An employee smashed the middle two fingers of the left hand while connecting two beams.
An employee was struck in the forehead by a ratchet chain binder handle.
An employee fell approximately 16 feet through a roof opening and struck his head on a table.
An employee was pushing a cart that contained grinder parts. The cart tipped and the grinder bit fell off the cart and struck the employee's left foot. He was hospitalized as a result.
An employee was performing milling work, taking up asphalt. The employee was struck by a semi-truck making a right turn.
An employee skiing on the Larry Fale Trail was struck by another skier. As a result, the employee suffered suspected rib fractures and other potential injuries to the shoulder and torso areas.
An employee fell while walking in the employee entrance and hit face on the wall.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was opening a lower clam door on a jet when he felt a burning sensation in his groin. He was hospitalized for a hematoma and infection.
An employee was cutting meat with a band saw and suffered an amputation to the right thumb.

On June 8, 2016, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee was opening the door on the back of a delivery truck when another truck rolled backwards and pinned him between the two vehicles. He suffered broken vertebrae.
An employee was preparing to move a cart loaded with springs when the cart tipped over and springs fell onto his right leg, fracturing it and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was lifting a 12' x 8" diameter steel vent pipe with three coworkers. They were using a come-along/chain fall to lift the pipe in place while the other employees were guiding. The pipe was shifted to maneuver around a guard rail, causing the rigging beam to slide off the I-beams it was placed on. The entire rigging assembly and load fell. As the rigging fell, the chain whipped around and struck the employee in the right arm, fracturing the ulna and radius.

A maintenance employee received multiple fractures and lacerations when a high-tension cable associated with a roll-up door wrapped around his right hand during attempts to troubleshoot a malfunction. He required surgery.
An employee sustained severe lacerations to the pinky and ring fingers of his left hand while cutting bone in pork on a band saw.

On 10/06/2015, at approximately 5:40 p.m., an employee was looking for a box in the UPS truck. While exiting the vehicle, he fell inside, landed on his side, hit his head, and could not stand. He required surgery for a broken leg.
An employee was hospitalized after suffering a broken ankle from slipping on ice in the parking lot.
An employee fell off a portable ladder while fixing a machine, breaking three ribs and puncturing a lung. He was hospitalized.

An employee was repairing a leaking water pump. The employee went to change into rubber boots when he stepped on a wheel wire brush. The wires from the brush punctured and broke off in his right heel, requiring surgical removal.

The employee was driving a loaded garbage truck to the landfill for dumping. As the employee entered the landfill, he rounded a corner and the garbage truck rolled onto its side. The employee fell from the truck and fractured ribs. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell on wet grass while delivering a package, breaking her ankle in two places and requiring surgery.
An employee working inside a trench was struck by the bucket of an excavator fracturing his hip.

On April 23, 2016, at approximately 4:00 PM an employee experienced a crushing injury and fractures when he got his left forearm and wrist caught between rollers while troubleshooting calendar rolls on the extrusion line.  The injury required surgery.

An employee was picking up a stack of boards behind the chamfer machine when the machine malfunctioned, causing the sawblades to throw the boards. The boards slammed onto the employee's left middle finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was tracing piping when the employee's pant pocket became caught on a hot water valve clamp. The valve then released hot water onto the employee's right arm and torso, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was pushing a four wheeled dolly and pinched his finger between the dolly and a door frame resulting in a left hand ring finger amputation.
An employee working at a powerhouse was splashed with a caustic solution made up of water and drain cleaner, suffering chemical burns.

An employee was loading a truck cab on a trailer while the tongue of the trailer was being held up by a jack. While moving the trailer, the jack slipped off the trailer tongue, partially amputating the employee's right pinky finger.

An employee was changing a battery and removed the battery plate. As the employee was replacing the plate, it became stuck. The employee tried to unjam the plate; in the process, the plate fell on the left middle finger, amputating the tip.
An employee was involved in a three-car auto accident while transporting a car for Enterprise to a body shop. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's right index fingertip was amputated in a rebar bender.
While on duty, an employee approached a shoplifter to request he return stolen items and was stabbed in the chest and left arm with a knife by the shoplifter.
A letter carrier slipped and fell on ice fracturing the left hip.
An employee was skiing downhill when he fell and hit the hard-packed snow, suffering spinal injuries.
On June 15, 2016, an employee was inspecting a refrigeration compressor outside and began to feel unwell. He was hospitalized with heat stress.

A propane-powered space heater was used inside the cab of an elevated crane during workplace operations. The space heater leaked, resulting in an explosion and fire. The employee who was trapped inside the cab sustained burns to the face and hands.
An employee struck himself in the head with a hammer.

An employee was performing maintenance on a roll-on ball dispensing machine. He was wiping the machine with a towel when his finger was pulled into the machine and was crushed between the drive pulley and belt. His left index fingertip was amputated. The machine was in operation at the time of the incident.

An employee was moving an overhead crane while walking with its pendent control.  The crane's slings with the plate-dog attached were behind the employee as he walked.  The plate-dog got caught on a empty steel work skid used to support the materials being fabricated and pulled it over landing on the employee's left ankle. The employee suffered a compound dislocation of the left ankle requiring surgery.

An employee was working from a 10-foot step ladder when a bar that holds clothes came loose. She lost her footing and fell 10 feet from the ladder to the concrete floor, breaking vertebrae in her neck and back.
An employee was at the nurse's desk, turned, and fell to the tile floor fracturing the left hip.
At 10:45 AM on February 17, 2015, an employee's left leg was struck-by a pipe while unloading a truck causing a deep thigh bruise. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
While carrying a box of parts, an employee tripped over a pallet and fell, injuring the left knee and fracturing a femur.
An employee tripped and fell. His leg was then run over by a forklift breaking it.
An employee was inspecting a roof when he fell to the ground and lost consciousness.
While walking to a house to deliver the mail, an employee slipped on ice and fell, suffering a broken left ankle.
On or about June 1, 2015, an employee was injured and hospitalized while performing pipe cleaning duties and tasks.
On 11/03/2015 at 4:45 pm an employee was exiting the facility and fell in the parking lot breaking her right arm.
At 7:00 a.m., on 7/27/2016, an employee was tripping decking forms when he fell off the 5-foot step ladder, breaking ribs and his wrist. He was hospitalized.

An excavator was dislodged from a flatbed trailer after hitting an overpass on Northbound I-15. An employee attempted to reload the excavator onto the trailer.  The excavator encountered fluid on the flatbed and slipped off the trailer. The employee was injured, sustaining a hairline fracture to the neck vertebrae.
An employee was preparing to change the line over to a different product on the breader elevator and amputated the right index fingertip.

An employee sustained a serious leg injury while he was attempting to dismount a CAT paving machine. The employee was in the process of dismounting the  equipment, slipped and suffered a puncture to the knee from a bolt protruding on the machine. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was sitting in a chair near the baggage conveyor belt. At the same time, a tug that was towing three baggage carts was making a turn around the baggage belt. During this turn, the last cart struck a concrete bollard and overturned. The overturned cart struck the employee, who suffered a broken ankle.
The worker fell backwards towards the slump rack stairs while washing his concrete truck and sustained a laceration to the back of his head.
An employee was struck by a car in a crosswalk while walking between buildings at the hospital. The employee sustained back and spine fractures.
An employee fell from a ladder and fractured three vertebrae while installing home TV cable.
An employee was adjusting a ratchet strap on a flat bed truck when his hand slipped off of the adjusting bar severely cutting his finger that required surgery and hospitalization.

On 9/24/15, at 7:15 a.m., an employee was operating a brake press. The light curtain on the press break was inoperative at the time. The employee sustained an amputation of the right index finger's first knuckle.

An operator turned off the extruder when a maintenance worker told him to turn it back on. As he was turning it back on, he purged the machine. Air was caught behind some plastic, causing the 325-degree plastic to shoot out and hit the employee's right arm. The employee suffered third degree burns.
An employee was holding a piece of lumber to cut it with a power saw when the saw kicked back and amputated the right pinky fingertip at the first knuckle.
While carrying a load of pallets on a forklift, an employee struck a column pole, suffering severe head injuries.

An employee was pulling the die from a rack when the push/pull mechanism of the die cart failed. When the employee realized this, he removed the chains from around the die and proceeded to set the brake, then pushed the die onto the die cart from behind the rack. The die cart then moved backwards, causing the die to start to tip and fall. When the employee tried to grab and stabilize it, the center of gravity for the die was over the edge of the die rack shelf, and the die fell and trapped the employee's arms between the top of the die and the underside of the die rack shelf. He broke both wrists and was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell to the ground while washing dishes and injured her back, neck, and head, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was helping to roll out roofing material. The employee fell approximately 16 feet through pallets and plywood that were covering a skylight to the concrete floor below. The employee was knocked unconscious.
An employee was investigating an unknown noise in a laboratory jar roller machine when his right index fingertip was caught in the machine's drive chain.

On 03/09/15, at approximately 10:30 a.m., an employee was working from an aluminum ladder that was leaning against a tank. The employee fell approximately 4 feet off of the ladder and landed on a cement barrier. The employee suffered three broken ribs and a bruised kidney and was admitted to UPMC-Presbyterian.

Am employee  working in the receiving area, sustained amputations of his right middle and ring fingertips on 2/18/15 at 7:30 PM. The employee's fingers were caught and amputated by receiving line gears while attempting to dislodge a cage. He was treated at Beebe Medical Center and hospitalized for 23 hours.
An employee was relieving residual nitrogen pressure on returned empty product cylinders and was exposed to methyl bromide vapors. The employee suffered second degree chemical burns.

A piece of wood was jammed in the splitter. The employee tried to unjam it by crawling up onto the machine before the saw had stopped. Somehow his thigh came into contact with the saw. The saw was idling down after being turned off.

An employee was using a planter machine to plant broccoli. As he was pulling a plant from the planter machine's cup, the cup turned and amputated his right index fingertip. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee slipped and fell 8 feet to the ground while installing a roof on a mini storage shed, sustaining a broken femur.

The employee was tracing the power source of the AC unit on the roof and went to the third floor to disconnect the power. He stepped on a plywood piece that came loose, and he and the plywood fell down to the lower level. The impact caused him to tumble from that level to the ground. He was hospitalized with a gash to his head, three fractured neck vertebrae, and left wrist and back trauma.

An employee drove a forklift (standup pick truck) to the end of an aisle way and was unable to stop before running into stopping blocks and a wall. The collision crushed his right foot between the operator platform and the cart that he was carrying, amputating three toes and partially amputating one toe.

An employee was setting up and performing maintenance on a drilling machine with a panel removed. When the machine cycled, its table moved a plastic bin, which smashed the employee's finger between the bin and the ledge of the machine. The employee's left middle fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee had just finished loading his trailer. While closing the rear trailer door, his finger was caught between the door panels, amputating his right index fingertip.

On or about September 24, 2015, an employee was unloading a piece of glass from the conveyor to place it on a cart. The employee's right-hand middle finger struck the edge of the glass and was lacerated. The wound became infected and required overnight hospitalization.
While an employee was working underneath a truck to take out the drive shaft, a piece of metal fell into his eye. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was performing preventative maintenance on piece of conveyor. He reached across and lifted up on the belt.  His back elbow crossed the photo eye, activating the belt.  His finger was caught between the end of the conveyor and the end guard.  When he pulled his hand back, he degloved the right ring finger resulting in medical amputation.
An employee fell and twisted an ankle while setting up an extension ladder.
An employee's hand was on the edge of a gang box when a coworker closed the box on the employee's finger, partially amputating it.

An employee was climbing a ladder to mount ductwork into the ceiling tile. When he shifted his body on the ladder, he twisted his knee. He experienced knee and lower leg swelling, and was hospitalized with an infection.
An employee removed the guard on a conveyor to perform maintenance. His hand was caught in the chain and sprocket and the left ring fingertip was amputated.

An employee and a coworker removed the die from a punch press to clear a jam. After the die was put back in the machine, the employee attempted to clear out some debris. The die then dropped on his left thumb, amputating it.

An employee was changing the oil on a prentice machine. As the employee was descending the machine's steps, he slipped and hit his forehead and lacerated the back of his ear on the machine. The employee suffered a TIA (mini stroke) and was admitted to the hospital with slurred speech.

An employee was attaching the hitch of a pick-up truck to the tow bar of the air-conditioning unit when his left little finger got caught between both pieces of equipment, resulting in the finger being amputated 1/2" at the tip.

An employee and his crew were loading steel coils onto a barge for shipment. As a coil was being lowered onto the saddle-shaped dunnage, the employee used his right foot to adjust the position of the dunnage board. He missed the board and the coil came down on top of the steel-toed cap of his boot, which collapsed onto his right toes. His big-toe nailbed was crushed and his second toe was fractured. His third and fourth toes were surgically amputated just below the nailbed.

An employee was removing a temporary barrier wall. A loader with forks was used to lift the wall to relieve pressure so the employee could pull pins from it. The pin shifted as he was pulling it and his right index finger was caught between the bolt and the barrier wall, amputating it at the first knuckle.

An employee was working to replace a lightning arrester( electrical distribution work). When the tool he was using came in proximity to an energized jumper coming from the top of the lightning arrester, an arc flash occurred.

An employee was going to weld on the casing of a drilling rig. The employee was sitting on/near the control panel with the right hand on the traveling chain and left hand near the controls. The employee's left hand bumped the controls, causing the traveling chain to move. The chain caught the employee's right hand, amputating three fingertips to the first knuckle.
An I-beam rolled onto an employee's fingers, pinching and amputating the left middle and ring fingertips.

An employee was installing an ice machine at a customer's location. While doing so, he bumped his left elbow on the machine and received a small scratch. The next day it started to swell and turn red. He was hospitalized for an infection in the wound.
An employee was installing laminate on the roof when he stepped into a hole and fell approximately 20 feet. He fractured his left arm, dislocated his pelvis, and required left arm surgery.
An employee was cleaning magnets while standing on a step ladder. The employee slipped while stepping off the ladder and fractured the left ankle.
An employee was climbing the ladder on a ready mix truck, slipped and fell to the ground fracturing the lower right leg.
An employee was lifting a box to put on a hand truck and suffered an abdominal hernia.
The injured employee was changing a steam line diaphragm. A second employee turned on the steam and the injured employee experienced first and second degree burns to his back.
An employee fell approximately 30 feet through an uncovered hole in the floor, sustaining multiple broken bones and a broken nose, and knocking out teeth.

An employee was performing routine maintenance on a wind tower when the wind picked up and caused the motor to start turning. The employee's glove was caught in the motor, and his middle finger was pulled in and lacerated. The finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee fell from the trailer of his truck and struck his head.
While walking through the lumber yard, an employee's foot was run over by a forklift, breaking it.
An employee was disconnecting hoses after completing a radiator flush. Pressure had built up in the hose and hot radiator fluid was released onto the employee's arms, torso, legs and face.
An employee was hospitalized on 7/28/15 at 11:00 a.m., due to a fall while stocking the walk-in cooler/freezer, which resulted in a broken arm.
An employee was on a back country patrol when his horse bolted. The employee's hand/finger was caught in the bridal reins.
After delivering mail to a house, an employee turned and started to descend the steps, which were wet. He slipped on the steps and broke his left ankle, requiring surgery.
An employee was providing home care and was bitten on the right inner thigh by the client's dog.

An employee was walking through the store to hand out food samples and had turned around to talk to a coworker. When she turned back around to continue on her way, she ran into a pole. She fell down and struck the back of her head, requiring hospitalization for concussion symptoms.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion while prepping a boat for painting. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was troubleshooting the preheat oven when his finger got caught between a cylinder and machine frame, amputating his left index fingertip.

On November 25, 2015, an employee was removing floor tiles with a razor scraper hand tool. While he attempted to replace a blade on the razor scraper, the blade contacted and deeply lacerated his wrist, possibly damaging tendons.
An employee on a ladder was shocked while installing circuits in an electrical junction box. The employee fell off the ladder and suffered a head injury, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was walking past a pallet when a 50-pound bag fell and struck the employee's shoulder and heel.
An employee's fingers were caught in a safe door when a coworker closed it on the employee's hand.

An employee was using a hose to wash crankcases with a cleaning solution when the hose nozzle came loose. The solution then pumped out and entered the employee's eyes and mouth. The employee was hospitalized with internal injuries.
